column2: Psalm 1. Beatus vir, qui non abiit.
column3: Psalm 1. Beatus vir, qui non abiit.

column2: 1 BLESSED is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners * and hath not sat in the seat of the scornful.
column3: BLESSED is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners * and hath not sat in the seat of the scornful.

column2: 2 But his delight is in the law of the Lord * and in his law will he exercise himself day and night.
column3: But his delight is in the law of the Lord * and in his law will he exercise himself day and night.

column2: 3 And he shall be like a tree planted by the water-side * that will bring forth his fruit in due season.
column3: And he shall be like a tree planted by the water-side * that will bring forth his fruit in due season.

column2: 4 His leaf also shall not wither * and look, whatsoever he doeth, it shall prosper.
column3: His leaf also shall not wither * and look, whatsoever he doeth, it shall prosper.

column2: 5 As for the ungodly, it is not so with them * but they are like the chaff, which the wind scattereth away from the face of the earth.
column3: As for the ungodly, it is not so with them * but they are like the chaff, which the wind scattereth away from the face of the earth.

column2: 6 Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgement * neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
column3: Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgement * neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

column2: 7 But the Lord knoweth the way of the righteous * and the way of the ungodly shall perish.
column3: But the Lord knoweth the way of the righteous * and the way of the ungodly shall perish.

column2: Psalm 2. Quare fremuerunt gentes?
column3: Psalm 2. Quare fremuerunt gentes?

column2: 1 WHY do the heathen so furiously rage together * and why do the people imagine a vain thing?
column3: WHY do the heathen so furiously rage together * and why do the people imagine a vain thing?

column2: 2 The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together * against the Lord, and against his Anointed.
column3: The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together * against the Lord, and against his Anointed.

column2: 3 Let us break their bonds asunder * and cast away their cords from us.
column3: Let us break their bonds asunder * and cast away their cords from us.

column2: 4 He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh them to scorn * the Lord shall have them in derision.
column3: He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh them to scorn * the Lord shall have them in derision.

column2: 5 Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath * and vex them in his sore displeasure.
column3: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath * and vex them in his sore displeasure.

column2: 6 Yet have I set my King * upon my holy hill of Sion.
column3: Yet have I set my King * upon my holy hill of Sion.

column2: 7 I will preach the law, whereof the Lord hath said unto me * Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.
column3: I will preach the law, whereof the Lord hath said unto me * Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

column2: 8 Desire of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance * and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.
column3: Desire of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance * and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

column2: 9 Thou shalt bruise them with a rod of iron * and break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.
column3: Thou shalt bruise them with a rod of iron * and break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.

column2: 10 Be wise now therefore, O ye kings * be learned, ye that are judges of the earth.
column3: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings * be learned, ye that are judges of the earth.

column2: 11 Serve the Lord in fear * and rejoice unto him with reverence.
column3: Serve the Lord in fear * and rejoice unto him with reverence.

column2: 12 Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and so ye perish from the right way * if his wrath be kindled, (yea, but a little), blessed are all they that put their trust in him.
column3: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and so ye perish from the right way * if his wrath be kindled, (yea, but a little), blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

column2: Psalm 3. Domine, quid multiplicati.
column3: Psalm 3. Domine, quid multiplicati.

column2: 1 LORD, how are they increased that trouble me * many are they that rise against me.
column3: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me * many are they that rise against me.

column2: 2 Many one there be that say of my soul * There is no help for him in his God.
column3: Many one there be that say of my soul * There is no help for him in his God.

column2: 3 But thou, O Lord, art my defender * thou art my worship, and the lifter up of my head.
column3: But thou, O Lord, art my defender * thou art my worship, and the lifter up of my head.

column2: 4 I did call upon the Lord with my voice * and he heard me out of his holy hill.
column3: I did call upon the Lord with my voice * and he heard me out of his holy hill.

column2: 5 I laid me down and slept, and rose up again * for the Lord sustained me.
column3: I laid me down and slept, and rose up again * for the Lord sustained me.

column2: 6 I will not be afraid for ten thousands of the people * that have set themselves against me round about.
column3: I will not be afraid for ten thousands of the people * that have set themselves against me round about.

column2: 7 Up, Lord, and help me, O my God * for thou smitest all mine enemies upon the cheekbone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
column3: Up, Lord, and help me, O my God * for thou smitest all mine enemies upon the cheekbone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

column2: 8 Salvation belongeth unto the Lord * and thy blessing is upon thy people.
column3: Salvation belongeth unto the Lord * and thy blessing is upon thy people.

column2: Psalm 4. Cum invocarem.
column3: Psalm 4. Cum invocarem.

column2: 1 HEAR me when I call, O God of my righteousness * thou hast set me at liberty when I was in trouble; have mercy upon me, and hearken unto my prayer.
column3: HEAR me when I call, O God of my righteousness * thou hast set me at liberty when I was in trouble; have mercy upon me, and hearken unto my prayer.

column2: 2 O ye sons of men, how long will ye blaspheme mine honour * and have such pleasure in vanity, and seek after leasing?
column3: O ye sons of men, how long will ye blaspheme mine honour * and have such pleasure in vanity, and seek after leasing?

column2: 3 Know this also, that the Lord hath chosen to himself the man that is godly * when I call upon the Lord, he will hear me.
column3: Know this also, that the Lord hath chosen to himself the man that is godly * when I call upon the Lord, he will hear me.

column2: 4 Stand in awe, and sin not * commune with your own heart, and in your chamber, and be still.
column3: Stand in awe, and sin not * commune with your own heart, and in your chamber, and be still.

column2: 5 Offer the sacrifice of righteousness * and put your trust in the Lord.
column3: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness * and put your trust in the Lord.

column2: 6 There be many that say * Who will shew us any good?
column3: There be many that say * Who will shew us any good?

column2: 7 Lord, lift thou up * the light of thy countenance upon us.
column3: Lord, lift thou up * the light of thy countenance upon us.

column2: 8 Thou hast put gladness in my heart * since the time that their corn and wine and oil increased.
column3: Thou hast put gladness in my heart * since the time that their corn and wine and oil increased.

column2: 9 I will lay me down in peace, and take my rest * for it is thou, Lord, only, that makest me dwell in safety.
column3: I will lay me down in peace, and take my rest * for it is thou, Lord, only, that makest me dwell in safety.

column2: Psalm 5. Verba mea auribus.
column3: Psalm 5. Verba mea auribus.

column2: 1 PONDER my words, O Lord * consider my meditation
column3: PONDER my words, O Lord * consider my meditation

column2: 2 O hearken thou unto the voice of my calling, my King, and my God * for unto thee will I make my prayer.
column3: O hearken thou unto the voice of my calling, my King, and my God * for unto thee will I make my prayer.

column2: 3 My voice shalt thou hear betimes, O Lord * early in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.
column3: My voice shalt thou hear betimes, O Lord * early in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

column2: 4 For thou art the God that hast no pleasure in wickedness * neither shall any evil dwell with thee.
column3: For thou art the God that hast no pleasure in wickedness * neither shall any evil dwell with thee.

column2: 5 Such as be foolish shall not stand in thy sight * for thou hatest all them that work vanity.
column3: Such as be foolish shall not stand in thy sight * for thou hatest all them that work vanity.

column2: 6 Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing * the Lord will abhor both the blood-thirsty and deceitful man.
column3: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing * the Lord will abhor both the blood-thirsty and deceitful man.

column2: 7 But as for me, I will come into thine house, even upon the multitude of thy mercy * and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.
column3: But as for me, I will come into thine house, even upon the multitude of thy mercy * and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

column2: 8 Lead me, O Lord, in thy righteousness, because of mine enemies * make thy way plain before my face.
column3: Lead me, O Lord, in thy righteousness, because of mine enemies * make thy way plain before my face.

column2: 9 For there is no faithfulness in his mouth * their inward parts are very wickedness.
column3: For there is no faithfulness in his mouth * their inward parts are very wickedness.

column2: 10 Their throat is an open sepulchre * they flatter with their tongue.
column3: Their throat is an open sepulchre * they flatter with their tongue.

column2: 11 Destroy thou them, O God; let them perish through their own imaginations * cast them out in the multitude of their ungodliness; for they have rebelled against thee.
column3: Destroy thou them, O God; let them perish through their own imaginations * cast them out in the multitude of their ungodliness; for they have rebelled against thee.

column2: 12 And let all them that put their trust in thee rejoice * they shall ever be giving of thanks, because thou defendest them; they that love thy Name shall be joyful in thee;
column3: And let all them that put their trust in thee rejoice * they shall ever be giving of thanks, because thou defendest them; they that love thy Name shall be joyful in thee;

column2: 13 For thou, Lord, wilt give thy blessing unto the righteous * and with thy favourable kindness wilt thou defend him as with a shield.
column3: For thou, Lord, wilt give thy blessing unto the righteous * and with thy favourable kindness wilt thou defend him as with a shield.

column2: Psalm 6. Domine, ne in furore.
column3: Psalm 6. Domine, ne in furore.

column2: 1 O LORD, rebuke me not in thine indignation * neither chasten me in thy displeasure.
column3: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine indignation * neither chasten me in thy displeasure.

column2: 2 Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am weak * O Lord, heal me, for my bones are vexed.
column3: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am weak * O Lord, heal me, for my bones are vexed.

column2: 3 My soul also is sore troubled * but, Lord, how long wilt thou punish me?
column3: My soul also is sore troubled * but, Lord, how long wilt thou punish me?

column2: 4 Turn thee, O Lord, and deliver my soul * O save me for thy mercy's sake.
column3: Turn thee, O Lord, and deliver my soul * O save me for thy mercy's sake.

column2: 5 For in death no man remembereth thee * and who will give thee thanks in the pit?
column3: For in death no man remembereth thee * and who will give thee thanks in the pit?

column2: 6 I am weary of my groaning; every night wash I my bed * and water my couch with my tears.
column3: I am weary of my groaning; every night wash I my bed * and water my couch with my tears.

column2: 7 My beauty is gone for very trouble * and worn away because of all mine enemies.
column3: My beauty is gone for very trouble * and worn away because of all mine enemies.

column2: 8 Away from me, all ye that work vanity * for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.
column3: Away from me, all ye that work vanity * for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.

column2: 9 The Lord hath heard my petition * the Lord will receive my prayer.
column3: The Lord hath heard my petition * the Lord will receive my prayer.

column2: 10 All mine enemies shall be confounded, and sore vexed * they shall be turned back, and put to shame suddenly.
column3: All mine enemies shall be confounded, and sore vexed * they shall be turned back, and put to shame suddenly.

column2: Psalm 7. Domine, Deus meus.
column3: Psalm 7. Domine, Deus meus.

column2: 1 O LORD my God, in thee have I put my trust * save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me;
column3: O LORD my God, in thee have I put my trust * save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me;

column2: 2 Lest he devour my soul, like a lion, and tear it in pieces * while there is none to help.
column3: Lest he devour my soul, like a lion, and tear it in pieces * while there is none to help.

column2: 3 O Lord my God, if I have done any such thing * or if there be any wickedness in my hands;
column3: O Lord my God, if I have done any such thing * or if there be any wickedness in my hands;

column2: 4 If I have rewarded evil unto him that dealt friendly with me * yea, I have delivered him that without any cause is mine enemy,
column3: If I have rewarded evil unto him that dealt friendly with me * yea, I have delivered him that without any cause is mine enemy,

column2: 5 Then let mine enemy persecute my soul, and take me * yea, let him tread my life down upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust.
column3: Then let mine enemy persecute my soul, and take me * yea, let him tread my life down upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust.

column2: 6 Stand up, O Lord, in thy wrath, and lift up thyself, because of the indignation of mine enemies * arise up for me in the judgement that thou hast commanded.
column3: Stand up, O Lord, in thy wrath, and lift up thyself, because of the indignation of mine enemies * arise up for me in the judgement that thou hast commanded.

column2: 7 And so shall the congregation of the people come about thee * for their sakes therefore lift up thyself again.
column3: And so shall the congregation of the people come about thee * for their sakes therefore lift up thyself again.

column2: 8 The Lord shall judge the people; give sentence with me, O Lord * according to my righteousness, and according to the innocency that is in me.
column3: The Lord shall judge the people; give sentence with me, O Lord * according to my righteousness, and according to the innocency that is in me.

column2: 9 O let the wickedness of the ungodly come to an end * but guide thou the just.
column3: O let the wickedness of the ungodly come to an end * but guide thou the just.

column2: 10 For the righteous God * trieth the very hearts and reins.
column3: For the righteous God * trieth the very hearts and reins.

column2: 11 My help cometh of God * who preserveth them that are true of heart.
column3: My help cometh of God * who preserveth them that are true of heart.

column2: 12 God is a righteous Judge, strong and patient * and God is provoked every day.
column3: God is a righteous Judge, strong and patient * and God is provoked every day.

column2: 13 If a man will not turn, he will whet his sword * he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
column3: If a man will not turn, he will whet his sword * he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

column2: 14 He hath prepared for him the instruments of death * he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors
column3: He hath prepared for him the instruments of death * he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors

column2: 15 Behold, he travaileth with mischief * he hath conceived sorrow, and brought forth ungodliness.
column3: Behold, he travaileth with mischief * he hath conceived sorrow, and brought forth ungodliness.

column2: 16 He hath graven and digged up a pit * and is fallen on himself into the destruction that he made for other.
column3: He hath graven and digged up a pit * and is fallen on himself into the destruction that he made for other.

column2: 17 For his travail shall come upon his own head * and his wickedness shall fall on his own pate.
column3: For his travail shall come upon his own head * and his wickedness shall fall on his own pate.

column2: 18 I will give thanks unto the Lord, according to his righteousness * and I will praise the Name of the Lord most High.
column3: I will give thanks unto the Lord, according to his righteousness * and I will praise the Name of the Lord most High.

column2: Psalm 8. Domine, Dominus noster.
column3: Psalm 8. Domine, Dominus noster.

column2: 1 O LORD our Governor, how excellent is thy Name in all the world * thou that hast set thy glory above the heavens!
column3: O LORD our Governor, how excellent is thy Name in all the world * thou that hast set thy glory above the heavens!

column2: 2 Out of the mouth of very babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength, because of thine enemies * that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.
column3: Out of the mouth of very babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength, because of thine enemies * that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

column2: 3 For I will consider thy heavens, even the works of thy fingers * the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained.
column3: For I will consider thy heavens, even the works of thy fingers * the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained.

column2: 4 What is man, that thou art mindful of him * and the son of man, that thou visitest him?
column3: What is man, that thou art mindful of him * and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

column2: 5 Thou madest him lower than the angels * to crown him with glory and worship.
column3: Thou madest him lower than the angels * to crown him with glory and worship.

column2: 6 Thou makest him to have dominion of the works of thy hands * and thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet;
column3: Thou makest him to have dominion of the works of thy hands * and thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet;

column2: 7 All sheep and oxen * yea, and the beasts of the field;
column3: All sheep and oxen * yea, and the beasts of the field;

column2: 8 The fowls of the air, and the fishes of the sea * and whatsoever walketh through the paths of the seas.
column3: The fowls of the air, and the fishes of the sea * and whatsoever walketh through the paths of the seas.

column2: 9 O Lord our Governor * how excellent is thy Name in all the world!
column3: O Lord our Governor * how excellent is thy Name in all the world!

column2: Psalm 9. Confitebor tibi.
column3: Psalm 9. Confitebor tibi.

column2: 1 I WILL give thanks unto thee, O Lord, with my whole heart * I will speak of all thy marvellous works.
column3: I WILL give thanks unto thee, O Lord, with my whole heart * I will speak of all thy marvellous works.

column2: 2 I will be glad and rejoice in thee * yea, my songs will I make of thy Name, O thou most Highest.
column3: I will be glad and rejoice in thee * yea, my songs will I make of thy Name, O thou most Highest.

column2: 3 While mine enemies are driven back * they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
column3: While mine enemies are driven back * they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

column2: 4 For thou hast maintained my right and my cause * thou art set in the throne that judgest right.
column3: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause * thou art set in the throne that judgest right.

column2: 5 Thou hast rebuked the heathen, and destroyed the ungodly * thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.
column3: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, and destroyed the ungodly * thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

column2: 6 O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end * even as the cities which thou hast destroyed, their memorial is perished with them.
column3: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end * even as the cities which thou hast destroyed, their memorial is perished with them.

column2: 7 But the Lord shall endure for ever * he hath also prepared his seat for judgement.
column3: But the Lord shall endure for ever * he hath also prepared his seat for judgement.

column2: 8 For he shall judge the world in righteousness * and minister true judgement unto the people.
column3: For he shall judge the world in righteousness * and minister true judgement unto the people.

column2: 9 The Lord also will be a defence for the oppressed * even a refuge in due time of trouble.
column3: The Lord also will be a defence for the oppressed * even a refuge in due time of trouble.

column2: 10 And they that know thy Name will put their trust in thee * for thou, Lord, hast never failed them that seek thee.
column3: And they that know thy Name will put their trust in thee * for thou, Lord, hast never failed them that seek thee.

column2: 11 O praise the Lord which dwelleth in Sion * shew the people of his doings.
column3: O praise the Lord which dwelleth in Sion * shew the people of his doings.

column2: 12 For when he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them * and forgetteth not the complaint of the poor.
column3: For when he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them * and forgetteth not the complaint of the poor.

column2: 13 Have mercy upon me, O Lord; consider the trouble which I suffer of them that hate me * thou that liftest me up from the gates of death.
column3: Have mercy upon me, O Lord; consider the trouble which I suffer of them that hate me * thou that liftest me up from the gates of death.

column2: 14 That I may shew all thy praises within the ports of the daughter of Sion * I will rejoice in thy salvation.
column3: That I may shew all thy praises within the ports of the daughter of Sion * I will rejoice in thy salvation.

column2: 15 The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made * in the same net which they hid privily, is their foot taken.
column3: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made * in the same net which they hid privily, is their foot taken.

column2: 16 The Lord is known to execute judgement * the ungodly is trapped in the work of his own hands.
column3: The Lord is known to execute judgement * the ungodly is trapped in the work of his own hands.

column2: 17 The wicked shall be turned into hell * and all the people that forget God.
column3: The wicked shall be turned into hell * and all the people that forget God.

column2: 18 For the poor shall not alway be forgotten * the patient abiding of the meek shall not perish for ever.
column3: For the poor shall not alway be forgotten * the patient abiding of the meek shall not perish for ever.

column2: 19 Up, Lord, and let not man have the upper hand * let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
column3: Up, Lord, and let not man have the upper hand * let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

column2: 20 Put them in fear, O Lord * that the heathen may know themselves to be but men.
column3: Put them in fear, O Lord * that the heathen may know themselves to be but men.

column2: Psalm 10. Ut quid, Domine?
column3: Psalm 10. Ut quid, Domine?

column2: 1 WHY standest thou so far off, O Lord * and hidest thy face in the needful time of trouble?
column3: WHY standest thou so far off, O Lord * and hidest thy face in the needful time of trouble?

column2: 2 The ungodly for his own lust doth persecute the poor * let them be taken in the crafty wiliness that they have imagined.
column3: The ungodly for his own lust doth persecute the poor * let them be taken in the crafty wiliness that they have imagined.

column2: 3 For the ungodly hath made boast of his own heart's desire * and speaketh good of the covetous, whom God abhorreth.
column3: For the ungodly hath made boast of his own heart's desire * and speaketh good of the covetous, whom God abhorreth.

column2: 4 The ungodly is so proud, that he careth not for God ; neither is God in all his thoughts.
column3: The ungodly is so proud, that he careth not for God ; neither is God in all his thoughts.

column2: 5 His ways are alway grievous * thy judgements are far above out of his sight, and therefore defieth he all his enemies.
column3: His ways are alway grievous * thy judgements are far above out of his sight, and therefore defieth he all his enemies.

column2: 6 For he hath said in his heart, Tush, I shall never be cast down * there shall no harm happen unto me.
column3: For he hath said in his heart, Tush, I shall never be cast down * there shall no harm happen unto me.

column2: 7 His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and fraud * under his tongue is ungodliness and vanity.
column3: His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and fraud * under his tongue is ungodliness and vanity.

column2: 8 He sitteth lurking in the thievish corners of the streets * and privily in his lurking dens doth he murder the innocent; his eyes are set against the poor.
column3: He sitteth lurking in the thievish corners of the streets * and privily in his lurking dens doth he murder the innocent; his eyes are set against the poor.

column2: 9 For he lieth waiting secretly, even as a lion lurketh he in his den * that he may ravish the poor.
column3: For he lieth waiting secretly, even as a lion lurketh he in his den * that he may ravish the poor.

column2: 10 He doth ravish the poor * when he getteth him into his net.
column3: He doth ravish the poor * when he getteth him into his net.

column2: 11 He falleth down, and humbleth himself * that the congregation of the poor may fall into the hands of his captains.
column3: He falleth down, and humbleth himself * that the congregation of the poor may fall into the hands of his captains.

column2: 12 He hath said in his heart, Tush, God hath forgotten * he hideth away his face, and he will never see it.
column3: He hath said in his heart, Tush, God hath forgotten * he hideth away his face, and he will never see it.

column2: 13 Arise, O Lord God, and lift up thine hand * forget not the poor.
column3: Arise, O Lord God, and lift up thine hand * forget not the poor.

column2: 14 Wherefore should the wicked blaspheme God * while he doth say in his heart, Tush, thou God carest not for it.
column3: Wherefore should the wicked blaspheme God * while he doth say in his heart, Tush, thou God carest not for it.

column2: 15 Surely thou hast seen it * for thou beholdest ungodliness and wrong.
column3: Surely thou hast seen it * for thou beholdest ungodliness and wrong.

column2: 16 That thou mayest take the matter into thy hand * the poor committeth himself unto thee; for thou art the helper of the friendless.
column3: That thou mayest take the matter into thy hand * the poor committeth himself unto thee; for thou art the helper of the friendless.

column2: 17 Break thou the power of the ungodly and malicious * take away his ungodliness, and thou shalt find none.
column3: Break thou the power of the ungodly and malicious * take away his ungodliness, and thou shalt find none.

column2: 18 The Lord is King for ever and ever * and the heathen are perished out of the land.
column3: The Lord is King for ever and ever * and the heathen are perished out of the land.

column2: 19 Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the poor * thou preparest their heart, and thine ear hearkeneth thereto;
column3: Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the poor * thou preparest their heart, and thine ear hearkeneth thereto;

column2: 20 To help the fatherless and poor unto their right * that the man of the earth be no more exalted against them.
column3: To help the fatherless and poor unto their right * that the man of the earth be no more exalted against them.

column2: Psalm 11. In Domino confido.
column3: Psalm 11. In Domino confido.

column2: 1 IN THE Lord put I my trust * how say ye then to my soul, that she should flee as a bird unto the hill?
column3: IN THE Lord put I my trust * how say ye then to my soul, that she should flee as a bird unto the hill?

column2: 2 For lo, the ungodly bend their bow, and make ready their arrows within the quiver * that they may privily shoot at them which are true of heart.
column3: For lo, the ungodly bend their bow, and make ready their arrows within the quiver * that they may privily shoot at them which are true of heart.

column2: 3 For the foundations will be cast down * and what hath the righteous done?
column3: For the foundations will be cast down * and what hath the righteous done?

column2: 4 The Lord is in his holy temple * the Lord's seat is in heaven.
column3: The Lord is in his holy temple * the Lord's seat is in heaven.

column2: 5 His eyes consider the poor * and his eye-lids try the children of men.
column3: His eyes consider the poor * and his eye-lids try the children of men.

column2: 6 The Lord alloweth the righteous * but the ungodly, and him that delighteth in wickedness, doth his soul abhor.
column3: The Lord alloweth the righteous * but the ungodly, and him that delighteth in wickedness, doth his soul abhor.

column2: 7 Upon the ungodly he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, storm and tempest * this shall be their portion to drink.
column3: Upon the ungodly he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, storm and tempest * this shall be their portion to drink.

column2: 8 For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness * his countenance will behold the thing that is just.
column3: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness * his countenance will behold the thing that is just.

column2: Psalm 12. Salvum me fac.
column3: Psalm 12. Salvum me fac.

column2: 1 HELP me, Lord, for there is not one godly man left * for the faithful are minished from among the children of men,
column3: HELP me, Lord, for there is not one godly man left * for the faithful are minished from among the children of men,

column2: 2 They talk of vanity every one with his neighbour * they do but flatter with their lips, and dissemble in their double heart.
column3: They talk of vanity every one with his neighbour * they do but flatter with their lips, and dissemble in their double heart.

column2: 3 The Lord shall root out all deceitful lips * and the tongue that speaketh proud things;
column3: The Lord shall root out all deceitful lips * and the tongue that speaketh proud things;

column2: 4 Which have said, With our tongue will we prevail * we are they that ought to speak , who is lord over us?
column3: Which have said, With our tongue will we prevail * we are they that ought to speak , who is lord over us?

column2: 5 Now for the comfortless trouble's sake of the needy * and because of the deep sighing of the poor,
column3: Now for the comfortless trouble's sake of the needy * and because of the deep sighing of the poor,

column2: 6 I will up, saith the Lord * and will help every one from him that swelleth against him, and will set him at rest.
column3: I will up, saith the Lord * and will help every one from him that swelleth against him, and will set him at rest.

column2: 7 The words of the Lord are pure words * even as the silver, which from the earth is tried, and purified seven times in the fire.
column3: The words of the Lord are pure words * even as the silver, which from the earth is tried, and purified seven times in the fire.

column2: 8 Thou shalt keep them, O Lord * thou shalt preserve him from this generation for ever.
column3: Thou shalt keep them, O Lord * thou shalt preserve him from this generation for ever.

column2: 9 The ungodly walk on every side * when they are exalted, the children of men are put to rebuke.
column3: The ungodly walk on every side * when they are exalted, the children of men are put to rebuke.

column2: Psalm 13. Usque quo, Domine?
column3: Psalm 13. Usque quo, Domine?

column2: 1 HOW long wilt thou forget me, O Lord, for ever * how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
column3: HOW long wilt thou forget me, O Lord, for ever * how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

column2: 2 How long shall I seek counsel in my soul, and be so vexed in my heart * how long shall mine enemies triumph over me?
column3: How long shall I seek counsel in my soul, and be so vexed in my heart * how long shall mine enemies triumph over me?

column2: 3 Consider, and hear me, O Lord my God * lighten mine eyes, that I sleep not in death.
column3: Consider, and hear me, O Lord my God * lighten mine eyes, that I sleep not in death.

column2: 4 Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him * for if I be cast down, they that trouble me will rejoice at it.
column3: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him * for if I be cast down, they that trouble me will rejoice at it.

column2: 5 But my trust is in thy mercy * and my heart is joyful in thy salvation.
column3: But my trust is in thy mercy * and my heart is joyful in thy salvation.

column2: 6 I will sing of the Lord, because he hath dealt so lovingly with me * yea, I will praise the Name of the Lord most Highest.
column3: I will sing of the Lord, because he hath dealt so lovingly with me * yea, I will praise the Name of the Lord most Highest.

column2: Psalm 14. Dixit insipiens.
column3: Psalm 14. Dixit insipiens.

column2: 1 THE fool hath said in his heart * There is no God.
column3: THE fool hath said in his heart * There is no God.

column2: 2 They are corrupt, and become abominable in their doings * there is none that doeth good, no not one.
column3: They are corrupt, and become abominable in their doings * there is none that doeth good, no not one.

column2: 3 The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men * to see if there were any that would understand, and seek after God.
column3: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men * to see if there were any that would understand, and seek after God.

column2: 4 But they are all gone out of the way, they are altogether become abominable * there is none that doeth good, no not one.
column3: But they are all gone out of the way, they are altogether become abominable * there is none that doeth good, no not one.

column2: 5 Their throat is an open sepulchre, with their tongues have they deceived * the poison of asps is under their lips.
column3: Their throat is an open sepulchre, with their tongues have they deceived * the poison of asps is under their lips.

column2: 6 Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness * their feet are swift to shed blood.
column3: Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness * their feet are swift to shed blood.

column2: 7 Destruction and unhappiness is in their ways, and the way of peace have they not known ; there is no fear of God before their eyes.
column3: Destruction and unhappiness is in their ways, and the way of peace have they not known ; there is no fear of God before their eyes.

column2: 8 Have they no knowledge, that they are all such workers of mischief * eating up my people as it were bread, and call not upon the Lord?
column3: Have they no knowledge, that they are all such workers of mischief * eating up my people as it were bread, and call not upon the Lord?

column2: 9 There were they brought in great fear, even where no fear was * for God is in the generation of the righteous.
column3: There were they brought in great fear, even where no fear was * for God is in the generation of the righteous.

column2: 10 As for you, ye have made a mock at the counsel of the poor * because he putteth his trust in the Lord.
column3: As for you, ye have made a mock at the counsel of the poor * because he putteth his trust in the Lord.

column2: 11 Who shall give salvation unto Israel out of Sion? When the Lord turneth the captivity of his people * then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
column3: Who shall give salvation unto Israel out of Sion? When the Lord turneth the captivity of his people * then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

column2: Psalm 15. Domine, quis habitabit?
column3: Psalm 15. Domine, quis habitabit?

column2: 1 LORD, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle * or who shall rest upon thy holy hill?
column3: LORD, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle * or who shall rest upon thy holy hill?

column2: 2 Even he that leadeth an uncorrupt life * and doeth the thing which is right, and speaketh the truth from his heart.
column3: Even he that leadeth an uncorrupt life * and doeth the thing which is right, and speaketh the truth from his heart.

column2: 3 He that hath used no deceit in his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbour * and hath not slandered his neighbour.
column3: He that hath used no deceit in his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbour * and hath not slandered his neighbour.

column2: 4 He that setteth not by himself, but is lowly in his own eyes * and maketh much of them that fear the Lord.
column3: He that setteth not by himself, but is lowly in his own eyes * and maketh much of them that fear the Lord.

column2: 5 He that sweareth unto his neighbour, and disappointeth him not * though it were to his own hindrance.
column3: He that sweareth unto his neighbour, and disappointeth him not * though it were to his own hindrance.

column2: 6 He that hath not given his money upon usury * nor taken reward against the innocent.
column3: He that hath not given his money upon usury * nor taken reward against the innocent.

column2: 7 Whoso doeth these things * shall never fall.
column3: Whoso doeth these things * shall never fall.

column2: Psalm 16. Conserva me, Domine.
column3: Psalm 16. Conserva me, Domine.

column2: 1 PRESERVE me, O God * for in thee have I put my trust.
column3: PRESERVE me, O God * for in thee have I put my trust.

column2: 2 O my soul, thou hast said unto the Lord * Thou art my God, my goods are nothing unto thee.
column3: O my soul, thou hast said unto the Lord * Thou art my God, my goods are nothing unto thee.

column2: 3 All my delight is upon the saints, that are in the earth * and upon such as excel in virtue.
column3: All my delight is upon the saints, that are in the earth * and upon such as excel in virtue.

column2: 4 But they that run after another god * shall have great trouble.
column3: But they that run after another god * shall have great trouble.

column2: 5 Their drink-offerings of blood will I not offer * neither make mention of their names within my lips.
column3: Their drink-offerings of blood will I not offer * neither make mention of their names within my lips.

column2: 6 The Lord himself is the portion of mine inheritance, and of my cup * thou shalt maintain my lot.
column3: The Lord himself is the portion of mine inheritance, and of my cup * thou shalt maintain my lot.

column2: 7 The lot is fallen unto me in a fair ground * yea, I have a goodly heritage.
column3: The lot is fallen unto me in a fair ground * yea, I have a goodly heritage.

column2: 8 I will thank the Lord for giving me warning * my reins also chasten me in the night-season.
column3: I will thank the Lord for giving me warning * my reins also chasten me in the night-season.

column2: 9 I have set God always before me * for he is on my right hand, therefore I shall not fall.
column3: I have set God always before me * for he is on my right hand, therefore I shall not fall.

column2: 10 Wherefore my heart was glad, and my glory rejoiced * my flesh also shall rest in hope.
column3: Wherefore my heart was glad, and my glory rejoiced * my flesh also shall rest in hope.

column2: 11 For why? thou shalt not leave my soul in hell * neither shalt thou suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.
column3: For why? thou shalt not leave my soul in hell * neither shalt thou suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.

column2: 12 Thou shalt shew me the path of life; in thy presence is the fulness of joy * and at thy right hand there is pleasure for evermore.
column3: Thou shalt shew me the path of life; in thy presence is the fulness of joy * and at thy right hand there is pleasure for evermore.

column2: Psalm 17. Exaudi, Domine.
column3: Psalm 17. Exaudi, Domine.

column2: 1 HEAR the right, O Lord, consider my complaint * and hearken unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.
column3: HEAR the right, O Lord, consider my complaint * and hearken unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.

column2: 2 Let my sentence come forth from thy presence * and let thine eyes look upon the thing that is equal.
column3: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence * and let thine eyes look upon the thing that is equal.

column2: 3 Thou hast proved and visited mine heart in the night-season; thou hast tried me, and shalt find no wickedness in me; for I am utterly purposed that my mouth shall not offend.
column3: Thou hast proved and visited mine heart in the night-season; thou hast tried me, and shalt find no wickedness in me; for I am utterly purposed that my mouth shall not offend.

column2: 4 Because of men's works, that are done against the words of thy lips * I have kept me from the ways of the destroyer.
column3: Because of men's works, that are done against the words of thy lips * I have kept me from the ways of the destroyer.

column2: 5 O hold thou up my goings in thy paths * that my footsteps slip not.
column3: O hold thou up my goings in thy paths * that my footsteps slip not.

column2: 6 I have called upon thee, O God, for thou shalt hear me * incline thine ear to me, and hearken unto my words.
column3: I have called upon thee, O God, for thou shalt hear me * incline thine ear to me, and hearken unto my words.

column2: 7 Shew thy marvellous loving-kindness, thou that art the Saviour of them which put their trust in thee * from such as resist thy right hand.
column3: Shew thy marvellous loving-kindness, thou that art the Saviour of them which put their trust in thee * from such as resist thy right hand.

column2: 8 Keep me as the apple of an eye * hide me under the shadow of thy wings.
column3: Keep me as the apple of an eye * hide me under the shadow of thy wings.

column2: 9 From the ungodly that trouble me * mine enemies compass me round about to take away my soul.
column3: From the ungodly that trouble me * mine enemies compass me round about to take away my soul.

column2: 10 They are inclosed in their own fat * and their mouth speaketh proud things.
column3: They are inclosed in their own fat * and their mouth speaketh proud things.

column2: 11 They lie waiting in our way on every side * turning their eyes down to the ground.
column3: They lie waiting in our way on every side * turning their eyes down to the ground.

column2: 12 Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey * and as it were a lion's whelp, lurking in secret places.
column3: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey * and as it were a lion's whelp, lurking in secret places.

column2: 13 Up, Lord, disappoint him, and cast him down * deliver my soul from the ungodly, which is a sword of thine;
column3: Up, Lord, disappoint him, and cast him down * deliver my soul from the ungodly, which is a sword of thine;

column2: 14 From the men of thy hand, O Lord, from the men, I say, and from the evil world * which have their portion in this life, whose bellies thou fillest with thy hid treasure.
column3: From the men of thy hand, O Lord, from the men, I say, and from the evil world * which have their portion in this life, whose bellies thou fillest with thy hid treasure.

column2: 15 They have children at their desire * and leave the rest of their substance for their babes.
column3: They have children at their desire * and leave the rest of their substance for their babes.

column2: 16 But as for me, I will behold thy presence in righteousness * and when I awake up after thy likeness, I shall be satisfied with it.
column3: But as for me, I will behold thy presence in righteousness * and when I awake up after thy likeness, I shall be satisfied with it.

column2: Psalm 18. Diligam te, Domine.
column3: Psalm 18. Diligam te, Domine.

column2: 1 I WILL love thee, O Lord, my strength; the Lord is my stony rock, and my defence * my saviour, my God, and my might, in whom I will trust, my buckler, the horn also of my salvation, and my refuge.
column3: I WILL love thee, O Lord, my strength; the Lord is my stony rock, and my defence * my saviour, my God, and my might, in whom I will trust, my buckler, the horn also of my salvation, and my refuge.

column2: 2 I will call upon the Lord, which is worthy to be praised * so shall I be safe from mine enemies.
column3: I will call upon the Lord, which is worthy to be praised * so shall I be safe from mine enemies.

column2: 3 The sorrows of death compassed me * and the overflowings of ungodliness made me afraid.
column3: The sorrows of death compassed me * and the overflowings of ungodliness made me afraid.

column2: 4 The pains of hell came about me * the snares of death overtook me.
column3: The pains of hell came about me * the snares of death overtook me.

column2: 5 In my trouble I will call upon the Lord * and complain unto my God.
column3: In my trouble I will call upon the Lord * and complain unto my God.

column2: 6 So shall he hear my voice out of his holy temple * and my complaint shall come before him, it shall enter even into his ears.
column3: So shall he hear my voice out of his holy temple * and my complaint shall come before him, it shall enter even into his ears.

column2: 7 The earth trembled and quaked * the very foundations also of the hills shook, and were removed, because he was wroth.
column3: The earth trembled and quaked * the very foundations also of the hills shook, and were removed, because he was wroth.

column2: 8 There went a smoke out in his presence * and a consuming fire out of his mouth, so that coals were kindled at it.
column3: There went a smoke out in his presence * and a consuming fire out of his mouth, so that coals were kindled at it.

column2: 9 He bowed the heavens also, and came down * and it was dark under his feet.
column3: He bowed the heavens also, and came down * and it was dark under his feet.

column2: 10 He rode upon the cherubins, and did fly * he came flying upon the wings of the wind.
column3: He rode upon the cherubins, and did fly * he came flying upon the wings of the wind.

column2: 11 He made darkness his secret place * his pavilion round about him, with dark water and thick clouds to cover him.
column3: He made darkness his secret place * his pavilion round about him, with dark water and thick clouds to cover him.

column2: 12 At the brightness of his presence his clouds removed * hail-stones, and coals of fire.
column3: At the brightness of his presence his clouds removed * hail-stones, and coals of fire.

column2: 13 The Lord also thundered out of heaven, and the Highest gave his thunder * hail-stones, and coals of fire.
column3: The Lord also thundered out of heaven, and the Highest gave his thunder * hail-stones, and coals of fire.

column2: 14 He sent out his arrows, and scattered them * he cast forth lightnings, and destroyed them.
column3: He sent out his arrows, and scattered them * he cast forth lightnings, and destroyed them.

column2: 15 The springs of water were seen, and the foundations of the round world were discovered, at thy chiding, O Lord * at the blasting of the breath of thy displeasure.
column3: The springs of water were seen, and the foundations of the round world were discovered, at thy chiding, O Lord * at the blasting of the breath of thy displeasure.

column2: 16 He shall send down from on high to fetch me * and shall take me out of many waters.
column3: He shall send down from on high to fetch me * and shall take me out of many waters.

column2: 17 He shall deliver me from my strongest enemy, and from them which hate me * for they are too mighty for me.
column3: He shall deliver me from my strongest enemy, and from them which hate me * for they are too mighty for me.

column2: 18 They prevented me in the day of my trouble * but the Lord was my upholder.
column3: They prevented me in the day of my trouble * but the Lord was my upholder.

column2: 19 He brought me forth also into a place of liberty * he brought me forth, even because he had a favour unto me.
column3: He brought me forth also into a place of liberty * he brought me forth, even because he had a favour unto me.

column2: 20 The Lord shall reward me after my righteous dealing * according to the cleanness of my hands shall he recompense me.
column3: The Lord shall reward me after my righteous dealing * according to the cleanness of my hands shall he recompense me.

column2: 21 Because I have kept the ways of the Lord * and have not forsaken my God, as the wicked doth.
column3: Because I have kept the ways of the Lord * and have not forsaken my God, as the wicked doth.

column2: 22 For I have an eye unto all his laws * and will not cast out his commandments from me.
column3: For I have an eye unto all his laws * and will not cast out his commandments from me.

column2: 23 I was also uncorrupt before him * and eschewed mine own wickedness.
column3: I was also uncorrupt before him * and eschewed mine own wickedness.

column2: 24 Therefore shall the Lord reward me after my righteous dealing * and according unto the cleanness of my hands in his eye-sight.
column3: Therefore shall the Lord reward me after my righteous dealing * and according unto the cleanness of my hands in his eye-sight.

column2: 25 With the holy thou shalt be holy * and with a perfect man thou shalt be perfect.
column3: With the holy thou shalt be holy * and with a perfect man thou shalt be perfect.

column2: 26 With the clean thou shalt be clean * and with the froward thou shalt learn frowardness.
column3: With the clean thou shalt be clean * and with the froward thou shalt learn frowardness.

column2: 27 For thou shalt save the people that are in adversity * and shalt bring down the high looks of the proud.
column3: For thou shalt save the people that are in adversity * and shalt bring down the high looks of the proud.

column2: 28 Thou also shalt light my candle * the Lord my God shall make my darkness to be light.
column3: Thou also shalt light my candle * the Lord my God shall make my darkness to be light.

column2: 29 For in thee I shall discomfit an host of men * and with the help of my God I shall leap over the wall.
column3: For in thee I shall discomfit an host of men * and with the help of my God I shall leap over the wall.

column2: 30 The way of God is an undefiled way * the word of the Lord also is tried in the fire; he is the defender of all them that put their trust in him.
column3: The way of God is an undefiled way * the word of the Lord also is tried in the fire; he is the defender of all them that put their trust in him.

column2: 31 For who is God, but the Lord * or who hath any strength, except our God?
column3: For who is God, but the Lord * or who hath any strength, except our God?

column2: 32 It is God, that girdeth me with strength of war * and maketh my way perfect.
column3: It is God, that girdeth me with strength of war * and maketh my way perfect.

column2: 33 He maketh my feet like harts' feet * and setteth me up on high.
column3: He maketh my feet like harts' feet * and setteth me up on high.

column2: 34 He teacheth mine hands to fight * and mine arms shall break even a bow of steel.
column3: He teacheth mine hands to fight * and mine arms shall break even a bow of steel.

column2: 35 Thou hast given me the defence of thy salvation * thy right hand also shall hold me up, and thy loving correction shall make me great.
column3: Thou hast given me the defence of thy salvation * thy right hand also shall hold me up, and thy loving correction shall make me great.

column2: 36 Thou shalt make room enough under me for to go * that my footsteps shall not slide.
column3: Thou shalt make room enough under me for to go * that my footsteps shall not slide.

column2: 37 I will follow upon mine enemies, and overtake them * neither will I turn again till I have destroyed them.
column3: I will follow upon mine enemies, and overtake them * neither will I turn again till I have destroyed them.

column2: 38 I will smite them, that they shall not be able to stand * but fall under my feet.
column3: I will smite them, that they shall not be able to stand * but fall under my feet.

column2: 39 Thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle * thou shalt throw down mine enemies under me.
column3: Thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle * thou shalt throw down mine enemies under me.

column2: 40 Thou hast made mine enemies also to turn their backs upon me * and I shall destroy them that hate me.
column3: Thou hast made mine enemies also to turn their backs upon me * and I shall destroy them that hate me.

column2: 41 They shall cry, but there shall be none to help them * yea, even unto the Lord shall they cry, but he shall not hear them.
column3: They shall cry, but there shall be none to help them * yea, even unto the Lord shall they cry, but he shall not hear them.

column2: 42 I will beat them as small as the dust before the wind * I will cast them out as the clay in the streets.
column3: I will beat them as small as the dust before the wind * I will cast them out as the clay in the streets.

column2: 43 Thou shalt deliver me from the strivings of the people * and thou shalt make me the head of the heathen.
column3: Thou shalt deliver me from the strivings of the people * and thou shalt make me the head of the heathen.

column2: 44 A people whom I have not known * shall serve me.
column3: A people whom I have not known * shall serve me.

column2: 45 As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me * but the strange children shall dissemble with me.
column3: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me * but the strange children shall dissemble with me.

column2: 46 The strange children shall fail * and be afraid out of their prisons.
column3: The strange children shall fail * and be afraid out of their prisons.

column2: 47 The Lord liveth, and blessed be my strong helper * and praised be the Lord of my salvation;
column3: The Lord liveth, and blessed be my strong helper * and praised be the Lord of my salvation;

column2: 48 Even the God that seeth that I be avenged * and subdueth the people unto me.
column3: Even the God that seeth that I be avenged * and subdueth the people unto me.

column2: 49 It is he that delivereth me from my cruel enemies, and setteth me up above mine adversaries * thou shalt rid me from the wicked man.
column3: It is he that delivereth me from my cruel enemies, and setteth me up above mine adversaries * thou shalt rid me from the wicked man.

column2: 50 For this cause will I give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the Gentiles * and sing praises unto thy Name.
column3: For this cause will I give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the Gentiles * and sing praises unto thy Name.

column2: 51 Great prosperity giveth he unto his King * and sheweth loving-kindness unto David his Anointed, and unto his seed for evermore.
column3: Great prosperity giveth he unto his King * and sheweth loving-kindness unto David his Anointed, and unto his seed for evermore.

column2: Psalm 19. Caeli enarrant.
column3: Psalm 19. Caeli enarrant.

column2: 1 THE heavens declare the glory of God * and the firmament sheweth his handywork.
column3: THE heavens declare the glory of God * and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

column2: 2 One day telleth another * and one night certifieth another.
column3: One day telleth another * and one night certifieth another.

column2: 3 There is neither speech nor language * but their voices are heard among them.
column3: There is neither speech nor language * but their voices are heard among them.

column2: 4 Their sound is gone out into all lands * and their words into the ends of the world.
column3: Their sound is gone out into all lands * and their words into the ends of the world.

column2: 5 In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun * which cometh forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a giant to run his course.
column3: In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun * which cometh forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a giant to run his course.

column2: 6 It goeth forth from the uttermost part of the heaven, and runneth about unto the end of it again * and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.
column3: It goeth forth from the uttermost part of the heaven, and runneth about unto the end of it again * and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

column2: 7 The law of the Lord is an undefiled law, converting the soul * the testimony of the Lord is sure, and giveth wisdom unto the simple.
column3: The law of the Lord is an undefiled law, converting the soul * the testimony of the Lord is sure, and giveth wisdom unto the simple.

column2: 8 The statutes of the Lord are right, and rejoice the heart * the commandment of the Lord is pure, and giveth light unto the eyes.
column3: The statutes of the Lord are right, and rejoice the heart * the commandment of the Lord is pure, and giveth light unto the eyes.

column2: 9 The fear of the Lord is clean, and endureth for ever * the judgements of the Lord are true, and righteous altogether.
column3: The fear of the Lord is clean, and endureth for ever * the judgements of the Lord are true, and righteous altogether.

column2: 10 More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold * sweeter also than honey, and the honey-comb.
column3: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold * sweeter also than honey, and the honey-comb.

column2: 11 Moreover, by them is thy servant taught * and in keeping of them there is great reward.
column3: Moreover, by them is thy servant taught * and in keeping of them there is great reward.

column2: 12 Who can tell how oft he offendeth * O cleanse thou me from my secret faults.
column3: Who can tell how oft he offendeth * O cleanse thou me from my secret faults.

column2: 13 Keep thy servant also from presumptuous sins, lest they get the dominion over me * so shall I be undefiled, and innocent from the great offence.
column3: Keep thy servant also from presumptuous sins, lest they get the dominion over me * so shall I be undefiled, and innocent from the great offence.

column2: 14 Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart * be alway acceptable in thy sight,
column3: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart * be alway acceptable in thy sight,

column2: 15 O Lord * my strength, and my redeemer.
column3: O Lord * my strength, and my redeemer.

column2: Psalm 20. Exaudiat te Dominus.
column3: Psalm 20. Exaudiat te Dominus.

column2: 1 THE Lord hear thee in the day of trouble * the Name of the God of Jacob defend thee;
column3: THE Lord hear thee in the day of trouble * the Name of the God of Jacob defend thee;

column2: 2 Send thee help from the sanctuary * and strengthen thee out of Sion;
column3: Send thee help from the sanctuary * and strengthen thee out of Sion;

column2: 3 Remember all thy offerings * and accept thy burnt-sacrifice;
column3: Remember all thy offerings * and accept thy burnt-sacrifice;

column2: 4 Grant thee thy heart's desire * and fulfil all thy mind.
column3: Grant thee thy heart's desire * and fulfil all thy mind.

column2: 5 We will rejoice in thy salvation, and triumph in the Name of the Lord our God * the Lord perform all thy petitions.
column3: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and triumph in the Name of the Lord our God * the Lord perform all thy petitions.

column2: 6 Now know I that the Lord helpeth his Anointed, and will hear him from his holy heaven * even with the wholesome strength of his right hand.
column3: Now know I that the Lord helpeth his Anointed, and will hear him from his holy heaven * even with the wholesome strength of his right hand.

column2: 7 Some put their trust in chariots, and some in horses * but we will remember the Name of the Lord our God.
column3: Some put their trust in chariots, and some in horses * but we will remember the Name of the Lord our God.

column2: 8 They are brought down, and fallen * but we are risen, and stand upright.
column3: They are brought down, and fallen * but we are risen, and stand upright.

column2: 9 Save, Lord, and hear us, O King of heaven * when we call upon thee.
column3: Save, Lord, and hear us, O King of heaven * when we call upon thee.

column2: Psalm 21. Domine, in virtute tua.
column3: Psalm 21. Domine, in virtute tua.

column2: 1 THE King shall rejoice in thy strength, O Lord * exceeding glad shall he be of thy salvation.
column3: THE King shall rejoice in thy strength, O Lord * exceeding glad shall he be of thy salvation.

column2: 2 Thou hast given him his heart's desire * and hast not denied him the request of his lips.
column3: Thou hast given him his heart's desire * and hast not denied him the request of his lips.

column2: 3 For thou shalt prevent him with the blessings of goodness * and shalt set a crown of pure gold upon his head.
column3: For thou shalt prevent him with the blessings of goodness * and shalt set a crown of pure gold upon his head.

column2: 4 He asked life of thee, and thou gavest him a long life * even for ever and ever.
column3: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest him a long life * even for ever and ever.

column2: 5 His honour is great in thy salvation * glory and great worship shalt thou lay upon him.
column3: His honour is great in thy salvation * glory and great worship shalt thou lay upon him.

column2: 6 For thou shalt give him everlasting felicity * and make him glad with the joy of thy countenance.
column3: For thou shalt give him everlasting felicity * and make him glad with the joy of thy countenance.

column2: 7 And why? because the King putteth his trust in the Lord * and in the mercy of the most Highest he shall not miscarry.
column3: And why? because the King putteth his trust in the Lord * and in the mercy of the most Highest he shall not miscarry.

column2: 8 All thine enemies shall feel thine hand * thy right hand shall find out them that hate thee.
column3: All thine enemies shall feel thine hand * thy right hand shall find out them that hate thee.

column2: 9 Thou shalt make them like a fiery oven in time of thy wrath * the Lord shall destroy them in his displeasure, and the fire shall consume them.
column3: Thou shalt make them like a fiery oven in time of thy wrath * the Lord shall destroy them in his displeasure, and the fire shall consume them.

column2: 10 Their fruit shalt thou root out of the earth * and their seed from among the children of men.
column3: Their fruit shalt thou root out of the earth * and their seed from among the children of men.

column2: 11 For they intended mischief against thee * and imagined such a device as they are not able to perform.
column3: For they intended mischief against thee * and imagined such a device as they are not able to perform.

column2: 12 Therefore shalt thou put them to flight * and the strings of thy bow shalt thou make ready against the face of them.
column3: Therefore shalt thou put them to flight * and the strings of thy bow shalt thou make ready against the face of them.

column2: 13 Be thou exalted, Lord, in thine own strength * so we will sing, and praise thy power.
column3: Be thou exalted, Lord, in thine own strength * so we will sing, and praise thy power.

column2: Psalm 22. Deus, Deus meus.
column3: Psalm 22. Deus, Deus meus.

column2: 1 MY GOD, my God, look upon me; why hast thou forsaken me * and art so far from my health, and from the words of my complaint?
column3: MY GOD, my God, look upon me; why hast thou forsaken me * and art so far from my health, and from the words of my complaint?

column2: 2 O my God, I cry in the day-time, but thou hearest not * and in the night-season also I take no rest.
column3: O my God, I cry in the day-time, but thou hearest not * and in the night-season also I take no rest.

column2: 3 And thou continuest holy * O thou worship of Israel.
column3: And thou continuest holy * O thou worship of Israel.

column2: 4 Our fathers hoped in thee * they trusted in thee, and thou didst deliver them.
column3: Our fathers hoped in thee * they trusted in thee, and thou didst deliver them.

column2: 5 They called upon thee, and were holpen * they put their trust in thee, and were not confounded.
column3: They called upon thee, and were holpen * they put their trust in thee, and were not confounded.

column2: 6 But as for me, I am a worm, and no man * a very scorn of men, and the outcast of the people.
column3: But as for me, I am a worm, and no man * a very scorn of men, and the outcast of the people.

column2: 7 All they that see me laugh me to scorn * they shoot our their lips, and shake their heads, saying,
column3: All they that see me laugh me to scorn * they shoot our their lips, and shake their heads, saying,

column2: 8 He trusted in God, that he would deliver him * let him deliver him, if he will have him.
column3: He trusted in God, that he would deliver him * let him deliver him, if he will have him.

column2: 9 But thou art he that took me out of my mother's womb * thou wast my hope, when I hanged yet upon my mother's breasts.
column3: But thou art he that took me out of my mother's womb * thou wast my hope, when I hanged yet upon my mother's breasts.

column2: 10 I have been left unto thee ever since I was born * thou art my God, even from my mother's womb.
column3: I have been left unto thee ever since I was born * thou art my God, even from my mother's womb.

column2: 11 O go not from me, for trouble is hard at hand * and there is none to help me.
column3: O go not from me, for trouble is hard at hand * and there is none to help me.

column2: 12 Many oxen are come about me * fat bulls of Basan close me in on every side.
column3: Many oxen are come about me * fat bulls of Basan close me in on every side.

column2: 13 They gape upon me with their mouths * as it were a ramping and a roaring lion.
column3: They gape upon me with their mouths * as it were a ramping and a roaring lion.

column2: 14 I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint * my heart also in the midst of my body is even like melting wax.
column3: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint * my heart also in the midst of my body is even like melting wax.

column2: 15 My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaveth to my gums * and thou shalt bring me into the dust of death.
column3: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaveth to my gums * and thou shalt bring me into the dust of death.

column2: 16 For many dogs are come about me * and the council of the wicked layeth siege against me.
column3: For many dogs are come about me * and the council of the wicked layeth siege against me.

column2: 17 They pierced my hands and my feet; I may tell all my bones * they stand staring and looking upon me.
column3: They pierced my hands and my feet; I may tell all my bones * they stand staring and looking upon me.

column2: 18 They part my garments among them * and casts lots upon my vesture.
column3: They part my garments among them * and casts lots upon my vesture.

column2: 19 But be not thou far from me, O Lord * thou art my succour, haste thee to help me.
column3: But be not thou far from me, O Lord * thou art my succour, haste thee to help me.

column2: 20 Deliver my soul from the sword * my darling from the power of the dog.
column3: Deliver my soul from the sword * my darling from the power of the dog.

column2: 21 Save me from the lion's mouth * thou hast heard me also from among the horns of the unicorns.
column3: Save me from the lion's mouth * thou hast heard me also from among the horns of the unicorns.

column2: 22 I will declare thy Name unto my brethren * in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.
column3: I will declare thy Name unto my brethren * in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

column2: 23 O praise the Lord, ye that fear him * magnify him, all ye of the seed of Jacob, and fear him, all ye seed of Israel.
column3: O praise the Lord, ye that fear him * magnify him, all ye of the seed of Jacob, and fear him, all ye seed of Israel.

column2: 24 For he hath not despised, nor abhorred, the low estate of the poor * he hath not hid his face from him, but when he called unto him he heard him.
column3: For he hath not despised, nor abhorred, the low estate of the poor * he hath not hid his face from him, but when he called unto him he heard him.

column2: 25 My praise is of thee in the great congregation * my vows will I perform in the sight of them that fear him.
column3: My praise is of thee in the great congregation * my vows will I perform in the sight of them that fear him.

column2: 26 The poor shall eat and be satisfied * they that seek after the Lord shall praise him; your heart shall live for ever.
column3: The poor shall eat and be satisfied * they that seek after the Lord shall praise him; your heart shall live for ever.

column2: 27 All the ends of the world shall remember themselves, and be turned unto the Lord * and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before him.
column3: All the ends of the world shall remember themselves, and be turned unto the Lord * and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before him.

column2: 28 For the kingdom is the Lord's * and he is the Governor among the people.
column3: For the kingdom is the Lord's * and he is the Governor among the people.

column2: 29 All such as be fat upon earth * have eaten and worshipped.
column3: All such as be fat upon earth * have eaten and worshipped.

column2: 30 All they that go down into the dust shall kneel before him * and no man hath quickened his own soul.
column3: All they that go down into the dust shall kneel before him * and no man hath quickened his own soul.

column2: 31 My seed shall serve him * they shall be counted unto the Lord for a generation.
column3: My seed shall serve him * they shall be counted unto the Lord for a generation.

column2: 32 They shall come, and the heavens shall declare his righteousness * unto a people that shall be born, whom the Lord hath made.
column3: They shall come, and the heavens shall declare his righteousness * unto a people that shall be born, whom the Lord hath made.

column2: Psalm 23. Dominus regit me.
column3: Psalm 23. Dominus regit me.

column2: 1 THE Lord is my shepherd * therefore can I lack nothing.
column3: THE Lord is my shepherd * therefore can I lack nothing.

column2: 2 He shall feed me in a green pasture * and lead me forth beside the waters of comfort.
column3: He shall feed me in a green pasture * and lead me forth beside the waters of comfort.

column2: 3 He shall convert my soul * and bring me forth in the paths of righteousness, for his Name's sake.
column3: He shall convert my soul * and bring me forth in the paths of righteousness, for his Name's sake.

column2: 4 Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil * for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff comfort me.
column3: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil * for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff comfort me.

column2: 5 Thou shalt prepare a table before me against them that trouble me * thou hast anointed my head with oil, and my cup shall be full.
column3: Thou shalt prepare a table before me against them that trouble me * thou hast anointed my head with oil, and my cup shall be full.

column2: 6 But thy loving-kindness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life * and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.
column3: But thy loving-kindness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life * and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.

column2: Psalm 24. Domini est terra.
column3: Psalm 24. Domini est terra.

column2: 1 THE earth is the Lord's, and all that therein is * the compass of the world, and they that dwell therein.
column3: THE earth is the Lord's, and all that therein is * the compass of the world, and they that dwell therein.

column2: 2 For he hath founded it upon the seas * and prepared it upon the floods.
column3: For he hath founded it upon the seas * and prepared it upon the floods.

column2: 3 Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord * or who shall rise up in his holy place?
column3: Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord * or who shall rise up in his holy place?

column2: 4 Even he that hath clean hands, and a pure heart * and that hath not lift up his mind unto vanity, nor sworn to deceive his neighbour.
column3: Even he that hath clean hands, and a pure heart * and that hath not lift up his mind unto vanity, nor sworn to deceive his neighbour.

column2: 5 He shall receive the blessing from the Lord * and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
column3: He shall receive the blessing from the Lord * and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

column2: 6 This is the generation of them that seek him * even of them that seek thy face, O Jacob.
column3: This is the generation of them that seek him * even of them that seek thy face, O Jacob.

column2: 7 Lift up your heads, O ye gates, and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors * and the King of glory shall come in.
column3: Lift up your heads, O ye gates, and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors * and the King of glory shall come in.

column2: 8 Who is the King of glory * it is the Lord strong and mighty, even the Lord mighty in battle.
column3: Who is the King of glory * it is the Lord strong and mighty, even the Lord mighty in battle.

column2: 9 Lift up your heads, O ye gates, and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors * and the King of glory shall come in.
column3: Lift up your heads, O ye gates, and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors * and the King of glory shall come in.

column2: 10 Who is the King of glory * even the Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory.
column3: Who is the King of glory * even the Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory.

column2: Psalm 25. Ad te, Domine, levavi.
column3: Psalm 25. Ad te, Domine, levavi.

column2: 1 UNTO thee, O Lord, will I lift up my soul; my God, I have put my trust in thee * O let me not be confounded, neither let mine enemies triumph over me.
column3: UNTO thee, O Lord, will I lift up my soul; my God, I have put my trust in thee * O let me not be confounded, neither let mine enemies triumph over me.

column2: 2 For all they that hope in thee shall not be ashamed * but such as transgress without a cause shall be put to confusion.
column3: For all they that hope in thee shall not be ashamed * but such as transgress without a cause shall be put to confusion.

column2: 3 Shew me thy ways, O Lord * and teach me thy paths.
column3: Shew me thy ways, O Lord * and teach me thy paths.

column2: 4 Lead me forth in thy truth, and learn me * for thou art the God of my salvation; in thee hath been my hope all the day long.
column3: Lead me forth in thy truth, and learn me * for thou art the God of my salvation; in thee hath been my hope all the day long.

column2: 5 Call to remembrance, O Lord, thy tender mercies * and thy loving-kindnesses, which have been ever of old.
column3: Call to remembrance, O Lord, thy tender mercies * and thy loving-kindnesses, which have been ever of old.

column2: 6 O remember not the sins and offences of my youth * but according to thy mercy think thou upon me, O Lord, for thy goodness.
column3: O remember not the sins and offences of my youth * but according to thy mercy think thou upon me, O Lord, for thy goodness.

column2: 7 Gracious and righteous is the Lord * therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
column3: Gracious and righteous is the Lord * therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

column2: 8 Them that are meek shall he guide in judgement * and such as are gentle, them shall he learn his way.
column3: Them that are meek shall he guide in judgement * and such as are gentle, them shall he learn his way.

column2: 9 All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth * unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
column3: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth * unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.

column2: 10 For thy Name's sake, O Lord * be merciful unto my sin, for it is great.
column3: For thy Name's sake, O Lord * be merciful unto my sin, for it is great.

column2: 11 What man is he that feareth the Lord * him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.
column3: What man is he that feareth the Lord * him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.

column2: 12 His soul shall dwell at ease * and his seed shall inherit the land.
column3: His soul shall dwell at ease * and his seed shall inherit the land.

column2: 13 The secret of the Lord is among them that fear him * and he will shew them his covenant.
column3: The secret of the Lord is among them that fear him * and he will shew them his covenant.

column2: 14 Mine eyes are ever looking unto the Lord * for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
column3: Mine eyes are ever looking unto the Lord * for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

column2: 15 Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me * for I am desolate and in misery.
column3: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me * for I am desolate and in misery.

column2: 16 The sorrows of my heart are enlarged * O bring thou me out of my troubles.
column3: The sorrows of my heart are enlarged * O bring thou me out of my troubles.

column2: 17 Look upon my adversity and misery * and forgive me all my sin.
column3: Look upon my adversity and misery * and forgive me all my sin.

column2: 18 Consider mine enemies, how many they are * and they bear a tyrannous hate against me.
column3: Consider mine enemies, how many they are * and they bear a tyrannous hate against me.

column2: 19 O keep my soul, and deliver me * let me not be confounded, for I have put my trust in thee.
column3: O keep my soul, and deliver me * let me not be confounded, for I have put my trust in thee.

column2: 20 Let perfectness and righteous dealing wait upon me * for my hope hath been in thee.
column3: Let perfectness and righteous dealing wait upon me * for my hope hath been in thee.

column2: 21 Deliver Israel, O God * out of all his troubles.
column3: Deliver Israel, O God * out of all his troubles.

column2: Psalm 26. Judica me, Domine.
column3: Psalm 26. Judica me, Domine.

column2: 1 BE THOU my judge, O Lord, for I have walked innocently * my trust hath been also in the Lord, therefore shall I not fall.
column3: BE THOU my judge, O Lord, for I have walked innocently * my trust hath been also in the Lord, therefore shall I not fall.

column2: 2 Examine me, O Lord, and prove me * try out my reins and my heart.
column3: Examine me, O Lord, and prove me * try out my reins and my heart.

column2: 3 For thy loving-kindness is ever before mine eyes * and I will walk in thy truth.
column3: For thy loving-kindness is ever before mine eyes * and I will walk in thy truth.

column2: 4 I have not dwelt with vain persons * neither will I have fellowship with the deceitful.
