column3: I have not dwelt with vain persons * neither will I have fellowship with the deceitful.

column2: 5 I have hated the congregation of the wicked * and will not sit among the ungodly.
column3: I have hated the congregation of the wicked * and will not sit among the ungodly.

column2: 6 I will wash my hands in innocency, O Lord * and so will I go to thine altar.
column3: I will wash my hands in innocency, O Lord * and so will I go to thine altar.

column2: 7 That I may shew the voice of thanksgiving * and tell of all thy wondrous works.
column3: That I may shew the voice of thanksgiving * and tell of all thy wondrous works.

column2: 8 Lord, I have loved the habitation of thy house * and the place where thine honour dwelleth.
column3: Lord, I have loved the habitation of thy house * and the place where thine honour dwelleth.

column2: 9 O shut not up my soul with the sinners * nor my life with the blood-thirsty.
column3: O shut not up my soul with the sinners * nor my life with the blood-thirsty.

column2: 10 In whose hands is wickedness * and their right hand is full of gifts.
column3: In whose hands is wickedness * and their right hand is full of gifts.

column2: 11 But as for me, I will walk innocently * O deliver me, and be merciful unto me.
column3: But as for me, I will walk innocently * O deliver me, and be merciful unto me.

column2: 12 My foot standeth right * I will praise the Lord in the congregations.
column3: My foot standeth right * I will praise the Lord in the congregations.

column2: Psalm 27. Dominus illuminatio.
column3: Psalm 27. Dominus illuminatio.

column2: 1 THE Lord is my light and my salvation ; whom then shall I fear * the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom then shall I be afraid?
column3: THE Lord is my light and my salvation ; whom then shall I fear * the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom then shall I be afraid?

column2: 2 When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh * they stumbled and fell.
column3: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh * they stumbled and fell.

column2: 3 Though an host of men were laid against me, yet shall not my heart be afraid * and though there rose up war against me, yet will I put my trust in him.
column3: Though an host of men were laid against me, yet shall not my heart be afraid * and though there rose up war against me, yet will I put my trust in him.

column2: 4 One thing have I desired of the Lord, which I will require * even that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the fair beauty of the Lord, and to visit his temple.
column3: One thing have I desired of the Lord, which I will require * even that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the fair beauty of the Lord, and to visit his temple.

column2: 5 For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his tabernacle * yea, in the secret place of his dwelling shall he hide me, and set me up upon a rock of stone.
column3: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his tabernacle * yea, in the secret place of his dwelling shall he hide me, and set me up upon a rock of stone.

column2: 6 And now shall he lift up mine head * above mine enemies round about me.
column3: And now shall he lift up mine head * above mine enemies round about me.

column2: 7 Therefore will I offer in his dwelling an oblation with great gladness * I will sing, and speak praises unto the Lord.
column3: Therefore will I offer in his dwelling an oblation with great gladness * I will sing, and speak praises unto the Lord.

column2: 8 Hearken unto my voice, O Lord, when I cry unto thee * have mercy upon me, and hear me.
column3: Hearken unto my voice, O Lord, when I cry unto thee * have mercy upon me, and hear me.

column2: 9 My heart hath talked of thee, Seek ye my face * Thy face, Lord, will I seek.
column3: My heart hath talked of thee, Seek ye my face * Thy face, Lord, will I seek.

column2: 10 O hide not thou thy face from me * nor cast thy servant away in displeasure.
column3: O hide not thou thy face from me * nor cast thy servant away in displeasure.

column2: 11 Thou hast been my succour * leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
column3: Thou hast been my succour * leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

column2: 12 When my father and my mother forsake me * the Lord taketh me up.
column3: When my father and my mother forsake me * the Lord taketh me up.

column2: 13 Teach me thy way, O Lord * and lead me in the right way, because of mine enemies.
column3: Teach me thy way, O Lord * and lead me in the right way, because of mine enemies.

column2: 14 Deliver me not over into the will of mine adversaries * for there are false witnesses risen up against me, and such as speak wrong.
column3: Deliver me not over into the will of mine adversaries * for there are false witnesses risen up against me, and such as speak wrong.

column2: 15 I should utterly have fainted * but that I believe verily to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.
column3: I should utterly have fainted * but that I believe verily to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.

column2: 16 O tarry thou the Lord's leisure * be strong, and he shall comfort thine heart ; and put thou thy trust in the Lord.
column3: O tarry thou the Lord's leisure * be strong, and he shall comfort thine heart ; and put thou thy trust in the Lord.

column2: Psalm 28. Ad te, Domine.
column3: Psalm 28. Ad te, Domine.

column2: 1 UNTO thee will I cry, O Lord my strength * think no scorn of me; lest, if thou make as though thou hearest not, I become like them that go down into the pit.
column3: UNTO thee will I cry, O Lord my strength * think no scorn of me; lest, if thou make as though thou hearest not, I become like them that go down into the pit.

column2: 2 Hear the voice of my humble petitions, when I cry unto thee * when I hold up my hands towards the mercy-seat of thy holy temple.
column3: Hear the voice of my humble petitions, when I cry unto thee * when I hold up my hands towards the mercy-seat of thy holy temple.

column2: 3 O pluck me not away, neither destroy me, with the ungodly and wicked doers * which speak friendly to their neighbours, but imagine mischief in their hearts.
column3: O pluck me not away, neither destroy me, with the ungodly and wicked doers * which speak friendly to their neighbours, but imagine mischief in their hearts.

column2: 4 Reward them according to their deeds * and according to the wickedness of their own inventions.
column3: Reward them according to their deeds * and according to the wickedness of their own inventions.

column2: 5 Recompense them after the work of their hands * pay them that they have deserved.
column3: Recompense them after the work of their hands * pay them that they have deserved.

column2: 6 For they regard not in their mind the works of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands * therefore shall he break them down, and not build them up.
column3: For they regard not in their mind the works of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands * therefore shall he break them down, and not build them up.

column2: 7 Praised be the Lord * for he hath heard the voice of my humble petitions.
column3: Praised be the Lord * for he hath heard the voice of my humble petitions.

column2: 8 The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart hath trusted in him, and I am helped * therefore my heart danceth for joy, and in my song will I praise him.
column3: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart hath trusted in him, and I am helped * therefore my heart danceth for joy, and in my song will I praise him.

column2: 9 The Lord is my strength * and he is the wholesome defence of his Anointed.
column3: The Lord is my strength * and he is the wholesome defence of his Anointed.

column2: 10 O save thy people, and give thy blessing unto thine inheritance * feed them , and set them up for ever.
column3: O save thy people, and give thy blessing unto thine inheritance * feed them , and set them up for ever.

column2: Psalm 29. Afferte Domino.
column3: Psalm 29. Afferte Domino.

column2: 1 BRING unto the Lord, O ye mighty, bring young rams unto the Lord * ascribe unto the Lord worship and strength.
column3: BRING unto the Lord, O ye mighty, bring young rams unto the Lord * ascribe unto the Lord worship and strength.

column2: 2 Give the Lord the honour due unto his Name * worship the Lord with holy worship.
column3: Give the Lord the honour due unto his Name * worship the Lord with holy worship.

column2: 3 It is the Lord that commandeth the waters * it is the glorious God that maketh the thunder.
column3: It is the Lord that commandeth the waters * it is the glorious God that maketh the thunder.

column2: 4 It is the Lord that ruleth the sea; the voice of the Lord is mighty in operation * the voice of the Lord is a glorious voice.
column3: It is the Lord that ruleth the sea; the voice of the Lord is mighty in operation * the voice of the Lord is a glorious voice.

column2: 5 The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedar-trees * yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Libanus.
column3: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedar-trees * yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Libanus.

column2: 6 He maketh them also to skip like a calf * Libanus also, and Sirion, like a young unicorn.
column3: He maketh them also to skip like a calf * Libanus also, and Sirion, like a young unicorn.

column2: 7 The voice of the Lord divideth the flames of fire; the voice of the Lord shaketh the wilderness * yea, the Lord shaketh the wilderness of Cades.
column3: The voice of the Lord divideth the flames of fire; the voice of the Lord shaketh the wilderness * yea, the Lord shaketh the wilderness of Cades.

column2: 8 The voice of the Lord maketh the hinds to bring forth young, and discovereth the thick bushes * in his temple doth every man speak of his honour.
column3: The voice of the Lord maketh the hinds to bring forth young, and discovereth the thick bushes * in his temple doth every man speak of his honour.

column2: 9 The Lord sitteth above the water-flood * and the Lord remaineth a King for ever.
column3: The Lord sitteth above the water-flood * and the Lord remaineth a King for ever.

column2: 10 The Lord shall give strength unto his people * the Lord shall give his people the blessing of peace.
column3: The Lord shall give strength unto his people * the Lord shall give his people the blessing of peace.

column2: Psalm 30. Exaltabo te, Domine.
column3: Psalm 30. Exaltabo te, Domine.

column2: 1 I WILL magnify thee, O Lord, for thou hast set me up * and not made my foes to triumph over me.
column3: I WILL magnify thee, O Lord, for thou hast set me up * and not made my foes to triumph over me.

column2: 2 O Lord my God, I cried unto thee * and thou hast healed me.
column3: O Lord my God, I cried unto thee * and thou hast healed me.

column2: 3 Thou, Lord, hast brought my soul out of hell * thou hast kept my life from them that go down to the pit.
column3: Thou, Lord, hast brought my soul out of hell * thou hast kept my life from them that go down to the pit.

column2: 4 Sing praises unto the Lord, O ye saints of his * and give thanks unto him for a remembrance of his holiness.
column3: Sing praises unto the Lord, O ye saints of his * and give thanks unto him for a remembrance of his holiness.

column2: 5 For his wrath endureth but the twinkling of an eye, and in his pleasure is life * heaviness may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
column3: For his wrath endureth but the twinkling of an eye, and in his pleasure is life * heaviness may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

column2: 6 And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be removed * thou, Lord, of thy goodness hast made my hill so strong.
column3: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be removed * thou, Lord, of thy goodness hast made my hill so strong.

column2: 7 Thou didst turn thy face from me * and I was troubled.
column3: Thou didst turn thy face from me * and I was troubled.

column2: 8 Then cried I unto thee, O Lord * and gat me to my Lord right humbly.
column3: Then cried I unto thee, O Lord * and gat me to my Lord right humbly.

column2: 9 What profit is there in my blood * when I go down to the pit?
column3: What profit is there in my blood * when I go down to the pit?

column2: 10 Shall the dust give thanks unto thee * or shall it declare thy truth?
column3: Shall the dust give thanks unto thee * or shall it declare thy truth?

column2: 11 Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me * Lord, be thou my helper.
column3: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me * Lord, be thou my helper.

column2: 12 Thou hast turned my heaviness into joy * thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness.
column3: Thou hast turned my heaviness into joy * thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness.

column2: 13 Therefore shall every good man sing of thy praise without ceasing * O my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
column3: Therefore shall every good man sing of thy praise without ceasing * O my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

column2: Psalm 31. In te, Domine, speravi.
column3: Psalm 31. In te, Domine, speravi.

column2: 1 IN THEE, O Lord, have I put my trust * let me never be put to confusion, deliver me in thy righteousness.
column3: IN THEE, O Lord, have I put my trust * let me never be put to confusion, deliver me in thy righteousness.

column2: 2 Bow down thine ear to me * make haste to deliver me.
column3: Bow down thine ear to me * make haste to deliver me.

column2: 3 And be thou my strong rock, and house of defence * that thou mayest save me.
column3: And be thou my strong rock, and house of defence * that thou mayest save me.

column2: 4 For thou art my strong rock, and my castle * be thou also my guide, and lead me for thy Name's sake.
column3: For thou art my strong rock, and my castle * be thou also my guide, and lead me for thy Name's sake.

column2: 5 Draw me out of the net that they have laid privily for me * for thou art my strength.
column3: Draw me out of the net that they have laid privily for me * for thou art my strength.

column2: 6 Into thy hands I commend my spirit * for thou hast redeemed me, O Lord, thou God of truth.
column3: Into thy hands I commend my spirit * for thou hast redeemed me, O Lord, thou God of truth.

column2: 7 I have hated them that hold of superstitious vanities * and my trust hath been in the Lord.
column3: I have hated them that hold of superstitious vanities * and my trust hath been in the Lord.

column2: 8 I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy * for thou hast considered my trouble, and hast known my soul in adversities.
column3: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy * for thou hast considered my trouble, and hast known my soul in adversities.

column2: 9 Thou hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy * but hast set my feet in a large room.
column3: Thou hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy * but hast set my feet in a large room.

column2: 10 Have mercy upon me, O Lord , for I am in trouble * and mine eye is consumed for very heaviness; yea, my soul and my body.
column3: Have mercy upon me, O Lord , for I am in trouble * and mine eye is consumed for very heaviness; yea, my soul and my body.

column2: 11 For my life is waxen old with heaviness * and my years with mourning.
column3: For my life is waxen old with heaviness * and my years with mourning.

column2: 12 My strength faileth me, because of mine iniquity * and my bones are consumed.
column3: My strength faileth me, because of mine iniquity * and my bones are consumed.

column2: 13 I became a reproof among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours * and they of mine acquaintance were afraid of me; and they that did see me without conveyed themselves from me.
column3: I became a reproof among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours * and they of mine acquaintance were afraid of me; and they that did see me without conveyed themselves from me.

column2: 14 I am clean forgotten, as a dead man out of mind * I am become like a broken vessel.
column3: I am clean forgotten, as a dead man out of mind * I am become like a broken vessel.

column2: 15 For I have heard the blasphemy of the multitude * and fear is on every side, while they conspire together against me, and take their counsel to take away my life.
column3: For I have heard the blasphemy of the multitude * and fear is on every side, while they conspire together against me, and take their counsel to take away my life.

column2: 16 But my hope hath been in thee, O Lord * I have said, Thou art my God.
column3: But my hope hath been in thee, O Lord * I have said, Thou art my God.

column2: 17 My time is in thy hand; deliver me from the hand of mine enemies * and from them that persecute me.
column3: My time is in thy hand; deliver me from the hand of mine enemies * and from them that persecute me.

column2: 18 Shew thy servant the light of thy countenance * and save me for thy mercy's sake.
column3: Shew thy servant the light of thy countenance * and save me for thy mercy's sake.

column2: 19 Let me not be confounded, O Lord, for I have called upon thee * let the ungodly be put to confusion, and be put to silence in the grave.
column3: Let me not be confounded, O Lord, for I have called upon thee * let the ungodly be put to confusion, and be put to silence in the grave.

column2: 20 Let the lying lips be put to silence * which cruelly, disdainfully, and despitefully, speak against the righteous.
column3: Let the lying lips be put to silence * which cruelly, disdainfully, and despitefully, speak against the righteous.

column2: 21 O how plentiful is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee * and that thou hast prepared for them that put their trust in thee, even before the sons of men!
column3: O how plentiful is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee * and that thou hast prepared for them that put their trust in thee, even before the sons of men!

column2: 22 Thou shalt hide them privily by thine own presence from the provoking of all men * thou shalt keep them secretly in thy tabernacle from the strife of tongues.
column3: Thou shalt hide them privily by thine own presence from the provoking of all men * thou shalt keep them secretly in thy tabernacle from the strife of tongues.

column2: 23 Thanks be to the Lord * for he hath shewed me marvellous great kindness in a strong city.
column3: Thanks be to the Lord * for he hath shewed me marvellous great kindness in a strong city.

column2: 24 And when I made haste, I said * I am cast out of the sight of thine eyes.
column3: And when I made haste, I said * I am cast out of the sight of thine eyes.

column2: 25 Nevertheless, thou heardest the voice of my prayer * when I cried unto thee.
column3: Nevertheless, thou heardest the voice of my prayer * when I cried unto thee.

column2: 26 O love the Lord, all ye his saints * for the Lord preserveth them that are faithful, and plenteously rewardeth the proud doer.
column3: O love the Lord, all ye his saints * for the Lord preserveth them that are faithful, and plenteously rewardeth the proud doer.

column2: 27 Be strong, and he shall establish your heart * all ye that put your trust in the Lord.
column3: Be strong, and he shall establish your heart * all ye that put your trust in the Lord.

column2: Psalm 32. Beati, quorum.
column3: Psalm 32. Beati, quorum.

column2: 1 BLESSED is he whose unrighteousness is forgiven * and whose sin is covered.
column3: BLESSED is he whose unrighteousness is forgiven * and whose sin is covered.

column2: 2 Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth no sin * and in whose spirit there is no guile.
column3: Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth no sin * and in whose spirit there is no guile.

column2: 3 For while I held my tongue * my bones consumed away through my daily complaining.
column3: For while I held my tongue * my bones consumed away through my daily complaining.

column2: 4 For thy hand is heavy upon me day and night * and my moisture is like the drought in summer.
column3: For thy hand is heavy upon me day and night * and my moisture is like the drought in summer.

column2: 5 I will acknowledge my sin unto thee * and mine unrighteousness have I not hid.
column3: I will acknowledge my sin unto thee * and mine unrighteousness have I not hid.

column2: 6 I said, I will confess my sins unto the Lord * and so thou forgavest the wickedness of my sin.
column3: I said, I will confess my sins unto the Lord * and so thou forgavest the wickedness of my sin.

column2: 7 For this shall every one that is godly make his prayer unto thee, in a time when thou mayest be found * but in the great water-floods they shall not come nigh him.
column3: For this shall every one that is godly make his prayer unto thee, in a time when thou mayest be found * but in the great water-floods they shall not come nigh him.

column2: 8 Thou art a place to hide me in, thou shalt preserve me from trouble * thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance.
column3: Thou art a place to hide me in, thou shalt preserve me from trouble * thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance.

column2: 9 I will inform thee, and teach thee in the way wherein thou shalt go * and I will guide thee with mine eye.
column3: I will inform thee, and teach thee in the way wherein thou shalt go * and I will guide thee with mine eye.

column2: 10 Be ye not like to horse and mule, which have no understanding * whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle, lest they fall upon thee.
column3: Be ye not like to horse and mule, which have no understanding * whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle, lest they fall upon thee.

column2: 11 Great plagues remain for the ungodly * but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord, mercy embraceth him on every side.
column3: Great plagues remain for the ungodly * but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord, mercy embraceth him on every side.

column2: 12 Be glad, O ye righteous, and rejoice in the Lord * and be joyful, all ye that are true of heart.
column3: Be glad, O ye righteous, and rejoice in the Lord * and be joyful, all ye that are true of heart.

column2: Psalm 33. Exultate, justi.
column3: Psalm 33. Exultate, justi.

column2: 1 REJOICE in the Lord, O ye righteous * for it becometh well the just to be thankful.
column3: REJOICE in the Lord, O ye righteous * for it becometh well the just to be thankful.

column2: 2 Praise the Lord with harp * sing praises unto him with the lute, and instrument of ten strings.
column3: Praise the Lord with harp * sing praises unto him with the lute, and instrument of ten strings.

column2: 3 Sing unto the Lord a new song * sing praises lustily unto him with a good courage.
column3: Sing unto the Lord a new song * sing praises lustily unto him with a good courage.

column2: 4 For the word of the Lord is true * and all his works are faithful.
column3: For the word of the Lord is true * and all his works are faithful.

column2: 5 He loveth righteousness and judgement * the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.
column3: He loveth righteousness and judgement * the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.

column2: 6 By the word of the Lord were the heavens made * and all the hosts of them by the breath of his mouth.
column3: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made * and all the hosts of them by the breath of his mouth.

column2: 7 He gathereth the waters of the sea together, as it were upon an heap * and layeth up the deep, as in a treasure-house.
column3: He gathereth the waters of the sea together, as it were upon an heap * and layeth up the deep, as in a treasure-house.

column2: 8 Let all the earth fear the Lord * stand in awe of him, all ye that dwell in the world.
column3: Let all the earth fear the Lord * stand in awe of him, all ye that dwell in the world.

column2: 9 For he spake, and it was done * he commanded, and it stood fast.
column3: For he spake, and it was done * he commanded, and it stood fast.

column2: 10 The Lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought * and maketh the devices of the people to be of none effect, and casteth out the counsels of princes.
column3: The Lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought * and maketh the devices of the people to be of none effect, and casteth out the counsels of princes.

column2: 11 The counsel of the Lord shall endure for ever * and the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.
column3: The counsel of the Lord shall endure for ever * and the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.

column2: 12 Blessed are the people, whose God is the Lord Jehovah * and blessed are the folk, that he hath chosen to him to be his inheritance.
column3: Blessed are the people, whose God is the Lord Jehovah * and blessed are the folk, that he hath chosen to him to be his inheritance.

column2: 13 The Lord looked down from heaven, and beheld all the children of men * from the habitation of his dwelling he considereth all them that dwell on the earth.
column3: The Lord looked down from heaven, and beheld all the children of men * from the habitation of his dwelling he considereth all them that dwell on the earth.

column2: 14 He fashioneth all the hearts of them * and understandeth all their works.
column3: He fashioneth all the hearts of them * and understandeth all their works.

column2: 15 There is no king that can be saved by the multitude of an host * neither is any mighty man delivered by much strength.
column3: There is no king that can be saved by the multitude of an host * neither is any mighty man delivered by much strength.

column2: 16 A horse is counted but a vain thing to save a man * neither shall he deliver any man by his great strength.
column3: A horse is counted but a vain thing to save a man * neither shall he deliver any man by his great strength.

column2: 18 Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him * and upon them that put their trust in his mercy;
column3: Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him * and upon them that put their trust in his mercy;

column2: 19 To deliver their soul from death * and to feed them in the time of dearth.
column3: To deliver their soul from death * and to feed them in the time of dearth.

column2: 20 Our soul hath patiently tarried for the Lord * for he is our help and our shield.
column3: Our soul hath patiently tarried for the Lord * for he is our help and our shield.

column2: 21 For our heart shall rejoice in him * because we have hoped in his holy Name.
column3: For our heart shall rejoice in him * because we have hoped in his holy Name.

column2: 22 Let thy merciful kindness, O Lord, be upon us * like as we do put our trust in thee.
column3: Let thy merciful kindness, O Lord, be upon us * like as we do put our trust in thee.

column2: Psalm 34. Benedicam Domino.
column3: Psalm 34. Benedicam Domino.

column2: 1 I WILL alway give thanks unto the Lord * his praise shall ever be in my mouth.
column3: I WILL alway give thanks unto the Lord * his praise shall ever be in my mouth.

column2: 2 My soul shall make her boast in the Lord * the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.
column3: My soul shall make her boast in the Lord * the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.

column2: 3 O praise the Lord with me * and let us magnify his Name together.
column3: O praise the Lord with me * and let us magnify his Name together.

column2: 4 I sought the Lord, and he heard me * yea, he delivered me out of all my fear.
column3: I sought the Lord, and he heard me * yea, he delivered me out of all my fear.

column2: 5 They had an eye unto him, and were lightened * and their faces were not ashamed.
column3: They had an eye unto him, and were lightened * and their faces were not ashamed.

column2: 6 Lo, the poor crieth, and the Lord heareth him * yea, and saveth him out of all his troubles.
column3: Lo, the poor crieth, and the Lord heareth him * yea, and saveth him out of all his troubles.

column2: 7 The angel of the Lord tarrieth round about them that fear him * and delivereth them.
column3: The angel of the Lord tarrieth round about them that fear him * and delivereth them.

column2: 8 O taste, and see, how gracious the Lord is * blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
column3: O taste, and see, how gracious the Lord is * blessed is the man that trusteth in him.

column2: 9 O fear the Lord, ye that are his saints * for they that fear him lack nothing.
column3: O fear the Lord, ye that are his saints * for they that fear him lack nothing.

column2: 10 The lions do lack, and suffer hunger * but they who seek the Lord shall want no manner of thing that is good.
column3: The lions do lack, and suffer hunger * but they who seek the Lord shall want no manner of thing that is good.

column2: 11 Come, ye children, and hearken unto me * I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
column3: Come, ye children, and hearken unto me * I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

column2: 12 What man is he that lusteth to live * and would fain see good days?
column3: What man is he that lusteth to live * and would fain see good days?

column2: 13 Keep thy tongue from evil * and thy lips, that they speak no guile.
column3: Keep thy tongue from evil * and thy lips, that they speak no guile.

column2: 14 Eschew evil, and do good * seek peace, and ensue it.
column3: Eschew evil, and do good * seek peace, and ensue it.

column2: 15 The eyes of the Lord are over the righteous * and his ears are open unto their prayers.
column3: The eyes of the Lord are over the righteous * and his ears are open unto their prayers.

column2: 16 The countenance of the Lord is against them that do evil * to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.
column3: The countenance of the Lord is against them that do evil * to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.

column2: 17 The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth them * and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
column3: The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth them * and delivereth them out of all their troubles.

column2: 18 The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a contrite heart * and will save such as be of an humble spirit.
column3: The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a contrite heart * and will save such as be of an humble spirit.

column2: 19 Great are the troubles of the righteous * but the Lord delivereth him out of all.
column3: Great are the troubles of the righteous * but the Lord delivereth him out of all.

column2: 20 He keepeth all his bones * so that not one of them is broken.
column3: He keepeth all his bones * so that not one of them is broken.

column2: 21 But misfortune shall slay the ungodly * and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.
column3: But misfortune shall slay the ungodly * and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.

column2: 22 The Lord delivereth the souls of his servants * and all they that put their trust in him shall not be destitute.
column3: The Lord delivereth the souls of his servants * and all they that put their trust in him shall not be destitute.

column2: Psalm 35. Judica, Domine.
column3: Psalm 35. Judica, Domine.

column2: 1 PLEAD thou my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me * and fight thou against them that fight against me.
column3: PLEAD thou my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me * and fight thou against them that fight against me.

column2: 2 Lay hand upon the shield and buckler * and stand up to help me.
column3: Lay hand upon the shield and buckler * and stand up to help me.

column2: 3 Bring forth the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me * say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.
column3: Bring forth the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me * say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.

column2: 4 Let them be confounded and put to shame, that seek after my soul * let them be turned back and brought to confusion, that imagine mischief for me.
column3: Let them be confounded and put to shame, that seek after my soul * let them be turned back and brought to confusion, that imagine mischief for me.

column2: 5 Let them be as the dust before the wind * and the angel of the Lord scattering them.
column3: Let them be as the dust before the wind * and the angel of the Lord scattering them.

column2: 6 Let their way be dark and slippery * and let the angel of the Lord persecute them.
column3: Let their way be dark and slippery * and let the angel of the Lord persecute them.

column2: 7 For they have privily laid their net to destroy me without a cause * yea, even without a cause have they made a pit for my soul.
column3: For they have privily laid their net to destroy me without a cause * yea, even without a cause have they made a pit for my soul.

column2: 8 Let a sudden destruction come upon him unawares, and his net, that he hath laid privily, catch himself * that he may fall into his own mischief.
column3: Let a sudden destruction come upon him unawares, and his net, that he hath laid privily, catch himself * that he may fall into his own mischief.

column2: 9 And, my soul, be joyful in the Lord * it shall rejoice in his salvation.
column3: And, my soul, be joyful in the Lord * it shall rejoice in his salvation.

column2: 10 All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, who deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him * yea, the poor, and him that is in misery, from him that spoileth him?
column3: All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, who deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him * yea, the poor, and him that is in misery, from him that spoileth him?

column2: 11 False witnesses did rise up * they laid to my charge things that I knew not.
column3: False witnesses did rise up * they laid to my charge things that I knew not.

column2: 12 They rewarded me evil for good * to the great discomfort of my soul.
column3: They rewarded me evil for good * to the great discomfort of my soul.

column2: 13 Nevertheless, when they were sick, I put on sackcloth, and humbled my soul with fasting * and my prayer shall turn into mine own bosom.
column3: Nevertheless, when they were sick, I put on sackcloth, and humbled my soul with fasting * and my prayer shall turn into mine own bosom.

column2: 14 I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother * I went heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.
column3: I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother * I went heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.

column2: 15 But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together * yea, the very abjects came together against me unawares, making mouths at me, and ceased not.
column3: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together * yea, the very abjects came together against me unawares, making mouths at me, and ceased not.

column2: 16 With the flatterers were busy mockers * who gnashed upon me with their teeth.
column3: With the flatterers were busy mockers * who gnashed upon me with their teeth.

column2: 17 Lord, how long wilt thou look upon this * O deliver my soul from the calamities which they bring on me, and my darling from the lions.
column3: Lord, how long wilt thou look upon this * O deliver my soul from the calamities which they bring on me, and my darling from the lions.

column2: 18 So will I give thee thanks in the great congregation * I will praise thee among much people.
column3: So will I give thee thanks in the great congregation * I will praise thee among much people.

column2: 19 O let not them that are mine enemies triumph over me ungodly * neither let them wink with their eyes that hate me without a cause.
column3: O let not them that are mine enemies triumph over me ungodly * neither let them wink with their eyes that hate me without a cause.

column2: 20 And why? their communing is not for peace; but they imagine deceitful words against them that are quiet in the land.
column3: And why? their communing is not for peace; but they imagine deceitful words against them that are quiet in the land.

column2: 21 They gaped upon me with their mouths, and said * Fie on thee, fie on thee, we saw it with our eyes.
column3: They gaped upon me with their mouths, and said * Fie on thee, fie on thee, we saw it with our eyes.

column2: 22 This thou hast seen, O Lord * hold not thy tongue then, go not far from me, O Lord.
column3: This thou hast seen, O Lord * hold not thy tongue then, go not far from me, O Lord.

column2: 23 Awake, and stand up to judge my quarrel * avenge thou my cause, my God, and my Lord.
column3: Awake, and stand up to judge my quarrel * avenge thou my cause, my God, and my Lord.

column2: 24 Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness * and let them not triumph over me.
column3: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness * and let them not triumph over me.

column2: 25 Let them not say in their hearts, There, there, so would we have it * neither let them say, We have devoured him.
column3: Let them not say in their hearts, There, there, so would we have it * neither let them say, We have devoured him.

column2: 26 Let them be put to confusion and shame together, that rejoice at my trouble * let them be clothed with rebuke and dishonour, that boast themselves against me.
column3: Let them be put to confusion and shame together, that rejoice at my trouble * let them be clothed with rebuke and dishonour, that boast themselves against me.

column2: 27 Let them be glad and rejoice, that favour my righteous dealing * yea, let them say alway, Blessed be the Lord, who hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
column3: Let them be glad and rejoice, that favour my righteous dealing * yea, let them say alway, Blessed be the Lord, who hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

column2: 28 And as for my tongue, it shall be talking of thy righteousness * and of thy praise all the day long.
column3: And as for my tongue, it shall be talking of thy righteousness * and of thy praise all the day long.

column2: Psalm 36. Dixit injustus.
column3: Psalm 36. Dixit injustus.

column2: 1 MY HEART sheweth me the wickedness of the ungodly * that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
column3: MY HEART sheweth me the wickedness of the ungodly * that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

column2: 2 For he flattereth himself in his own sight * until his abominable sin be found out.
column3: For he flattereth himself in his own sight * until his abominable sin be found out.

column2: 3 The words of his mouth are unrighteous, and full of deceit * he hath left off to behave himself wisely, and to do good.
column3: The words of his mouth are unrighteous, and full of deceit * he hath left off to behave himself wisely, and to do good.

column2: 4 He imagineth mischief upon his bed, and hath set himself in no good way * neither doth he abhor any thing that is evil.
column3: He imagineth mischief upon his bed, and hath set himself in no good way * neither doth he abhor any thing that is evil.

column2: 5 Thy mercy, O Lord, reacheth unto the heavens * and thy faithfulness unto the clouds.
column3: Thy mercy, O Lord, reacheth unto the heavens * and thy faithfulness unto the clouds.

column2: 6 Thy righteousness standeth like the strong mountains * thy judgements are like the great deep.
column3: Thy righteousness standeth like the strong mountains * thy judgements are like the great deep.

column2: 7 Thou, Lord, shalt save both man and beast; How excellent is thy mercy, O God * and the children of men shall put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.
column3: Thou, Lord, shalt save both man and beast; How excellent is thy mercy, O God * and the children of men shall put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

column2: 8 They shall be satisfied with the plenteousness of thy house * and thou shalt give them drink of thy pleasures, as out of the river.
column3: They shall be satisfied with the plenteousness of thy house * and thou shalt give them drink of thy pleasures, as out of the river.

column2: 9 For with thee is the well of life * and in thy light shall we see light.
column3: For with thee is the well of life * and in thy light shall we see light.

column2: 10 O continue forth thy loving-kindness unto them that know thee * and thy righteousness unto them that are true of heart.
column3: O continue forth thy loving-kindness unto them that know thee * and thy righteousness unto them that are true of heart.

column2: 11 O let not the foot of pride come against me * and let not the hand of the ungodly cast me down.
column3: O let not the foot of pride come against me * and let not the hand of the ungodly cast me down.

column2: 12 There are they fallen, all that work wickedness * they are cast down, and shall not be able to stand.
column3: There are they fallen, all that work wickedness * they are cast down, and shall not be able to stand.

column2: Psalm 37. Noli aemulari.
column3: Psalm 37. Noli aemulari.

column2: 1 FRET not thyself because of the ungodly * neither be thou envious against the evil-doers.
column3: FRET not thyself because of the ungodly * neither be thou envious against the evil-doers.

column2: 2 For they shall soon be cut down like the grass * and be withered even as the green herb.
column3: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass * and be withered even as the green herb.

column2: 3 Put thou thy trust in the Lord, and be doing good * dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.
column3: Put thou thy trust in the Lord, and be doing good * dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.

column2: 4 Delight thou in the Lord * and he shall give thee thy heart's desire.
column3: Delight thou in the Lord * and he shall give thee thy heart's desire.

column2: 5 Commit thy way unto the Lord, and put thy trust in him * and he shall bring it to pass.
column3: Commit thy way unto the Lord, and put thy trust in him * and he shall bring it to pass.

column2: 6 He shall make thy righteousness as clear as the light * and thy just dealing as the noon-day.
column3: He shall make thy righteousness as clear as the light * and thy just dealing as the noon-day.

column2: 7 Hold thee still in the Lord, and abide patiently upon him * but grieve not thyself at him whose way doth prosper, against the man that doeth after evil counsels.
column3: Hold thee still in the Lord, and abide patiently upon him * but grieve not thyself at him whose way doth prosper, against the man that doeth after evil counsels.

column2: 8 Leave off from wrath, and let go displeasure * fret not thyself, else shalt thou be moved to do evil.
column3: Leave off from wrath, and let go displeasure * fret not thyself, else shalt thou be moved to do evil.

column2: 9 Wicked doers shall be rooted out * and they that patiently abide the Lord, those shall inherit the land.
column3: Wicked doers shall be rooted out * and they that patiently abide the Lord, those shall inherit the land.

column2: 10 Yet a little while, and the ungodly shall be clean gone * thou shalt look after his place, and he shall be away.
column3: Yet a little while, and the ungodly shall be clean gone * thou shalt look after his place, and he shall be away.

column2: 11 But the meek-spirited shall possess the earth * and shall be refreshed in the multitude of peace.
column3: But the meek-spirited shall possess the earth * and shall be refreshed in the multitude of peace.

column2: 12 The ungodly seeketh counsel against the just * and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.
column3: The ungodly seeketh counsel against the just * and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.

column2: 13 The Lord shall laugh him to scorn * for he hath seen that his day is coming.
column3: The Lord shall laugh him to scorn * for he hath seen that his day is coming.

column2: 14 The ungodly have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow * to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as are of a right conversation.
column3: The ungodly have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow * to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as are of a right conversation.

column2: 15 Their sword shall go through their own heart * and their bow shall be broken.
column3: Their sword shall go through their own heart * and their bow shall be broken.

column2: 16 A small thing that the righteous hath * is better than great riches of the ungodly.
column3: A small thing that the righteous hath * is better than great riches of the ungodly.

column2: 17 For the arms of the ungodly shall be broken * and the Lord upholdeth the righteous.
column3: For the arms of the ungodly shall be broken * and the Lord upholdeth the righteous.

column2: 18 The Lord knoweth the days of the godly * and their inheritance shall endure for ever.
column3: The Lord knoweth the days of the godly * and their inheritance shall endure for ever.

column2: 19 They shall not be confounded in the perilous time * and in the days of dearth they shall have enough.
column3: They shall not be confounded in the perilous time * and in the days of dearth they shall have enough.

column2: 20 As for the ungodly, they shall perish; and the enemies of the Lord shall consume as the fat of lambs * yea, even as the smoke shall they consume away.
column3: As for the ungodly, they shall perish; and the enemies of the Lord shall consume as the fat of lambs * yea, even as the smoke shall they consume away.

column2: 21 The ungodly borroweth, and payeth not again * but the righteous is merciful and liberal.
column3: The ungodly borroweth, and payeth not again * but the righteous is merciful and liberal.

column2: 22 Such as are blessed of God shall possess the land * and they that are cursed of him shall be rooted out.
column3: Such as are blessed of God shall possess the land * and they that are cursed of him shall be rooted out.

column2: 23 The Lord ordereth a good man's going * and maketh his way acceptable to himself.
column3: The Lord ordereth a good man's going * and maketh his way acceptable to himself.

column2: 24 Though he fall, he shall not be cast away * for the Lord upholdeth him with his hand.
column3: Though he fall, he shall not be cast away * for the Lord upholdeth him with his hand.

column2: 25 I have been young, and now am old * and yet saw I never the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging their bread.
column3: I have been young, and now am old * and yet saw I never the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging their bread.

column2: 26 The righteous is ever merciful, and lendeth * and his seed is blessed.
column3: The righteous is ever merciful, and lendeth * and his seed is blessed.

column2: 27 Flee from evil, and do the thing that is good * and dwell for evermore.
column3: Flee from evil, and do the thing that is good * and dwell for evermore.

column2: 28 For the Lord loveth the thing that is right * he forsaketh not his that be godly, but they are preserved for ever.
column3: For the Lord loveth the thing that is right * he forsaketh not his that be godly, but they are preserved for ever.

column2: 29 The unrighteous shall be punished * as for the seed of the ungodly, it shall be rooted out.
column3: The unrighteous shall be punished * as for the seed of the ungodly, it shall be rooted out.

column2: 30 The righteous shall inherit the land * and dwell therein for ever.
column3: The righteous shall inherit the land * and dwell therein for ever.

column2: 31 The mouth of the righteous is exercised in wisdom * and his tongue will be talking of judgement.
column3: The mouth of the righteous is exercised in wisdom * and his tongue will be talking of judgement.

column2: 32 The law of his God is in his heart * and his goings shall not slide.
column3: The law of his God is in his heart * and his goings shall not slide.

column2: 33 The ungodly seeth the righteous * and seeketh occasion to slay him.
column3: The ungodly seeth the righteous * and seeketh occasion to slay him.

column2: 34 The Lord will not leave him in his hand * nor condemn him when he is judged.
column3: The Lord will not leave him in his hand * nor condemn him when he is judged.

column2: 35 Hope thou in the Lord, and keep his way, and he shall promote thee, that thou shalt possess the land * when the ungodly shall perish, thou shalt see it.
column3: Hope thou in the Lord, and keep his way, and he shall promote thee, that thou shalt possess the land * when the ungodly shall perish, thou shalt see it.

column2: 36 I myself have seen the ungodly in great power * and flourishing like a green bay-tree.
column3: I myself have seen the ungodly in great power * and flourishing like a green bay-tree.

column2: 37 I went by, and lo, he was gone * I sought him, but his place could no where be found.
column3: I went by, and lo, he was gone * I sought him, but his place could no where be found.

column2: 38 Keep innocency, and take heed unto the thing that is right * for that shall bring a man peace at the last.
column3: Keep innocency, and take heed unto the thing that is right * for that shall bring a man peace at the last.

column2: 39 As for the transgressors, they shall perish together * and the end of the ungodly is, they shall be rooted out at the last.
column3: As for the transgressors, they shall perish together * and the end of the ungodly is, they shall be rooted out at the last.

column2: 40 But the salvation of the righteous cometh of the Lord * who is also their strength in the time of trouble.
column3: But the salvation of the righteous cometh of the Lord * who is also their strength in the time of trouble.

column2: 41 And the Lord shall stand by them, and save them * he shall deliver them from the ungodly, and shall save them, because they put their trust in him.
column3: And the Lord shall stand by them, and save them * he shall deliver them from the ungodly, and shall save them, because they put their trust in him.

column2: Psalm 38. Domine, ne in furore.
column3: Psalm 38. Domine, ne in furore.

column2: 1 PUT me not to rebuke, O Lord, in thine anger * neither chasten me in thy heavy displeasure.
column3: PUT me not to rebuke, O Lord, in thine anger * neither chasten me in thy heavy displeasure.

column2: 2 For thine arrows stick fast in me * and thy hand presseth me sore.
column3: For thine arrows stick fast in me * and thy hand presseth me sore.

column2: 3 There is no health in my flesh, because of thy displeasure * neither is there any rest in my bones, by reason of my sin.
column3: There is no health in my flesh, because of thy displeasure * neither is there any rest in my bones, by reason of my sin.

column2: 4 For my wickednesses are gone over my head * and are like a sore burden, too heavy for me to bear.
column3: For my wickednesses are gone over my head * and are like a sore burden, too heavy for me to bear.

column2: 5 My wounds stink, and are corrupt * through my foolishness.
column3: My wounds stink, and are corrupt * through my foolishness.

column2: 6 I am brought into so great trouble and misery * that I go mourning all the day long.
column3: I am brought into so great trouble and misery * that I go mourning all the day long.

column2: 7 For my loins are filled with a sore disease * and there is no whole part in my body.
column3: For my loins are filled with a sore disease * and there is no whole part in my body.

column2: 8 I am feeble, and sore smitten * I have roared for the very disquietness of my heart.
column3: I am feeble, and sore smitten * I have roared for the very disquietness of my heart.

column2: 9 Lord, thou knowest all my desire * and my groaning is not hid from thee.
column3: Lord, thou knowest all my desire * and my groaning is not hid from thee.

column2: 10 My heart panteth, my strength hath failed me * and the sight of mine eyes is gone from me.
column3: My heart panteth, my strength hath failed me * and the sight of mine eyes is gone from me.

column2: 11 My lovers and my neighbours did stand looking upon my trouble * and my kinsmen stood afar off.
column3: My lovers and my neighbours did stand looking upon my trouble * and my kinsmen stood afar off.

column2: 12 They also that sought after my life laid snares for me * and they that went about to do me evil talked of wickedness, and imagined deceit all the day long.
column3: They also that sought after my life laid snares for me * and they that went about to do me evil talked of wickedness, and imagined deceit all the day long.

column2: 13 As for me, I was like a deaf man, and heard not * and as one that is dumb, who doth not open his mouth.
column3: As for me, I was like a deaf man, and heard not * and as one that is dumb, who doth not open his mouth.

column2: 14 I became even as a man that heareth not * and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
column3: I became even as a man that heareth not * and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

column2: 15 For in thee, O Lord, have I put my trust * thou shalt answer for me, O Lord my God.
column3: For in thee, O Lord, have I put my trust * thou shalt answer for me, O Lord my God.

column2: 16 I have required that they, even mine enemies, should not triumph over me * for when my foot slipped, they rejoiced greatly against me.
column3: I have required that they, even mine enemies, should not triumph over me * for when my foot slipped, they rejoiced greatly against me.

column2: 17 And I, truly, am set in the plague * and my heaviness is ever in my sight.
column3: And I, truly, am set in the plague * and my heaviness is ever in my sight.

column2: 18 For I will confess my wickedness * and be sorry for my sin.
column3: For I will confess my wickedness * and be sorry for my sin.

column2: 19 But mine enemies live, and are mighty * and they that hate me wrongfully are many in number.
column3: But mine enemies live, and are mighty * and they that hate me wrongfully are many in number.

column2: 20 They also that reward evil for good are against me * because I follow the thing that good is.
column3: They also that reward evil for good are against me * because I follow the thing that good is.

column2: 21 Forsake me not, O Lord my God * be not thou far from me.
column3: Forsake me not, O Lord my God * be not thou far from me.

column2: 22 Haste thee to help me * O Lord God of my salvation.
column3: Haste thee to help me * O Lord God of my salvation.

column2: Psalm 39. Dixi, Custodiam.
column3: Psalm 39. Dixi, Custodiam.

column2: 1 I SAID, I will take heed to my ways * that I offend not in my tongue.
column3: I SAID, I will take heed to my ways * that I offend not in my tongue.

column2: 2 I will keep my mouth as it were with a bridle * while the ungodly is in my sight.
column3: I will keep my mouth as it were with a bridle * while the ungodly is in my sight.

column2: 3 I held my tongue, and spake nothing * I kept silence, yea, even from good words; but it was pain and grief to me.
column3: I held my tongue, and spake nothing * I kept silence, yea, even from good words; but it was pain and grief to me.

column2: 4 My heart was hot within me, and while I was thus musing the fire kindled * and at the last I spake with my tongue;
column3: My heart was hot within me, and while I was thus musing the fire kindled * and at the last I spake with my tongue;

column2: 5 Lord, let me know mine end, and the number of my days * that I may be certified how long I have to live.
column3: Lord, let me know mine end, and the number of my days * that I may be certified how long I have to live.

column2: 6 Behold, thou hast made my days as it were a span long * and mine age is even as nothing in respect of thee; and verily every man living is altogether vanity.
column3: Behold, thou hast made my days as it were a span long * and mine age is even as nothing in respect of thee; and verily every man living is altogether vanity.

column2: 7 For man walketh in a vain shadow, and disquieteth himself in vain * he heapeth up riches, and cannot tell who shall gather them.
column3: For man walketh in a vain shadow, and disquieteth himself in vain * he heapeth up riches, and cannot tell who shall gather them.

column2: 8 And now, Lord, what is my hope * truly my hope is even in thee.
column3: And now, Lord, what is my hope * truly my hope is even in thee.

column2: 9 Deliver me from all mine offences * and make me not a rebuke unto the foolish.
column3: Deliver me from all mine offences * and make me not a rebuke unto the foolish.

column2: 10 I became dumb, and opened not my mouth * for it was thy doing.
column3: I became dumb, and opened not my mouth * for it was thy doing.

column2: 11 Take thy plague away from me * I am even consumed by the means of thy heavy hand.
column3: Take thy plague away from me * I am even consumed by the means of thy heavy hand.

column2: 12 When thou with rebukes dost chasten man for sin, thou makest his beauty to consume away, like as it were a moth fretting a garment * every man therefore is but vanity.
column3: When thou with rebukes dost chasten man for sin, thou makest his beauty to consume away, like as it were a moth fretting a garment * every man therefore is but vanity.

column2: 13 Hear my prayer, O Lord, and with thine ears consider my calling * hold not thy peace at my tears.
column3: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and with thine ears consider my calling * hold not thy peace at my tears.

column2: 14 For I am a stranger with thee * and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
column3: For I am a stranger with thee * and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

column2: 15 O spare me a little, that I may recover my strength * before I go hence, and be no more seen.
column3: O spare me a little, that I may recover my strength * before I go hence, and be no more seen.

column2: Psalm 40. Expectans expectavi.
column3: Psalm 40. Expectans expectavi.

column2: 1 I WAITED patiently for the Lord * and he inclined unto me, and heard my calling.
column3: I WAITED patiently for the Lord * and he inclined unto me, and heard my calling.

column2: 2 He brought me also out of the horrible pit, out of the mire and clay * and set my feet upon the rock, and ordered my goings.
column3: He brought me also out of the horrible pit, out of the mire and clay * and set my feet upon the rock, and ordered my goings.

column2: 3 And he hath put a new song in my mouth * even a thanksgiving unto our God.
column3: And he hath put a new song in my mouth * even a thanksgiving unto our God.

column2: 4 Many shall see it, and fear * and shall put their trust in the Lord.
column3: Many shall see it, and fear * and shall put their trust in the Lord.

column2: 5 Blessed is the man that hath set his hope in the Lord * and turned not unto the proud, and to such as go about with lies.
column3: Blessed is the man that hath set his hope in the Lord * and turned not unto the proud, and to such as go about with lies.

column2: 6 O Lord my God, great are the wondrous works which thou hast done, like as be also thy thoughts which are to us-ward * and yet there is no man that ordereth them unto thee:
column3: O Lord my God, great are the wondrous works which thou hast done, like as be also thy thoughts which are to us-ward * and yet there is no man that ordereth them unto thee:

column2: 7 If I should declare them, and speak of them * they should be more than I am able to express.
column3: If I should declare them, and speak of them * they should be more than I am able to express.

column2: 8 Sacrifice and meat-offering thou wouldest not * but mine ears hast thou opened.
column3: Sacrifice and meat-offering thou wouldest not * but mine ears hast thou opened.

column2: 9 Burnt-offerings, and sacrifice for sin, hast thou not required * then said I, Lo, I come,
column3: Burnt-offerings, and sacrifice for sin, hast thou not required * then said I, Lo, I come,

column2: 10 In the volume of the book it is written of me, that I should fulfil thy will, O my God * I am content to do it; yea, thy law is within my heart.
column3: In the volume of the book it is written of me, that I should fulfil thy will, O my God * I am content to do it; yea, thy law is within my heart.

column2: 11 I have declared thy righteousness in the great congregation * lo, I will not refrain my lips, O Lord, and that thou knowest.
column3: I have declared thy righteousness in the great congregation * lo, I will not refrain my lips, O Lord, and that thou knowest.

column2: 12 I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart * my talk hath been of thy truth and of thy salvation.
column3: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart * my talk hath been of thy truth and of thy salvation.

column2: 13 I have not kept back thy loving mercy and truth * from the great congregation.
column3: I have not kept back thy loving mercy and truth * from the great congregation.

column2: 14 Withdraw not thou thy mercy from me, O Lord * let thy loving-kindness and thy truth alway preserve me.
column3: Withdraw not thou thy mercy from me, O Lord * let thy loving-kindness and thy truth alway preserve me.

column2: 15 For innumerable troubles are come about me; my sins have taken such hold upon me that I am not able to look up * yea, they are more in number than the hairs of my head, and my heart hath failed me.
column3: For innumerable troubles are come about me; my sins have taken such hold upon me that I am not able to look up * yea, they are more in number than the hairs of my head, and my heart hath failed me.

column2: 16 O Lord, let it be thy pleasure to deliver me * make haste, O Lord, to help me.
column3: O Lord, let it be thy pleasure to deliver me * make haste, O Lord, to help me.

column2: 17 Let them be ashamed and confounded together, that seek after my soul to destroy it * let them be driven backward and put to rebuke, that wish me evil.
column3: Let them be ashamed and confounded together, that seek after my soul to destroy it * let them be driven backward and put to rebuke, that wish me evil.

column2: 18 Let them be desolate, and rewarded with shame * that say unto me, Fie upon thee, fie upon thee.
column3: Let them be desolate, and rewarded with shame * that say unto me, Fie upon thee, fie upon thee.

column2: 19 Let all those that seek thee be joyful and glad in thee * and let such as love thy salvation say alway, The Lord be praised.
column3: Let all those that seek thee be joyful and glad in thee * and let such as love thy salvation say alway, The Lord be praised.

column2: 20 As for me, I am poor and needy * but the Lord careth for me.
column3: As for me, I am poor and needy * but the Lord careth for me.

column2: 21 Thou art my helper and redeemer * make no long tarrying, O my God.
column3: Thou art my helper and redeemer * make no long tarrying, O my God.

column2: Psalm 41. Beatus qui intelligit.
column3: Psalm 41. Beatus qui intelligit.

column2: 1 BLESSED is he that considereth the poor and needy * the Lord shall deliver him in the time of trouble.
column3: BLESSED is he that considereth the poor and needy * the Lord shall deliver him in the time of trouble.

column2: 2 The Lord preserve him, and keep him alive, that he may be blessed upon earth * and deliver not thou him into the will of his enemies.
column3: The Lord preserve him, and keep him alive, that he may be blessed upon earth * and deliver not thou him into the will of his enemies.

column2: 3 The Lord comfort him, when he lieth sick upon his bed * make thou all his bed in his sickness.
column3: The Lord comfort him, when he lieth sick upon his bed * make thou all his bed in his sickness.

column2: 4 I said, Lord, be merciful unto me * heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.
column3: I said, Lord, be merciful unto me * heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.

column2: 5 Mine enemies speak evil of me * When shall he die, and his name perish?
column3: Mine enemies speak evil of me * When shall he die, and his name perish?

column2: 6 And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity * and his heart conceiveth falsehood within himself, and when he cometh forth he telleth it.
column3: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity * and his heart conceiveth falsehood within himself, and when he cometh forth he telleth it.

column2: 7 All mine enemies whisper together against me * even against me do they imagine this evil.
column3: All mine enemies whisper together against me * even against me do they imagine this evil.

column2: 8 Let the sentence of guiltiness proceed against him * and now that he lieth, let him rise up no more.
column3: Let the sentence of guiltiness proceed against him * and now that he lieth, let him rise up no more.

column2: 9 Yea, even mine own familiar friend, whom I trusted * who did also eat of my bread, hath laid great wait for me.
column3: Yea, even mine own familiar friend, whom I trusted * who did also eat of my bread, hath laid great wait for me.

column2: 10 But be thou merciful unto me, O Lord * raise thou me up again, and I shall reward them.
column3: But be thou merciful unto me, O Lord * raise thou me up again, and I shall reward them.

column2: 11 By this I know thou favourest me * that mine enemy doth not triumph against me.
column3: By this I know thou favourest me * that mine enemy doth not triumph against me.

column2: 12 And when I am in my health, thou upholdest me * and shalt set me before thy face for ever.
column3: And when I am in my health, thou upholdest me * and shalt set me before thy face for ever.

column2: 13 Blessed be the Lord God of Israel * world without end. Amen.
column3: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel * world without end. Amen.

column2: Psalm 42. Quemadmodum.
column3: Psalm 42. Quemadmodum.

column2: 1 LIKE as the hart desireth the water-brooks * so longeth my soul after thee, O God.
column3: LIKE as the hart desireth the water-brooks * so longeth my soul after thee, O God.

column2: 2 My soul is athirst for God, yea, even for the living God * when shall I come to appear before the presence of God?
column3: My soul is athirst for God, yea, even for the living God * when shall I come to appear before the presence of God?

column2: 3 My tears have been my meat day and night * while they daily say unto me, Where is now thy God?
column3: My tears have been my meat day and night * while they daily say unto me, Where is now thy God?

column2: 4 Now when I think thereupon, I pour out my heart by myself * for I went with the multitude, and brought them forth into the house of God;
column3: Now when I think thereupon, I pour out my heart by myself * for I went with the multitude, and brought them forth into the house of God;

column2: 5 In the voice of praise and thanksgiving * among such as keep holy-day.
column3: In the voice of praise and thanksgiving * among such as keep holy-day.

column2: 6 Why art thou so full of heaviness, O my soul * and why art thou so disquieted within me?
column3: Why art thou so full of heaviness, O my soul * and why art thou so disquieted within me?

column2: 7 Put thy trust in God * for I will yet give him thanks for the help of his countenance.
column3: Put thy trust in God * for I will yet give him thanks for the help of his countenance.

column2: 8 My God, my soul is vexed within me * therefore will I remember thee concerning the land of Jordan, and the little hill of Hermon.
column3: My God, my soul is vexed within me * therefore will I remember thee concerning the land of Jordan, and the little hill of Hermon.

column2: 9 One deep calleth another, because of the noise of the water-pipes * all thy waves and storms are gone over me.
column3: One deep calleth another, because of the noise of the water-pipes * all thy waves and storms are gone over me.

column2: 10 The Lord hath granted his loving-kindness in the day-time * and in the night-season did I sing of him, and made my prayer unto the God of my life.
column3: The Lord hath granted his loving-kindness in the day-time * and in the night-season did I sing of him, and made my prayer unto the God of my life.

column2: 11 I will say unto the God of my strength, Why hast thou forgotten me * why go I thus heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?
column3: I will say unto the God of my strength, Why hast thou forgotten me * why go I thus heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?

column2: 12 My bones are smitten asunder as with a sword * while mine enemies that trouble me cast me in the teeth;
column3: My bones are smitten asunder as with a sword * while mine enemies that trouble me cast me in the teeth;

column2: 13 Namely, while they say daily unto me * Where is now thy God?
column3: Namely, while they say daily unto me * Where is now thy God?

column2: 14 Why art thou so vexed, O my soul * and why art thou so disquieted within me?
column3: Why art thou so vexed, O my soul * and why art thou so disquieted within me?

column2: 15 O put thy trust in God * for I will yet thank him, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.
column3: O put thy trust in God * for I will yet thank him, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.

column2: Psalm 43. Judica me, Deus.
column3: Psalm 43. Judica me, Deus.

column2: 1 GIVE sentence with me, O God, and defend my cause against the ungodly people * O deliver me from the deceitful and wicked man.
column3: GIVE sentence with me, O God, and defend my cause against the ungodly people * O deliver me from the deceitful and wicked man.

column2: 2 For thou art the God of my strength, why hast thou put me from thee * and why go I so heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?
column3: For thou art the God of my strength, why hast thou put me from thee * and why go I so heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?

column2: 3 O send out thy light and thy truth, that they may lead me * and bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy dwelling.
column3: O send out thy light and thy truth, that they may lead me * and bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy dwelling.

column2: 4 And that I may go unto the altar of God, even unto the God of my joy and gladness * and upon the harp will I give thanks unto thee, O God, my God.
column3: And that I may go unto the altar of God, even unto the God of my joy and gladness * and upon the harp will I give thanks unto thee, O God, my God.

column2: 5 Why art thou so heavy, O my soul * and why art thou so disquieted within me?
column3: Why art thou so heavy, O my soul * and why art thou so disquieted within me?

column2: 6 O put thy trust in God * for I will yet give him thanks, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.
column3: O put thy trust in God * for I will yet give him thanks, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.

column2: Psalm 44. Deus, auribus.
column3: Psalm 44. Deus, auribus.

column2: 1 WE HAVE heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us * what thou hast done in their time of old;
column3: WE HAVE heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us * what thou hast done in their time of old;

column2: 2 How thou hast driven out the heathen with thy hand, and planted them in * how thou hast destroyed the nations and cast them out.
column3: How thou hast driven out the heathen with thy hand, and planted them in * how thou hast destroyed the nations and cast them out.

column2: 3 For they gat not the land in possession through their own sword * neither was it their own arm that helped them;
column3: For they gat not the land in possession through their own sword * neither was it their own arm that helped them;

column2: 4 But thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance * because thou hadst a favour unto them.
column3: But thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance * because thou hadst a favour unto them.

column2: 5 Thou art my King, O God * send help unto Jacob.
column3: Thou art my King, O God * send help unto Jacob.

column2: 6 Through thee will we overthrow our enemies * and in thy Name will we tread them under, that rise up against us.
column3: Through thee will we overthrow our enemies * and in thy Name will we tread them under, that rise up against us.

column2: 7 For I will not trust in my bow * it is not my sword that shall help me;
column3: For I will not trust in my bow * it is not my sword that shall help me;

column2: 8 But it is thou that savest us from our enemies * and puttest them to confusion that hate us.
column3: But it is thou that savest us from our enemies * and puttest them to confusion that hate us.

column2: 9 We make our boast of God all day long * and will praise thy Name for ever.
column3: We make our boast of God all day long * and will praise thy Name for ever.

column2: 10 But now thou art far off, and puttest us to confusion * and goest not forth with our armies.
column3: But now thou art far off, and puttest us to confusion * and goest not forth with our armies.

column2: 11 Thou makest us to turn our backs upon our enemies * so that they which hate us spoil our goods.
column3: Thou makest us to turn our backs upon our enemies * so that they which hate us spoil our goods.

column2: 12 Thou lettest us be eaten up like sheep * and hast scattered us among the heathen.
column3: Thou lettest us be eaten up like sheep * and hast scattered us among the heathen.

column2: 13 Thou sellest thy people for nought * and takest no money for them.
column3: Thou sellest thy people for nought * and takest no money for them.

column2: 14 Thou makest us to be rebuked of our neighbours * to be laughed to scorn, and had in derision of them that are round about us.
column3: Thou makest us to be rebuked of our neighbours * to be laughed to scorn, and had in derision of them that are round about us.

column2: 15 Thou makest us to be a by-word among the heathen * and that the people shake their heads at us.
column3: Thou makest us to be a by-word among the heathen * and that the people shake their heads at us.

column2: 16 My confusion is daily before me * and the shame of my face hath covered me;
column3: My confusion is daily before me * and the shame of my face hath covered me;

column2: 17 For the voice of the slanderer and blasphemer * for the enemy and avenger.
column3: For the voice of the slanderer and blasphemer * for the enemy and avenger.

column2: 18 And though all this be come upon us, yet do we not forget thee * nor behave ourselves frowardly in thy covenant.
column3: And though all this be come upon us, yet do we not forget thee * nor behave ourselves frowardly in thy covenant.

column2: 19 Our heart is not turned back * neither our steps gone out of thy way;
column3: Our heart is not turned back * neither our steps gone out of thy way;

column2: 20 No, not when thou hast smitten us into the place of dragons * and covered us with the shadow of death.
column3: No, not when thou hast smitten us into the place of dragons * and covered us with the shadow of death.

column2: 21 If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and holden up our hands to any strange god * shall not God search it out? for he knoweth the very secrets of the heart.
column3: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and holden up our hands to any strange god * shall not God search it out? for he knoweth the very secrets of the heart.

column2: 22 For thy sake also are we killed all the day long * and are counted as sheep appointed to be slain.
column3: For thy sake also are we killed all the day long * and are counted as sheep appointed to be slain.

column2: 23 Up, Lord, why sleepest thou * awake, and be not absent from us for ever.
column3: Up, Lord, why sleepest thou * awake, and be not absent from us for ever.

column2: 24 Wherefore hidest thou thy face * and forgettest our misery and trouble?
column3: Wherefore hidest thou thy face * and forgettest our misery and trouble?

column2: 25 For our soul is brought low, even unto the dust * our belly cleaveth unto the ground.
column3: For our soul is brought low, even unto the dust * our belly cleaveth unto the ground.

column2: 26 Arise, and help us * and deliver us for thy mercy's sake.
column3: Arise, and help us * and deliver us for thy mercy's sake.

column2: Psalm 45. Eructavit cor meum.
column3: Psalm 45. Eructavit cor meum.

column2: 1 MY HEART is inditing of a good matter * I speak of the things which I have made unto the King.
column3: MY HEART is inditing of a good matter * I speak of the things which I have made unto the King.

column2: 2 My tongue is the pen * of a ready writer.
column3: My tongue is the pen * of a ready writer.

column2: 3 Thou art fairer than the children of men * full of grace are thy lips, because God hath blessed thee for ever.
column3: Thou art fairer than the children of men * full of grace are thy lips, because God hath blessed thee for ever.

column2: 4 Gird thee with thy sword upon thy thigh, O thou most Mighty * according to thy worship and renown.
column3: Gird thee with thy sword upon thy thigh, O thou most Mighty * according to thy worship and renown.

column2: 5 Good luck have thou with thine honour * ride on, because of the word of truth , of meekness, and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
column3: Good luck have thou with thine honour * ride on, because of the word of truth , of meekness, and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

column2: 6 Thy arrows are very sharp, and the people shall be subdued unto thee * even in the midst among the King's enemies.
column3: Thy arrows are very sharp, and the people shall be subdued unto thee * even in the midst among the King's enemies.

column2: 7 Thy seat, O God, endureth for ever * the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.
column3: Thy seat, O God, endureth for ever * the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.

column2: 8 Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity * wherefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
column3: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity * wherefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

column2: 9 All thy garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia * out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.
column3: All thy garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia * out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.

column2: 10 Kings' daughters were among thy honourable women * upon thy right hand did stand the queen in a vesture of gold, wrought about with divers colours.
column3: Kings' daughters were among thy honourable women * upon thy right hand did stand the queen in a vesture of gold, wrought about with divers colours.

column2: 11 Hearken, O daughter, and consider, incline thine ear *; forget also thine own people, and thy father's house.
column3: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, incline thine ear *; forget also thine own people, and thy father's house.

column2: 12 So shall the King have pleasure in thy beauty * for he is thy Lord God, and worship thou him.
column3: So shall the King have pleasure in thy beauty * for he is thy Lord God, and worship thou him.

column2: 13 And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift * like as the rich also among the people shall make their supplication before thee.
column3: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift * like as the rich also among the people shall make their supplication before thee.

column2: 14 The King's daughter is all glorious within * her clothing is of wrought gold.
column3: The King's daughter is all glorious within * her clothing is of wrought gold.
