column2: 15 She shall be brought unto the King in raiment of needle-work * the virgins that be her fellows shall bear her company, and shall be brought unto thee.
column3: She shall be brought unto the King in raiment of needle-work * the virgins that be her fellows shall bear her company, and shall be brought unto thee.

column2: 16 With joy and gladness shall they be brought * and shall enter into the King's palace.
column3: With joy and gladness shall they be brought * and shall enter into the King's palace.

column2: 17 Instead of thy fathers thou shalt have children * whom thou mayest make princes in all lands.
column3: Instead of thy fathers thou shalt have children * whom thou mayest make princes in all lands.

column2: 18 I will remember thy Name from one generation to another * therefore shall the people give thanks unto thee, world without end.
column3: I will remember thy Name from one generation to another * therefore shall the people give thanks unto thee, world without end.

column2: Psalm 46. Deus noster refugium.
column3: Psalm 46. Deus noster refugium.

column2: 1 GOD is our hope and strength * a very present help in trouble.
column3: GOD is our hope and strength * a very present help in trouble.

column2: 2 Therefore will we not fear, though the earth be moved * and though the hills be carried into the midst of the sea;
column3: Therefore will we not fear, though the earth be moved * and though the hills be carried into the midst of the sea;

column2: 3 Though the waters thereof rage and swell * and though the mountains shake at the tempest of the same.
column3: Though the waters thereof rage and swell * and though the mountains shake at the tempest of the same.

column2: 4 The rivers of the flood thereof shall make glad the city of God * the holy place of the tabernacle of the most Highest.
column3: The rivers of the flood thereof shall make glad the city of God * the holy place of the tabernacle of the most Highest.

column2: 5 God is in the midst of her, therefore shall she not be removed * God shall help her, and that right early.
column3: God is in the midst of her, therefore shall she not be removed * God shall help her, and that right early.

column2: 6 The heathen make much ado, and the kingdoms are moved * but God hath shewed his voice, and the earth shall melt away.
column3: The heathen make much ado, and the kingdoms are moved * but God hath shewed his voice, and the earth shall melt away.

column2: 7 The Lord of hosts is with us * the God of Jacob is our refuge.
column3: The Lord of hosts is with us * the God of Jacob is our refuge.

column2: 8 O come hither, and behold the works of the Lord * what destruction he hath brought upon the earth.
column3: O come hither, and behold the works of the Lord * what destruction he hath brought upon the earth.

column2: 9 He maketh wars to cease in all the world * he breaketh the bow, and knappeth the spear in sunder, and burneth the chariots in the fire.
column3: He maketh wars to cease in all the world * he breaketh the bow, and knappeth the spear in sunder, and burneth the chariots in the fire.

column2: 10 Be still then, and know that I am God * I will be exalted among the heathen, and I will be exalted in the earth.
column3: Be still then, and know that I am God * I will be exalted among the heathen, and I will be exalted in the earth.

column2: 11 The Lord of hosts is with us * the God of Jacob is our refuge.
column3: The Lord of hosts is with us * the God of Jacob is our refuge.

column2: Psalm 47. Omnes gentes, plaudite.
column3: Psalm 47. Omnes gentes, plaudite.

column2: 1 O CLAP your hands together, all ye people * O sing unto God with the voice of melody.
column3: O CLAP your hands together, all ye people * O sing unto God with the voice of melody.

column2: 2 For the Lord is high, and to be feared * he is the great King upon all the earth.
column3: For the Lord is high, and to be feared * he is the great King upon all the earth.

column2: 3 He shall subdue the people under us * and the nations under our feet.
column3: He shall subdue the people under us * and the nations under our feet.

column2: 4 He shall choose out an heritage for us * even the worship of Jacob, whom he loved.
column3: He shall choose out an heritage for us * even the worship of Jacob, whom he loved.

column2: 5 God is gone up with a merry noise * and the Lord with the sound of the trump.
column3: God is gone up with a merry noise * and the Lord with the sound of the trump.

column2: 6 O sing praises, sing praises unto our God * O sing praises, sing praises unto our King.
column3: O sing praises, sing praises unto our God * O sing praises, sing praises unto our King.

column2: 7 For God is the King of all the earth * sing ye praises with understanding.
column3: For God is the King of all the earth * sing ye praises with understanding.

column2: 8 God reigneth over the heathen * God sitteth upon his holy seat.
column3: God reigneth over the heathen * God sitteth upon his holy seat.

column2: 9 The princes of the people are joined unto the people of the God of Abraham * for God, which is very high exalted, doth defend the earth, as it were with a shield.
column3: The princes of the people are joined unto the people of the God of Abraham * for God, which is very high exalted, doth defend the earth, as it were with a shield.

column2: Psalm 48. Magnus Dominus.
column3: Psalm 48. Magnus Dominus.

column2: 1 GREAT is the Lord, and highly to be praised * in the city of our God, even upon his holy hill.
column3: GREAT is the Lord, and highly to be praised * in the city of our God, even upon his holy hill.

column2: 2 The hill of Sion is a fair place, and the joy of the whole earth * upon the north-side lieth the city of the great King; God is well known in her palaces as a sure refuge.
column3: The hill of Sion is a fair place, and the joy of the whole earth * upon the north-side lieth the city of the great King; God is well known in her palaces as a sure refuge.

column2: 3 For lo, the kings of the earth * are gathered, and gone by together.
column3: For lo, the kings of the earth * are gathered, and gone by together.

column2: 4 They marvelled to see such things * they were astonished, and suddenly cast down.
column3: They marvelled to see such things * they were astonished, and suddenly cast down.

column2: 5 Fear came there upon them, and sorrow * as upon a woman in her travail.
column3: Fear came there upon them, and sorrow * as upon a woman in her travail.

column2: 6 Thou shalt break the ships of the sea * through the east-wind.
column3: Thou shalt break the ships of the sea * through the east-wind.

column2: 7 Like as we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God * God upholdeth the same for ever.
column3: Like as we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God * God upholdeth the same for ever.

column2: 8 We wait for thy loving-kindness, O God * in the midst of thy temple.
column3: We wait for thy loving-kindness, O God * in the midst of thy temple.

column2: 9 O God, according to thy Name, so is thy praise unto the world's end * thy right hand is full of righteousness.
column3: O God, according to thy Name, so is thy praise unto the world's end * thy right hand is full of righteousness.

column2: 10 Let the mount Sion rejoice, and the daughters of Judah be glad * because of thy judgements.
column3: Let the mount Sion rejoice, and the daughters of Judah be glad * because of thy judgements.

column2: 11 Walk about Sion, and go round about her * and tell the towers thereof.
column3: Walk about Sion, and go round about her * and tell the towers thereof.

column2: 12 Mark well her bulwarks, set up her houses * that ye may tell them that come after.
column3: Mark well her bulwarks, set up her houses * that ye may tell them that come after.

column2: 13 For this God is our God for ever and ever * he shall be our guide unto death.
column3: For this God is our God for ever and ever * he shall be our guide unto death.

column2: Psalm 49. Audite haec, omnes.
column3: Psalm 49. Audite haec, omnes.

column2: 1 O HEAR ye this, all ye people * ponder it with your ears, all ye that dwell in the world;
column3: O HEAR ye this, all ye people * ponder it with your ears, all ye that dwell in the world;

column2: 2 High and low, rich and poor * one with another.
column3: High and low, rich and poor * one with another.

column2: 3 My mouth shall speak of wisdom * and my heart shall muse of understanding.
column3: My mouth shall speak of wisdom * and my heart shall muse of understanding.

column2: 4 I will incline mine ear to the parable * and shew my dark speech upon the harp.
column3: I will incline mine ear to the parable * and shew my dark speech upon the harp.

column2: 5 Wherefore should I fear in the days of wickedness * and when the wickedness of my heels compasseth me round about?
column3: Wherefore should I fear in the days of wickedness * and when the wickedness of my heels compasseth me round about?

column2: 6 There be some that put their trust in their goods * and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches.
column3: There be some that put their trust in their goods * and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches.

column2: 7 But no man may deliver his brother * nor make agreement unto God for him;
column3: But no man may deliver his brother * nor make agreement unto God for him;

column2: 8 For it cost more to redeem their souls * so that he must let that alone for ever;
column3: For it cost more to redeem their souls * so that he must let that alone for ever;

column2: 9 Yea, though he live long * and see not the grave.
column3: Yea, though he live long * and see not the grave.

column2: 10 For he seeth that wise men also die, and perish together * as well as the ignorant and foolish, and leave their riches for other.
column3: For he seeth that wise men also die, and perish together * as well as the ignorant and foolish, and leave their riches for other.

column2: 11 And yet they think that their houses shall continue for ever * and that their dwelling-places shall endure from one generation to another; and call the lands after their own names.
column3: And yet they think that their houses shall continue for ever * and that their dwelling-places shall endure from one generation to another; and call the lands after their own names.

column2: 12 Nevertheless, man will not abide in honour * seeing he may be compared unto the beasts that perish; this is the way of them.
column3: Nevertheless, man will not abide in honour * seeing he may be compared unto the beasts that perish; this is the way of them.

column2: 13 This is their foolishness * and their posterity praise their saying.
column3: This is their foolishness * and their posterity praise their saying.

column2: 14 They lie in the hell like sheep, death gnaweth upon them, and the righteous shall have domination over them in the morning * their beauty shall consume in the sepulchre out of their dwelling.
column3: They lie in the hell like sheep, death gnaweth upon them, and the righteous shall have domination over them in the morning * their beauty shall consume in the sepulchre out of their dwelling.

column2: 15 But God hath delivered my soul from the place of hell * for he shall receive me.
column3: But God hath delivered my soul from the place of hell * for he shall receive me.

column2: 16 Be not thou afraid, though one be made rich * or if the glory of his house be increased;
column3: Be not thou afraid, though one be made rich * or if the glory of his house be increased;

column2: 17 For he shall carry nothing away with him when he dieth * neither shall his pomp follow him.
column3: For he shall carry nothing away with him when he dieth * neither shall his pomp follow him.

column2: 18 For while he lived, he counted himself an happy man * and so long as thou doest well unto thyself, men will speak good of thee.
column3: For while he lived, he counted himself an happy man * and so long as thou doest well unto thyself, men will speak good of thee.

column2: 19 He shall follow the generation of his fathers * and shall never see light.
column3: He shall follow the generation of his fathers * and shall never see light.

column2: 20 Man being in honour hath no understanding * but is compared unto the beasts that perish.
column3: Man being in honour hath no understanding * but is compared unto the beasts that perish.

column2: Psalm 50. Deus deorum.
column3: Psalm 50. Deus deorum.

column2: 1 THE Lord, even the most mighty God, hath spoken * and called the world, from the rising up of the sun unto the going down thereof.
column3: THE Lord, even the most mighty God, hath spoken * and called the world, from the rising up of the sun unto the going down thereof.

column2: 2 Out of Sion hath God appeared * in perfect beauty.
column3: Out of Sion hath God appeared * in perfect beauty.

column2: 3 Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence * there shall go before him a consuming fire, and a mighty tempest shall be stirred up round about him.
column3: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence * there shall go before him a consuming fire, and a mighty tempest shall be stirred up round about him.

column2: 4 He shall call the heaven from above * and the earth, that he may judge his people.
column3: He shall call the heaven from above * and the earth, that he may judge his people.

column2: 5 Gather my saints together unto me * those that have made a covenant with me with sacrifice.
column3: Gather my saints together unto me * those that have made a covenant with me with sacrifice.

column2: 6 And the heavens shall declare his righteousness * for God is Judge himself.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness * for God is Judge himself.

column2: 7 Hear, O my people, and I will speak * I myself will testify against thee, O Israel; for I am God, even thy God.
column3: Hear, O my people, and I will speak * I myself will testify against thee, O Israel; for I am God, even thy God.

column2: 8 I will not reprove thee because of thy sacrifices, or for thy burnt-offerings * because they were not alway before me.
column3: I will not reprove thee because of thy sacrifices, or for thy burnt-offerings * because they were not alway before me.

column2: 9 I will take no bullock out of thine house * nor he-goat out of thy folds.
column3: I will take no bullock out of thine house * nor he-goat out of thy folds.

column2: 10 For all the beasts of the forest are mine * and so are the cattle upon a thousand hills.
column3: For all the beasts of the forest are mine * and so are the cattle upon a thousand hills.

column2: 11 I know all the fowls upon the mountains * and the wild beasts of the field are in my sight.
column3: I know all the fowls upon the mountains * and the wild beasts of the field are in my sight.

column2: 12 If I be hungry, I will not tell thee * for the whole world is mine, and all that is therein.
column3: If I be hungry, I will not tell thee * for the whole world is mine, and all that is therein.

column2: 13 Thinkest thou that I will eat bulls' flesh * and drink the blood of goats?
column3: Thinkest thou that I will eat bulls' flesh * and drink the blood of goats?

column2: 14 Offer unto God thanksgiving * and pay thy vows unto the most Highest.
column3: Offer unto God thanksgiving * and pay thy vows unto the most Highest.

column2: 15 And call upon me in the time of trouble * so will I hear thee, and thou shalt praise me.
column3: And call upon me in the time of trouble * so will I hear thee, and thou shalt praise me.

column2: 16 But unto the ungodly said God * Why dost thou preach my laws, and takest my covenant in thy mouth;
column3: But unto the ungodly said God * Why dost thou preach my laws, and takest my covenant in thy mouth;

column2: 17 Whereas thou hatest to be reformed * and has cast my words behind thee?
column3: Whereas thou hatest to be reformed * and has cast my words behind thee?

column2: 18 When thou sawest a thief, thou consentedst unto him * and hast been partaker with the adulterers.
column3: When thou sawest a thief, thou consentedst unto him * and hast been partaker with the adulterers.

column2: 19 Thou hast let thy mouth speak wickedness * and with thy tongue thou hast set forth deceit.
column3: Thou hast let thy mouth speak wickedness * and with thy tongue thou hast set forth deceit.

column2: 20 Thou satest, and spakest against thy brother * yea, and hast slandered thine own mother's son.
column3: Thou satest, and spakest against thy brother * yea, and hast slandered thine own mother's son.

column2: 21 These things hast thou done, and I held my tongue, and thou thoughtest wickedly, that I am even such a one as thyself * but I will reprove thee, and set before thee the things that thou hast done.
column3: These things hast thou done, and I held my tongue, and thou thoughtest wickedly, that I am even such a one as thyself * but I will reprove thee, and set before thee the things that thou hast done.

column2: 22 O consider this, ye that forget God * lest I pluck you away, and there be none to deliver you.
column3: O consider this, ye that forget God * lest I pluck you away, and there be none to deliver you.

column2: 23 Whoso offereth me thanks and praise, he honoureth me * and to him that ordereth his conversation right will I shew the salvation of God.
column3: Whoso offereth me thanks and praise, he honoureth me * and to him that ordereth his conversation right will I shew the salvation of God.

column2: Psalm 51. Miserere mei, Deus.
column3: Psalm 51. Miserere mei, Deus.

column2: 1 HAVE mercy upon me, O God, after thy great goodness * according to the multitude of thy mercies do away mine offences.
column3: HAVE mercy upon me, O God, after thy great goodness * according to the multitude of thy mercies do away mine offences.

column2: 2 Wash me throughly from my wickedness * and cleanse me from my sin.
column3: Wash me throughly from my wickedness * and cleanse me from my sin.

column2: 3 For I acknowledge my faults * and my sin is ever before me.
column3: For I acknowledge my faults * and my sin is ever before me.

column2: 4 Against thee only have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight * that thou mightest be justified in thy saying, and clear when thou art judged.
column3: Against thee only have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight * that thou mightest be justified in thy saying, and clear when thou art judged.

column2: 5 Behold, I was shapen in wickedness * and in sin hath my mother conceived me.
column3: Behold, I was shapen in wickedness * and in sin hath my mother conceived me.

column2: 6 But lo, thou requirest truth in the inward parts * and shalt make me to understand wisdom secretly.
column3: But lo, thou requirest truth in the inward parts * and shalt make me to understand wisdom secretly.

column2: 7 Thou shalt purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean * thou shalt wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
column3: Thou shalt purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean * thou shalt wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

column2: 8 Thou shalt make me hear of joy and gladness * that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.
column3: Thou shalt make me hear of joy and gladness * that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

column2: 9 Turn thy face from my sins * and put out all my misdeeds.
column3: Turn thy face from my sins * and put out all my misdeeds.

column2: 10 Make me a clean heart, O God * and renew a right spirit within me.
column3: Make me a clean heart, O God * and renew a right spirit within me.

column2: 11 Cast me not away from thy presence * and take not thy holy Spirit from me.
column3: Cast me not away from thy presence * and take not thy holy Spirit from me.

column2: 12 O give me the comfort of thy help again * and stablish me with thy free Spirit.
column3: O give me the comfort of thy help again * and stablish me with thy free Spirit.

column2: 13 Then shall I teach thy ways unto the wicked * and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
column3: Then shall I teach thy ways unto the wicked * and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

column2: 14 Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, thou that art the God of my health * and my tongue shall sing of thy righteousness.
column3: Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, thou that art the God of my health * and my tongue shall sing of thy righteousness.

column2: 15 Thou shalt open my lips, O Lord * and my mouth shall shew thy praise.
column3: Thou shalt open my lips, O Lord * and my mouth shall shew thy praise.

column2: 16 For thou desirest no sacrifice, else would I give it thee * but thou delightest not in burnt-offerings.
column3: For thou desirest no sacrifice, else would I give it thee * but thou delightest not in burnt-offerings.

column2: 17 The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit * a broken and contrite heart, O God, shalt thou not despise.
column3: The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit * a broken and contrite heart, O God, shalt thou not despise.

column2: 18 O be favourable and gracious unto Sion * build thou the walls of Jerusalem.
column3: O be favourable and gracious unto Sion * build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

column2: 19 Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifice of righteousness, with the burnt-offerings and oblations * then shall they offer young bullocks upon thine altar.
column3: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifice of righteousness, with the burnt-offerings and oblations * then shall they offer young bullocks upon thine altar.

column2: Psalm 52. Quid gloriaris?
column3: Psalm 52. Quid gloriaris?

column2: 1 WHY boastest thou thyself, thou tyrant * that thou canst do mischief;
column3: WHY boastest thou thyself, thou tyrant * that thou canst do mischief;

column2: 2 Whereas the goodness of God * endureth yet daily?
column3: Whereas the goodness of God * endureth yet daily?

column2: 3 Thy tongue imagineth wickedness * and with lies thou cuttest like a sharp rasor.
column3: Thy tongue imagineth wickedness * and with lies thou cuttest like a sharp rasor.

column2: 4 Thou hast loved unrighteousness more then goodness * and to talk of lies more than righteousness.
column3: Thou hast loved unrighteousness more then goodness * and to talk of lies more than righteousness.

column2: 5 Thou hast loved to speak all words that may do hurt * O thou false tongue.
column3: Thou hast loved to speak all words that may do hurt * O thou false tongue.

column2: 6 Therefore shall God destroy thee for ever * he shall take thee, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling, and root thee out of the land of the living.
column3: Therefore shall God destroy thee for ever * he shall take thee, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling, and root thee out of the land of the living.

column2: 7 The righteous also shall see this, and fear * and shall laugh him to scorn;
column3: The righteous also shall see this, and fear * and shall laugh him to scorn;

column2: 8 Lo, this is the man that took not God for his strength * but trusted unto the multitude of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.
column3: Lo, this is the man that took not God for his strength * but trusted unto the multitude of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.

column2: 9 As for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God * my trust is in the tender mercy of God for ever and ever.
column3: As for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God * my trust is in the tender mercy of God for ever and ever.

column2: 10 I will always give thanks unto thee for that thou hast done * and I will hope in thy Name, for thy saints like it well.
column3: I will always give thanks unto thee for that thou hast done * and I will hope in thy Name, for thy saints like it well.

column2: Psalm 53. Dixit insipiens.
column3: Psalm 53. Dixit insipiens.

column2: 1 THE foolish body hath said in his heart * There is no God.
column3: THE foolish body hath said in his heart * There is no God.

column2: 2 Corrupt are they, and become abominable in their wickedness * there is none that doeth good.
column3: Corrupt are they, and become abominable in their wickedness * there is none that doeth good.

column2: 3 God looked down from heaven upon the children of men * to see if there were any that would understand, and seek after God.
column3: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men * to see if there were any that would understand, and seek after God.

column2: 4 But they are all gone out of the way, they are altogether become abominable * there is also none that doeth good, no not one.
column3: But they are all gone out of the way, they are altogether become abominable * there is also none that doeth good, no not one.

column2: 5 Are not they without understanding, that work wickedness * eating up my people as if they would eat bread? they have not called upon God.
column3: Are not they without understanding, that work wickedness * eating up my people as if they would eat bread? they have not called upon God.

column2: 6 They were afraid where no fear was * for God hath broken the bones of him that besieged thee; thou hast put them to confusion, because God hath despised them.
column3: They were afraid where no fear was * for God hath broken the bones of him that besieged thee; thou hast put them to confusion, because God hath despised them.

column2: 7 O that the salvation were given unto Israel out of Sion * O that the Lord would deliver his people out of captivity!
column3: O that the salvation were given unto Israel out of Sion * O that the Lord would deliver his people out of captivity!

column2: 8 Then should Jacob rejoice * and Israel should be right glad.
column3: Then should Jacob rejoice * and Israel should be right glad.

column2: Psalm 54. Deus, in nomine.
column3: Psalm 54. Deus, in nomine.

column2: 1 SAVE me, O God, for thy Name's sake * and avenge me in thy strength.
column3: SAVE me, O God, for thy Name's sake * and avenge me in thy strength.

column2: 2 Hear my prayer, O God * and hearken unto the words of my mouth.
column3: Hear my prayer, O God * and hearken unto the words of my mouth.

column2: 3 For strangers are risen up against me * and tyrants, which have not God before their eyes, seek after my soul.
column3: For strangers are risen up against me * and tyrants, which have not God before their eyes, seek after my soul.

column2: 4 Behold, God is my helper * the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.
column3: Behold, God is my helper * the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.

column2: 5 He shall reward evil unto mine enemies * destroy thou them in thy truth.
column3: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies * destroy thou them in thy truth.

column2: 6 An offering of a free heart will I give thee, and praise thy Name, O Lord * because it is so comfortable.
column3: An offering of a free heart will I give thee, and praise thy Name, O Lord * because it is so comfortable.

column2: 7 For he hath delivered me out of all my trouble * and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.
column3: For he hath delivered me out of all my trouble * and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.

column2: Psalm 55. Exaudi, Deus.
column3: Psalm 55. Exaudi, Deus.

column2: 1 HEAR my prayer, O God * and hide not thyself from my petition.
column3: HEAR my prayer, O God * and hide not thyself from my petition.

column2: 2 Take heed unto me, and hear me * how I mourn in my prayer, and am vexed.
column3: Take heed unto me, and hear me * how I mourn in my prayer, and am vexed.

column2: 3 The enemy crieth so, and the ungodly cometh on so fast * for they are minded to do me some mischief; so maliciously are they set against me.
column3: The enemy crieth so, and the ungodly cometh on so fast * for they are minded to do me some mischief; so maliciously are they set against me.

column2: 4 My heart is disquieted within me * and the fear of death is fallen upon me.
column3: My heart is disquieted within me * and the fear of death is fallen upon me.

column2: 5 Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me * and an horrible dread hath overwhelmed me.
column3: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me * and an horrible dread hath overwhelmed me.

column2: 6 And I said, O that I had wings like a dove * for then would I flee away, and be at rest.
column3: And I said, O that I had wings like a dove * for then would I flee away, and be at rest.

column2: 7 Lo, then would I get me away far off * and remain in the wilderness.
column3: Lo, then would I get me away far off * and remain in the wilderness.

column2: 8 I would make haste to escape * because of the stormy wind and tempest.
column3: I would make haste to escape * because of the stormy wind and tempest.

column2: 9 Destroy their tongues, O Lord, and divide them * for I have spied unrighteousness and strife in the city.
column3: Destroy their tongues, O Lord, and divide them * for I have spied unrighteousness and strife in the city.

column2: 10 Day and night they go about within the walls thereof * mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.
column3: Day and night they go about within the walls thereof * mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

column2: 11 Wickedness is therein * deceit and guile go not out of their streets.
column3: Wickedness is therein * deceit and guile go not out of their streets.

column2: 12 For it is not an open enemy, that hath done me this dishonour * for then I could have borne it.
column3: For it is not an open enemy, that hath done me this dishonour * for then I could have borne it.

column2: 13 Neither was it mine adversary, that did magnify himself against me * for then peradventure I would have hid myself from him.
column3: Neither was it mine adversary, that did magnify himself against me * for then peradventure I would have hid myself from him.

column2: 14 But it was even thou, my companion * my guide, and mine own familiar friend.
column3: But it was even thou, my companion * my guide, and mine own familiar friend.

column2: 15 We took sweet counsel together * and walked in the house of God as friends.
column3: We took sweet counsel together * and walked in the house of God as friends.

column2: 16 Let death come hastily upon them, and let them go down quick into hell * for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.
column3: Let death come hastily upon them, and let them go down quick into hell * for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.

column2: 17 As for me, I will call upon God * and the Lord shall save me.
column3: As for me, I will call upon God * and the Lord shall save me.

column2: 18 In the evening, and morning, and at noonday will I pray, and that instantly * and he shall hear my voice.
column3: In the evening, and morning, and at noonday will I pray, and that instantly * and he shall hear my voice.

column2: 19 It is he that hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me * for there were many with me.
column3: It is he that hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me * for there were many with me.

column2: 20 Yea, even God, that endureth for ever, shall hear me, and bring them down * for they will not turn, nor fear God.
column3: Yea, even God, that endureth for ever, shall hear me, and bring them down * for they will not turn, nor fear God.

column2: 21 He laid his hands upon such as be at peace with him * and he brake his covenant.
column3: He laid his hands upon such as be at peace with him * and he brake his covenant.

column2: 22 The words of his mouth were softer than butter, having war in his heart * his words were smoother than oil, and yet be they very swords.
column3: The words of his mouth were softer than butter, having war in his heart * his words were smoother than oil, and yet be they very swords.

column2: 23 O cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall nourish thee * and shall not suffer the righteous to fall for ever.
column3: O cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall nourish thee * and shall not suffer the righteous to fall for ever.

column2: 24 And as for them * thou, O God, shalt bring them into the pit of destruction.
column3: And as for them * thou, O God, shalt bring them into the pit of destruction.

column2: 25 The blood-thirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days * nevertheless, my trust shall be in thee, O Lord.
column3: The blood-thirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days * nevertheless, my trust shall be in thee, O Lord.

column2: Psalm 56. Miserere mei, Deus.
column3: Psalm 56. Miserere mei, Deus.

column2: 1 BE MERCIFUL unto me, O God, for man goeth about to devour me * he is daily fighting, and troubling me.
column3: BE MERCIFUL unto me, O God, for man goeth about to devour me * he is daily fighting, and troubling me.

column2: 2 Mine enemies are daily in hand to swallow me up * for they be many that fight against me, O thou most Highest.
column3: Mine enemies are daily in hand to swallow me up * for they be many that fight against me, O thou most Highest.

column2: 3 Nevertheless, though I am sometime afraid * yet put I my trust in thee.
column3: Nevertheless, though I am sometime afraid * yet put I my trust in thee.

column2: 4 I will praise God, because of his word * I have put my trust in God, and will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
column3: I will praise God, because of his word * I have put my trust in God, and will not fear what flesh can do unto me.

column2: 5 They daily mistake my words * all that they imagine is to do me evil.
column3: They daily mistake my words * all that they imagine is to do me evil.

column2: 6 They hold all together, and keep themselves close * and mark my steps, when they lay wait for my soul.
column3: They hold all together, and keep themselves close * and mark my steps, when they lay wait for my soul.

column2: 7 Shall they escape for their wickedness * thou, O God, in thy displeasure shalt cast them down.
column3: Shall they escape for their wickedness * thou, O God, in thy displeasure shalt cast them down.

column2: 8 Thou tellest my flittings; put my tears into thy bottle * are not these things noted in thy book?
column3: Thou tellest my flittings; put my tears into thy bottle * are not these things noted in thy book?

column2: 9 Whensoever I call upon thee, then shall mine enemies be put to flight * this I know; for God is on my side.
column3: Whensoever I call upon thee, then shall mine enemies be put to flight * this I know; for God is on my side.

column2: 10 In God's word I will rejoice * in the Lord's word will I comfort me.
column3: In God's word I will rejoice * in the Lord's word will I comfort me.

column2: 11 Yea, in God have I put my trust * I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.
column3: Yea, in God have I put my trust * I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

column2: 12 Unto thee, O God, will I pay my vows * unto thee will I give thanks.
column3: Unto thee, O God, will I pay my vows * unto thee will I give thanks.

column2: 13 For thou hast delivered my soul from death, and my feet from falling * that I may walk before God in the light of the living.
column3: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, and my feet from falling * that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

column2: Psalm 57. Miserere mei, Deus.
column3: Psalm 57. Miserere mei, Deus.

column2: 1 BE MERCIFUL unto me, O God, be merciful unto me, for my soul trusteth in thee * and under the shadow of thy wings shall be my refuge, until this tyranny be over-past.
column3: BE MERCIFUL unto me, O God, be merciful unto me, for my soul trusteth in thee * and under the shadow of thy wings shall be my refuge, until this tyranny be over-past.

column2: 2 I will call unto the most high God * even unto the God that shall perform the cause which I have in hand.
column3: I will call unto the most high God * even unto the God that shall perform the cause which I have in hand.

column2: 3 He shall send from heaven * and save me from the reproof of him that would eat me up.
column3: He shall send from heaven * and save me from the reproof of him that would eat me up.

column2: 4 God shall send forth his mercy and truth * my soul is among lions.
column3: God shall send forth his mercy and truth * my soul is among lions.

column2: 5 And I lie even among the children of men, that are set on fire * whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword
column3: And I lie even among the children of men, that are set on fire * whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword

column2: 6 Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens * and thy glory above all the earth.
column3: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens * and thy glory above all the earth.

column2: 7 They have laid a net for my feet, and pressed down my soul * they have digged a pit before me, and are fallen into the midst of it themselves.
column3: They have laid a net for my feet, and pressed down my soul * they have digged a pit before me, and are fallen into the midst of it themselves.

column2: 8 My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed * I will sing, and give praise.
column3: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed * I will sing, and give praise.

column2: 9 Awake up, my glory; awake, lute and harp * I myself will awake right early.
column3: Awake up, my glory; awake, lute and harp * I myself will awake right early.

column2: 10 I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the people * and I will sing unto thee among the nations.
column3: I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the people * and I will sing unto thee among the nations.

column2: 11 For the greatness of thy mercy reacheth unto the heavens * and thy truth unto the clouds.
column3: For the greatness of thy mercy reacheth unto the heavens * and thy truth unto the clouds.

column2: 12 Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens * and thy glory above all the earth.
column3: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens * and thy glory above all the earth.

column2: Psalm 58. Si vere utique.
column3: Psalm 58. Si vere utique.

column2: 1 ARE your minds set upon righteousness, O ye congregation * and do ye judge the thing that is right, O ye sons of men?
column3: ARE your minds set upon righteousness, O ye congregation * and do ye judge the thing that is right, O ye sons of men?

column2: 2 Yea, ye imagine mischief in your heart upon the earth * and your hands deal with wickedness.
column3: Yea, ye imagine mischief in your heart upon the earth * and your hands deal with wickedness.

column2: 3 The ungodly are froward, even from their mother's womb * as soon as they are born, they go astray, and speak lies.
column3: The ungodly are froward, even from their mother's womb * as soon as they are born, they go astray, and speak lies.

column2: 4 They are as venomous as the poison of a serpent * even like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ears;
column3: They are as venomous as the poison of a serpent * even like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ears;

column2: 5 Which refuseth to hear the voice of the charmer * charm he never so wisely.
column3: Which refuseth to hear the voice of the charmer * charm he never so wisely.

column2: 6 Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths; smite the jaw-bones of the lions, O Lord * let them fall away like water that runneth apace; and when they shoot their arrows let them be rooted out.
column3: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths; smite the jaw-bones of the lions, O Lord * let them fall away like water that runneth apace; and when they shoot their arrows let them be rooted out.

column2: 7 Let them consume away like a snail, and be like the untimely fruit of a woman * and let them not see the sun.
column3: Let them consume away like a snail, and be like the untimely fruit of a woman * and let them not see the sun.

column2: 8 Or ever your pots be made hot with thorns * so let indignation vex him, even as a thing that is raw.
column3: Or ever your pots be made hot with thorns * so let indignation vex him, even as a thing that is raw.

column2: 9 The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance * he shall wash his footsteps in the blood of the ungodly.
column3: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance * he shall wash his footsteps in the blood of the ungodly.

column2: 10 So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous * doubtless there is a God that judgeth the earth.
column3: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous * doubtless there is a God that judgeth the earth.

column2: Psalm 59. Eripe me de inimicis.
column3: Psalm 59. Eripe me de inimicis.

column2: 1 DELIVER me from mine enemies, O God * defend me from them that rise up against me.
column3: DELIVER me from mine enemies, O God * defend me from them that rise up against me.

column2: 2 O deliver me from the wicked doers * and save me from the blood-thirsty men.
column3: O deliver me from the wicked doers * and save me from the blood-thirsty men.

column2: 3 For lo, they lie waiting for my soul * the mighty men are gathered against me, without any offence or fault of me, O Lord.
column3: For lo, they lie waiting for my soul * the mighty men are gathered against me, without any offence or fault of me, O Lord.

column2: 4 They run and prepare themselves without my fault * arise thou therefore to help me, and behold.
column3: They run and prepare themselves without my fault * arise thou therefore to help me, and behold.

column2: 5 Stand up, O Lord God of hosts, thou God of Israel, to visit all the heathen * and be not merciful unto them that offend of malicious wickedness.
column3: Stand up, O Lord God of hosts, thou God of Israel, to visit all the heathen * and be not merciful unto them that offend of malicious wickedness.

column2: 6 They go to and fro in the evening * they grin like a dog, and run about through the city.
column3: They go to and fro in the evening * they grin like a dog, and run about through the city.

column2: 7 Behold, they speak with their mouth, and swords are in their lips * for who doth hear?
column3: Behold, they speak with their mouth, and swords are in their lips * for who doth hear?

column2: 8 But thou. O Lord, shalt have them in derision * and thou shalt laugh all the heathen to scorn.
column3: But thou. O Lord, shalt have them in derision * and thou shalt laugh all the heathen to scorn.

column2: 9 My strength will I ascribe unto thee * for thou art the God of my refuge.
column3: My strength will I ascribe unto thee * for thou art the God of my refuge.

column2: 10 God sheweth me his goodness plenteously * and God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
column3: God sheweth me his goodness plenteously * and God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.

column2: 11 Slay them not, lest my people forget it * but scatter them abroad among the people, and put them down, O Lord, our defence.
column3: Slay them not, lest my people forget it * but scatter them abroad among the people, and put them down, O Lord, our defence.

column2: 12 For the sin of their mouth, and for the words of their lips, they shall be taken in their pride * and why? their preaching is of cursing and lies.
column3: For the sin of their mouth, and for the words of their lips, they shall be taken in their pride * and why? their preaching is of cursing and lies.

column2: 13 Consume them in thy wrath, consume them, that they may perish * and know that it is God that ruleth in Jacob, and unto the ends of the world.
column3: Consume them in thy wrath, consume them, that they may perish * and know that it is God that ruleth in Jacob, and unto the ends of the world.

column2: 14 And in the evening they will return * grin like a dog, and will go about the city.
column3: And in the evening they will return * grin like a dog, and will go about the city.

column2: 15 They will run here and there for meat * and grudge if they be not satisfied.
column3: They will run here and there for meat * and grudge if they be not satisfied.

column2: 16 As for me, I will sing of thy power, and will praise thy mercy betimes in the morning * for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.
column3: As for me, I will sing of thy power, and will praise thy mercy betimes in the morning * for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

column2: 17 Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing * for thou, O God, art my refuge, and my merciful God.
column3: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing * for thou, O God, art my refuge, and my merciful God.

column2: Psalm 60. Deus, repulisti nos.
column3: Psalm 60. Deus, repulisti nos.

column2: 1 O GOD, thou hast cast us out, and scattered us abroad * thou hast also been displeased; O turn thee unto us again.
column3: O GOD, thou hast cast us out, and scattered us abroad * thou hast also been displeased; O turn thee unto us again.

column2: 2 Thou hast moved the land, and divided it * heal the sores thereof, for it shaketh.
column3: Thou hast moved the land, and divided it * heal the sores thereof, for it shaketh.

column2: 3 Thou hast shewed thy people heavy things * thou hast given us a drink of deadly wine.
column3: Thou hast shewed thy people heavy things * thou hast given us a drink of deadly wine.

column2: 4 Thou hast given a token for such as fear thee * that they may triumph because of the truth.
column3: Thou hast given a token for such as fear thee * that they may triumph because of the truth.

column2: 5 Therefore were thy beloved delivered * help me with thy right hand, and hear me.
column3: Therefore were thy beloved delivered * help me with thy right hand, and hear me.

column2: 6 God hath spoken in his holiness, I will rejoice, and divide Sichem * and mete out the valley of Succoth.
column3: God hath spoken in his holiness, I will rejoice, and divide Sichem * and mete out the valley of Succoth.

column2: 7 Gilead is mine, and Manasses is mine * Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;
column3: Gilead is mine, and Manasses is mine * Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;

column2: 8 Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe * Philistia, be thou glad of me.
column3: Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe * Philistia, be thou glad of me.

column2: 9 Who will lead me into the strong city * who will bring me into Edom?
column3: Who will lead me into the strong city * who will bring me into Edom?

column2: 10 Hast not thou cast us out, O God * wilt not thou, O God, go out with our hosts?
column3: Hast not thou cast us out, O God * wilt not thou, O God, go out with our hosts?

column2: 11 O be thou our help in trouble * for vain is the help of man.
column3: O be thou our help in trouble * for vain is the help of man.

column2: 12 Through God will we do great acts * for it is he that shall tread down our enemies.
column3: Through God will we do great acts * for it is he that shall tread down our enemies.

column2: Psalm 61. Exaudi, Deus.
column3: Psalm 61. Exaudi, Deus.

column2: 1 HEAR my crying, O God * give ear unto my prayer.
column3: HEAR my crying, O God * give ear unto my prayer.

column2: 2 From the ends of the earth will I call upon thee * when my heart is in heaviness.
column3: From the ends of the earth will I call upon thee * when my heart is in heaviness.

column2: 3 O set me up upon the rock that is higher than I * for thou hast been my hope, and a strong tower for me against the enemy.
column3: O set me up upon the rock that is higher than I * for thou hast been my hope, and a strong tower for me against the enemy.

column2: 4 I will dwell in thy tabernacle for ever * and my trust shall be under the covering of thy wings.
column3: I will dwell in thy tabernacle for ever * and my trust shall be under the covering of thy wings.

column2: 5 For thou, O Lord, hast heard my desires * and hast given an heritage unto those that fear thy Name.
column3: For thou, O Lord, hast heard my desires * and hast given an heritage unto those that fear thy Name.

column2: 6 Thou shalt grant the King a long life * that his years may endure throughout all generations.
column3: Thou shalt grant the King a long life * that his years may endure throughout all generations.

column2: 7 He shall dwell before God for ever * O prepare thy loving mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.
column3: He shall dwell before God for ever * O prepare thy loving mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.

column2: 8 So will I always sing praise unto thy Name * that I may daily perform my vows.
column3: So will I always sing praise unto thy Name * that I may daily perform my vows.

column2: Psalm 62. Nonne Deo?
column3: Psalm 62. Nonne Deo?

column2: 1 MY SOUL truly waiteth still upon God * for of him cometh my salvation.
column3: MY SOUL truly waiteth still upon God * for of him cometh my salvation.

column2: 2 He verily is my strength and my salvation * he is my defence, so that I shall not greatly fall.
column3: He verily is my strength and my salvation * he is my defence, so that I shall not greatly fall.

column2: 3 How long will ye imagine mischief against every man * ye shall be slain all the sort of you; yea, as a tottering wall shall ye be, and like a broken hedge.
column3: How long will ye imagine mischief against every man * ye shall be slain all the sort of you; yea, as a tottering wall shall ye be, and like a broken hedge.

column2: 4 Their device is only how to put him out whom God will exalt * their delight is in lies; they give good words with their mouth, but curse with their heart.
column3: Their device is only how to put him out whom God will exalt * their delight is in lies; they give good words with their mouth, but curse with their heart.

column2: 5 Nevertheless, my soul, wait thou still upon God * for my hope is in him.
column3: Nevertheless, my soul, wait thou still upon God * for my hope is in him.

column2: 6 He truly is my strength and my salvation * he is my defence, so that I shall not fall.
column3: He truly is my strength and my salvation * he is my defence, so that I shall not fall.

column2: 7 In God is my health, and my glory * the rock of my might, and in God is my trust.
column3: In God is my health, and my glory * the rock of my might, and in God is my trust.

column2: 8 O put your trust in him alway, ye people * pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope.
column3: O put your trust in him alway, ye people * pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope.

column2: 9 As for the children of men, they are but vanity * the children of men are deceitful upon the weights, they are altogether lighter than vanity itself.
column3: As for the children of men, they are but vanity * the children of men are deceitful upon the weights, they are altogether lighter than vanity itself.

column2: 10 O trust not in wrong and robbery, give not yourselves unto vanity * if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
column3: O trust not in wrong and robbery, give not yourselves unto vanity * if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

column2: 11 God spake once, and twice I have also heard the same * that power belongeth unto God;
column3: God spake once, and twice I have also heard the same * that power belongeth unto God;

column2: 12 And that thou, Lord, art merciful * for thou rewardest every man according to his work.
column3: And that thou, Lord, art merciful * for thou rewardest every man according to his work.

column2: Psalm 63. Deus, Deus meus.
column3: Psalm 63. Deus, Deus meus.

column2: 1 O GOD, thou art my God * early will I seek thee.
column3: O GOD, thou art my God * early will I seek thee.

column2: 2 My soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh also longeth after thee * in a barren and dry land where no water is.
column3: My soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh also longeth after thee * in a barren and dry land where no water is.

column2: 3 Thus have I looked for thee in holiness * that I might behold thy power and glory.
column3: Thus have I looked for thee in holiness * that I might behold thy power and glory.

column2: 4 For thy loving-kindness is better than the life itself * my lips shall praise thee.
column3: For thy loving-kindness is better than the life itself * my lips shall praise thee.

column2: 5 As long as I live will I magnify thee on this manner * and lift up my hands in thy Name.
column3: As long as I live will I magnify thee on this manner * and lift up my hands in thy Name.

column2: 6 My soul shall be satisfied, even as it were with marrow and fatness * when my mouth praiseth thee with joyful lips.
column3: My soul shall be satisfied, even as it were with marrow and fatness * when my mouth praiseth thee with joyful lips.

column2: 7 Have I not remembered thee in my bed * and thought upon thee when I was waking?
column3: Have I not remembered thee in my bed * and thought upon thee when I was waking?

column2: 8 Because thou hast been my helper * therefore under the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
column3: Because thou hast been my helper * therefore under the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

column2: 9 My soul hangeth upon thee * thy right hand hath upholden me.
column3: My soul hangeth upon thee * thy right hand hath upholden me.

column2: 10 These also that seek the hurt of my soul * they shall go under the earth.
column3: These also that seek the hurt of my soul * they shall go under the earth.

column2: 11 Let them fall upon the edge of the sword * that they may be a portion for foxes.
column3: Let them fall upon the edge of the sword * that they may be a portion for foxes.

column2: 12 But the King shall rejoice in God; all they also that swear by him shall be commended * for the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
column3: But the King shall rejoice in God; all they also that swear by him shall be commended * for the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.

column2: Psalm 64. Exaudi, Deus.
column3: Psalm 64. Exaudi, Deus.

column2: 1 HEAR my voice, O God, in my prayer * preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
column3: HEAR my voice, O God, in my prayer * preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

column2: 2 Hide me from the gathering together of the froward * and from the insurrection of wicked doers;
column3: Hide me from the gathering together of the froward * and from the insurrection of wicked doers;

column2: 3 Who have whet their tongue like a sword * and shoot out their arrows, even bitter words;
column3: Who have whet their tongue like a sword * and shoot out their arrows, even bitter words;

column2: 4 That they may privily shoot at him that is perfect * suddenly do they hit him, and fear not.
column3: That they may privily shoot at him that is perfect * suddenly do they hit him, and fear not.

column2: 5 They encourage themselves in mischief * and commune among themselves how they may lay snares, and say that no man shall see them.
column3: They encourage themselves in mischief * and commune among themselves how they may lay snares, and say that no man shall see them.

column2: 6 They imagine wickedness, and practise it * that they keep secret among themselves, every man in the deep of his heart.
column3: They imagine wickedness, and practise it * that they keep secret among themselves, every man in the deep of his heart.

column2: 7 But God shall suddenly shoot at them with a swift arrow * that they shall be wounded.
column3: But God shall suddenly shoot at them with a swift arrow * that they shall be wounded.

column2: 8 Yea, their own tongues shall make them fall * insomuch that whoso seeth them shall laugh them to scorn.
column3: Yea, their own tongues shall make them fall * insomuch that whoso seeth them shall laugh them to scorn.

column2: 9 And all men that see it shall say, This hath God done * for they shall perceive that it is his work.
column3: And all men that see it shall say, This hath God done * for they shall perceive that it is his work.

column2: 10 The righteous shall rejoice in the Lord, and put his trust in him * and all they that are true of heart shall be glad.
column3: The righteous shall rejoice in the Lord, and put his trust in him * and all they that are true of heart shall be glad.

column2: Psalm 65. Te decet hymnus.
column3: Psalm 65. Te decet hymnus.

column2: 1 THOU, O God, art praised in Sion * and unto thee shall the vow be performed in Jerusalem.
column3: THOU, O God, art praised in Sion * and unto thee shall the vow be performed in Jerusalem.

column2: 2 Thou that hearest the prayer * unto thee shall all flesh come.
column3: Thou that hearest the prayer * unto thee shall all flesh come.

column2: 3 My misdeeds prevail against me * O be thou merciful unto our sins.
column3: My misdeeds prevail against me * O be thou merciful unto our sins.

column2: 4 Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and receivest unto thee * he shall dwell in thy court, and shall be satisfied with the pleasures of thy house, even of thy holy temple.
column3: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and receivest unto thee * he shall dwell in thy court, and shall be satisfied with the pleasures of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

column2: 5 Thou shalt shew us wonderful things in thy righteousness, O God of our salvation * thou that art the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of them that remain in the broad sea.
column3: Thou shalt shew us wonderful things in thy righteousness, O God of our salvation * thou that art the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of them that remain in the broad sea.

column2: 6 Who in his strength setteth fast the mountains * and is girded about with power.
column3: Who in his strength setteth fast the mountains * and is girded about with power.

column2: 7 Who stilleth the raging of the sea * and the noise of his waves, and the madness of the people.
column3: Who stilleth the raging of the sea * and the noise of his waves, and the madness of the people.

column2: 8 They also that dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth shall be afraid at thy tokens * thou that makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to praise thee.
column3: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth shall be afraid at thy tokens * thou that makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to praise thee.

column2: 9 Thou visitest the earth, and blessest it * thou makest it very plenteous.
column3: Thou visitest the earth, and blessest it * thou makest it very plenteous.

column2: 10 The river of God is full of water * thou preparest their corn, for so thou providest for the earth.
column3: The river of God is full of water * thou preparest their corn, for so thou providest for the earth.

column2: 11 Thou waterest her furrows, thou sendest rain into the little valleys thereof * thou makest it soft with the drops of rain, and blessest the increase of it.
column3: Thou waterest her furrows, thou sendest rain into the little valleys thereof * thou makest it soft with the drops of rain, and blessest the increase of it.

column2: 12 Thou crownest the year with thy goodness * and thy clouds drop fatness.
column3: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness * and thy clouds drop fatness.

column2: 13 They shall drop upon the dwellings of the wilderness * and the little hills shall rejoice on every side.
column3: They shall drop upon the dwellings of the wilderness * and the little hills shall rejoice on every side.

column2: 14 The folds shall be full of sheep * the valleys also shall stand so thick with corn, that they shall laugh and sing.
column3: The folds shall be full of sheep * the valleys also shall stand so thick with corn, that they shall laugh and sing.

column2: Psalm 66. Jubilate Deo.
column3: Psalm 66. Jubilate Deo.

column2: 1 O BE joyful in God * all ye lands
column3: O BE joyful in God * all ye lands

column2: 2 Sing praises unto the honour of his Name * make his praise to be glorious.
column3: Sing praises unto the honour of his Name * make his praise to be glorious.

column2: 3 Say unto God, O how wonderful art thou in thy works * through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies be found liars unto thee.
column3: Say unto God, O how wonderful art thou in thy works * through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies be found liars unto thee.

column2: 4 For all the world shall worship thee * sing of thee, and praise thy Name.
column3: For all the world shall worship thee * sing of thee, and praise thy Name.

column2: 5 O come hither, and behold the works of God * how wonderful he is in his doing toward the children of men.
column3: O come hither, and behold the works of God * how wonderful he is in his doing toward the children of men.

column2: 6 He turned the sea into dry land * so that they went through the water on foot; there did we rejoice thereof.
column3: He turned the sea into dry land * so that they went through the water on foot; there did we rejoice thereof.

column2: 7 He ruleth with his power for ever; his eyes behold the people * and such as will not believe shall not be able to exalt themselves.
column3: He ruleth with his power for ever; his eyes behold the people * and such as will not believe shall not be able to exalt themselves.

column2: 8 O praise our God, ye people * and make the voice of his praise to be heard;
column3: O praise our God, ye people * and make the voice of his praise to be heard;

column2: 9 Who holdeth our soul in life * and suffereth not our feet to slip.
column3: Who holdeth our soul in life * and suffereth not our feet to slip.

column2: 10 For thou, O God, hast proved us * thou also hast tried us, like as silver is tried.
column3: For thou, O God, hast proved us * thou also hast tried us, like as silver is tried.

column2: 11 Thou broughtest us into the snare * and laidest trouble upon our loins.
column3: Thou broughtest us into the snare * and laidest trouble upon our loins.

column2: 12 Thou sufferedst men to ride over our heads * we went through fire and water, and thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.
column3: Thou sufferedst men to ride over our heads * we went through fire and water, and thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

column2: 13 I will go into thine house with burnt-offerings * and will pay thee my vows,
column3: I will go into thine house with burnt-offerings * and will pay thee my vows,

column2: 14 which I promised with my lips, and spake with my mouth * when I was in trouble.
column3: which I promised with my lips, and spake with my mouth * when I was in trouble.

column2: 15 I will offer unto thee fat burnt-sacrifices, with the incense of rams * I will offer bullocks and goats.
column3: I will offer unto thee fat burnt-sacrifices, with the incense of rams * I will offer bullocks and goats.

column2: 16 O come hither, and hearken, all ye that fear God * and I will tell you what he hath done for my soul.
column3: O come hither, and hearken, all ye that fear God * and I will tell you what he hath done for my soul.

column2: 17 I called unto him with my mouth * and gave him praises with my tongue.
column3: I called unto him with my mouth * and gave him praises with my tongue.

column2: 18 If I incline unto wickedness with mine heart * the Lord will not hear me.
column3: If I incline unto wickedness with mine heart * the Lord will not hear me.

column2: 19 But God hath heard me * and considered the voice of my prayer.
column3: But God hath heard me * and considered the voice of my prayer.

column2: 20 Praised be God, who hath not cast out my prayer * nor turned his mercy from me.
column3: Praised be God, who hath not cast out my prayer * nor turned his mercy from me.

column2: Psalm 67. Deus misereatur.
column3: Psalm 67. Deus misereatur.

column2: 1 GOD be merciful unto us, and bless us * and shew us the light of his countenance, and be merciful unto us:
column3: GOD be merciful unto us, and bless us * and shew us the light of his countenance, and be merciful unto us:

column2: 2 That thy way may be known upon earth * thy saving health among all nations.
column3: That thy way may be known upon earth * thy saving health among all nations.

column2: 3 Let the people praise thee, O God * yea, let all the people praise thee.
column3: Let the people praise thee, O God * yea, let all the people praise thee.

column2: 4 O let the nations rejoice and be glad * for thou shalt judge the folk righteously, and govern the nations upon earth.
column3: O let the nations rejoice and be glad * for thou shalt judge the folk righteously, and govern the nations upon earth.

column2: 5 Let the people praise thee, O God * let all the people praise thee.
column3: Let the people praise thee, O God * let all the people praise thee.

column2: 6 Then shall the earth bring forth her increase * and God, even our own God, shall give us his blessing.
column3: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase * and God, even our own God, shall give us his blessing.

column2: 7 God shall bless us * and all the ends of the world shall fear him.
column3: God shall bless us * and all the ends of the world shall fear him.

column2: Psalm 68. Exurgat Deus.
column3: Psalm 68. Exurgat Deus.

column2: 1 LET God arise, and let his enemies be scattered * let them also that hate him flee before him.
column3: LET God arise, and let his enemies be scattered * let them also that hate him flee before him.

column2: 2 Like as the smoke vanisheth, so shalt thou drive them away * and like as wax melteth at the fire, so let the ungodly perish at the presence of God.
column3: Like as the smoke vanisheth, so shalt thou drive them away * and like as wax melteth at the fire, so let the ungodly perish at the presence of God.

column2: 3 But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God * let them also be merry and joyful.
column3: But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God * let them also be merry and joyful.

column2: 4 O sing unto God, and sing praises unto his Name * magnify him that rideth upon the heavens, as it were upon an horse; praise him in his Name JAH, and rejoice before him.
column3: O sing unto God, and sing praises unto his Name * magnify him that rideth upon the heavens, as it were upon an horse; praise him in his Name JAH, and rejoice before him.

column2: 5 He is a father of the fatherless, and defendeth the cause of the widows * even God in his holy habitation.
column3: He is a father of the fatherless, and defendeth the cause of the widows * even God in his holy habitation.

column2: 6 He is the God that maketh men to be of one mind in an house, and bringeth the prisoners out of captivity * but letteth the runagates continue in scarceness.
column3: He is the God that maketh men to be of one mind in an house, and bringeth the prisoners out of captivity * but letteth the runagates continue in scarceness.

column2: 7 O God, when thou wentest forth before the people * when thou wentest through the wilderness;
column3: O God, when thou wentest forth before the people * when thou wentest through the wilderness;

column2: 8 The earth shook, and the heavens dropped at the presence of God * even as Sinai also was moved at the presence of God, who is the God of Israel.
column3: The earth shook, and the heavens dropped at the presence of God * even as Sinai also was moved at the presence of God, who is the God of Israel.

column2: 9 Thou, O God, sentest a gracious rain upon thine inheritance * and refreshedst it when it was weary.
column3: Thou, O God, sentest a gracious rain upon thine inheritance * and refreshedst it when it was weary.

column2: 10 Thy congregation shall dwell therein * for thou, O God, hast of thy goodness prepared for the poor.
column3: Thy congregation shall dwell therein * for thou, O God, hast of thy goodness prepared for the poor.

column2: 11 The Lord gave the word * great was the company of the preachers.
column3: The Lord gave the word * great was the company of the preachers.

column2: 12 Kings with their armies did flee, and were discomfited * and they of the household divided the spoil.
column3: Kings with their armies did flee, and were discomfited * and they of the household divided the spoil.

column2: 13 Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove * that is covered with silver wings, and her feathers like gold.
column3: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove * that is covered with silver wings, and her feathers like gold.

column2: 14 When the Almighty scattered kings for their sake * then were they as white as snow in Salmon.
column3: When the Almighty scattered kings for their sake * then were they as white as snow in Salmon.

column2: 15 As the hill of Basan, so is God's hill * even an high hill, as the hill of Basan.
column3: As the hill of Basan, so is God's hill * even an high hill, as the hill of Basan.

column2: 16 Why hop ye so, ye high hills? this is God's hill, in the which it pleaseth him to dwell * yea, the Lord will abide in it for ever.
column3: Why hop ye so, ye high hills? this is God's hill, in the which it pleaseth him to dwell * yea, the Lord will abide in it for ever.

column2: 17 The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels * and the Lord is among them, as in the holy place of Sinai.
column3: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels * and the Lord is among them, as in the holy place of Sinai.

column2: 18 Thou art gone up on high, thou hast led captivity captive, and received gifts for men * yea, even for thine enemies, that the Lord God might dwell among them.
column3: Thou art gone up on high, thou hast led captivity captive, and received gifts for men * yea, even for thine enemies, that the Lord God might dwell among them.

column2: 19 Praised be the Lord daily * even the God who helpeth us, and poureth his benefits upon us.
column3: Praised be the Lord daily * even the God who helpeth us, and poureth his benefits upon us.

column2: 20 He is our God, even the God of whom cometh salvation * God is the Lord, by whom we escape death.
column3: He is our God, even the God of whom cometh salvation * God is the Lord, by whom we escape death.

column2: 21 God shall wound the head of his enemies * and the hairy scalp of such a one as goeth on still in his wickedness.
column3: God shall wound the head of his enemies * and the hairy scalp of such a one as goeth on still in his wickedness.

column2: 22 The Lord hath said, I will bring my people again, as I did from Basan * mine own will I bring again, as I did sometime from the deep of the sea.
column3: The Lord hath said, I will bring my people again, as I did from Basan * mine own will I bring again, as I did sometime from the deep of the sea.

column2: 23 That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies * and that the tongue of thy dogs may be red through the same.
column3: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies * and that the tongue of thy dogs may be red through the same.

column2: 24 It is well seen, O God, how thou goest * how thou, my God and King, goest in the sanctuary.
column3: It is well seen, O God, how thou goest * how thou, my God and King, goest in the sanctuary.

column2: 25 The singers go before, the minstrels follow after * in the midst are the damsels playing with the timbrels.
column3: The singers go before, the minstrels follow after * in the midst are the damsels playing with the timbrels.

column2: 26 Give thanks, O Israel, unto God the Lord in the congregations * from the ground of the heart.
column3: Give thanks, O Israel, unto God the Lord in the congregations * from the ground of the heart.

column2: 27 There is little Benjamin their ruler, and the princes of Judah their counsel * the princes of Zabulon, and the princes of Nephthali.
column3: There is little Benjamin their ruler, and the princes of Judah their counsel * the princes of Zabulon, and the princes of Nephthali.

column2: 28 Thy God hath sent forth strength for thee * stablish the thing, O God, that thou hast wrought in us,
column3: Thy God hath sent forth strength for thee * stablish the thing, O God, that thou hast wrought in us,

column2: 29 For thy temple's sake at Jerusalem * so shall kings bring presents unto thee.
column3: For thy temple's sake at Jerusalem * so shall kings bring presents unto thee.

column2: 30 When the company of the spear-men, and multitude of the mighty are scattered abroad among the beasts of the people, so that they humbly bring pieces of silver * and when he hath scattered the people that delight in war;
column3: When the company of the spear-men, and multitude of the mighty are scattered abroad among the beasts of the people, so that they humbly bring pieces of silver * and when he hath scattered the people that delight in war;

column2: 31 Then shall the princes come out of Eqypt * the Morians' land shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.
column3: Then shall the princes come out of Eqypt * the Morians' land shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.

column2: 32 Sing unto God, O ye kingdoms of the earth * O sing praises unto the Lord;
column3: Sing unto God, O ye kingdoms of the earth * O sing praises unto the Lord;

column2: 33 Who sitteth in the heavens over all from the beginning * lo, he doth send out his voice, yea, and that a mighty voice.
column3: Who sitteth in the heavens over all from the beginning * lo, he doth send out his voice, yea, and that a mighty voice.

column2: 34 Ascribe ye the power to God over Israel * his worship and strength is in the clouds.
column3: Ascribe ye the power to God over Israel * his worship and strength is in the clouds.

column2: 35 O God, wonderful art thou in thy holy places * even the God of Israel, he will give strength and power unto his people; blessed be God.
column3: O God, wonderful art thou in thy holy places * even the God of Israel, he will give strength and power unto his people; blessed be God.

column2: Psalm 69. Salvum me fac.
column3: Psalm 69. Salvum me fac.

column2: 1 SAVE me, O God * for the waters are come in, even unto my soul.
column3: SAVE me, O God * for the waters are come in, even unto my soul.

column2: 2 I stick fast in the deep mire, where no ground is * I am come into deep waters, so that the floods run over me.
column3: I stick fast in the deep mire, where no ground is * I am come into deep waters, so that the floods run over me.

column2: 3 I am weary of crying; my throat is dry * my sight faileth me for waiting so long upon my God.
column3: I am weary of crying; my throat is dry * my sight faileth me for waiting so long upon my God.

column2: 4 They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head * they that are mine enemies, and would destroy me guiltless, are mighty.
column3: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head * they that are mine enemies, and would destroy me guiltless, are mighty.

column2: 5 I paid them the things that I never took * God, thou knowest my simpleness, and my faults are not hid from thee.
column3: I paid them the things that I never took * God, thou knowest my simpleness, and my faults are not hid from thee.

column2: 6 Let not them that trust in thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my cause * let not those that seek thee be confounded through me, O Lord God of Israel.
column3: Let not them that trust in thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my cause * let not those that seek thee be confounded through me, O Lord God of Israel.

column2: 7 And why? for thy sake have I suffered reproof * shame hath covered my face.
column3: And why? for thy sake have I suffered reproof * shame hath covered my face.

column2: 8 I am become a stranger unto my brethren * even an alien unto my mother's children.
column3: I am become a stranger unto my brethren * even an alien unto my mother's children.

column2: 9 For the zeal of thine house hath even eaten me * and the rebukes of them that rebuked thee are fallen upon me.
column3: For the zeal of thine house hath even eaten me * and the rebukes of them that rebuked thee are fallen upon me.

column2: 10 I wept, and chastened myself with fasting * and that was turned to my reproof.
column3: I wept, and chastened myself with fasting * and that was turned to my reproof.

column2: 11 I put on sackcloth also * and they jested upon me.
column3: I put on sackcloth also * and they jested upon me.

column2: 12 They that sit in the gate speak against me * and the drunkards make songs upon me.
column3: They that sit in the gate speak against me * and the drunkards make songs upon me.

column2: 13 But, Lord, I make my prayer unto thee * in an acceptable time.
column3: But, Lord, I make my prayer unto thee * in an acceptable time.

column2: 14 Hear me, O God, in the multitude of thy mercy * even in the truth of thy salvation.
column3: Hear me, O God, in the multitude of thy mercy * even in the truth of thy salvation.

column2: 15 Take me out of the mire, that I sink not * O let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
column3: Take me out of the mire, that I sink not * O let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

column2: 16 Let not the water-flood drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up * and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
column3: Let not the water-flood drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up * and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

column2: 17 Hear me, O Lord, for thy loving-kindness is comfortable * turn thee unto me according to the multitude of thy mercies.
column3: Hear me, O Lord, for thy loving-kindness is comfortable * turn thee unto me according to the multitude of thy mercies.

column2: 18 And hide not thy face from thy servant, for I am in trouble * O haste thee, and hear me.
column3: And hide not thy face from thy servant, for I am in trouble * O haste thee, and hear me.

column2: 19 Draw nigh unto my soul, and save it * O deliver me, because of mine enemies.
column3: Draw nigh unto my soul, and save it * O deliver me, because of mine enemies.

column2: 20 Thou hast known my reproof, my shame, and my dishonour * mine adversaries are all in thy sight.
column3: Thou hast known my reproof, my shame, and my dishonour * mine adversaries are all in thy sight.

column2: 21 Thy rebuke hath broken my heart; I am full of heaviness * I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was no man, neither found I any to comfort me.
column3: Thy rebuke hath broken my heart; I am full of heaviness * I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was no man, neither found I any to comfort me.

column2: 22 They gave me gall to eat * and when I was thirsty they gave me vinegar to drink.
column3: They gave me gall to eat * and when I was thirsty they gave me vinegar to drink.

column2: 23 Let their table be made a snare to take themselves withal * and let the things that should have been for their wealth be unto them an occasion of falling.
column3: Let their table be made a snare to take themselves withal * and let the things that should have been for their wealth be unto them an occasion of falling.

column2: 24 Let their eyes be blinded, that they see not * and ever bow thou down their backs.
column3: Let their eyes be blinded, that they see not * and ever bow thou down their backs.

column2: 25 Pour out thine indignation upon them * and let thy wrathful displeasure take hold of them.
column3: Pour out thine indignation upon them * and let thy wrathful displeasure take hold of them.

column2: 26 Let their habitation be void * and no man to dwell in their tents.
