column3: Let their habitation be void * and no man to dwell in their tents.

column2: 27 For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten * and they talk how they may vex them whom thou hast wounded.
column3: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten * and they talk how they may vex them whom thou hast wounded.

column2: 28 Let them fall from one wickedness to another * and not come into thy righteousness.
column3: Let them fall from one wickedness to another * and not come into thy righteousness.

column2: 29 Let them be wiped out of the book of the living * and not be written among the righteous.
column3: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living * and not be written among the righteous.

column2: 30 As for me, when I am poor and in heaviness * thy help, O God, shall lift me up.
column3: As for me, when I am poor and in heaviness * thy help, O God, shall lift me up.

column2: 31 I will praise the Name of God with a song * and magnify it with thanksgiving.
column3: I will praise the Name of God with a song * and magnify it with thanksgiving.

column2: 32 This also shall please the Lord * better than a bullock that hath horns and hoofs.
column3: This also shall please the Lord * better than a bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

column2: 33 The humble shall consider this, and be glad * seek ye after God, and your soul shall live.
column3: The humble shall consider this, and be glad * seek ye after God, and your soul shall live.

column2: 34 For the Lord heareth the poor * and despiseth not his prisoners.
column3: For the Lord heareth the poor * and despiseth not his prisoners.

column2: 35 Let heaven and earth praise him * the sea, and all that moveth therein.
column3: Let heaven and earth praise him * the sea, and all that moveth therein.

column2: 36 For God will save Sion, and build the cities of Judah * that men may dwell there, and have it in possession.
column3: For God will save Sion, and build the cities of Judah * that men may dwell there, and have it in possession.

column2: 37 The posterity also of his servants shall inherit it * and they that love his Name shall dwell therein.
column3: The posterity also of his servants shall inherit it * and they that love his Name shall dwell therein.

column2: Psalm 70. Deus, in adjutorium.
column3: Psalm 70. Deus, in adjutorium.

column2: 1 HASTE thee, O God, to deliver me * make haste to help me, O Lord.
column3: HASTE thee, O God, to deliver me * make haste to help me, O Lord.

column2: 2 Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul * let them be turned backward and put to confusion that wish me evil.
column3: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul * let them be turned backward and put to confusion that wish me evil.

column2: 3 Let them for their reward be soon brought to shame * that cry over me, There, there.
column3: Let them for their reward be soon brought to shame * that cry over me, There, there.

column2: 4 But let all those that seek thee be joyful and glad in thee * and let all such as delight in thy salvation say alway, The Lord be praised.
column3: But let all those that seek thee be joyful and glad in thee * and let all such as delight in thy salvation say alway, The Lord be praised.

column2: 5 As for me, I am poor and in misery * haste thee unto me, O God.
column3: As for me, I am poor and in misery * haste thee unto me, O God.

column2: 6 Thou art my helper and my redeemer * O Lord, make no long tarrying.
column3: Thou art my helper and my redeemer * O Lord, make no long tarrying.

column2: Psalm 71. In te, Domine, speravi.
column3: Psalm 71. In te, Domine, speravi.

column2: 1 IN THEE, O Lord, have I put my trust, let me never be put to confusion * but rid me and deliver me in thy righteousness, incline thine ear unto me, and save me.
column3: IN THEE, O Lord, have I put my trust, let me never be put to confusion * but rid me and deliver me in thy righteousness, incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

column2: 2 Be thou my strong hold, whereunto I may alway resort * thou hast promised to help me, for thou art my house of defence and my castle.
column3: Be thou my strong hold, whereunto I may alway resort * thou hast promised to help me, for thou art my house of defence and my castle.

column2: 3 Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the ungodly * out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
column3: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the ungodly * out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

column2: 4 For thou, O Lord God, art the thing that I long for * thou art my hope, even from my youth.
column3: For thou, O Lord God, art the thing that I long for * thou art my hope, even from my youth.

column2: 5 Through thee have I been holden up ever since I was born * thou art he that took me out of my mother's womb; my praise shall be always of thee.
column3: Through thee have I been holden up ever since I was born * thou art he that took me out of my mother's womb; my praise shall be always of thee.

column2: 6 I am become as it were a monster unto many * but my sure trust is in thee.
column3: I am become as it were a monster unto many * but my sure trust is in thee.

column2: 7 O let my mouth be filled with thy praise * that I may sing of thy glory and honour all the day long.
column3: O let my mouth be filled with thy praise * that I may sing of thy glory and honour all the day long.

column2: 8 Cast me not away in the time of age * forsake me not when my strength faileth me.
column3: Cast me not away in the time of age * forsake me not when my strength faileth me.

column2: 9 For mine enemies speak against me, and they that lay wait for my soul take their counsel together, saying * God hath forsaken him; persecute him, and take him, for there is none to deliver him.
column3: For mine enemies speak against me, and they that lay wait for my soul take their counsel together, saying * God hath forsaken him; persecute him, and take him, for there is none to deliver him.

column2: 10 Go not far from me, O God * my God, haste thee to help me.
column3: Go not far from me, O God * my God, haste thee to help me.

column2: 11 Let them be confounded and perish that are against my soul * let them be covered with shame and dishonour that seek to do me evil.
column3: Let them be confounded and perish that are against my soul * let them be covered with shame and dishonour that seek to do me evil.

column2: 12 As for me, I will patiently abide alway * and will praise thee more and more.
column3: As for me, I will patiently abide alway * and will praise thee more and more.

column2: 13 My mouth shall daily speak of thy righteousness and salvation * for I know no end thereof.
column3: My mouth shall daily speak of thy righteousness and salvation * for I know no end thereof.

column2: 14 I will go forth in the strength of the Lord God * and will make mention of thy righteousness only.
column3: I will go forth in the strength of the Lord God * and will make mention of thy righteousness only.

column2: 15 Thou, O God, hast taught me from my youth up until now * therefore will I tell of thy wondrous works.
column3: Thou, O God, hast taught me from my youth up until now * therefore will I tell of thy wondrous works.

column2: 16 Forsake me not, O God, in mine old age, when I am gray-headed * until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to all them that are yet for to come.
column3: Forsake me not, O God, in mine old age, when I am gray-headed * until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to all them that are yet for to come.

column2: 17 Thy righteousness, O God, is very high * and great things are they that thou hast done; O God, who is like unto thee?
column3: Thy righteousness, O God, is very high * and great things are they that thou hast done; O God, who is like unto thee?

column2: 18 O what great troubles and adversities hast thou shewed me, and yet didst thou turn and refresh me * yea, and broughtest me from the deep of the earth again.
column3: O what great troubles and adversities hast thou shewed me, and yet didst thou turn and refresh me * yea, and broughtest me from the deep of the earth again.

column2: 19 Thou hast brought me to great honour * and comforted me on every side.
column3: Thou hast brought me to great honour * and comforted me on every side.

column2: 20 Therefore will I praise thee and thy faithfulness, O God, playing upon an instrument of musick * unto thee will I sing upon the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.
column3: Therefore will I praise thee and thy faithfulness, O God, playing upon an instrument of musick * unto thee will I sing upon the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.

column2: 21 My lips will be fain when I sing unto thee * and so will my soul whom thou hast delivered.
column3: My lips will be fain when I sing unto thee * and so will my soul whom thou hast delivered.

column2: 22 My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long * for they are confounded and brought unto shame that seek to do me evil.
column3: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long * for they are confounded and brought unto shame that seek to do me evil.

column2: Psalm 72. Deus, judicium.
column3: Psalm 72. Deus, judicium.

column2: 1 GIVE the King thy judgements, O God * and thy righteousness unto the King's son.
column3: GIVE the King thy judgements, O God * and thy righteousness unto the King's son.

column2: 2 Then shall he judge thy people according unto right * and defend the poor.
column3: Then shall he judge thy people according unto right * and defend the poor.

column2: 3 The mountains also shall bring peace * and the little hills righteousness unto the people.
column3: The mountains also shall bring peace * and the little hills righteousness unto the people.

column2: 4 He shall keep the simple folk by their right * defend the children of the poor, and punish the wrong-doer.
column3: He shall keep the simple folk by their right * defend the children of the poor, and punish the wrong-doer.

column2: 5 They shall fear thee, as long as the sun and moon endureth * from one generation to another.
column3: They shall fear thee, as long as the sun and moon endureth * from one generation to another.

column2: 6 He shall come down like the rain into a fleece of wool * even as the drops that water the earth.
column3: He shall come down like the rain into a fleece of wool * even as the drops that water the earth.

column2: 7 In his time shall the righteous flourish * yea, and abundance of peace, so long as the moon endureth.
column3: In his time shall the righteous flourish * yea, and abundance of peace, so long as the moon endureth.

column2: 8 His dominion shall be also from the one sea to the other * and from the flood unto the world's end.
column3: His dominion shall be also from the one sea to the other * and from the flood unto the world's end.

column2: 9 They that dwell in the wilderness shall kneel before him * his enemies shall lick the dust.
column3: They that dwell in the wilderness shall kneel before him * his enemies shall lick the dust.

column2: 10 The kings of Tharsis and of the isles shall give presents * the kings of Arabia and Saba shall bring gifts.
column3: The kings of Tharsis and of the isles shall give presents * the kings of Arabia and Saba shall bring gifts.

column2: 11 All kings shall fall down before him * all nations shall do him service.
column3: All kings shall fall down before him * all nations shall do him service.

column2: 12 For he shall deliver the poor when he crieth * the needy also, and him that hath no helper.
column3: For he shall deliver the poor when he crieth * the needy also, and him that hath no helper.

column2: 13 He shall be favourable to the simple and needy * and shall preserve the souls of the poor.
column3: He shall be favourable to the simple and needy * and shall preserve the souls of the poor.

column2: 14 He shall deliver their souls from falsehood and wrong * and dear shall their blood be in his sight.
column3: He shall deliver their souls from falsehood and wrong * and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

column2: 15 He shall live, and unto him shall be given of the gold of Arabia * prayer shall be made ever unto him, and daily shall he be praised.
column3: He shall live, and unto him shall be given of the gold of Arabia * prayer shall be made ever unto him, and daily shall he be praised.

column2: 16 There shall be an heap of corn in the earth, high upon the hills * his fruit shall shake like Libanus, and shall be green in the city like grass upon the earth.
column3: There shall be an heap of corn in the earth, high upon the hills * his fruit shall shake like Libanus, and shall be green in the city like grass upon the earth.

column2: 17 His Name shall endure for ever; his Name shall remain under the sun among the posterities * which shall be blessed through him; and all the heathen shall praise him.
column3: His Name shall endure for ever; his Name shall remain under the sun among the posterities * which shall be blessed through him; and all the heathen shall praise him.

column2: 18 Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel * which only doeth wondrous things;
column3: Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel * which only doeth wondrous things;

column2: 19 And blessed be the Name of his majesty for ever * and all the earth shall be filled with his majesty. Amen, Amen.
column3: And blessed be the Name of his majesty for ever * and all the earth shall be filled with his majesty. Amen, Amen.

column2: Psalm 73. Quam bonus Israel!
column3: Psalm 73. Quam bonus Israel!

column2: 1 TRULY God is loving unto Israel * even unto such as are of a clean heart.
column3: TRULY God is loving unto Israel * even unto such as are of a clean heart.

column2: 2 Nevertheless, my feet were almost gone * my treadings had well-nigh slipt.
column3: Nevertheless, my feet were almost gone * my treadings had well-nigh slipt.

column2: 3 And why? I was grieved at the wicked * I do also see the ungodly in such prosperity.
column3: And why? I was grieved at the wicked * I do also see the ungodly in such prosperity.

column2: 4 For they are in no peril of death * but are lusty and strong.
column3: For they are in no peril of death * but are lusty and strong.

column2: 5 They come in no misfortune like other folk * neither are they plagued like other men.
column3: They come in no misfortune like other folk * neither are they plagued like other men.

column2: 6 And this is the cause that they are so holden with pride * and overwhelmed with cruelty.
column3: And this is the cause that they are so holden with pride * and overwhelmed with cruelty.

column2: 7 Their eyes swell with fatness * and they do even what they lust.
column3: Their eyes swell with fatness * and they do even what they lust.

column2: 8 They corrupt other, and speak of wicked blasphemy * their talking is against the most High.
column3: They corrupt other, and speak of wicked blasphemy * their talking is against the most High.

column2: 9 For they stretch forth their mouth unto the heaven * and their tongue goeth through the world.
column3: For they stretch forth their mouth unto the heaven * and their tongue goeth through the world.

column2: 10 Therefore fall the people unto them * and thereout suck they no small advantage.
column3: Therefore fall the people unto them * and thereout suck they no small advantage.

column2: 11 Tush, say they, how should God perceive it * is there knowledge in the most High?
column3: Tush, say they, how should God perceive it * is there knowledge in the most High?

column2: 12 Lo, these are the ungodly, these prosper in the world, and these have riches in possession * and I said, Then have I cleansed my heart in vain, and washed mine hands in innocency.
column3: Lo, these are the ungodly, these prosper in the world, and these have riches in possession * and I said, Then have I cleansed my heart in vain, and washed mine hands in innocency.

column2: 13 All the day long have I been punished * and chastened every morning.
column3: All the day long have I been punished * and chastened every morning.

column2: 14 Yea, and I had almost said even as they * but lo, then I should have condemned the generation of thy children.
column3: Yea, and I had almost said even as they * but lo, then I should have condemned the generation of thy children.

column2: 15 Then thought I to understand this * but it was too hard for me,
column3: Then thought I to understand this * but it was too hard for me,

column2: 16 Until I went into the sanctuary of God * then understood I the end of these men;
column3: Until I went into the sanctuary of God * then understood I the end of these men;

column2: 17 Namely, how thou dost set them in slippery places * and castest them down, and destroyest them.
column3: Namely, how thou dost set them in slippery places * and castest them down, and destroyest them.

column2: 18 O how suddenly do they consume * perish, and come to a fearful end!
column3: O how suddenly do they consume * perish, and come to a fearful end!

column2: 19 Yea, even like as a dream when one awaketh * so shalt thou make their image to vanish out of the city.
column3: Yea, even like as a dream when one awaketh * so shalt thou make their image to vanish out of the city.

column2: 20 Thus my heart was grieved * and it went even through my reins.
column3: Thus my heart was grieved * and it went even through my reins.

column2: 21 So foolish was I, and ignorant * even as it were a beast before thee.
column3: So foolish was I, and ignorant * even as it were a beast before thee.

column2: 22 Nevertheless, I am alway by thee * for thou hast holden me by my right hand.
column3: Nevertheless, I am alway by thee * for thou hast holden me by my right hand.

column2: 23 Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel * and after that receive me with glory.
column3: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel * and after that receive me with glory.

column2: 24 Whom have I in heaven but thee * and there is none upon earth that I desire in comparison of thee.
column3: Whom have I in heaven but thee * and there is none upon earth that I desire in comparison of thee.

column2: 25 My flesh and my heart faileth * but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
column3: My flesh and my heart faileth * but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

column2: 26 For lo, they that forsake thee shall perish * thou hast destroyed all them that commit fornication against thee.
column3: For lo, they that forsake thee shall perish * thou hast destroyed all them that commit fornication against thee.

column2: 27 But it is good for me to hold me fast by God, to put my trust in the Lord God * and to speak of all thy works in the gates of the daughter of Sion.
column3: But it is good for me to hold me fast by God, to put my trust in the Lord God * and to speak of all thy works in the gates of the daughter of Sion.

column2: Psalm 74. Ut quid, Deus?
column3: Psalm 74. Ut quid, Deus?

column2: 1 O GOD, wherefore art thou absent from us so long * why is thy wrath so hot against the sheep of thy pasture?
column3: O GOD, wherefore art thou absent from us so long * why is thy wrath so hot against the sheep of thy pasture?

column2: 2 O think upon thy congregation * whom thou hast purchased and redeemed of old.
column3: O think upon thy congregation * whom thou hast purchased and redeemed of old.

column2: 3 Think upon the tribe of thine inheritance * and mount Sion, wherein thou hast dwelt.
column3: Think upon the tribe of thine inheritance * and mount Sion, wherein thou hast dwelt.

column2: 4 Lift up thy feet, that thou mayest utterly destroy every enemy * which hath done evil in thy sanctuary.
column3: Lift up thy feet, that thou mayest utterly destroy every enemy * which hath done evil in thy sanctuary.

column2: 5 Thine adversaries roar in the midst of thy congregations * and set up their banners for tokens.
column3: Thine adversaries roar in the midst of thy congregations * and set up their banners for tokens.

column2: 6 He that hewed timber afore out of the thick trees * was known to bring it to an excellent work.
column3: He that hewed timber afore out of the thick trees * was known to bring it to an excellent work.

column2: 7 But now they break down all the carved work thereof * with axes and hammers.
column3: But now they break down all the carved work thereof * with axes and hammers.

column2: 8 They have set fire upon thy holy places * and have defiled the dwelling-place of thy Name, even unto the ground.
column3: They have set fire upon thy holy places * and have defiled the dwelling-place of thy Name, even unto the ground.

column2: 9 Yea, they said in their hearts, Let us make havock of them altogether * thus have they burnt up all the houses of God in the land.
column3: Yea, they said in their hearts, Let us make havock of them altogether * thus have they burnt up all the houses of God in the land.

column2: 10 We see not our tokens, there is not one prophet more * no, not one is there among us, that understandeth any more.
column3: We see not our tokens, there is not one prophet more * no, not one is there among us, that understandeth any more.

column2: 11 O God, how long shall the adversary do this dishonour * how long shall the enemy blaspheme thy Name, for ever?
column3: O God, how long shall the adversary do this dishonour * how long shall the enemy blaspheme thy Name, for ever?

column2: 12 Why withdrawest thou thy hand * why pluckest thou not thy right hand out of thy bosom to consume the enemy?
column3: Why withdrawest thou thy hand * why pluckest thou not thy right hand out of thy bosom to consume the enemy?

column2: 13 For God is my King of old * the help that is done upon earth he doeth it himself.
column3: For God is my King of old * the help that is done upon earth he doeth it himself.

column2: 14 Thou didst divide the sea through thy power * thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
column3: Thou didst divide the sea through thy power * thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.

column2: 15 Thou smotest the heads of Leviathan in pieces * and gavest him to be meat for the people in the wilderness.
column3: Thou smotest the heads of Leviathan in pieces * and gavest him to be meat for the people in the wilderness.

column2: 16 Thou broughtest out fountains and waters out of the hard rocks * thou driedst up mighty waters.
column3: Thou broughtest out fountains and waters out of the hard rocks * thou driedst up mighty waters.

column2: 17 The day is thine, and the night is thine * thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
column3: The day is thine, and the night is thine * thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

column2: 18 Thou hast set all the borders of the earth * thou hast made summer and winter.
column3: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth * thou hast made summer and winter.

column2: 19 Remember this, O Lord, how the enemy hath rebuked * and how the foolish people hath blasphemed thy Name.
column3: Remember this, O Lord, how the enemy hath rebuked * and how the foolish people hath blasphemed thy Name.

column2: 20 O deliver not the soul of thy turtle-dove unto the multitude of the enemies * and forget not the congregation of the poor for ever.
column3: O deliver not the soul of thy turtle-dove unto the multitude of the enemies * and forget not the congregation of the poor for ever.

column2: 21 Look upon the covenant * for all the earth is full of darkness and cruel habitations.
column3: Look upon the covenant * for all the earth is full of darkness and cruel habitations.

column2: 22 O let not the simple go away ashamed * but let the poor and needy give praise unto thy Name.
column3: O let not the simple go away ashamed * but let the poor and needy give praise unto thy Name.

column2: 23 Arise, O God, maintain thine own cause * remember how the foolish man blasphemeth thee daily.
column3: Arise, O God, maintain thine own cause * remember how the foolish man blasphemeth thee daily.

column2: 24 Forget not the voice of thine enemies * the presumption of them that hate thee increaseth ever more and more.
column3: Forget not the voice of thine enemies * the presumption of them that hate thee increaseth ever more and more.

column2: Psalm 75. Confitebimur tibi.
column3: Psalm 75. Confitebimur tibi.

column2: 1 UNTO thee, O God, do we give thanks * yea, unto thee do we give thanks.
column3: UNTO thee, O God, do we give thanks * yea, unto thee do we give thanks.

column2: 2 Thy Name also is so nigh * and that do thy wondrous works declare.
column3: Thy Name also is so nigh * and that do thy wondrous works declare.

column2: 3 When I receive the congregation * I shall judge according unto right.
column3: When I receive the congregation * I shall judge according unto right.

column2: 4 The earth is weak, and all the inhabiters thereof * I bear up the pillars of it.
column3: The earth is weak, and all the inhabiters thereof * I bear up the pillars of it.

column2: 5 I said unto the fools, Deal not so madly * and to the ungodly, Set not up your horn.
column3: I said unto the fools, Deal not so madly * and to the ungodly, Set not up your horn.

column2: 6 Set not up your horn on high * and speak not with a stiff neck.
column3: Set not up your horn on high * and speak not with a stiff neck.

column2: 7 For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west * nor yet from the south.
column3: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west * nor yet from the south.

column2: 8 And why? God is the Judge * he putteth down one, and setteth up another.
column3: And why? God is the Judge * he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

column2: 9 For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, and the wine is red * it is full mixed, and he poureth out of the same.
column3: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, and the wine is red * it is full mixed, and he poureth out of the same.

column2: 10 As for the dregs thereof * all the ungodly of the earth shall drink them, and suck them out.
column3: As for the dregs thereof * all the ungodly of the earth shall drink them, and suck them out.

column2: 11 But I will talk of the God of Jacob * and praise him for ever.
column3: But I will talk of the God of Jacob * and praise him for ever.

column2: 12 All the horns of the ungodly also will I break * and the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
column3: All the horns of the ungodly also will I break * and the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

column2: Psalm 76. Notus in Judaea.
column3: Psalm 76. Notus in Judaea.

column2: 1 IN JEWRY is God known * his Name is great in Israel.
column3: IN JEWRY is God known * his Name is great in Israel.

column2: 2 At Salem is his tabernacle * and his dwelling in Sion.
column3: At Salem is his tabernacle * and his dwelling in Sion.

column2: 3 There brake he the arrows of the bow * the shield, the sword, and the battle.
column3: There brake he the arrows of the bow * the shield, the sword, and the battle.

column2: 4 Thou art of more honour and might * than the hills of the robbers.
column3: Thou art of more honour and might * than the hills of the robbers.

column2: 5 The proud are robbed, they have slept their sleep * and all the men whose hands were mighty have found nothing.
column3: The proud are robbed, they have slept their sleep * and all the men whose hands were mighty have found nothing.

column2: 6 At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob * both the chariot and horse are fallen.
column3: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob * both the chariot and horse are fallen.

column2: 7 Thou, even thou art to be feared * and who may stand in thy sight when thou art angry?
column3: Thou, even thou art to be feared * and who may stand in thy sight when thou art angry?

column2: 8 Thou didst cause thy judgement to be heard from heaven * the earth trembled, and was still;
column3: Thou didst cause thy judgement to be heard from heaven * the earth trembled, and was still;

column2: 9 When God arose to judgement * and to help all the meek upon earth.
column3: When God arose to judgement * and to help all the meek upon earth.

column2: 10 The fierceness of man shall turn to thy praise * and the fierceness of them shalt thou refrain.
column3: The fierceness of man shall turn to thy praise * and the fierceness of them shalt thou refrain.

column2: 11 Promise unto the Lord your God, and keep it, all ye that are round about him * bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.
column3: Promise unto the Lord your God, and keep it, all ye that are round about him * bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.

column2: 12 He shall refrain the spirit of princes * and is wonderful among the kings of the earth.
column3: He shall refrain the spirit of princes * and is wonderful among the kings of the earth.

column2: Psalm 77. Voce mea ad Dominum.
column3: Psalm 77. Voce mea ad Dominum.

column2: 1 I WILL cry unto God with my voice * even unto God will I cry with my voice, and he shall hearken unto me.
column3: I WILL cry unto God with my voice * even unto God will I cry with my voice, and he shall hearken unto me.

column2: 2 In the time of my trouble I sought the Lord * my sore ran and ceased not in the night-season ; my soul refused comfort.
column3: In the time of my trouble I sought the Lord * my sore ran and ceased not in the night-season ; my soul refused comfort.

column2: 3 When I am in heaviness, I will think upon God * when my heart is vexed, I will complain.
column3: When I am in heaviness, I will think upon God * when my heart is vexed, I will complain.

column2: 4 Thou holdest mine eyes waking * I am so feeble, that I cannot speak.
column3: Thou holdest mine eyes waking * I am so feeble, that I cannot speak.

column2: 5 I have considered the days of old * and the years that are past.
column3: I have considered the days of old * and the years that are past.

column2: 6 I call to remembrance my song * and in the night I commune with mine own heart, and search out my spirits.
column3: I call to remembrance my song * and in the night I commune with mine own heart, and search out my spirits.

column2: 7 Will the Lord absent himself for ever * and will he be no more intreated?
column3: Will the Lord absent himself for ever * and will he be no more intreated?

column2: 8 Is his mercy clean gone for ever * and is his promise come utterly to an end for evermore?
column3: Is his mercy clean gone for ever * and is his promise come utterly to an end for evermore?

column2: 9 Hath God forgotten to be gracious * and will he shut up his loving-kindness in displeasure?
column3: Hath God forgotten to be gracious * and will he shut up his loving-kindness in displeasure?

column2: 10 And I said, It is mine own infirmity * but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most Highest.
column3: And I said, It is mine own infirmity * but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most Highest.

column2: 11 I will remember the works of the Lord * and call to mind thy wonders of old time.
column3: I will remember the works of the Lord * and call to mind thy wonders of old time.

column2: 12 I will think also of all thy works * and my talking shall be of thy doings.
column3: I will think also of all thy works * and my talking shall be of thy doings.

column2: 13 Thy way, O God, is holy * who is so great a God as our God?
column3: Thy way, O God, is holy * who is so great a God as our God?

column2: 14 Thou art the God that doeth wonders * and hast declared thy power among the people.
column3: Thou art the God that doeth wonders * and hast declared thy power among the people.

column2: 15 Thou hast mightily delivered thy people * even the sons of Jacob and Joseph.
column3: Thou hast mightily delivered thy people * even the sons of Jacob and Joseph.

column2: 16 The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee, and were afraid * the depths also were troubled.
column3: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee, and were afraid * the depths also were troubled.

column2: 17 The clouds poured out water, the air thundered * and thine arrows went abroad.
column3: The clouds poured out water, the air thundered * and thine arrows went abroad.

column2: 18 The voice of thy thunder was heard round about * the lightnings shone upon the ground * the earth was moved, and shook withal.
column3: The voice of thy thunder was heard round about * the lightnings shone upon the ground * the earth was moved, and shook withal.

column2: 19 Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in the great waters * and thy footsteps are not known.
column3: Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in the great waters * and thy footsteps are not known.

column2: 20 Thou leddest thy people like sheep * by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
column3: Thou leddest thy people like sheep * by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

column2: Psalm 78. Attendite, popule.
column3: Psalm 78. Attendite, popule.

column2: 1 HEAR my law, O my people * incline your ears unto the words of my mouth.
column3: HEAR my law, O my people * incline your ears unto the words of my mouth.

column2: 2 I will open my mouth in a parable * I will declare hard sentences of old;
column3: I will open my mouth in a parable * I will declare hard sentences of old;

column2: 3 Which we have heard and known * and such as our fathers have told us;
column3: Which we have heard and known * and such as our fathers have told us;

column2: 4 That we should not hide them from the children of the generations to come * but to shew the honour of the Lord, his mighty and wonderful works that he hath done.
column3: That we should not hide them from the children of the generations to come * but to shew the honour of the Lord, his mighty and wonderful works that he hath done.

column2: 5 He made a covenant with Jacob, and gave Israel a law * which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children;
column3: He made a covenant with Jacob, and gave Israel a law * which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children;

column2: 6 That their posterity might know it * and the children which were yet unborn;
column3: That their posterity might know it * and the children which were yet unborn;

column2: 7 To the intent that when they came up * they might shew their children the same;
column3: To the intent that when they came up * they might shew their children the same;

column2: 8 That they might put their trust in God * and not to forget the works of God, but to keep his commandments;
column3: That they might put their trust in God * and not to forget the works of God, but to keep his commandments;

column2: 9 And not to be as their forefathers, a faithless and stubborn generation * a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit cleaveth not stedfastly unto God;
column3: And not to be as their forefathers, a faithless and stubborn generation * a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit cleaveth not stedfastly unto God;

column2: 10 Like as the children of Ephraim * who being harnessed, and carrying bows, turned themselves back in the day of battle.
column3: Like as the children of Ephraim * who being harnessed, and carrying bows, turned themselves back in the day of battle.

column2: 11 They kept not the covenant of God * and would not walk in his law;
column3: They kept not the covenant of God * and would not walk in his law;

column2: 12 But forgat what he had done * and the wonderful works that he had shewed for them.
column3: But forgat what he had done * and the wonderful works that he had shewed for them.

column2: 13 Marvellous things did he in the sight of our forefathers, in the land of Egypt * even in the field of Zoan.
column3: Marvellous things did he in the sight of our forefathers, in the land of Egypt * even in the field of Zoan.

column2: 14 He divided the sea, and let them go through * he made the waters to stand on an heap.
column3: He divided the sea, and let them go through * he made the waters to stand on an heap.

column2: 15 In the day-time also he led them with a cloud * and all the night through with a light of fire.
column3: In the day-time also he led them with a cloud * and all the night through with a light of fire.

column2: 16 He clave the hard rocks in the wilderness * and gave them drink thereof, as it had been out of the great depth.
column3: He clave the hard rocks in the wilderness * and gave them drink thereof, as it had been out of the great depth.

column2: 17 He brought waters out of the stony rock * so that it gushed out like the rivers.
column3: He brought waters out of the stony rock * so that it gushed out like the rivers.

column2: 18 Yet for all this they sinned more against him * and provoked the most Highest in the wilderness.
column3: Yet for all this they sinned more against him * and provoked the most Highest in the wilderness.

column2: 19 They tempted God in their hearts * and required meat for their lust.
column3: They tempted God in their hearts * and required meat for their lust.

column2: 20 They spake against God also, saying * Shall God prepare a table in the wilderness?
column3: They spake against God also, saying * Shall God prepare a table in the wilderness?

column2: 21 He smote the stony rock indeed, that the waters gushed out, and the streams flowed withal * but can he give bread also, or provide flesh for his people?
column3: He smote the stony rock indeed, that the waters gushed out, and the streams flowed withal * but can he give bread also, or provide flesh for his people?

column2: 22 When the Lord heard this, he was wroth * so the fire was kindled in Jacob, and there came up heavy displeasure against Israel;
column3: When the Lord heard this, he was wroth * so the fire was kindled in Jacob, and there came up heavy displeasure against Israel;

column2: 23 Because they believed not in God * and put not their trust in his help.
column3: Because they believed not in God * and put not their trust in his help.

column2: 24 So he commanded the clouds above * and opened the doors of heaven.
column3: So he commanded the clouds above * and opened the doors of heaven.

column2: 25 He rained down manna also upon them for to eat * and gave them food from heaven.
column3: He rained down manna also upon them for to eat * and gave them food from heaven.

column2: 26 So man did eat angels' food * for he sent them meat enough.
column3: So man did eat angels' food * for he sent them meat enough.

column2: 27 He caused the east-wind to blow under heaven * and through his power he brought in the south-west-wind.
column3: He caused the east-wind to blow under heaven * and through his power he brought in the south-west-wind.

column2: 28 He rained flesh upon them as thick as dust * and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.
column3: He rained flesh upon them as thick as dust * and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.

column2: 29 He let it fall among their tents * even round about their habitation.
column3: He let it fall among their tents * even round about their habitation.

column2: 30 So they did eat and were well filled, for he gave them their own desire * they were not disappointed of their lust.
column3: So they did eat and were well filled, for he gave them their own desire * they were not disappointed of their lust.

column2: 31 But while the meat was yet in their mouths, the heavy wrath of God came upon them, and slew the wealthiest of them * yea, and smote down the chosen men that were in Israel.
column3: But while the meat was yet in their mouths, the heavy wrath of God came upon them, and slew the wealthiest of them * yea, and smote down the chosen men that were in Israel.

column2: 32 But for all this they sinned yet more * and believed not his wondrous works.
column3: But for all this they sinned yet more * and believed not his wondrous works.

column2: 33 Therefore their days did he consume in vanity * and their years in trouble.
column3: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity * and their years in trouble.

column2: 34 When he slew them, they sought him * and turned them early, and inquired after God.
column3: When he slew them, they sought him * and turned them early, and inquired after God.

column2: 35 And they remembered that God was their strength * and that the high God was their redeemer.
column3: And they remembered that God was their strength * and that the high God was their redeemer.

column2: 36 Nevertheless, they did but flatter him with their mouth * and dissembled with him in their tongue.
column3: Nevertheless, they did but flatter him with their mouth * and dissembled with him in their tongue.

column2: 37 For their heart was not whole with him * neither continued they stedfast in his covenant.
column3: For their heart was not whole with him * neither continued they stedfast in his covenant.

column2: 38 But he was so merciful, that he forgave their misdeeds * and destroyed them not.
column3: But he was so merciful, that he forgave their misdeeds * and destroyed them not.

column2: 39 Yea, many a time turned he his wrath away * and would not suffer his whole displeasure to arise.
column3: Yea, many a time turned he his wrath away * and would not suffer his whole displeasure to arise.

column2: 40 For he considered that they were but flesh * and that they were even a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
column3: For he considered that they were but flesh * and that they were even a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

column2: 41 Many a time did they provoke him in the wilderness * and grieved him in the desert.
column3: Many a time did they provoke him in the wilderness * and grieved him in the desert.

column2: 42 They turned back, and tempted God * and moved the Holy One in Israel.
column3: They turned back, and tempted God * and moved the Holy One in Israel.

column2: 43 They thought not of his hand * and of the day when he delivered them from the hand of the enemy;
column3: They thought not of his hand * and of the day when he delivered them from the hand of the enemy;

column2: 44 How he had wrought his miracles in Egypt * and his wonders in the field of Zoan.
column3: How he had wrought his miracles in Egypt * and his wonders in the field of Zoan.

column2: 45 He turned their waters into blood * so that they might not drink of the rivers.
column3: He turned their waters into blood * so that they might not drink of the rivers.

column2: 46 He sent lice among them, and devoured them up * and frogs to destroy them.
column3: He sent lice among them, and devoured them up * and frogs to destroy them.

column2: 47 He gave their fruit unto the caterpillar * and their labour unto the grasshopper.
column3: He gave their fruit unto the caterpillar * and their labour unto the grasshopper.

column2: 48 He destroyed their vines with hail-stones * and their mulberry-trees with the frost.
column3: He destroyed their vines with hail-stones * and their mulberry-trees with the frost.

column2: 49 He smote their cattle also with hail-stones * and their flocks with hot thunderbolts.
column3: He smote their cattle also with hail-stones * and their flocks with hot thunderbolts.

column2: 50 He cast upon them the furiousness of his wrath, anger, displeasure and trouble * and sent evil angels among them.
column3: He cast upon them the furiousness of his wrath, anger, displeasure and trouble * and sent evil angels among them.

column2: 51 He made a way to his indignation, and spared not their soul from death * but gave their life over to the pestilence;
column3: He made a way to his indignation, and spared not their soul from death * but gave their life over to the pestilence;

column2: 52 And smote all the first-born in Egypt * the most principal and mightiest in the dwellings of Ham.
column3: And smote all the first-born in Egypt * the most principal and mightiest in the dwellings of Ham.

column2: 53 But as for his own people, he led them forth like sheep * and carried them in the wilderness like a flock.
column3: But as for his own people, he led them forth like sheep * and carried them in the wilderness like a flock.

column2: 54 He brought them out safely, that they should not fear * and overwhelmed their enemies with the sea.
column3: He brought them out safely, that they should not fear * and overwhelmed their enemies with the sea.

column2: 55 And brought them within the borders of his sanctuary * even to his mountain which he purchased with his right hand.
column3: And brought them within the borders of his sanctuary * even to his mountain which he purchased with his right hand.

column2: 56 He cast out the heathen also before them * caused their land to be divided among them for an heritage, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
column3: He cast out the heathen also before them * caused their land to be divided among them for an heritage, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

column2: 57 So they tempted and displeased the most high God * and kept not his testimonies;
column3: So they tempted and displeased the most high God * and kept not his testimonies;

column2: 58 But turned their backs, and fell away like their forefathers * starting aside like a broken bow.
column3: But turned their backs, and fell away like their forefathers * starting aside like a broken bow.

column2: 59 For they grieved him with their hill-altars * and provoked him to displeasure with their images.
column3: For they grieved him with their hill-altars * and provoked him to displeasure with their images.

column2: 60 When God heard this, he was wroth * and took sore displeasure at Israel.
column3: When God heard this, he was wroth * and took sore displeasure at Israel.

column2: 61 So that he forsook the tabernacle in Silo * even the tent that he had pitched among men.
column3: So that he forsook the tabernacle in Silo * even the tent that he had pitched among men.

column2: 62 He delivered their power into captivity * and their beauty into the enemy's hand.
column3: He delivered their power into captivity * and their beauty into the enemy's hand.

column2: 63 He gave his people over also unto the sword * and was wroth with his inheritance.
column3: He gave his people over also unto the sword * and was wroth with his inheritance.

column2: 64 The fire consumed their young men * and their maidens were not given to marriage.
column3: The fire consumed their young men * and their maidens were not given to marriage.

column2: 65 Their priests were slain with the sword * and there were no widows to make lamentation.
column3: Their priests were slain with the sword * and there were no widows to make lamentation.

column2: 66 So the Lord awaked as one out of sleep * and like a giant refreshed with wine.
column3: So the Lord awaked as one out of sleep * and like a giant refreshed with wine.

column2: 67 He smote his enemies in the hinder parts * and put them to a perpetual shame.
column3: He smote his enemies in the hinder parts * and put them to a perpetual shame.

column2: 68 He refused the tabernacle of Joseph * and chose not the tribe of Ephraim;
column3: He refused the tabernacle of Joseph * and chose not the tribe of Ephraim;

column2: 69 But chose the tribe of Judah * even the hill of Sion which he loved.
column3: But chose the tribe of Judah * even the hill of Sion which he loved.

column2: 70 And there he built his temple on high * and laid the foundation of it like the ground which he hath made continually.
column3: And there he built his temple on high * and laid the foundation of it like the ground which he hath made continually.

column2: 71 He chose David also his servant * and took him away from the sheep-folds.
column3: He chose David also his servant * and took him away from the sheep-folds.

column2: 72 As he was following the ewes great with young ones he took him * that he might feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
column3: As he was following the ewes great with young ones he took him * that he might feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

column2: 73 So he fed them with a faithful and true heart * and ruled them prudently with all his power.
column3: So he fed them with a faithful and true heart * and ruled them prudently with all his power.

column2: Psalm 79. Deus, venerunt.
column3: Psalm 79. Deus, venerunt.

column2: 1 O GOD, the heathen are come into thine inheritance * thy holy temple have they defiled, and made Jerusalem an heap of stones.
column3: O GOD, the heathen are come into thine inheritance * thy holy temple have they defiled, and made Jerusalem an heap of stones.

column2: 2 The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the air * and the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the land.
column3: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the air * and the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the land.

column2: 3 Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem * and there was no man to bury them.
column3: Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem * and there was no man to bury them.

column2: 4 We are become an open shame to our enemies * a very scorn and derision unto them that are round about us.
column3: We are become an open shame to our enemies * a very scorn and derision unto them that are round about us.

column2: 5 Lord, how long wilt thou be angry * shall thy jealousy burn like fire for ever?
column3: Lord, how long wilt thou be angry * shall thy jealousy burn like fire for ever?

column2: 6 Pour out thine indignation upon the heathen that have not known thee * and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy Name.
column3: Pour out thine indignation upon the heathen that have not known thee * and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy Name.

column2: 7 For they have devoured Jacob * and laid waste his dwelling-place.
column3: For they have devoured Jacob * and laid waste his dwelling-place.

column2: 8 O remember not our old sins, but have mercy upon us, and that soon * for we are come to great misery.
column3: O remember not our old sins, but have mercy upon us, and that soon * for we are come to great misery.

column2: 9 Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy Name * O deliver us, and be merciful unto our sins, for thy Name's sake.
column3: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy Name * O deliver us, and be merciful unto our sins, for thy Name's sake.

column2: 10 Wherefore do the heathen say * Where is now their God?
column3: Wherefore do the heathen say * Where is now their God?

column2: 11 O let the vengeance of thy servants' blood that is shed * be openly shewed upon the heathen in our sight.
column3: O let the vengeance of thy servants' blood that is shed * be openly shewed upon the heathen in our sight.

column2: 12 O let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before thee * according to the greatness of thy power, preserve thou those that are appointed to die.
column3: O let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before thee * according to the greatness of thy power, preserve thou those that are appointed to die.

column2: 13 And for the blasphemy wherewith our neighbours have blasphemed thee * reward thou them , O Lord, seven-fold into their bosom.
column3: And for the blasphemy wherewith our neighbours have blasphemed thee * reward thou them , O Lord, seven-fold into their bosom.

column2: 14 So we, that are thy people, and sheep of thy pasture, shall give thee thanks for ever * and will alway be shewing forth thy praise from generation to generation.
column3: So we, that are thy people, and sheep of thy pasture, shall give thee thanks for ever * and will alway be shewing forth thy praise from generation to generation.

column2: Psalm 80. Qui regis Israel.
column3: Psalm 80. Qui regis Israel.

column2: 1 HEAR, O thou Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a sheep * shew thyself also, thou that sittest upon the cherubims.
column3: HEAR, O thou Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a sheep * shew thyself also, thou that sittest upon the cherubims.

column2: 2 Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasses * stir up thy strength, and come, and help us.
column3: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasses * stir up thy strength, and come, and help us.

column2: 3 Turn us again, O God * shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.
column3: Turn us again, O God * shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

column2: 4 O Lord God of hosts * how long wilt thou be angry with thy people that prayeth?
column3: O Lord God of hosts * how long wilt thou be angry with thy people that prayeth?

column2: 5 Thou feedest them with the bread of tears * and givest them plenteousness of tears to drink.
column3: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears * and givest them plenteousness of tears to drink.

column2: 6 Thou hast made us a very strife unto our neighbours * and our enemies laugh us to scorn.
column3: Thou hast made us a very strife unto our neighbours * and our enemies laugh us to scorn.

column2: 7 Turn us again, thou God of hosts * shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.
column3: Turn us again, thou God of hosts * shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

column2: 8 Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt * thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
column3: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt * thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.

column2: 9 Thou madest room for it * and when it had taken root it filled the land.
column3: Thou madest room for it * and when it had taken root it filled the land.

column2: 10 The hills were covered with the shadow of it * and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedar-trees.
column3: The hills were covered with the shadow of it * and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedar-trees.

column2: 11 She stretched out her branches unto the sea * and her boughs unto the river.
column3: She stretched out her branches unto the sea * and her boughs unto the river.

column2: 12 Why hast thou then broken down her hedge * that all they that go by pluck off her grapes?
column3: Why hast thou then broken down her hedge * that all they that go by pluck off her grapes?

column2: 13 The wild boar out of the wood doth root it up * and the wild beasts of the field devour it.
column3: The wild boar out of the wood doth root it up * and the wild beasts of the field devour it.

column2: 14 Turn thee again, thou God of hosts, look down from heaven * behold, and visit this vine;
column3: Turn thee again, thou God of hosts, look down from heaven * behold, and visit this vine;

column2: 15 And the place of the vineyard that thy right hand hath planted * and the branch that thou madest so strong for thyself.
column3: And the place of the vineyard that thy right hand hath planted * and the branch that thou madest so strong for thyself.

column2: 16 It is burnt with fire, and cut down * and they shall perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
column3: It is burnt with fire, and cut down * and they shall perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.

column2: 17 Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand * and upon the son of man, whom thou madest so strong for thine own self.
column3: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand * and upon the son of man, whom thou madest so strong for thine own self.

column2: 18 And so will not we go back from thee * O let us live, and we shall call upon thy Name.
column3: And so will not we go back from thee * O let us live, and we shall call upon thy Name.

column2: 19 Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts * shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.
column3: Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts * shew the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

column2: Psalm 81. Exultate Deo.
column3: Psalm 81. Exultate Deo.

column2: 1 SING we merrily unto God our strength * make a cheerful noise unto the God of Jacob.
column3: SING we merrily unto God our strength * make a cheerful noise unto the God of Jacob.

column2: 2 Take the psalm, bring hither the tabret * the merry harp with the lute.
column3: Take the psalm, bring hither the tabret * the merry harp with the lute.

column2: 3 Blow up the trumpet in the new-moon * even in the time appointed, and upon our solemn feast-day.
column3: Blow up the trumpet in the new-moon * even in the time appointed, and upon our solemn feast-day.

column2: 4 For this was made a statute for Israel * and a law of the God of Jacob.
column3: For this was made a statute for Israel * and a law of the God of Jacob.

column2: 5 This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony * when he came out of the land of Egypt, and had heard a strange language.
column3: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony * when he came out of the land of Egypt, and had heard a strange language.

column2: 6 I eased his shoulder from the burden * and his hands were delivered from making the pots.
column3: I eased his shoulder from the burden * and his hands were delivered from making the pots.

column2: 7 Thou calledst upon me in troubles, and I delivered thee * and heard thee what time as the storm fell upon thee.
column3: Thou calledst upon me in troubles, and I delivered thee * and heard thee what time as the storm fell upon thee.

column2: 8 I proved thee also * at the waters of strife.
column3: I proved thee also * at the waters of strife.

column2: 9 Hear, O my people, and I will assure thee, O Israel * if thou wilt hearken unto me,
column3: Hear, O my people, and I will assure thee, O Israel * if thou wilt hearken unto me,

column2: 10 There shall no strange god be in thee * neither shalt thou worship any other god.
column3: There shall no strange god be in thee * neither shalt thou worship any other god.

column2: 11 I am the Lord thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt * open thy mouth wide, and I shall fill it.
column3: I am the Lord thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt * open thy mouth wide, and I shall fill it.

column2: 12 But my people would not hear my voice * and Israel would not obey me.
column3: But my people would not hear my voice * and Israel would not obey me.

column2: 13 So I gave them up unto their own hearts' lusts * and let them follow their own imaginations.
column3: So I gave them up unto their own hearts' lusts * and let them follow their own imaginations.

column2: 14 O that my people would have hearkened unto me * for if Israel had walked in my ways,
column3: O that my people would have hearkened unto me * for if Israel had walked in my ways,

column2: 15 I should soon have put down their enemies * and turned my hand against their adversaries.
column3: I should soon have put down their enemies * and turned my hand against their adversaries.

column2: 16 The haters of the Lord should have been found liars * but their time should have endured for ever.
column3: The haters of the Lord should have been found liars * but their time should have endured for ever.

column2: 17 He should have fed them also with the finest wheat-flour * and with honey out of the stony rock should I have satisfied thee.
column3: He should have fed them also with the finest wheat-flour * and with honey out of the stony rock should I have satisfied thee.

column2: Psalm 82. Deus stetit.
column3: Psalm 82. Deus stetit.

column2: 1 GOD standeth in the congregation of princes * he is a Judge among gods.
column3: GOD standeth in the congregation of princes * he is a Judge among gods.

column2: 2 How long will ye give wrong judgement * and accept the persons of the ungodly?
column3: How long will ye give wrong judgement * and accept the persons of the ungodly?

column2: 3 Defend the poor and fatherless * see that such as are in need and necessity have right.
column3: Defend the poor and fatherless * see that such as are in need and necessity have right.

column2: 4 Deliver the outcast and poor * save them from the hand of the ungodly.
column3: Deliver the outcast and poor * save them from the hand of the ungodly.

column2: 5 They will not be learned nor understand, but walk on still in darkness * all the foundations of the earth are out of course.
column3: They will not be learned nor understand, but walk on still in darkness * all the foundations of the earth are out of course.

column2: 6 I have said, Ye are gods * and ye are all the children of the most Highest.
column3: I have said, Ye are gods * and ye are all the children of the most Highest.

column2: 7 But ye shall die like men * and fall like one of the princes.
column3: But ye shall die like men * and fall like one of the princes.

column2: 8 Arise, O God, and judge thou the earth * for thou shalt take all heathen to thine inheritance.
column3: Arise, O God, and judge thou the earth * for thou shalt take all heathen to thine inheritance.

column2: Psalm 83. Deus, quis similis?
column3: Psalm 83. Deus, quis similis?

column2: 1 HOLD not thy tongue, O God, keep not still silence * refrain not thyself, O God.
column3: HOLD not thy tongue, O God, keep not still silence * refrain not thyself, O God.

column2: 2 For lo, thine enemies make a murmuring * and they that hate thee have lift up their head.
column3: For lo, thine enemies make a murmuring * and they that hate thee have lift up their head.

column2: 3 They have imagined craftily against thy people * and taken counsel against thy secret ones.
column3: They have imagined craftily against thy people * and taken counsel against thy secret ones.

column2: 4 They have said, Come, and let us root them out, that they be no more a people * and that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
column3: They have said, Come, and let us root them out, that they be no more a people * and that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.

column2: 5 For they have cast their heads together with one consent * and are confederate against thee;
column3: For they have cast their heads together with one consent * and are confederate against thee;

column2: 6 The tabernacles of the Edomites, and the Ismaelites * the Moabites and Hagarenes;
column3: The tabernacles of the Edomites, and the Ismaelites * the Moabites and Hagarenes;

column2: 7 Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek * the Philistines, with them that dwell at Tyre.
column3: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek * the Philistines, with them that dwell at Tyre.

column2: 8 Assur also is joined with them * and have holpen the children of Lot.
column3: Assur also is joined with them * and have holpen the children of Lot.

column2: 9 But do thou to them as unto the Madianites * unto Sisera, and unto Jabin at the brook of Kison;
column3: But do thou to them as unto the Madianites * unto Sisera, and unto Jabin at the brook of Kison;

column2: 10 Who perished at Endor * and became as the dung of the earth.
column3: Who perished at Endor * and became as the dung of the earth.

column2: 11 Make them and their princes like Oreb and Zeb * yea, make all their princes like as Zeba and Salmana;
column3: Make them and their princes like Oreb and Zeb * yea, make all their princes like as Zeba and Salmana;

column2: 12 Who say, Let us take to ourselves * the houses of God in possession.
column3: Who say, Let us take to ourselves * the houses of God in possession.

column2: 13 O my God, make them like unto a wheel * and as the stubble before the wind;
column3: O my God, make them like unto a wheel * and as the stubble before the wind;

column2: 14 Like as the fire that burneth up the wood * and as the flame that consumeth the mountains.
column3: Like as the fire that burneth up the wood * and as the flame that consumeth the mountains.

column2: 15 Persecute them even so with thy tempest * and make them afraid with thy storm.
column3: Persecute them even so with thy tempest * and make them afraid with thy storm.

column2: 16 Make their faces ashamed, O Lord * that they may seek thy Name.
column3: Make their faces ashamed, O Lord * that they may seek thy Name.

column2: 17 Let them be confounded and vexed ever more and more * let them be put to shame, and perish.
column3: Let them be confounded and vexed ever more and more * let them be put to shame, and perish.

column2: 18 And they shall know that thou, whose Name is Jehovah * art only the most Highest over all the earth.
column3: And they shall know that thou, whose Name is Jehovah * art only the most Highest over all the earth.

column2: Psalm 84. Quam dilecta!
column3: Psalm 84. Quam dilecta!

column2: 1 O HOW amiable are thy dwellings * thou Lord of hosts!
column3: O HOW amiable are thy dwellings * thou Lord of hosts!

column2: 2 My soul hath a desire and longing to enter into the courts of the Lord * my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.
column3: My soul hath a desire and longing to enter into the courts of the Lord * my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

column2: 3 Yea, the sparrow hath found her an house, and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young * even thy altars, O Lord of hosts, my King and my God.
column3: Yea, the sparrow hath found her an house, and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young * even thy altars, O Lord of hosts, my King and my God.

column2: 4 Blessed are they that dwell in thy house * they will be alway praising thee.
column3: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house * they will be alway praising thee.

column2: 5 Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee * in whose heart are thy ways.
column3: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee * in whose heart are thy ways.

column2: 6 Who going through the vale of misery use it for a well * and the pools are filled with water.
column3: Who going through the vale of misery use it for a well * and the pools are filled with water.

column2: 7 They will go from strength to strength * and unto the God of gods appeareth every one of them in Sion.
column3: They will go from strength to strength * and unto the God of gods appeareth every one of them in Sion.

column2: 8 O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer * hearken, O God of Jacob.
column3: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer * hearken, O God of Jacob.

column2: 9 Behold, O God our defender * and look upon the face of thine Anointed.
column3: Behold, O God our defender * and look upon the face of thine Anointed.

column2: 10 For one day in thy courts * is better than a thousand.
column3: For one day in thy courts * is better than a thousand.

column2: 11 I had rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God * than to dwell in the tents of ungodliness.
column3: I had rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God * than to dwell in the tents of ungodliness.

column2: 12 For the Lord God is a light and defence * the Lord will give grace and worship, and no good thing shall he withhold from them that live a godly life.
column3: For the Lord God is a light and defence * the Lord will give grace and worship, and no good thing shall he withhold from them that live a godly life.

column2: 13 O Lord God of hosts * blessed is the man that putteth his trust in thee.
column3: O Lord God of hosts * blessed is the man that putteth his trust in thee.

column2: Psalm 85. Benedixisti, Domine.
column3: Psalm 85. Benedixisti, Domine.

column2: 1 LORD, thou art become gracious unto thy land * thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob.
column3: LORD, thou art become gracious unto thy land * thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob.

column2: 2 Thou hast forgiven the offence of thy people * and covered all their sins.
column3: Thou hast forgiven the offence of thy people * and covered all their sins.

column2: 3 Thou hast taken away all thy displeasure * and turned thyself from thy wrathful indignation.
column3: Thou hast taken away all thy displeasure * and turned thyself from thy wrathful indignation.

column2: 4 Turn us then, O God our Saviour * and let thine anger cease from us.
column3: Turn us then, O God our Saviour * and let thine anger cease from us.

column2: 5 Wilt thou be displeased at us for ever * and wilt thou stretch out thy wrath from one generation to another?
column3: Wilt thou be displeased at us for ever * and wilt thou stretch out thy wrath from one generation to another?

column2: 6 Wilt thou not turn again, and quicken us * that thy people may rejoice in thee?
column3: Wilt thou not turn again, and quicken us * that thy people may rejoice in thee?

column2: 7 Shew us thy mercy, O Lord * and grant us thy salvation.
column3: Shew us thy mercy, O Lord * and grant us thy salvation.

column2: 8 I will hearken what the Lord God will say concerning me * for he shall speak peace unto his people, and to his saints, that they turn not again.
column3: I will hearken what the Lord God will say concerning me * for he shall speak peace unto his people, and to his saints, that they turn not again.

column2: 9 For his salvation is nigh them that fear him * that glory may dwell in our land.
column3: For his salvation is nigh them that fear him * that glory may dwell in our land.

column2: 10 Mercy and truth are met together * righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
column3: Mercy and truth are met together * righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

column2: 11 Truth shall flourish out of the earth * and righteousness hath looked down from heaven.
column3: Truth shall flourish out of the earth * and righteousness hath looked down from heaven.

column2: 12 Yea, the Lord shall shew loving-kindness * and our land shall give her increase.
column3: Yea, the Lord shall shew loving-kindness * and our land shall give her increase.

column2: 13 Righteousness shall go before him * and he shall direct his going in the way.
column3: Righteousness shall go before him * and he shall direct his going in the way.

column2: Psalm 86. Inclina, Domine.
column3: Psalm 86. Inclina, Domine.

column2: 1 BOW down thine ear, O Lord, and hear me * for I am poor, and in misery.
column3: BOW down thine ear, O Lord, and hear me * for I am poor, and in misery.

column2: 2 Preserve thou my soul, for I am holy * my God, save thy servant that putteth his trust in thee.
column3: Preserve thou my soul, for I am holy * my God, save thy servant that putteth his trust in thee.

column2: 3 Be merciful unto me, O Lord * for I will call daily upon thee.
column3: Be merciful unto me, O Lord * for I will call daily upon thee.

column2: 4 Comfort the soul of thy servant * for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
column3: Comfort the soul of thy servant * for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

column2: 5 For thou, Lord, art good and gracious * and of great mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
column3: For thou, Lord, art good and gracious * and of great mercy unto all them that call upon thee.

column2: 6 Give ear, Lord, unto my prayer * and ponder the voice of my humble desires.
column3: Give ear, Lord, unto my prayer * and ponder the voice of my humble desires.

column2: 7 In the time of my trouble I will call upon thee * for thou hearest me.
column3: In the time of my trouble I will call upon thee * for thou hearest me.

column2: 8 Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord * there is not one that can do as thou doest.
column3: Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord * there is not one that can do as thou doest.

column2: 9 All nations whom thou hadst made shall come and worship thee, O Lord * and shall glorify thy Name.
column3: All nations whom thou hadst made shall come and worship thee, O Lord * and shall glorify thy Name.

column2: 10 For thou art great, and doest wondrous things * thou art God alone.
column3: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things * thou art God alone.

column2: 11 Teach me thy way, O Lord, and I will walk in thy truth * O knit my heart unto thee, that I may fear thy Name.
column3: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and I will walk in thy truth * O knit my heart unto thee, that I may fear thy Name.

column2: 12 I will thank thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart * and will praise thy Name for evermore.
column3: I will thank thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart * and will praise thy Name for evermore.

column2: 13 For great is thy mercy toward me * and thou hast delivered my soul from the nethermost hell.
column3: For great is thy mercy toward me * and thou hast delivered my soul from the nethermost hell.

column2: 14 O God, the proud are risen against me * and the congregations of naughty men have sought after my soul, and have not set thee before their eyes.
column3: O God, the proud are risen against me * and the congregations of naughty men have sought after my soul, and have not set thee before their eyes.

column2: 15 But thou, O Lord God, art full of compassion and mercy * long-suffering, plenteous in goodness and truth.
column3: But thou, O Lord God, art full of compassion and mercy * long-suffering, plenteous in goodness and truth.

column2: 16 O turn thee then unto me, and have mercy upon me * give thy strength unto thy servant, and help the son of thine handmaid.
column3: O turn thee then unto me, and have mercy upon me * give thy strength unto thy servant, and help the son of thine handmaid.

column2: 17 Shew some token upon me for good, that they who hate me may see it and be ashamed * because thou, Lord, hast holpen me and comforted me.
column3: Shew some token upon me for good, that they who hate me may see it and be ashamed * because thou, Lord, hast holpen me and comforted me.

column2: Psalm 87. Fundamenta ejus.
column3: Psalm 87. Fundamenta ejus.

column2: 1 HER foundations are upon the holy hills * the Lord loveth the gates of Sion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
column3: HER foundations are upon the holy hills * the Lord loveth the gates of Sion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

column2: 2 Very excellent things are spoken of thee * thou city of God.
column3: Very excellent things are spoken of thee * thou city of God.

column2: 3 I will think upon Rahab and Babylon * with them that know me.
column3: I will think upon Rahab and Babylon * with them that know me.

column2: 4 Behold ye the Philistines also * and they of Tyre, with the Morians; lo, there was he born.
column3: Behold ye the Philistines also * and they of Tyre, with the Morians; lo, there was he born.

column2: 5 And of Sion it shall be reported that he was born in her * and the most High shall stablish her.
column3: And of Sion it shall be reported that he was born in her * and the most High shall stablish her.

column2: 6 The Lord shall rehearse it when he writeth up the people * that he was born there.
column3: The Lord shall rehearse it when he writeth up the people * that he was born there.

column2: 7 The singers also and trumpeters shall he rehearse * All my fresh springs shall be in thee.
column3: The singers also and trumpeters shall he rehearse * All my fresh springs shall be in thee.

column2: Psalm 88. Domine Deus.
column3: Psalm 88. Domine Deus.

column2: 1 O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee * O let my prayer enter into thy presence, incline thine ear unto my calling.
column3: O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee * O let my prayer enter into thy presence, incline thine ear unto my calling.

column2: 2 For my soul is full of trouble * and my life draweth nigh unto hell.
column3: For my soul is full of trouble * and my life draweth nigh unto hell.

column2: 3 I am counted as one of them that go down into the pit * and I have been even as a man that hath no strength.
column3: I am counted as one of them that go down into the pit * and I have been even as a man that hath no strength.

column2: 4 Free among the dead, like unto them that are wounded, and lie in the grave * who are out of remembrance, and are cut away from thy hand.
column3: Free among the dead, like unto them that are wounded, and lie in the grave * who are out of remembrance, and are cut away from thy hand.

column2: 5 Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit * in a place of darkness, and in the deep.
column3: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit * in a place of darkness, and in the deep.

column2: 6 Thine indignation lieth hard upon me * and thou hast vexed me with all thy storms.
column3: Thine indignation lieth hard upon me * and thou hast vexed me with all thy storms.

column2: 7 Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me * and made me to be abhorred of them.
column3: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me * and made me to be abhorred of them.

column2: 8 I am so fast in prison * that I cannot get forth.
column3: I am so fast in prison * that I cannot get forth.

column2: 9 My sight faileth for very trouble * Lord, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched forth my hands unto thee.
column3: My sight faileth for very trouble * Lord, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched forth my hands unto thee.

column2: 10 Dost thou shew wonders among the dead * or shall the dead rise up again, and praise thee?
column3: Dost thou shew wonders among the dead * or shall the dead rise up again, and praise thee?

column2: 11 Shall thy loving-kindness be shewed in the grave * or thy faithfulness in destruction?
column3: Shall thy loving-kindness be shewed in the grave * or thy faithfulness in destruction?

column2: 12 Shall thy wondrous works be known in the dark * and thy righteousness in the land where all things are forgotten?
column3: Shall thy wondrous works be known in the dark * and thy righteousness in the land where all things are forgotten?

column2: 13 Unto thee have I cried, O Lord * and early shall my prayer come before thee.
column3: Unto thee have I cried, O Lord * and early shall my prayer come before thee.

column2: 14 Lord, why abhorrest thou my soul * and hidest thou thy face from me?
column3: Lord, why abhorrest thou my soul * and hidest thou thy face from me?

column2: 15 I am in misery, and like unto him that is at the point to die * even from my youth up thy terrors have I suffered with a troubled mind.
column3: I am in misery, and like unto him that is at the point to die * even from my youth up thy terrors have I suffered with a troubled mind.

column2: 16 Thy wrathful displeasure goeth over me * and the fear of thee hath undone me.
column3: Thy wrathful displeasure goeth over me * and the fear of thee hath undone me.

column2: 17 They came round about me daily like water * and compassed me together on every side.
column3: They came round about me daily like water * and compassed me together on every side.

column2: 18 My lovers and friends hast thou put away from me * and hid mine acquaintance out of my sight.
column3: My lovers and friends hast thou put away from me * and hid mine acquaintance out of my sight.

column2: Psalm 89. Misericordias Domini.
column3: Psalm 89. Misericordias Domini.

column2: 1 MY SONG shall be alway of the loving-kindness of the Lord * with my mouth will I ever be shewing thy truth from one generation to another.
column3: MY SONG shall be alway of the loving-kindness of the Lord * with my mouth will I ever be shewing thy truth from one generation to another.

column2: 2 For I have said, Mercy shall be set up for ever * thy truth shalt thou stablish in the heavens.
column3: For I have said, Mercy shall be set up for ever * thy truth shalt thou stablish in the heavens.

column2: 3 I have made a covenant with my chosen * I have sworn unto David my servant;
column3: I have made a covenant with my chosen * I have sworn unto David my servant;

column2: 4 Thy seed will I stablish for ever * and set up thy throne from one generation to another.
