column3: Thy seed will I stablish for ever * and set up thy throne from one generation to another.

column2: 5 O Lord, the very heavens shall praise thy wondrous works * and thy truth in the congregation of the saints.
column3: O Lord, the very heavens shall praise thy wondrous works * and thy truth in the congregation of the saints.

column2: 6 For who is he among the clouds * that shall be compared unto the Lord?
column3: For who is he among the clouds * that shall be compared unto the Lord?

column2: 7 And what is he among the gods * that shall be like unto the Lord?
column3: And what is he among the gods * that shall be like unto the Lord?

column2: 8 God is very greatly to be feared in the council of the saints * and to be had in reverence of all them that are round about him.
column3: God is very greatly to be feared in the council of the saints * and to be had in reverence of all them that are round about him.

column2: 9 O Lord God of hosts, who is like unto thee * thy truth, most mighty Lord, is on every side.
column3: O Lord God of hosts, who is like unto thee * thy truth, most mighty Lord, is on every side.

column2: 10 Thou rulest the raging of the sea * thou stillest the waves thereof when they arise.
column3: Thou rulest the raging of the sea * thou stillest the waves thereof when they arise.

column2: 11 Thou hast subdued Egypt, and destroyed it * thou hast scattered thine enemies abroad with thy mighty arm.
column3: Thou hast subdued Egypt, and destroyed it * thou hast scattered thine enemies abroad with thy mighty arm.

column2: 12 The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine * thou hast laid the foundation of the round world, and all that therein is.
column3: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine * thou hast laid the foundation of the round world, and all that therein is.

column2: 13 Thou hast made the north and the south * Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy Name.
column3: Thou hast made the north and the south * Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy Name.

column2: 14 Thou hast a mighty arm * strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
column3: Thou hast a mighty arm * strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

column2: 15 Righteousness and equity are the habitation of thy seat * mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
column3: Righteousness and equity are the habitation of thy seat * mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

column2: 16 Blessed is the people, O Lord, that can rejoice in thee * they shall walk in the light of thy countenance.
column3: Blessed is the people, O Lord, that can rejoice in thee * they shall walk in the light of thy countenance.

column2: 17 Their delight shall be daily in thy Name * and in thy righteousness shall they make their boast.
column3: Their delight shall be daily in thy Name * and in thy righteousness shall they make their boast.

column2: 18 For thou art the glory of their strength * and in thy loving-kindness thou shalt lift up our horns.
column3: For thou art the glory of their strength * and in thy loving-kindness thou shalt lift up our horns.

column2: 19 For the Lord is our defence * the Holy One of Israel is our King.
column3: For the Lord is our defence * the Holy One of Israel is our King.

column2: 20 Thou spakest sometime in visions unto thy saints, and saidst * I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
column3: Thou spakest sometime in visions unto thy saints, and saidst * I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

column2: 21 I have found David my servant * with my holy oil have I anointed him.
column3: I have found David my servant * with my holy oil have I anointed him.

column2: 22 My hand shall hold him fast * and my arm shall strengthen him.
column3: My hand shall hold him fast * and my arm shall strengthen him.

column2: 23 The enemy shall not be able to do him violence * the son of wickedness shall not hurt him.
column3: The enemy shall not be able to do him violence * the son of wickedness shall not hurt him.

column2: 24 I will smite down his foes before his face * and plague them that hate him.
column3: I will smite down his foes before his face * and plague them that hate him.

column2: 25 My truth also and my mercy shall be with him * and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.
column3: My truth also and my mercy shall be with him * and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.

column2: 26 I will set his dominion also in the sea * and his right hand in the floods.
column3: I will set his dominion also in the sea * and his right hand in the floods.

column2: 27 He shall call me, Thou art my Father * my God, and my strong salvation.
column3: He shall call me, Thou art my Father * my God, and my strong salvation.

column2: 28 And I will make him my first-born * higher than the kings of the earth.
column3: And I will make him my first-born * higher than the kings of the earth.

column2: 29 My mercy will I keep for him for evermore * and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
column3: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore * and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

column2: 30 His seed also will I make to endure for ever * and his throne as the days of heaven.
column3: His seed also will I make to endure for ever * and his throne as the days of heaven.

column2: 31 But if his children forsake my law * and walk not in my judgements;
column3: But if his children forsake my law * and walk not in my judgements;

column2: 32 If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments * I will visit their offences with the rod, and their sin with scourges.
column3: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments * I will visit their offences with the rod, and their sin with scourges.

column2: 33 Nevertheless, my loving-kindness will I not utterly take from him * nor suffer my truth to fail.
column3: Nevertheless, my loving-kindness will I not utterly take from him * nor suffer my truth to fail.

column2: 34 My covenant I will not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips * I have sworn once by my holiness, that I will not fail David.
column3: My covenant I will not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips * I have sworn once by my holiness, that I will not fail David.

column2: 35 His seed shall endure for ever * and his seat is like as the sun before me.
column3: His seed shall endure for ever * and his seat is like as the sun before me.

column2: 36 He shall stand fast for evermore as the moon * and as the faithful witness in heaven.
column3: He shall stand fast for evermore as the moon * and as the faithful witness in heaven.

column2: 37 But thou hast abhorred and forsaken thine Anointed * and art displeased at him.
column3: But thou hast abhorred and forsaken thine Anointed * and art displeased at him.

column2: 38 Thou hast broken the covenant of thy servant * and cast his crown to the ground.
column3: Thou hast broken the covenant of thy servant * and cast his crown to the ground.

column2: 39 Thou hast overthrown all his hedges * and broken down his strong holds.
column3: Thou hast overthrown all his hedges * and broken down his strong holds.

column2: 40 All they that go by spoil him * and he is become a reproach to his neighbours.
column3: All they that go by spoil him * and he is become a reproach to his neighbours.

column2: 41 Thou hast set up the right hand of his enemies * and made all his adversaries to rejoice.
column3: Thou hast set up the right hand of his enemies * and made all his adversaries to rejoice.

column2: 42 Thou hast taken away the edge of his sword * and givest him not victory in the battle.
column3: Thou hast taken away the edge of his sword * and givest him not victory in the battle.

column2: 43 Thou hast put out his glory * and cast his throne down to the ground.
column3: Thou hast put out his glory * and cast his throne down to the ground.

column2: 44 The days of his youth hast thou shortened * and covered him with dishonour.
column3: The days of his youth hast thou shortened * and covered him with dishonour.

column2: 45 Lord, how long wilt thou hide thyself, for ever * and shall thy wrath burn like fire?
column3: Lord, how long wilt thou hide thyself, for ever * and shall thy wrath burn like fire?

column2: 46 O remember how short my time is * wherefore hast thou made all men for nought?
column3: O remember how short my time is * wherefore hast thou made all men for nought?

column2: 47 What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death * and shall he deliver his soul from the hand of hell?
column3: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death * and shall he deliver his soul from the hand of hell?

column2: 48 Lord, where are thy old loving-kindnesses * which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?
column3: Lord, where are thy old loving-kindnesses * which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

column2: 49 Remember, Lord, the rebuke that thy servants have * and how I do bear in my bosom the rebukes of many people.
column3: Remember, Lord, the rebuke that thy servants have * and how I do bear in my bosom the rebukes of many people.

column2: 50 Wherewith thine enemies have blasphemed thee, and slandered the footsteps of thine Anointed * Praised be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
column3: Wherewith thine enemies have blasphemed thee, and slandered the footsteps of thine Anointed * Praised be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.

column2: Psalm 90. Domine, refugium.
column3: Psalm 90. Domine, refugium.

column2: 1 LORD, thou hast been our refuge * from one generation to another.
column3: LORD, thou hast been our refuge * from one generation to another.

column2: 2 Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever the earth and the world were made * thou art God from everlasting, and world without end.
column3: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever the earth and the world were made * thou art God from everlasting, and world without end.

column2: 3 Thou turnest man to destruction * again thou sayest, Come again, ye children of men.
column3: Thou turnest man to destruction * again thou sayest, Come again, ye children of men.

column2: 4 For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday * seeing that is past as a watch in the night.
column3: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday * seeing that is past as a watch in the night.

column2: 5 As soon as thou scatterest them they are even as a sleep * and fade away suddenly like the grass.
column3: As soon as thou scatterest them they are even as a sleep * and fade away suddenly like the grass.

column2: 6 In the morning it is green, and groweth up * but in the evening it is cut down, dried up, and withered.
column3: In the morning it is green, and groweth up * but in the evening it is cut down, dried up, and withered.

column2: 7 For we consume away in thy displeasure * and are afraid at thy wrathful indignation.
column3: For we consume away in thy displeasure * and are afraid at thy wrathful indignation.

column2: 8 Thou hast set our misdeeds before thee * and our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
column3: Thou hast set our misdeeds before thee * and our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.

column2: 9 For when thou art angry all our days are gone * we bring our years to an end, as it were a tale that is told.
column3: For when thou art angry all our days are gone * we bring our years to an end, as it were a tale that is told.

column2: 10 The days of our age are threescore years and ten; and though men be so strong that they come to fourscore years * yet is their strength then but labour and sorrow; so soon passeth it away, and we are gone.
column3: The days of our age are threescore years and ten; and though men be so strong that they come to fourscore years * yet is their strength then but labour and sorrow; so soon passeth it away, and we are gone.

column2: 11 But who regardeth the power of thy wrath * for even thereafter as a man feareth, so is thy displeasure.
column3: But who regardeth the power of thy wrath * for even thereafter as a man feareth, so is thy displeasure.

column2: 12 So teach us to number our days * that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
column3: So teach us to number our days * that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.

column2: 13 Turn thee again, O Lord, at the last * and be gracious unto thy servants.
column3: Turn thee again, O Lord, at the last * and be gracious unto thy servants.

column2: 14 O satisfy us with thy mercy, and that soon * so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.
column3: O satisfy us with thy mercy, and that soon * so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.

column2: 15 Comfort us again now after the time that thou hast plagued us * and for the years wherein we have suffered adversity.
column3: Comfort us again now after the time that thou hast plagued us * and for the years wherein we have suffered adversity.

column2: 16 Shew thy servants thy work * and their children thy glory.
column3: Shew thy servants thy work * and their children thy glory.

column2: 17 And the glorious majesty of the Lord our God be upon us * prosper thou the work of our hands upon us, O prosper thou our handywork.
column3: And the glorious majesty of the Lord our God be upon us * prosper thou the work of our hands upon us, O prosper thou our handywork.

column2: Psalm 91. Qui habitat.
column3: Psalm 91. Qui habitat.

column2: 1 WHOSO dwelleth under the defence of the most High * shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
column3: WHOSO dwelleth under the defence of the most High * shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

column2: 2 I will say unto the Lord, Thou art my hope, and my strong hold * my God, in him will I trust.
column3: I will say unto the Lord, Thou art my hope, and my strong hold * my God, in him will I trust.

column2: 3 For he shall deliver thee from the snare of the hunter * and from the noisome pestilence.
column3: For he shall deliver thee from the snare of the hunter * and from the noisome pestilence.

column2: 4 He shall defend thee under his wings, and thou shalt be safe under his feathers * his faithfulness and truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
column3: He shall defend thee under his wings, and thou shalt be safe under his feathers * his faithfulness and truth shall be thy shield and buckler.

column2: 5 Thou shalt not be afraid for any terror by night * nor for the arrow that flieth by day;
column3: Thou shalt not be afraid for any terror by night * nor for the arrow that flieth by day;

column2: 6 For the pestilence that walketh in darkness * nor for the sickness that destroyeth in the noon-day.
column3: For the pestilence that walketh in darkness * nor for the sickness that destroyeth in the noon-day.

column2: 7 A thousand shall fall beside thee, and ten thousand at thy right hand * but it shall not come nigh thee.
column3: A thousand shall fall beside thee, and ten thousand at thy right hand * but it shall not come nigh thee.

column2: 8 Yea, with thine eyes shalt thou behold * and see the reward of the ungodly.
column3: Yea, with thine eyes shalt thou behold * and see the reward of the ungodly.

column2: 9 For thou, Lord, art my hope * thou hast set thine house of defence very high.
column3: For thou, Lord, art my hope * thou hast set thine house of defence very high.

column2: 10 There shall no evil happen unto thee * neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.
column3: There shall no evil happen unto thee * neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.

column2: 11 For he shall give his angels charge over thee * to keep thee in all thy ways.
column3: For he shall give his angels charge over thee * to keep thee in all thy ways.

column2: 12 They shall bear thee in their hands * that thou hurt not thy foot against a stone.
column3: They shall bear thee in their hands * that thou hurt not thy foot against a stone.

column2: 13 Thou shalt go upon the lion and adder * the young lion and the dragon shalt thou tread under thy feet.
column3: Thou shalt go upon the lion and adder * the young lion and the dragon shalt thou tread under thy feet.

column2: 14 Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him * I will set him up, because he hath known my Name.
column3: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him * I will set him up, because he hath known my Name.

column2: 15 He shall call upon me, and I will hear him * yea, I am with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and bring him to honour.
column3: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him * yea, I am with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and bring him to honour.

column2: 16 With long life will I satisfy him * and shew him my salvation.
column3: With long life will I satisfy him * and shew him my salvation.

column2: Psalm 92. Bonum est confiteri.
column3: Psalm 92. Bonum est confiteri.

column2: 1 IT IS a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord * and to sing praises unto thy Name, O most Highest;
column3: IT IS a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord * and to sing praises unto thy Name, O most Highest;

column2: 2 To tell of thy loving-kindness early in the morning * and of thy truth in the night-season;
column3: To tell of thy loving-kindness early in the morning * and of thy truth in the night-season;

column2: 3 Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the lute * upon a loud instrument, and upon the harp.
column3: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the lute * upon a loud instrument, and upon the harp.

column2: 4 For thou, Lord, hast made me glad through thy works * and I will rejoice in giving praise for the operations of thy hands.
column3: For thou, Lord, hast made me glad through thy works * and I will rejoice in giving praise for the operations of thy hands.

column2: 5 O Lord, how glorious are thy works * thy thoughts are very deep.
column3: O Lord, how glorious are thy works * thy thoughts are very deep.

column2: 6 An unwise man doth not well consider this * and a fool doth not understand it.
column3: An unwise man doth not well consider this * and a fool doth not understand it.

column2: 7 When the ungodly are green as the grass, and when all the workers of wickedness do flourish * then shall they be destroyed for ever; but thou, Lord, art the most Highest for evermore.
column3: When the ungodly are green as the grass, and when all the workers of wickedness do flourish * then shall they be destroyed for ever; but thou, Lord, art the most Highest for evermore.

column2: 8 For lo, thine enemies, O Lord, lo, thine enemies shall perish * and all the workers of wickedness shall be destroyed.
column3: For lo, thine enemies, O Lord, lo, thine enemies shall perish * and all the workers of wickedness shall be destroyed.

column2: 9 But mine horn shall be exalted like the horn of an unicorn * for I am anointed with fresh oil.
column3: But mine horn shall be exalted like the horn of an unicorn * for I am anointed with fresh oil.

column2: 10 Mine eye also shall see his lust of mine enemies * and mine ear shall hear his desire of the wicked that arise up against me.
column3: Mine eye also shall see his lust of mine enemies * and mine ear shall hear his desire of the wicked that arise up against me.

column2: 11 The righteous shall flourish like a palm-tree * and shall spread abroad like a cedar in Libanus.
column3: The righteous shall flourish like a palm-tree * and shall spread abroad like a cedar in Libanus.

column2: 12 Such as are planted in the house of the Lord * shall flourish in the courts of the house of our God.
column3: Such as are planted in the house of the Lord * shall flourish in the courts of the house of our God.

column2: 13 They also shall bring forth more fruit in their age * and shall be fat and well-liking.
column3: They also shall bring forth more fruit in their age * and shall be fat and well-liking.

column2: 14 That they may shew how true the Lord my strength is * and that there is no unrighteousness in him.
column3: That they may shew how true the Lord my strength is * and that there is no unrighteousness in him.

column2: Psalm 93. Dominus regnavit.
column3: Psalm 93. Dominus regnavit.

column2: 1 THE Lord is King, and hath put on glorious apparel * the Lord hath put on his apparel, and girded himself with strength.
column3: THE Lord is King, and hath put on glorious apparel * the Lord hath put on his apparel, and girded himself with strength.

column2: 2 He hath made the round world so sure * that it cannot be moved.
column3: He hath made the round world so sure * that it cannot be moved.

column2: 3 Ever since the world began hath thy seat been prepared * thou art from everlasting.
column3: Ever since the world began hath thy seat been prepared * thou art from everlasting.

column2: 4 The floods are risen, O Lord, the floods have lift up their voice * the floods lift up their waves.
column3: The floods are risen, O Lord, the floods have lift up their voice * the floods lift up their waves.

column2: 5 The waves of the sea are mighty, and rage horribly * but yet the Lord, who dwelleth on high, is mightier.
column3: The waves of the sea are mighty, and rage horribly * but yet the Lord, who dwelleth on high, is mightier.

column2: 6 Thy testimonies, O Lord, are very sure * holiness becometh thine house for ever.
column3: Thy testimonies, O Lord, are very sure * holiness becometh thine house for ever.

column2: Psalm 94. Deus ultionum.
column3: Psalm 94. Deus ultionum.

column2: 1 O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth * thou God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.
column3: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth * thou God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

column2: 2 Arise, thou Judge of the world * and reward the proud after their deserving.
column3: Arise, thou Judge of the world * and reward the proud after their deserving.

column2: 3 Lord, how long shall the ungodly * how long shall the ungodly triumph?
column3: Lord, how long shall the ungodly * how long shall the ungodly triumph?

column2: 4 How long shall all wicked doers speak so disdainfully * and make such proud boasting?
column3: How long shall all wicked doers speak so disdainfully * and make such proud boasting?

column2: 5 They smite down thy people, O Lord * and trouble thine heritage.
column3: They smite down thy people, O Lord * and trouble thine heritage.

column2: 6 They murder the widow and the stranger * and put the fatherless to death.
column3: They murder the widow and the stranger * and put the fatherless to death.

column2: 7 And yet they say, Tush, the Lord shall not see * neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.
column3: And yet they say, Tush, the Lord shall not see * neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.

column2: 8 Take heed, ye unwise among the people * O ye fools, when will ye understand?
column3: Take heed, ye unwise among the people * O ye fools, when will ye understand?

column2: 9 He that planted the ear, shall he not hear * or he that made the eye, shall he not see?
column3: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear * or he that made the eye, shall he not see?

column2: 10 Or he that nurtureth the heathen * it is he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he punish?
column3: Or he that nurtureth the heathen * it is he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he punish?

column2: 11 The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man * that they are but vain.
column3: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man * that they are but vain.

column2: 12 Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Lord * and teachest him in thy law;
column3: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Lord * and teachest him in thy law;

column2: 13 That thou mayest give him patience in time of adversity * until the pit be digged up for the ungodly.
column3: That thou mayest give him patience in time of adversity * until the pit be digged up for the ungodly.

column2: 14 For the Lord will not fail his people * neither will he forsake his inheritance;
column3: For the Lord will not fail his people * neither will he forsake his inheritance;

column2: 15 Until righteousness turn again unto judgement * all such as are true in heart shall follow it.
column3: Until righteousness turn again unto judgement * all such as are true in heart shall follow it.

column2: 16 Who will rise up with me against the wicked * or who will take my part against the evil-doers?
column3: Who will rise up with me against the wicked * or who will take my part against the evil-doers?

column2: 17 If the Lord had not helped me * it had not failed but my soul had been put to silence.
column3: If the Lord had not helped me * it had not failed but my soul had been put to silence.

column2: 18 But when I said, My foot hath slipt * thy mercy, O Lord, held me up.
column3: But when I said, My foot hath slipt * thy mercy, O Lord, held me up.

column2: 19 In the multitude of the sorrows that I had in my heart * thy comforts have refreshed my soul.
column3: In the multitude of the sorrows that I had in my heart * thy comforts have refreshed my soul.

column2: 20 Wilt thou have any thing to do with the stool of wickedness * which imagineth mischief as a law?
column3: Wilt thou have any thing to do with the stool of wickedness * which imagineth mischief as a law?

column2: 21 They gather them together against the soul of the righteous * and condemn the innocent blood.
column3: They gather them together against the soul of the righteous * and condemn the innocent blood.

column2: 22 But the Lord is my refuge * and my God is the strength of my confidence.
column3: But the Lord is my refuge * and my God is the strength of my confidence.

column2: 23 He shall recompense them their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice * yea, the Lord our God shall destroy them.
column3: He shall recompense them their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice * yea, the Lord our God shall destroy them.

column2: Psalm 95. Venite, exultemus.
column3: Psalm 95. Venite, exultemus.

column2: 1 O COME, let us sing unto the Lord * let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.
column3: O COME, let us sing unto the Lord * let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

column2: 2 Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving * and shew ourselves glad in him with psalms.
column3: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving * and shew ourselves glad in him with psalms.

column2: 3 For the Lord is a great God * and a great King above all gods.
column3: For the Lord is a great God * and a great King above all gods.

column2: 4 In his hand are all the corners of the earth * and the strength of the hills is his also.
column3: In his hand are all the corners of the earth * and the strength of the hills is his also.

column2: 5 The sea is his, and he made it * and his hands prepared the dry land.
column3: The sea is his, and he made it * and his hands prepared the dry land.

column2: 6 O come, let us worship and fall down * and kneel before the Lord our Maker.
column3: O come, let us worship and fall down * and kneel before the Lord our Maker.

column2: 7 For he is the Lord our God * and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.
column3: For he is the Lord our God * and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.

column2: 8 To-day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts * as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness.
column3: To-day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts * as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness.

column2: 9 When your fathers tempted me * proved me, and saw my works.
column3: When your fathers tempted me * proved me, and saw my works.

column2: 10 Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said * It is a people that do err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways;
column3: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said * It is a people that do err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways;

column2: 11 Unto whom I sware in my wrath * that they should not enter into my rest.
column3: Unto whom I sware in my wrath * that they should not enter into my rest.

column2: Psalm 96. Cantate Domino.
column3: Psalm 96. Cantate Domino.

column2: 1 O SING unto the Lord a new song * sing unto the Lord, all the whole earth.
column3: O SING unto the Lord a new song * sing unto the Lord, all the whole earth.

column2: 2 Sing unto the Lord, and praise his Name * be telling of his salvation from day to day.
column3: Sing unto the Lord, and praise his Name * be telling of his salvation from day to day.

column2: 3 Declare his honour unto the heathen * and his wonders unto all people.
column3: Declare his honour unto the heathen * and his wonders unto all people.

column2: 4 For the Lord is great, and cannot worthily be praised * he is more to be feared than all gods.
column3: For the Lord is great, and cannot worthily be praised * he is more to be feared than all gods.

column2: 5 As for all the gods of the heathen, they are but idols * but it is the Lord that made the heavens.
column3: As for all the gods of the heathen, they are but idols * but it is the Lord that made the heavens.

column2: 6 Glory and worship are before him * power and honour are in his sanctuary.
column3: Glory and worship are before him * power and honour are in his sanctuary.

column2: 7 Ascribe unto the Lord, O ye kindreds of the people * ascribe unto the Lord worship and power.
column3: Ascribe unto the Lord, O ye kindreds of the people * ascribe unto the Lord worship and power.

column2: 8 Ascribe unto the Lord the honour due unto his Name * bring presents, and come into his courts.
column3: Ascribe unto the Lord the honour due unto his Name * bring presents, and come into his courts.

column2: 9 O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness * let the whole earth stand in awe of him.
column3: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness * let the whole earth stand in awe of him.

column2: 10 Tell it out among the heathen that the Lord is King * and that it is he who hath made the round world so fast that it cannot be moved; and how that he shall judge the people righteously.
column3: Tell it out among the heathen that the Lord is King * and that it is he who hath made the round world so fast that it cannot be moved; and how that he shall judge the people righteously.

column2: 11 Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad * let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is.
column3: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad * let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is.

column2: 12 Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it * then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the Lord.
column3: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it * then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the Lord.

column2: 13 For he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth * and with righteousness to judge the world, and the people with his truth.
column3: For he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth * and with righteousness to judge the world, and the people with his truth.

column2: Psalm 97. Dominus regnavit.
column3: Psalm 97. Dominus regnavit.

column2: 1 THE Lord is King, the earth may be glad thereof * yea, the multitude of the isles may be glad thereof.
column3: THE Lord is King, the earth may be glad thereof * yea, the multitude of the isles may be glad thereof.

column2: 2 Clouds and darkness are round about him * righteousness and judgement are the habitation of his seat.
column3: Clouds and darkness are round about him * righteousness and judgement are the habitation of his seat.

column2: 3 There shall go a fire before him * and burn up his enemies on every side.
column3: There shall go a fire before him * and burn up his enemies on every side.

column2: 4 His lightnings gave shine unto the world * the earth saw it, and was afraid.
column3: His lightnings gave shine unto the world * the earth saw it, and was afraid.

column2: 5 The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord * at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
column3: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord * at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

column2: 6 The heavens have declared his righteousness * and all the people have seen his glory.
column3: The heavens have declared his righteousness * and all the people have seen his glory.

column2: 7 Confounded be all they that worship carved images, and that delight in vain gods * worship him, all ye gods.
column3: Confounded be all they that worship carved images, and that delight in vain gods * worship him, all ye gods.

column2: 8 Sion heard of it, and rejoiced * and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of thy judgements, O Lord.
column3: Sion heard of it, and rejoiced * and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of thy judgements, O Lord.

column2: 9 For thou, Lord, art higher than all that are in the earth * thou art exalted far above all gods.
column3: For thou, Lord, art higher than all that are in the earth * thou art exalted far above all gods.

column2: 10 O ye that love the Lord, see that ye hate the thing which is evil * the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints; he shall deliver them from the hand of the ungodly.
column3: O ye that love the Lord, see that ye hate the thing which is evil * the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints; he shall deliver them from the hand of the ungodly.

column2: 11 There is sprung up a light for the righteous * and joyful gladness for such as are true-hearted.
column3: There is sprung up a light for the righteous * and joyful gladness for such as are true-hearted.

column2: 12 Rejoice in the Lord, ye righteous * and give thanks for a remembrance of his holiness.
column3: Rejoice in the Lord, ye righteous * and give thanks for a remembrance of his holiness.

column2: Psalm 98. Cantate Domino.
column3: Psalm 98. Cantate Domino.

column2: 1 O SING unto the Lord a new song * for he hath done marvellous things.
column3: O SING unto the Lord a new song * for he hath done marvellous things.

column2: 2 With his own right hand, and with his holy arm * hath he gotten himself the victory.
column3: With his own right hand, and with his holy arm * hath he gotten himself the victory.

column2: 3 The Lord declared his salvation * his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.
column3: The Lord declared his salvation * his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.

column2: 4 He hath remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel * and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.
column3: He hath remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel * and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.

column2: 5 Shew yourselves joyful unto the Lord, all ye lands * sing, rejoice, and give thanks.
column3: Shew yourselves joyful unto the Lord, all ye lands * sing, rejoice, and give thanks.

column2: 6 Praise the Lord upon the harp * sing to the harp with a psalm of thanksgiving.
column3: Praise the Lord upon the harp * sing to the harp with a psalm of thanksgiving.

column2: 7 With trumpets also and shawms * O shew yourselves joyful before the Lord the King.
column3: With trumpets also and shawms * O shew yourselves joyful before the Lord the King.

column2: 8 Let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is * the round world, and they that dwell therein.
column3: Let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is * the round world, and they that dwell therein.

column2: 9 Let the floods clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the Lord * for he is come to judge the earth.
column3: Let the floods clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the Lord * for he is come to judge the earth.

column2: 10 With righteousness shall he judge the world * and the people with equity.
column3: With righteousness shall he judge the world * and the people with equity.

column2: Psalm 99. Dominus regnavit.
column3: Psalm 99. Dominus regnavit.

column2: 1 THE Lord is King, be the people never so unpatient * he sitteth between the cherubims, be the earth never so unquiet.
column3: THE Lord is King, be the people never so unpatient * he sitteth between the cherubims, be the earth never so unquiet.

column2: 2 The Lord is great in Sion * and high above all people.
column3: The Lord is great in Sion * and high above all people.

column2: 3 They shall give thanks unto thy Name * which is great, wonderful, and holy.
column3: They shall give thanks unto thy Name * which is great, wonderful, and holy.

column2: 4 The King's power loveth judgement; thou hast prepared equity * thou hast executed judgement and righteousness in Jacob.
column3: The King's power loveth judgement; thou hast prepared equity * thou hast executed judgement and righteousness in Jacob.

column2: 5 O magnify the Lord our God * and fall down before his footstool, for he is holy.
column3: O magnify the Lord our God * and fall down before his footstool, for he is holy.

column2: 6 Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among such as call upon his Name * these called upon the Lord, and he heard them.
column3: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among such as call upon his Name * these called upon the Lord, and he heard them.

column2: 7 He spake unto them out of the cloudy pillar * for they kept his testimonies, and the law that he gave them.
column3: He spake unto them out of the cloudy pillar * for they kept his testimonies, and the law that he gave them.

column2: 8 Thou heardest them, O Lord our God * thou forgavest them, O God, and punishedst their own inventions.
column3: Thou heardest them, O Lord our God * thou forgavest them, O God, and punishedst their own inventions.

column2: 9 O magnify the Lord our God, and worship him upon his holy hill * for the Lord our God is holy.
column3: O magnify the Lord our God, and worship him upon his holy hill * for the Lord our God is holy.

column2: Psalm 100. Jubilate Deo.
column3: Psalm 100. Jubilate Deo.

column2: 1 O BE joyful in the Lord, all ye lands * serve the Lord with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.
column3: O BE joyful in the Lord, all ye lands * serve the Lord with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.

column2: 2 Be ye sure that the Lord he is God * it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
column3: Be ye sure that the Lord he is God * it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

column2: 3 O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise * be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.
column3: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise * be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.

column2: 4 For the Lord is gracious, his mercy is everlasting * and his truth endureth from generation to generation.
column3: For the Lord is gracious, his mercy is everlasting * and his truth endureth from generation to generation.

column2: Psalm 101. Misericordiam et judicium.
column3: Psalm 101. Misericordiam et judicium.

column2: 1 MY SONG shall be of mercy and judgement * unto thee, O Lord, will I sing.
column3: MY SONG shall be of mercy and judgement * unto thee, O Lord, will I sing.

column2: 2 O let me have understanding * in the way of godliness.
column3: O let me have understanding * in the way of godliness.

column2: 3 When wilt thou come unto me * I will walk in my house with a perfect heart.
column3: When wilt thou come unto me * I will walk in my house with a perfect heart.

column2: 4 I will take no wicked thing in hand; I hate the sins of unfaithfulness * there shall no such cleave unto me.
column3: I will take no wicked thing in hand; I hate the sins of unfaithfulness * there shall no such cleave unto me.

column2: 5 A froward heart shall depart from me * I will not know a wicked person.
column3: A froward heart shall depart from me * I will not know a wicked person.

column2: 6 Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour * him will I destroy.
column3: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour * him will I destroy.

column2: 7 Whoso hath also a proud look and high stomach * I will not suffer him.
column3: Whoso hath also a proud look and high stomach * I will not suffer him.

column2: 8 Mine eyes look upon such as are faithful in the land * that they may dwell with me.
column3: Mine eyes look upon such as are faithful in the land * that they may dwell with me.

column2: 9 Whoso leadeth a godly life * he shall be my servant.
column3: Whoso leadeth a godly life * he shall be my servant.

column2: 10 There shall no deceitful person dwell in my house * he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.
column3: There shall no deceitful person dwell in my house * he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.

column2: 11 I shall soon destroy all the ungodly that are in the land * that I may root out all wicked doers from the city of the Lord.
column3: I shall soon destroy all the ungodly that are in the land * that I may root out all wicked doers from the city of the Lord.

column2: Psalm 102. Domine, exaudi.
column3: Psalm 102. Domine, exaudi.

column2: 1 HEAR my prayer, O Lord * and let my crying come unto thee.
column3: HEAR my prayer, O Lord * and let my crying come unto thee.

column2: 2 Hide not thy face from me in the time of my trouble * incline thine ear unto me when I call; O hear me, and that right soon.
column3: Hide not thy face from me in the time of my trouble * incline thine ear unto me when I call; O hear me, and that right soon.

column2: 3 For my days are consumed away like smoke * and my bones are burnt up as it were a firebrand.
column3: For my days are consumed away like smoke * and my bones are burnt up as it were a firebrand.

column2: 4 My heart is smitten down, and withered liked grass * so that I forget to eat my bread.
column3: My heart is smitten down, and withered liked grass * so that I forget to eat my bread.

column2: 5 For the voice of my groaning * my bones will scarce cleave to my flesh.
column3: For the voice of my groaning * my bones will scarce cleave to my flesh.

column2: 6 I am become like a pelican in the wilderness * and like an owl that is in the desert.
column3: I am become like a pelican in the wilderness * and like an owl that is in the desert.

column2: 7 I have watched, and am even as it were a sparrow * that sitteth alone upon the house-top.
column3: I have watched, and am even as it were a sparrow * that sitteth alone upon the house-top.

column2: 8 Mine enemies revile me all the day long * and they that are mad upon me are sworn together against me.
column3: Mine enemies revile me all the day long * and they that are mad upon me are sworn together against me.

column2: 9 For I have eaten ashes as it were bread * and mingled my drink with weeping;
column3: For I have eaten ashes as it were bread * and mingled my drink with weeping;

column2: 10 And that because of thine indignation and wrath * for thou hast taken me up, and cast me down.
column3: And that because of thine indignation and wrath * for thou hast taken me up, and cast me down.

column2: 11 My days are gone like a shadow * and I am withered like grass.
column3: My days are gone like a shadow * and I am withered like grass.

column2: 12 But thou, O Lord, shalt endure for ever * and thy remembrance throughout all generations.
column3: But thou, O Lord, shalt endure for ever * and thy remembrance throughout all generations.

column2: 13 Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Sion * for it is time that thou have mercy upon her, yea, the time is come.
column3: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Sion * for it is time that thou have mercy upon her, yea, the time is come.

column2: 14 And why? thy servants think upon her stones * and it pitieth them to see her in the dust.
column3: And why? thy servants think upon her stones * and it pitieth them to see her in the dust.

column2: 15 The heathen shall fear thy Name, O Lord * and all the kings of the earth thy majesty;
column3: The heathen shall fear thy Name, O Lord * and all the kings of the earth thy majesty;

column2: 16 When the Lord shall build up Sion * and when his glory shall appear;
column3: When the Lord shall build up Sion * and when his glory shall appear;

column2: 17 When he turneth him unto the prayer of the poor destitute * and despiseth not their desire.
column3: When he turneth him unto the prayer of the poor destitute * and despiseth not their desire.

column2: 18 This shall be written for those that come after * and the people which shall be born shall praise the Lord.
column3: This shall be written for those that come after * and the people which shall be born shall praise the Lord.

column2: 19 For he hath looked down from his sanctuary * out of the heaven did the Lord behold the earth;
column3: For he hath looked down from his sanctuary * out of the heaven did the Lord behold the earth;

column2: 20 That he might hear the mournings of such as are in captivity * and deliver the children appointed unto death;
column3: That he might hear the mournings of such as are in captivity * and deliver the children appointed unto death;

column2: 21 That they may declare the Name of the Lord in Sion * and his worship at Jerusalem;
column3: That they may declare the Name of the Lord in Sion * and his worship at Jerusalem;

column2: 22 When the people are gathered together * and the kingdoms also, to serve the Lord.
column3: When the people are gathered together * and the kingdoms also, to serve the Lord.

column2: 23 He brought down my strength in my journey * and shortened my days.
column3: He brought down my strength in my journey * and shortened my days.

column2: 24 But I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of mine age * as for thy years, they endure throughout all generations.
column3: But I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of mine age * as for thy years, they endure throughout all generations.

column2: 25 Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth * and the heavens are the work of thy hands.
column3: Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth * and the heavens are the work of thy hands.

column2: 26 They shall perish, but thou shalt endure * they all shall wax old as doth a garment;
column3: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure * they all shall wax old as doth a garment;

column2: 27 And as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed * but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.
column3: And as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed * but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.

column2: 28 The children of thy servants shall continue * and their seed shall stand fast in thy sight.
column3: The children of thy servants shall continue * and their seed shall stand fast in thy sight.

column2: Psalm 103. Benedic, anima mea.
column3: Psalm 103. Benedic, anima mea.

column2: 1 PRAISE the Lord, O my soul * and all that is within me praise his holy Name.
column3: PRAISE the Lord, O my soul * and all that is within me praise his holy Name.

column2: 2 Praise the Lord, O my soul * and forget not all his benefits;
column3: Praise the Lord, O my soul * and forget not all his benefits;

column2: 3 Who forgiveth all thy sin * and healeth all thine infirmities;
column3: Who forgiveth all thy sin * and healeth all thine infirmities;

column2: 4 Who saveth thy life from destruction * and crowneth thee with mercy and loving-kindness;
column3: Who saveth thy life from destruction * and crowneth thee with mercy and loving-kindness;

column2: 5 Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things * making thee young and lusty as an eagle.
column3: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things * making thee young and lusty as an eagle.

column2: 6 The Lord executeth righteousness and judgement * for all them that are oppressed with wrong.
column3: The Lord executeth righteousness and judgement * for all them that are oppressed with wrong.

column2: 7 He shewed his ways unto Moses * his works unto the children of Israel.
column3: He shewed his ways unto Moses * his works unto the children of Israel.

column2: 8 The Lord is full of compassion and mercy * long-suffering, and of great goodness.
column3: The Lord is full of compassion and mercy * long-suffering, and of great goodness.

column2: 9 He will not alway be chiding * neither keepeth he his anger for ever.
column3: He will not alway be chiding * neither keepeth he his anger for ever.

column2: 10 He hath not dealt with us after our sins * nor rewarded us according to our wickednesses.
column3: He hath not dealt with us after our sins * nor rewarded us according to our wickednesses.

column2: 11 For look how high the heaven is in comparison of the earth * so great is his mercy also toward them that fear him.
column3: For look how high the heaven is in comparison of the earth * so great is his mercy also toward them that fear him.

column2: 12 Look how wide also the east is from the west * so far hath he set our sins from us.
column3: Look how wide also the east is from the west * so far hath he set our sins from us.

column2: 13 Yea, like as a father pitieth his own children * even so is the Lord merciful unto them that fear him.
column3: Yea, like as a father pitieth his own children * even so is the Lord merciful unto them that fear him.

column2: 14 For he knoweth whereof we are made * he remembereth that we are but dust.
column3: For he knoweth whereof we are made * he remembereth that we are but dust.

column2: 15 The days of man are but as grass * for he flourisheth as a flower of the field.
column3: The days of man are but as grass * for he flourisheth as a flower of the field.

column2: 16 For as soon as the wind goeth over it, it is gone * and the place thereof shall know it no more.
column3: For as soon as the wind goeth over it, it is gone * and the place thereof shall know it no more.

column2: 17 But the merciful goodness of the Lord endureth for ever and ever upon them that fear him * and his righteousness upon children's children;
column3: But the merciful goodness of the Lord endureth for ever and ever upon them that fear him * and his righteousness upon children's children;

column2: 18 Even upon such as keep his covenant * and think upon his commandments to do them.
column3: Even upon such as keep his covenant * and think upon his commandments to do them.

column2: 19 The Lord hath prepared his seat in heaven * and his kingdom ruleth over all.
column3: The Lord hath prepared his seat in heaven * and his kingdom ruleth over all.

column2: 20 O praise the Lord, ye angels of his, ye that excel in strength * ye that fulfil his commandment, and hearken unto the voice of his words.
column3: O praise the Lord, ye angels of his, ye that excel in strength * ye that fulfil his commandment, and hearken unto the voice of his words.

column2: 21 O praise the Lord, all ye his hosts * ye servants of his that do his pleasure.
column3: O praise the Lord, all ye his hosts * ye servants of his that do his pleasure.

column2: 22 O speak good of the Lord, all ye works of his, in all places of his dominion * praise thou the Lord, O my soul.
column3: O speak good of the Lord, all ye works of his, in all places of his dominion * praise thou the Lord, O my soul.

column2: Psalm 104. Benedic, anima mea.
column3: Psalm 104. Benedic, anima mea.

column2: 1 PRAISE the Lord, O my soul * O Lord my God, thou art become exceeding glorious; thou art clothed with majesty and honour.
column3: PRAISE the Lord, O my soul * O Lord my God, thou art become exceeding glorious; thou art clothed with majesty and honour.

column2: 2 Thou deckest thyself with light as it were with a garment * and spreadest out the heavens like a curtain.
column3: Thou deckest thyself with light as it were with a garment * and spreadest out the heavens like a curtain.

column2: 3 Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters * and maketh the clouds his chariot, and walketh upon the wings of the wind.
column3: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters * and maketh the clouds his chariot, and walketh upon the wings of the wind.

column2: 4 He maketh his angels spirits * and his ministers a flaming fire.
column3: He maketh his angels spirits * and his ministers a flaming fire.

column2: 5 He laid the foundations of the earth * that it never should move at any time.
column3: He laid the foundations of the earth * that it never should move at any time.

column2: 6 Thou coveredst it with the deep like as with a garment * the waters stand in the hills.
column3: Thou coveredst it with the deep like as with a garment * the waters stand in the hills.

column2: 7 At thy rebuke they flee * at the voice of thy thunder they are afraid.
column3: At thy rebuke they flee * at the voice of thy thunder they are afraid.

column2: 8 They go up as high as the hills, and down to the valleys beneath * even unto the place which thou hast appointed for them.
column3: They go up as high as the hills, and down to the valleys beneath * even unto the place which thou hast appointed for them.

column2: 9 Thou hast set them their bounds which they shall not pass * neither turn again to cover the earth.
column3: Thou hast set them their bounds which they shall not pass * neither turn again to cover the earth.

column2: 10 He sendeth the springs into the rivers * which run among the hills.
column3: He sendeth the springs into the rivers * which run among the hills.

column2: 11 All beasts of the field drink thereof * and the wild asses quench their thirst.
column3: All beasts of the field drink thereof * and the wild asses quench their thirst.

column2: 12 Beside them shall the fowls of the air have their habitation * and sing among the branches.
column3: Beside them shall the fowls of the air have their habitation * and sing among the branches.

column2: 13 He watereth the hills from above * the earth is filled with the fruit of thy works.
column3: He watereth the hills from above * the earth is filled with the fruit of thy works.

column2: 14 He bringeth forth grass for the cattle * and green herb for the service of men;
column3: He bringeth forth grass for the cattle * and green herb for the service of men;

column2: 15 That he may bring food out of the earth, and wine that maketh glad the heart of man * and oil to make him a cheerful countenance, and bread to strengthen man's heart.
column3: That he may bring food out of the earth, and wine that maketh glad the heart of man * and oil to make him a cheerful countenance, and bread to strengthen man's heart.

column2: 16 The trees of the Lord also are full of sap * even the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted;
column3: The trees of the Lord also are full of sap * even the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted;

column2: 17 Wherein the birds make their nests * and the fir-trees are a dwelling for the stork.
column3: Wherein the birds make their nests * and the fir-trees are a dwelling for the stork.

column2: 18 The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats * and so are the stony rocks for the conies.
column3: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats * and so are the stony rocks for the conies.

column2: 19 He appointed the moon for certain seasons * and the sun knoweth his going down.
column3: He appointed the moon for certain seasons * and the sun knoweth his going down.

column2: 20 Thou makest darkness that it may be night * wherein all the beasts of the forest do move.
column3: Thou makest darkness that it may be night * wherein all the beasts of the forest do move.

column2: 21 The lions roaring after their prey * do seek their meat from God.
column3: The lions roaring after their prey * do seek their meat from God.

column2: 22 The sun ariseth, and they get them away together * and lay them down in their dens.
column3: The sun ariseth, and they get them away together * and lay them down in their dens.

column2: 23 Man goeth forth to his work, and to his labour * until the evening.
column3: Man goeth forth to his work, and to his labour * until the evening.

column2: 24 O Lord, how manifold are thy works * in wisdom hast thou made them all; the earth is full of thy riches.
column3: O Lord, how manifold are thy works * in wisdom hast thou made them all; the earth is full of thy riches.

column2: 25 So is the great and wide sea also * wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.
column3: So is the great and wide sea also * wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

column2: 26 There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan * whom thou hast made to take his pastime therein.
column3: There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan * whom thou hast made to take his pastime therein.

column2: 27 These wait all upon thee * that thou mayest give them meat in due season.
column3: These wait all upon thee * that thou mayest give them meat in due season.

column2: 28 When thou givest it them they gather it * and when thou openest thy hand they are filled with good.
column3: When thou givest it them they gather it * and when thou openest thy hand they are filled with good.

column2: 29 When thou hidest thy face they are troubled * when thou takest away their breath they die, and are turned again to their dust.
column3: When thou hidest thy face they are troubled * when thou takest away their breath they die, and are turned again to their dust.

column2: 30 When thou lettest thy breath go forth they shall be made * and thou shalt renew the face of the earth.
column3: When thou lettest thy breath go forth they shall be made * and thou shalt renew the face of the earth.

column2: 31 The glorious majesty of the Lord shall endure for ever * the Lord shall rejoice in his works.
column3: The glorious majesty of the Lord shall endure for ever * the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

column2: 32 The earth shall tremble at the look of him * if he do but touch the hills, they shall smoke.
column3: The earth shall tremble at the look of him * if he do but touch the hills, they shall smoke.

column2: 33 I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live * I will praise my God while I have my being.
column3: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live * I will praise my God while I have my being.

column2: 34 And so shall my words please him * my joy shall be in the Lord.
column3: And so shall my words please him * my joy shall be in the Lord.

column2: 35 As for sinners, they shall be consumed out of the earth, and the ungodly shall come to an end * praise thou the Lord, O my soul, praise the Lord.
column3: As for sinners, they shall be consumed out of the earth, and the ungodly shall come to an end * praise thou the Lord, O my soul, praise the Lord.

column2: Psalm 105. Confitemini Domino.
column3: Psalm 105. Confitemini Domino.

column2: 1 O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, and call upon his Name * tell the people what things he hath done.
column3: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, and call upon his Name * tell the people what things he hath done.

column2: 2 O let your songs be of him, and praise him * and let your talking be of all his wondrous works.
column3: O let your songs be of him, and praise him * and let your talking be of all his wondrous works.

column2: 3 Rejoice in his holy Name * let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.
column3: Rejoice in his holy Name * let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

column2: 4 Seek the Lord and his strength * seek his face evermore.
column3: Seek the Lord and his strength * seek his face evermore.

column2: 5 Remember the marvellous works that he hath done * his wonders, and the judgements of his mouth.
column3: Remember the marvellous works that he hath done * his wonders, and the judgements of his mouth.

column2: 6 O ye seed of Abraham his servant * ye children of Jacob his chosen.
column3: O ye seed of Abraham his servant * ye children of Jacob his chosen.

column2: 7 He is the Lord our God * his judgements are in all the world.
column3: He is the Lord our God * his judgements are in all the world.

column2: 8 He hath been alway mindful of his covenant and promise * that he made to a thousand generations;
column3: He hath been alway mindful of his covenant and promise * that he made to a thousand generations;

column2: 9 Even the covenant that he made with Abraham * and the oath that he sware unto Isaac;
column3: Even the covenant that he made with Abraham * and the oath that he sware unto Isaac;

column2: 10 And appointed the same unto Jacob for a law * and to Israel for an everlasting testament;
column3: And appointed the same unto Jacob for a law * and to Israel for an everlasting testament;

column2: 11 Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan * the lot of your inheritance;
column3: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan * the lot of your inheritance;

column2: 12 When there were yet but a few of them * and they strangers in the land;
column3: When there were yet but a few of them * and they strangers in the land;

column2: 13 What time as they went from one nation to another * from one kingdom to another people;
column3: What time as they went from one nation to another * from one kingdom to another people;

column2: 14 He suffered no man to do them wrong * but reproved even kings for their sakes;
column3: He suffered no man to do them wrong * but reproved even kings for their sakes;

column2: 15 Touch not mine Anointed * and do my prophets no harm.
column3: Touch not mine Anointed * and do my prophets no harm.

column2: 16 Moreover, he called for a dearth upon the land * and destroyed all the provision of bread.
column3: Moreover, he called for a dearth upon the land * and destroyed all the provision of bread.

column2: 17 But he had sent a man before them * even Joseph, who was sold to be a bond-servant;
column3: But he had sent a man before them * even Joseph, who was sold to be a bond-servant;

column2: 18 Whose feet they hurt in the stocks * the iron entered into his soul;
column3: Whose feet they hurt in the stocks * the iron entered into his soul;

column2: 19 Until the time came that his cause was known * the word of the Lord tried him.
column3: Until the time came that his cause was known * the word of the Lord tried him.

column2: 20 The king sent, and delivered him * the prince of the people let him go free.
column3: The king sent, and delivered him * the prince of the people let him go free.

column2: 21 He made him lord also of his house * and ruler of all his substance;
column3: He made him lord also of his house * and ruler of all his substance;

column2: 22 That he might inform his princes after his will * and teach his senators wisdom.
column3: That he might inform his princes after his will * and teach his senators wisdom.

column2: 23 Israel also came into Egypt * and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.
column3: Israel also came into Egypt * and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.

column2: 24 And he increased his people exceedingly * and made them stronger than their enemies;
column3: And he increased his people exceedingly * and made them stronger than their enemies;

column2: 25 Whose heart turned, so that they hated his people * and dealt untruly with his servants.
column3: Whose heart turned, so that they hated his people * and dealt untruly with his servants.

column2: 26 Then sent he Moses his servant * and Aaron whom he had chosen.
column3: Then sent he Moses his servant * and Aaron whom he had chosen.

column2: 27 And these shewed his tokens among them * and wonders in the land of Ham.
column3: And these shewed his tokens among them * and wonders in the land of Ham.

column2: 28 He sent darkness, and it was dark * and they were not obedient unto his word.
column3: He sent darkness, and it was dark * and they were not obedient unto his word.

column2: 29 He turned their waters into blood * and slew their fish.
column3: He turned their waters into blood * and slew their fish.

column2: 30 Their land brought forth frogs * yea, even in their kings' chambers.
column3: Their land brought forth frogs * yea, even in their kings' chambers.

column2: 31 He spake the word, and there came all manner of flies * and lice in all their quarters.
column3: He spake the word, and there came all manner of flies * and lice in all their quarters.

column2: 32 He gave them hail-stones for rain * and flames of fire in their land.
column3: He gave them hail-stones for rain * and flames of fire in their land.

column2: 33 He smote their vines also and fig-trees * and destroyed the trees that were in their coasts.
column3: He smote their vines also and fig-trees * and destroyed the trees that were in their coasts.

column2: 34 He spake the word, and the grasshoppers came, and caterpillars innumerable * and did eat up all the grass in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.
column3: He spake the word, and the grasshoppers came, and caterpillars innumerable * and did eat up all the grass in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

column2: 35 He smote all the first-born in their land * even the chief of all their strength.
column3: He smote all the first-born in their land * even the chief of all their strength.

column2: 36 He brought them forth also with silver and gold * there was not one feeble person among their tribes.
column3: He brought them forth also with silver and gold * there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

column2: 37 Egypt was glad at their departing * for they were afraid of them.
column3: Egypt was glad at their departing * for they were afraid of them.

column2: 38 He spread out a cloud to be a covering * and fire to give light in the night-season.
column3: He spread out a cloud to be a covering * and fire to give light in the night-season.

column2: 39 At their desire he brought quails * and he filled them with the bread of heaven.
column3: At their desire he brought quails * and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

column2: 40 He opened the rock of stone, and the waters flowed out * so that rivers ran in the dry places.
column3: He opened the rock of stone, and the waters flowed out * so that rivers ran in the dry places.

column2: 41 For why? he remembered his holy promise * and Abraham his servant.
column3: For why? he remembered his holy promise * and Abraham his servant.

column2: 42 And he brought forth his people with joy * and his chosen with gladness;
column3: And he brought forth his people with joy * and his chosen with gladness;

column2: 43 And gave them the lands of the heathen * and they took the labours of the people in possession;
column3: And gave them the lands of the heathen * and they took the labours of the people in possession;

column2: 44 That they might keep his statutes * and observe his laws.
column3: That they might keep his statutes * and observe his laws.

column2: Psalm 106. Confitemini Domino.
column3: Psalm 106. Confitemini Domino.

column2: 1 O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious * and his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious * and his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 2 Who can express the noble acts of the Lord * or shew forth all his praise?
column3: Who can express the noble acts of the Lord * or shew forth all his praise?

column2: 3 Blessed are they that alway keep judgement * and do righteousness.
column3: Blessed are they that alway keep judgement * and do righteousness.

column2: 4 Remember me, O Lord, according to the favour that thou bearest unto thy people * O visit me with thy salvation;
column3: Remember me, O Lord, according to the favour that thou bearest unto thy people * O visit me with thy salvation;

column2: 5 That I may see the felicity of thy chosen * and rejoice in the gladness of thy people, and give thanks with thine inheritance.
column3: That I may see the felicity of thy chosen * and rejoice in the gladness of thy people, and give thanks with thine inheritance.

column2: 6 We have sinned with our fathers * we have done amiss, and dealt wickedly.
column3: We have sinned with our fathers * we have done amiss, and dealt wickedly.

column2: 7 Our fathers regarded not thy wonders in Egypt, neither kept they thy great goodness in remembrance * but were disobedient at the sea, even at the Red sea.
column3: Our fathers regarded not thy wonders in Egypt, neither kept they thy great goodness in remembrance * but were disobedient at the sea, even at the Red sea.

column2: 8 Nevertheless, he helped them for his Name's sake * that he might make his power to be known.
column3: Nevertheless, he helped them for his Name's sake * that he might make his power to be known.

column2: 9 He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up * so he led them through the deep, as through a wilderness.
column3: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up * so he led them through the deep, as through a wilderness.

column2: 10 And he saved them from the adversaries' hand * and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.
column3: And he saved them from the adversaries' hand * and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.

column2: 11 As for those that troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them * there was not one of them left.
column3: As for those that troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them * there was not one of them left.

column2: 12 Then believed they his words * and sang praise unto him.
column3: Then believed they his words * and sang praise unto him.

column2: 13 But within a while they forgat his works * and would not abide his counsel.
column3: But within a while they forgat his works * and would not abide his counsel.

column2: 14 But lust came upon them in the wilderness * and they tempted God in the desert.
column3: But lust came upon them in the wilderness * and they tempted God in the desert.

column2: 15 And he gave them their desire * and sent leanness withal into their soul.
column3: And he gave them their desire * and sent leanness withal into their soul.

column2: 16 They angered Moses also in the tents * and Aaron the saint of the Lord.
column3: They angered Moses also in the tents * and Aaron the saint of the Lord.

column2: 17 So the earth opened, and swallowed up Dathan * and covered the congregation of Abiram.
column3: So the earth opened, and swallowed up Dathan * and covered the congregation of Abiram.

column2: 18 And the fire was kindled in their company * the flame burnt up the ungodly.
column3: And the fire was kindled in their company * the flame burnt up the ungodly.

column2: 19 They made a calf in Horeb * and worshipped the molten image.
column3: They made a calf in Horeb * and worshipped the molten image.

column2: 20 Thus they turned their glory * into the similitude of a calf that eateth hay.
column3: Thus they turned their glory * into the similitude of a calf that eateth hay.

column2: 21 And they forgat God their Saviour * who had done so great things in Egypt;
column3: And they forgat God their Saviour * who had done so great things in Egypt;

column2: 22 Wondrous works in the land of Ham * and fearful things by the Red sea.
column3: Wondrous works in the land of Ham * and fearful things by the Red sea.

column2: 23 So he said, he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the gap * to turn away his wrathful indignation, lest he should destroy them.
column3: So he said, he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the gap * to turn away his wrathful indignation, lest he should destroy them.

column2: 24 Yea, they thought scorn of that pleasant land * and gave no credence unto his word;
column3: Yea, they thought scorn of that pleasant land * and gave no credence unto his word;

column2: 25 But murmured in their tents * and hearkened not unto the voice of the lord.
column3: But murmured in their tents * and hearkened not unto the voice of the lord.

column2: 26 Then lift he up his hand against them * to overthrow them in the wilderness;
column3: Then lift he up his hand against them * to overthrow them in the wilderness;

column2: 27 To cast out their seed among the nations * and to scatter them in the lands.
column3: To cast out their seed among the nations * and to scatter them in the lands.

column2: 28 They joined themselves unto Baal-peor * and ate the offerings of the dead.
column3: They joined themselves unto Baal-peor * and ate the offerings of the dead.

column2: 29 Thus they provoked him to anger with their own inventions * and the plague was great among them.
column3: Thus they provoked him to anger with their own inventions * and the plague was great among them.

column2: 30 Then stood up Phinees and prayed * and so the plague ceased.
column3: Then stood up Phinees and prayed * and so the plague ceased.

column2: 31 And that was counted unto him for righteousness * among all posterities for evermore.
column3: And that was counted unto him for righteousness * among all posterities for evermore.

column2: 32 They angered him also at the waters of strife * so that he punished Moses for their sakes;
column3: They angered him also at the waters of strife * so that he punished Moses for their sakes;

column2: 33 Because they provoked his spirit * so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
column3: Because they provoked his spirit * so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

column2: 34 Neither destroyed they the heathen * as the Lord commanded them;
column3: Neither destroyed they the heathen * as the Lord commanded them;

column2: 35 But were mingled among the heathen * and learned their works.
column3: But were mingled among the heathen * and learned their works.

column2: 36 Insomuch that they worshipped their idols, which turned to their own decay * yea, they offered their sons and their daughters unto devils;
column3: Insomuch that they worshipped their idols, which turned to their own decay * yea, they offered their sons and their daughters unto devils;

column2: 37 And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters * whom they had offered unto the idols of Canaan; and the land was defiled with blood.
column3: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters * whom they had offered unto the idols of Canaan; and the land was defiled with blood.

column2: 38 Thus were they stained with their own works * and went a whoring with their own inventions.
column3: Thus were they stained with their own works * and went a whoring with their own inventions.

column2: 39 Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people * insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
column3: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people * insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

column2: 40 And he gave them over into the hands of the heathen * and they that hated them were lords over them.
column3: And he gave them over into the hands of the heathen * and they that hated them were lords over them.

column2: 41 Their enemies oppressed them * and had them in subjection.
column3: Their enemies oppressed them * and had them in subjection.

column2: 42 Many a time did he deliver them * but they rebelled against him with their own inventions, and were brought down in their wickedness.
column3: Many a time did he deliver them * but they rebelled against him with their own inventions, and were brought down in their wickedness.

column2: 43 Nevertheless, when he saw their adversity * he heard their complaint.
column3: Nevertheless, when he saw their adversity * he heard their complaint.

column2: 44 He thought upon his covenant, and pitied them according unto the multitude of his mercies * yea, he made all those that led them away captive to pity them.
column3: He thought upon his covenant, and pitied them according unto the multitude of his mercies * yea, he made all those that led them away captive to pity them.

column2: 45 Deliver us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen * that we may give thanks unto thy holy Name, and make our boast of thy praise.
column3: Deliver us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen * that we may give thanks unto thy holy Name, and make our boast of thy praise.

column2: 46 Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting and world without end * and let all the people say, Amen.
column3: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting and world without end * and let all the people say, Amen.

column2: Psalm 107. Confitemini Domino.
column3: Psalm 107. Confitemini Domino.

column2: 1 O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious * and his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious * and his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 2 Let them give thanks whom the Lord hath redeemed * and delivered from the hand of the enemy;
column3: Let them give thanks whom the Lord hath redeemed * and delivered from the hand of the enemy;

column2: 3 And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west * from the north and from the south.
column3: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west * from the north and from the south.

column2: 4 They went astray in the wilderness out of the way * and found no city to dwell in;
column3: They went astray in the wilderness out of the way * and found no city to dwell in;

column2: 5 Hungry and thirsty * their soul fainted in them.
column3: Hungry and thirsty * their soul fainted in them.

column2: 6 So they cried unto the Lord in their trouble * and he delivered them from their distress.
column3: So they cried unto the Lord in their trouble * and he delivered them from their distress.

column2: 7 He led them forth by the right way * that they might go to the city where they dwelt.
column3: He led them forth by the right way * that they might go to the city where they dwelt.

column2: 8 O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness * and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!
column3: O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness * and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

column2: 9 For he satisfieth the empty soul * and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
column3: For he satisfieth the empty soul * and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

column2: 10 Such as sit in darkness, and in the shadow of death * being fast bound in misery and iron ;
column3: Such as sit in darkness, and in the shadow of death * being fast bound in misery and iron ;

column2: 11 Because they rebelled against the words of the Lord * and lightly regarded the counsel of the most Highest;
column3: Because they rebelled against the words of the Lord * and lightly regarded the counsel of the most Highest;

column2: 12 He also brought down their heart through heaviness * they fell down, and there was none to help them.
column3: He also brought down their heart through heaviness * they fell down, and there was none to help them.

column2: 13 So when they cried unto the Lord in their trouble * he delivered them out of their distress.
column3: So when they cried unto the Lord in their trouble * he delivered them out of their distress.

column2: 14 For he brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death * and brake their bonds in sunder.
column3: For he brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death * and brake their bonds in sunder.
