column2: 15 O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness * and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!
column3: O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness * and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

column2: 16 For he hath broken the gates of brass * and smitten the bars of iron in sunder.
column3: For he hath broken the gates of brass * and smitten the bars of iron in sunder.

column2: 17 Foolish men are plagued for their offence * and because of their wickedness.
column3: Foolish men are plagued for their offence * and because of their wickedness.

column2: 18 Their soul abhorred all manner of meat * and they were even hard at death's door.
column3: Their soul abhorred all manner of meat * and they were even hard at death's door.

column2: 19 So when they cried unto the Lord in their trouble * he delivered them out of their distress.
column3: So when they cried unto the Lord in their trouble * he delivered them out of their distress.

column2: 20 He sent his word, and healed them * and they were saved from their destruction.
column3: He sent his word, and healed them * and they were saved from their destruction.

column2: 21 O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness * and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!
column3: O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness * and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

column2: 22 That they would offer unto him the sacrifice of thanksgiving * and tell out his works with gladness!
column3: That they would offer unto him the sacrifice of thanksgiving * and tell out his works with gladness!

column2: 23 They that go down to the sea in ships * and occupy their business in great waters;
column3: They that go down to the sea in ships * and occupy their business in great waters;

column2: 24 These men see the works of the Lord * and his wonders in the deep.
column3: These men see the works of the Lord * and his wonders in the deep.

column2: 25 For at his word the stormy wind ariseth * which lifteth up the waves thereof.
column3: For at his word the stormy wind ariseth * which lifteth up the waves thereof.

column2: 26 They are carried up to the heaven, and down again to the deep * their soul melteth away because of the trouble.
column3: They are carried up to the heaven, and down again to the deep * their soul melteth away because of the trouble.

column2: 27 They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man * and are at their wits' end.
column3: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man * and are at their wits' end.

column2: 28 So when they cry unto the Lord in their trouble * he delivereth them out of their distress.
column3: So when they cry unto the Lord in their trouble * he delivereth them out of their distress.

column2: 29 For he maketh the storm to cease * so that the waves thereof are still.
column3: For he maketh the storm to cease * so that the waves thereof are still.

column2: 30 Then are they glad, because they are at rest * and so he bringeth them unto the haven where they would be.
column3: Then are they glad, because they are at rest * and so he bringeth them unto the haven where they would be.

column2: 31 O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness * and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!
column3: O that men would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness * and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

column2: 32 That they would exalt him also in the congregation of the people * and praise him in the seat of the elders!
column3: That they would exalt him also in the congregation of the people * and praise him in the seat of the elders!

column2: 33 Who turneth the floods into a wilderness * and drieth up the water-springs.
column3: Who turneth the floods into a wilderness * and drieth up the water-springs.

column2: 34 A fruitful land maketh he barren * for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
column3: A fruitful land maketh he barren * for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

column2: 35 Again, he maketh the wilderness a standing water * and water-springs of a dry ground.
column3: Again, he maketh the wilderness a standing water * and water-springs of a dry ground.

column2: 36 And there he setteth the hungry * that they may build them a city to dwell in;
column3: And there he setteth the hungry * that they may build them a city to dwell in;

column2: 37 That they may sow their land, and plant vineyards * to yield them fruits of increase.
column3: That they may sow their land, and plant vineyards * to yield them fruits of increase.

column2: 38 He blesseth them so that they multiply exceedingly * and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
column3: He blesseth them so that they multiply exceedingly * and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

column2: 39 And again, when they are minished and brought low * through oppression, through any plague or trouble;
column3: And again, when they are minished and brought low * through oppression, through any plague or trouble;

column2: 40 Though he suffer them to be evil intreated through tyrants * and let them wander out of the way in the wilderness;
column3: Though he suffer them to be evil intreated through tyrants * and let them wander out of the way in the wilderness;

column2: 41 Yet helpeth he the poor out of misery * and maketh him households like a flock of sheep.
column3: Yet helpeth he the poor out of misery * and maketh him households like a flock of sheep.

column2: 42 The righteous will consider this, and rejoice * and the mouth of all wickedness shall be stopped.
column3: The righteous will consider this, and rejoice * and the mouth of all wickedness shall be stopped.

column2: 43 Whoso is wise will ponder these things * and they shall understand the loving-kindness of the Lord.
column3: Whoso is wise will ponder these things * and they shall understand the loving-kindness of the Lord.

column2: Psalm 108. Paratum cor meum.
column3: Psalm 108. Paratum cor meum.

column2: 1 O GOD, my heart is ready, my heart is ready * I will sing and give praise with the best member that I have.
column3: O GOD, my heart is ready, my heart is ready * I will sing and give praise with the best member that I have.

column2: 2 Awake, thou lute, and harp * I myself will awake right early.
column3: Awake, thou lute, and harp * I myself will awake right early.

column2: 3 I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the people * I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
column3: I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the people * I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

column2: 4 For thy mercy is greater than the heavens * and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.
column3: For thy mercy is greater than the heavens * and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.

column2: 5 Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens * and thy glory above all the earth.
column3: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens * and thy glory above all the earth.

column2: 6 That thy beloved may be delivered * let thy right hand save them, and hear thou me.
column3: That thy beloved may be delivered * let thy right hand save them, and hear thou me.

column2: 7 God hath spoken in his holiness * I will rejoice therefore, and divide Sichem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
column3: God hath spoken in his holiness * I will rejoice therefore, and divide Sichem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

column2: 8 Gilead is mine, and Manasses is mine * Ephraim also is the strength of my head.
column3: Gilead is mine, and Manasses is mine * Ephraim also is the strength of my head.

column2: 9 Judah is my law-giver, Moab is my wash-pot * over Edom will I cast out my shoe, upon Philistia will I triumph.
column3: Judah is my law-giver, Moab is my wash-pot * over Edom will I cast out my shoe, upon Philistia will I triumph.

column2: 10 Who will lead me into the strong city * and who will bring me into Edom?
column3: Who will lead me into the strong city * and who will bring me into Edom?

column2: 11 Hast not thou forsaken us, O God * and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?
column3: Hast not thou forsaken us, O God * and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

column2: 12 O help us against the enemy * for vain is the help of man.
column3: O help us against the enemy * for vain is the help of man.

column2: 13 Through God we shall do great acts * and it is he that shall tread down our enemies.
column3: Through God we shall do great acts * and it is he that shall tread down our enemies.

column2: Psalm 109. Deus, laudem.
column3: Psalm 109. Deus, laudem.

column2: 1 HOLD not thy tongue, O God of my praise * for the mouth of the ungodly, yea, the mouth of the deceitful is opened upon me.
column3: HOLD not thy tongue, O God of my praise * for the mouth of the ungodly, yea, the mouth of the deceitful is opened upon me.

column2: 2 And they have spoken against me with false tongues * they compassed me about also with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.
column3: And they have spoken against me with false tongues * they compassed me about also with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.

column2: 3 For the love that I had unto them, lo, they take now my contrary part * but I give myself unto prayer.
column3: For the love that I had unto them, lo, they take now my contrary part * but I give myself unto prayer.

column2: 4 Thus have they rewarded me evil for good * and hatred for my good will.
column3: Thus have they rewarded me evil for good * and hatred for my good will.

column2: 5 Set thou an ungodly man to be ruler over him * and let Satan stand at his right hand.
column3: Set thou an ungodly man to be ruler over him * and let Satan stand at his right hand.

column2: 6 When sentence is given upon him, let him be condemned * and let his prayer be turned into sin.
column3: When sentence is given upon him, let him be condemned * and let his prayer be turned into sin.

column2: 7 Let his days be few * and let another take his office.
column3: Let his days be few * and let another take his office.

column2: 8 Let his children be fatherless * and his wife a widow.
column3: Let his children be fatherless * and his wife a widow.

column2: 9 Let his children be vagabonds, and beg their bread * let them seek it also out of desolate places.
column3: Let his children be vagabonds, and beg their bread * let them seek it also out of desolate places.

column2: 10 Let the extortioner consume all that he hath * and let the stranger spoil his labour.
column3: Let the extortioner consume all that he hath * and let the stranger spoil his labour.

column2: 11 Let there be no man to pity him * nor to have compassion upon his fatherless children.
column3: Let there be no man to pity him * nor to have compassion upon his fatherless children.

column2: 12 Let his posterity be destroyed * and in the next generation let his name be clean put out.
column3: Let his posterity be destroyed * and in the next generation let his name be clean put out.

column2: 13 Let the wickedness of his fathers be had in remembrance in the sight of the Lord * and let not the sin of his mother be done away.
column3: Let the wickedness of his fathers be had in remembrance in the sight of the Lord * and let not the sin of his mother be done away.

column2: 14 Let them alway be before the Lord * that he may root out the memorial of them from off the earth.
column3: Let them alway be before the Lord * that he may root out the memorial of them from off the earth.

column2: 15 And that, because his mind was not to do good * but persecuted the poor helpless man, that he might slay him that was vexed at the heart.
column3: And that, because his mind was not to do good * but persecuted the poor helpless man, that he might slay him that was vexed at the heart.

column2: 16 His delight was in cursing, and it shall happen unto him * he loved not blessing, therefore shall it be far from him.
column3: His delight was in cursing, and it shall happen unto him * he loved not blessing, therefore shall it be far from him.

column2: 17 He clothed himself with cursing, like as with a raiment * and it shall come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.
column3: He clothed himself with cursing, like as with a raiment * and it shall come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

column2: 18 Let it be unto him as the cloke that he hath upon him * and as the girdle that he is alway girded withal.
column3: Let it be unto him as the cloke that he hath upon him * and as the girdle that he is alway girded withal.

column2: 19 Let it thus happen from the Lord unto mine enemies * and to those that speak evil against my soul.
column3: Let it thus happen from the Lord unto mine enemies * and to those that speak evil against my soul.

column2: 20 But deal thou with me, O Lord God, according unto thy Name * for sweet is thy mercy.
column3: But deal thou with me, O Lord God, according unto thy Name * for sweet is thy mercy.

column2: 21 O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor * and my heart is wounded within me.
column3: O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor * and my heart is wounded within me.

column2: 22 I go hence like the shadow that departeth * and am driven away as the grasshopper.
column3: I go hence like the shadow that departeth * and am driven away as the grasshopper.

column2: 23 My knees are weak through fasting * my flesh is dried up for want of fatness.
column3: My knees are weak through fasting * my flesh is dried up for want of fatness.

column2: 24 I became also a reproach unto them * they that looked upon me shaked their heads.
column3: I became also a reproach unto them * they that looked upon me shaked their heads.

column2: 25 Help me, O Lord my God * O save me according to thy mercy.
column3: Help me, O Lord my God * O save me according to thy mercy.

column2: 26 And they shall know, how that this is thy hand * and that thou, Lord, hast done it.
column3: And they shall know, how that this is thy hand * and that thou, Lord, hast done it.

column2: 27 Though they curse, yet bless thou * and let them be confounded that rise up against me; but let thy servant rejoice.
column3: Though they curse, yet bless thou * and let them be confounded that rise up against me; but let thy servant rejoice.

column2: 28 Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame * and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a cloke.
column3: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame * and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a cloke.

column2: 29 As for me, I will give great thanks unto the Lord with my mouth * and praise him among the multitude.
column3: As for me, I will give great thanks unto the Lord with my mouth * and praise him among the multitude.

column2: 30 For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor * to save his soul from the unrighteous judges.
column3: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor * to save his soul from the unrighteous judges.

column2: Psalm 110. Dixit Dominus.
column3: Psalm 110. Dixit Dominus.

column2: 1 THE Lord said unto my Lord * Sit thou on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
column3: THE Lord said unto my Lord * Sit thou on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

column2: 2 The Lord shall send the rod of thy power out of Sion * be thou ruler, even in the midst among thine enemies.
column3: The Lord shall send the rod of thy power out of Sion * be thou ruler, even in the midst among thine enemies.

column2: 3 In the day of thy power shall the people offer thee free-will offerings with an holy worship * the dew of thy birth is of the womb of the morning.
column3: In the day of thy power shall the people offer thee free-will offerings with an holy worship * the dew of thy birth is of the womb of the morning.

column2: 4 The Lord sware, and will not repent * Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedech.
column3: The Lord sware, and will not repent * Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedech.

column2: 5 The Lord upon thy right hand * shall wound even kings in the day of his wrath.
column3: The Lord upon thy right hand * shall wound even kings in the day of his wrath.

column2: 6 He shall judge among the heathen; he shall fill the places with the dead bodies * and smite in sunder the heads over divers countries.
column3: He shall judge among the heathen; he shall fill the places with the dead bodies * and smite in sunder the heads over divers countries.

column2: 7 He shall drink of the brook in the way * therefore shall he lift up his head.
column3: He shall drink of the brook in the way * therefore shall he lift up his head.

column2: Psalm 111. Confitebor tibi.
column3: Psalm 111. Confitebor tibi.

column2: 1 I WILL give thanks unto the Lord with my whole heart * secretly among the faithful, and in the congregation.
column3: I WILL give thanks unto the Lord with my whole heart * secretly among the faithful, and in the congregation.

column2: 2 The works of the Lord are great * sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.
column3: The works of the Lord are great * sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

column2: 3 His work is worthy to be praised and had in honour * and his righteousness endureth for ever.
column3: His work is worthy to be praised and had in honour * and his righteousness endureth for ever.

column2: 4 The merciful and gracious Lord hath so done his marvellous works * that they ought to be had in remembrance.
column3: The merciful and gracious Lord hath so done his marvellous works * that they ought to be had in remembrance.

column2: 5 He hath given meat unto them that fear him * he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.
column3: He hath given meat unto them that fear him * he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.

column2: 6 He hath shewed his people the power of his works * that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.
column3: He hath shewed his people the power of his works * that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

column2: 7 The works of his hands are verity and judgement * all his commandments are true.
column3: The works of his hands are verity and judgement * all his commandments are true.

column2: 8 They stand fast for ever and ever * and are done in truth and equity.
column3: They stand fast for ever and ever * and are done in truth and equity.

column2: 9 He sent redemption unto his people * he hath commanded his covenant for ever; holy and reverend is his Name.
column3: He sent redemption unto his people * he hath commanded his covenant for ever; holy and reverend is his Name.

column2: 10 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom * a good understanding have all they that do thereafter; the praise of it endureth for ever.
column3: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom * a good understanding have all they that do thereafter; the praise of it endureth for ever.

column2: Psalm 112. Beatus vir.
column3: Psalm 112. Beatus vir.

column2: 1 BLESSED is the man that feareth the Lord * he hath great delight in his commandments.
column3: BLESSED is the man that feareth the Lord * he hath great delight in his commandments.

column2: 2 His seed shall be mighty upon earth * the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.
column3: His seed shall be mighty upon earth * the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.

column2: 3 Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house * and his righteousness endureth for ever.
column3: Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house * and his righteousness endureth for ever.

column2: 4 Unto the godly there ariseth up light in the darkness * he is merciful, loving, and righteous.
column3: Unto the godly there ariseth up light in the darkness * he is merciful, loving, and righteous.

column2: 5 A good man is merciful, and lendeth * and will guide his words with discretion.
column3: A good man is merciful, and lendeth * and will guide his words with discretion.

column2: 6 For he shall never be moved * and the righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance.
column3: For he shall never be moved * and the righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance.

column2: 7 He will not be afraid of any evil tidings * for his heart standeth fast, and believeth in the Lord.
column3: He will not be afraid of any evil tidings * for his heart standeth fast, and believeth in the Lord.

column2: 8 His heart is established, and will not shrink * until he see his desire upon his enemies.
column3: His heart is established, and will not shrink * until he see his desire upon his enemies.

column2: 9 He hath dispersed abroad, and given to the poor * and his righteousness remaineth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.
column3: He hath dispersed abroad, and given to the poor * and his righteousness remaineth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

column2: 10 The ungodly shall see it, and it shall grieve him * he shall gnash with his teeth, and consume away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.
column3: The ungodly shall see it, and it shall grieve him * he shall gnash with his teeth, and consume away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.

column2: Psalm 113. Laudate, pueri.
column3: Psalm 113. Laudate, pueri.

column2: 1 PRAISE the Lord, ye servants * O praise the Name of the Lord.
column3: PRAISE the Lord, ye servants * O praise the Name of the Lord.

column2: 2 Blessed be the Name of the Lord * from this time forth for evermore.
column3: Blessed be the Name of the Lord * from this time forth for evermore.

column2: 3 The Lord's Name is praised * from the rising up of the sun unto the going down of the same.
column3: The Lord's Name is praised * from the rising up of the sun unto the going down of the same.

column2: 4 The Lord is high above all heathen * and his glory above the heavens.
column3: The Lord is high above all heathen * and his glory above the heavens.

column2: 5 Who is like unto the Lord our God, that hath his dwelling so high * and yet humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth?
column3: Who is like unto the Lord our God, that hath his dwelling so high * and yet humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth?

column2: 6 He taketh up the simple out of the dust * and lifteth the poor out of the mire;
column3: He taketh up the simple out of the dust * and lifteth the poor out of the mire;

column2: 7 That he may set him with the princes * even with the princes of his people.
column3: That he may set him with the princes * even with the princes of his people.

column2: 8 He maketh the barren woman to keep house * and to be a joyful mother of children.
column3: He maketh the barren woman to keep house * and to be a joyful mother of children.

column2: Psalm 114. In exitu Israel.
column3: Psalm 114. In exitu Israel.

column2: 1 WHEN Israel came out of Egypt * and the house of Jacob from among the strange people,
column3: WHEN Israel came out of Egypt * and the house of Jacob from among the strange people,

column2: 2 Judah was his sanctuary * and Israel his dominion.
column3: Judah was his sanctuary * and Israel his dominion.

column2: 3 The sea saw that, and fled * Jordan was driven back.
column3: The sea saw that, and fled * Jordan was driven back.

column2: 4 The mountains skipped like rams * and the little hills like young sheep.
column3: The mountains skipped like rams * and the little hills like young sheep.

column2: 5 What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest * and thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?
column3: What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest * and thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

column2: 6 Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams * and ye little hills, like young sheep?
column3: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams * and ye little hills, like young sheep?

column2: 7 Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord * at the presence of the God of Jacob;
column3: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord * at the presence of the God of Jacob;

column2: 8 Who turned the hard rock into a standing water * and the flint-stone into a springing well.
column3: Who turned the hard rock into a standing water * and the flint-stone into a springing well.

column2: Psalm 115. Non nobis, Domine.
column3: Psalm 115. Non nobis, Domine.

column2: 1 NOT unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto thy Name give the praise * for thy loving mercy and for thy truth's sake.
column3: NOT unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto thy Name give the praise * for thy loving mercy and for thy truth's sake.

column2: 2 Wherefore shall the heathen say * Where is now their God?
column3: Wherefore shall the heathen say * Where is now their God?

column2: 3 As for our God, he is in heaven * he hath done whatsoever pleased him.
column3: As for our God, he is in heaven * he hath done whatsoever pleased him.

column2: 4 Their idols are silver and gold * even the work of men's hands.
column3: Their idols are silver and gold * even the work of men's hands.

column2: 5 They have mouths, and speak not * eyes have they, and see not.
column3: They have mouths, and speak not * eyes have they, and see not.

column2: 6 They have ears, and hear not * noses have they, and smell not.
column3: They have ears, and hear not * noses have they, and smell not.

column2: 7 They have hands, and handle not; feet have they, and walk not * neither speak they through their throat.
column3: They have hands, and handle not; feet have they, and walk not * neither speak they through their throat.

column2: 8 They that make them are like unto them ; and so are all such as put their trust in them.
column3: They that make them are like unto them ; and so are all such as put their trust in them.

column2: 9 But thou, house of Israel, trust thou in the Lord * he is their succour and defence.
column3: But thou, house of Israel, trust thou in the Lord * he is their succour and defence.

column2: 10 Ye house of Aaron, put your trust in the Lord * he is their helper and defender.
column3: Ye house of Aaron, put your trust in the Lord * he is their helper and defender.

column2: 11 Ye that fear the Lord, put your trust in the Lord * he is their helper and defender.
column3: Ye that fear the Lord, put your trust in the Lord * he is their helper and defender.

column2: 12 The Lord hath been mindful of us, and he shall bless us * even he shall bless the house of Israel, he shall bless the house of Aaron.
column3: The Lord hath been mindful of us, and he shall bless us * even he shall bless the house of Israel, he shall bless the house of Aaron.

column2: 13 He shall bless them that fear the Lord * both small and great.
column3: He shall bless them that fear the Lord * both small and great.

column2: 14 The Lord shall increase you more and more * you and your children.
column3: The Lord shall increase you more and more * you and your children.

column2: 15 Ye are the blessed of the Lord * who made heaven and earth.
column3: Ye are the blessed of the Lord * who made heaven and earth.

column2: 16 All the whole heavens are the Lord's * the earth hath he given to the children of men.
column3: All the whole heavens are the Lord's * the earth hath he given to the children of men.

column2: 17 The dead praise not thee, O Lord * neither all they that go down into silence.
column3: The dead praise not thee, O Lord * neither all they that go down into silence.

column2: 18 But we will praise the Lord * from this time forth for evermore. Praise the Lord.
column3: But we will praise the Lord * from this time forth for evermore. Praise the Lord.

column2: Psalm 116. Dilexi, quoniam.
column3: Psalm 116. Dilexi, quoniam.

column2: 1 I AM well pleased * that the Lord hath heard the voice of my prayer;
column3: I AM well pleased * that the Lord hath heard the voice of my prayer;

column2: 2 That he hath inclined his ear unto me * therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.
column3: That he hath inclined his ear unto me * therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

column2: 3 The snares of death compassed me round about * and the pains of hell gat hold upon me.
column3: The snares of death compassed me round about * and the pains of hell gat hold upon me.

column2: 4 I shall find trouble and heaviness, and I will call upon the Name of the Lord * O Lord, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.
column3: I shall find trouble and heaviness, and I will call upon the Name of the Lord * O Lord, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

column2: 5 Gracious is the Lord, and righteous * yea, our God is merciful.
column3: Gracious is the Lord, and righteous * yea, our God is merciful.

column2: 6 The Lord preserveth the simple * I was in misery, and he helped me.
column3: The Lord preserveth the simple * I was in misery, and he helped me.

column2: 7 Turn again then unto thy rest, O my soul * for the Lord hath rewarded thee.
column3: Turn again then unto thy rest, O my soul * for the Lord hath rewarded thee.

column2: 8 And why? thou hast delivered my soul from death * mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
column3: And why? thou hast delivered my soul from death * mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

column2: 9 I will walk before the Lord * in the land of the living.
column3: I will walk before the Lord * in the land of the living.

column2: 10 I believed, and therefore will I speak; but I was sore troubled * I said in my haste, All men are liars.
column3: I believed, and therefore will I speak; but I was sore troubled * I said in my haste, All men are liars.

column2: 11 What reward shall I give unto the Lord * for all the benefits that he hath done unto me?
column3: What reward shall I give unto the Lord * for all the benefits that he hath done unto me?

column2: 12 I will receive the cup of salvation * and call upon the Name of the Lord.
column3: I will receive the cup of salvation * and call upon the Name of the Lord.

column2: 13 I will pay my vows now in the presence of all his people * right dear in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.
column3: I will pay my vows now in the presence of all his people * right dear in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

column2: 14 Behold, O Lord, how that I am thy servant * I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid; thou hast broken my bonds in sunder.
column3: Behold, O Lord, how that I am thy servant * I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid; thou hast broken my bonds in sunder.

column2: 15 I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving * and will call upon the Name of the Lord.
column3: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving * and will call upon the Name of the Lord.

column2: 16 I will pay my vows unto the Lord, in the sight of all his people * in the courts of the Lord's house, even in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.
column3: I will pay my vows unto the Lord, in the sight of all his people * in the courts of the Lord's house, even in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.

column2: Psalm 117. Laudate Dominum.
column3: Psalm 117. Laudate Dominum.

column2: 1 O PRAISE the Lord, all ye heathen * praise him, all ye nations.
column3: O PRAISE the Lord, all ye heathen * praise him, all ye nations.

column2: 2 For his merciful kindness is ever more and more towards us * and the truth of the Lord endureth for ever. Praise the Lord.
column3: For his merciful kindness is ever more and more towards us * and the truth of the Lord endureth for ever. Praise the Lord.

column2: Psalm 118. Confitemini Domino.
column3: Psalm 118. Confitemini Domino.

column2: 1 O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious * because his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious * because his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 2 Let Israel now confess that he is gracious * and that his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Let Israel now confess that he is gracious * and that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 3 Let the house of Aaron now confess * that his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Let the house of Aaron now confess * that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 4 Yea, let them now that fear the Lord confess * that his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Yea, let them now that fear the Lord confess * that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 5 I called upon the Lord in trouble * and the Lord heard me at large.
column3: I called upon the Lord in trouble * and the Lord heard me at large.

column2: 6 The Lord is on my side * I will not fear what man doeth unto me.
column3: The Lord is on my side * I will not fear what man doeth unto me.

column2: 7 The Lord taketh my part with them that help me * therefore shall I see my desire upon mine enemies.
column3: The Lord taketh my part with them that help me * therefore shall I see my desire upon mine enemies.

column2: 8 It is better to trust in the Lord * than to put any confidence in man.
column3: It is better to trust in the Lord * than to put any confidence in man.

column2: 9 It is better to trust in the Lord * than to put any confidence in princes.
column3: It is better to trust in the Lord * than to put any confidence in princes.

column2: 10 All nations compassed me round about * but in the Name of the Lord will I destroy them.
column3: All nations compassed me round about * but in the Name of the Lord will I destroy them.

column2: 11 They kept me in on every side, they kept me in, I say, on every side * but in the Name of the Lord will I destroy them.
column3: They kept me in on every side, they kept me in, I say, on every side * but in the Name of the Lord will I destroy them.

column2: 12 They came about me like bees, and are extinct even as the fire among the thorns * for in the Name of the Lord I will destroy them.
column3: They came about me like bees, and are extinct even as the fire among the thorns * for in the Name of the Lord I will destroy them.

column2: 13 Thou hast thrust sore at me, that I might fall * but the Lord was my help.
column3: Thou hast thrust sore at me, that I might fall * but the Lord was my help.

column2: 14 The Lord is my strength, and my song * and is become my salvation.
column3: The Lord is my strength, and my song * and is become my salvation.

column2: 15 The voice of joy and health is in the dwellings of the righteous * the right hand of the Lord bringeth mighty things to pass.
column3: The voice of joy and health is in the dwellings of the righteous * the right hand of the Lord bringeth mighty things to pass.

column2: 16 The right hand of the Lord hath the pre-eminence * the right hand of the Lord bringeth mighty things to pass.
column3: The right hand of the Lord hath the pre-eminence * the right hand of the Lord bringeth mighty things to pass.

column2: 17 I shall not die, but live * and declare the works of the Lord.
column3: I shall not die, but live * and declare the works of the Lord.

column2: 18 The Lord hath chastened and corrected me * but he hath not given me over unto death.
column3: The Lord hath chastened and corrected me * but he hath not given me over unto death.

column2: 19 Open me the gates of righteousness * that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the Lord.
column3: Open me the gates of righteousness * that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the Lord.

column2: 20 This is the gate of the Lord * the righteous shall enter into it.
column3: This is the gate of the Lord * the righteous shall enter into it.

column2: 21 I will thank thee, for thou hast heard me * and art become my salvation.
column3: I will thank thee, for thou hast heard me * and art become my salvation.

column2: 22 The same stone which the builders refused * is become the head-stone in the corner.
column3: The same stone which the builders refused * is become the head-stone in the corner.

column2: 23 This is the Lord's doing * and it is marvellous in our eyes.
column3: This is the Lord's doing * and it is marvellous in our eyes.

column2: 24 This is the day which the Lord hath made * we will rejoice and be glad in it.
column3: This is the day which the Lord hath made * we will rejoice and be glad in it.

column2: 25 Help me now, O Lord * O Lord, send us now prosperity.
column3: Help me now, O Lord * O Lord, send us now prosperity.

column2: 26 Blessed be he that cometh in the Name of the Lord * we have wished you good luck , ye that are of the house of the Lord.
column3: Blessed be he that cometh in the Name of the Lord * we have wished you good luck , ye that are of the house of the Lord.

column2: 27 God is the Lord who hath shewed us light * bind the sacrifice with cords, yea, even unto the horns of the altar.
column3: God is the Lord who hath shewed us light * bind the sacrifice with cords, yea, even unto the horns of the altar.

column2: 28 Thou art my God, and I will thank thee * thou art my God, and I will praise thee.
column3: Thou art my God, and I will thank thee * thou art my God, and I will praise thee.

column2: 29 O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious * and his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious * and his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: Psalm 119.
column3: Psalm 119.

column2: 1 Beati immaculati. BLESSED are those that are undefiled in the way * and walk in the law of the Lord.
column3: Beati immaculati. BLESSED are those that are undefiled in the way * and walk in the law of the Lord.

column2: 2 Blessed are they that keep his testimonies * and seek him with their whole heart.
column3: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies * and seek him with their whole heart.

column2: 3 For they who do no wickedness * walk in his ways.
column3: For they who do no wickedness * walk in his ways.

column2: 4 Thou hast charged * that we shall diligently keep thy commandments.
column3: Thou hast charged * that we shall diligently keep thy commandments.

column2: 5 O that my ways were made so direct * that I might keep thy statutes!
column3: O that my ways were made so direct * that I might keep thy statutes!

column2: 6 So shall I not be confounded * while I have respect unto all thy commandments.
column3: So shall I not be confounded * while I have respect unto all thy commandments.

column2: 7 I will thank thee with an unfeigned heart * when I shall have learned the judgements of thy righteousness.
column3: I will thank thee with an unfeigned heart * when I shall have learned the judgements of thy righteousness.

column2: 8 I will keep thy ceremonies * O forsake me not utterly.
column3: I will keep thy ceremonies * O forsake me not utterly.

column2: 9 In quo corriget? WHEREWITHAL shall a young man cleanse his way * even by ruling himself after thy word.
column3: In quo corriget? WHEREWITHAL shall a young man cleanse his way * even by ruling himself after thy word.

column2: 10 With my whole heart have I sought thee * O let me not go wrong out of thy commandments.
column3: With my whole heart have I sought thee * O let me not go wrong out of thy commandments.

column2: 11 Thy words have I hid within my heart * that I should not sin against thee.
column3: Thy words have I hid within my heart * that I should not sin against thee.

column2: 12 Blessed art thou, O Lord * O teach me thy statutes.
column3: Blessed art thou, O Lord * O teach me thy statutes.

column2: 13 With my lips have I been telling * of all the judgements of thy mouth.
column3: With my lips have I been telling * of all the judgements of thy mouth.

column2: 14 I have had as great delight in the way of thy testimonies * as in all manner of riches.
column3: I have had as great delight in the way of thy testimonies * as in all manner of riches.

column2: 15 I will talk of thy commandments * and have respect unto thy ways.
column3: I will talk of thy commandments * and have respect unto thy ways.

column2: 16 My delight shall be in thy statutes * and I will not forget thy word.
column3: My delight shall be in thy statutes * and I will not forget thy word.

column2: 17 Retribue servo tuo. O DO well unto thy servant * that I may live, and keep thy word.
column3: Retribue servo tuo. O DO well unto thy servant * that I may live, and keep thy word.

column2: 18 Open thou mine eyes * that I may see the wondrous things of thy law.
column3: Open thou mine eyes * that I may see the wondrous things of thy law.

column2: 19 I am a stranger upon earth * O hide not thy commandments from me.
column3: I am a stranger upon earth * O hide not thy commandments from me.

column2: 20 My soul breaketh out for the very fervent desire * that it hath alway unto thy judgements.
column3: My soul breaketh out for the very fervent desire * that it hath alway unto thy judgements.

column2: 21 Thou hast rebuked the proud * and cursed are they that do err from thy commandments.
column3: Thou hast rebuked the proud * and cursed are they that do err from thy commandments.

column2: 22 O turn from me shame and rebuke * for I have kept thy testimonies.
column3: O turn from me shame and rebuke * for I have kept thy testimonies.

column2: 23 Princes also did sit and speak against me * but thy servant is occupied in thy statutes.
column3: Princes also did sit and speak against me * but thy servant is occupied in thy statutes.

column2: 24 For thy testimonies are my delight * and my counsellors.
column3: For thy testimonies are my delight * and my counsellors.

column2: 25 Adhaesit pavimento. MY SOUL cleaveth to the dust * O quicken thou me, according to thy word.
column3: Adhaesit pavimento. MY SOUL cleaveth to the dust * O quicken thou me, according to thy word.

column2: 26 I have acknowledged my ways, and thou heardest me * O teach me thy statutes.
column3: I have acknowledged my ways, and thou heardest me * O teach me thy statutes.

column2: 27 Make me to understand the way of thy commandments * and so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.
column3: Make me to understand the way of thy commandments * and so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

column2: 28 My soul melteth away for very heaviness * comfort thou me according unto thy word.
column3: My soul melteth away for very heaviness * comfort thou me according unto thy word.

column2: 29 Take from me the way of lying * and cause thou me to make much of thy law.
column3: Take from me the way of lying * and cause thou me to make much of thy law.

column2: 30 I have chosen the way of truth * and thy judgements have I laid before me.
column3: I have chosen the way of truth * and thy judgements have I laid before me.

column2: 31 I have stuck unto thy testimonies * O Lord, confound me not.
column3: I have stuck unto thy testimonies * O Lord, confound me not.

column2: 32 I will run the way of thy commandments * when thou hast set my heart at liberty.
column3: I will run the way of thy commandments * when thou hast set my heart at liberty.

column2: 33 Legem pone. TEACH me, O Lord, the way of thy statutes * and I shall keep it unto the end.
column3: Legem pone. TEACH me, O Lord, the way of thy statutes * and I shall keep it unto the end.

column2: 34 Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law * yea, I shall keep it with my whole heart.
column3: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law * yea, I shall keep it with my whole heart.

column2: 35 Make me to go in the path of thy commandments * for therein is my desire.
column3: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments * for therein is my desire.

column2: 36 Incline my heart unto thy testimonies * and not to covetousness.
column3: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies * and not to covetousness.

column2: 37 O turn away mine eyes, lest they behold vanity * and quicken thou me in thy way.
column3: O turn away mine eyes, lest they behold vanity * and quicken thou me in thy way.

column2: 38 O stablish thy word in thy servant * that I may fear thee.
column3: O stablish thy word in thy servant * that I may fear thee.

column2: 39 Take away the rebuke that I am afraid of * for thy judgements are good.
column3: Take away the rebuke that I am afraid of * for thy judgements are good.

column2: 40 Behold, my delight is in thy commandments * O quicken me in thy righteousness.
column3: Behold, my delight is in thy commandments * O quicken me in thy righteousness.

column2: 41 Et veniat super me. LET thy loving mercy come also unto me, O Lord * even thy salvation, according unto thy word.
column3: Et veniat super me. LET thy loving mercy come also unto me, O Lord * even thy salvation, according unto thy word.

column2: 42 So shall I make answer unto my blasphemers * for my trust is in thy word.
column3: So shall I make answer unto my blasphemers * for my trust is in thy word.

column2: 43 O take not the word of thy truth utterly out of my mouth * for my hope is in thy judgements.
column3: O take not the word of thy truth utterly out of my mouth * for my hope is in thy judgements.

column2: 44 So shall I alway keep thy law * yea, for ever and ever.
column3: So shall I alway keep thy law * yea, for ever and ever.

column2: 45 And I will walk at liberty * for I seek thy commandments.
column3: And I will walk at liberty * for I seek thy commandments.

column2: 46 I will speak of thy testimonies also, even before kings * and will not be ashamed.
column3: I will speak of thy testimonies also, even before kings * and will not be ashamed.

column2: 47 And my delight shall be in thy commandments * which I have loved.
column3: And my delight shall be in thy commandments * which I have loved.

column2: 48 My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved * and my study shall be in thy statutes.
column3: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved * and my study shall be in thy statutes.

column2: 49 Memor esto servi tui. O THINK upon thy servant, as concerning thy word * wherein thou hast caused me to put my trust.
column3: Memor esto servi tui. O THINK upon thy servant, as concerning thy word * wherein thou hast caused me to put my trust.

column2: 50 The same is my comfort in my trouble * for thy word hath quickened me.
column3: The same is my comfort in my trouble * for thy word hath quickened me.

column2: 51 The proud have had me exceedingly in derision * yet have I not shrinked from thy law.
column3: The proud have had me exceedingly in derision * yet have I not shrinked from thy law.

column2: 52 For I remembered thine everlasting judgements, O Lord * and received comfort.
column3: For I remembered thine everlasting judgements, O Lord * and received comfort.

column2: 53 I am horribly afraid * for the ungodly that forsake thy law.
column3: I am horribly afraid * for the ungodly that forsake thy law.

column2: 54 Thy statutes have been my songs * in the house of my pilgrimage.
column3: Thy statutes have been my songs * in the house of my pilgrimage.

column2: 55 I have thought upon thy Name, O Lord, in the night-season * and have kept thy law.
column3: I have thought upon thy Name, O Lord, in the night-season * and have kept thy law.

column2: 56 This I had * because I kept thy commandments.
column3: This I had * because I kept thy commandments.

column2: 57 Portio mea, Domine. THOU art my portion, O Lord * I have promised to keep thy law.
column3: Portio mea, Domine. THOU art my portion, O Lord * I have promised to keep thy law.

column2: 58 I made my humble petition in thy presence with my whole heart * O be merciful unto me, according to thy word.
column3: I made my humble petition in thy presence with my whole heart * O be merciful unto me, according to thy word.

column2: 59 I called mine own ways to remembrance * and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.
column3: I called mine own ways to remembrance * and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

column2: 60 I made haste, and prolonged not the time * to keep thy commandments.
column3: I made haste, and prolonged not the time * to keep thy commandments.

column2: 61 The congregations of the ungodly have robbed me * but I have not forgotten thy law.
column3: The congregations of the ungodly have robbed me * but I have not forgotten thy law.

column2: 62 At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee * because of thy righteous judgements.
column3: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee * because of thy righteous judgements.

column2: 63 I am a companion of all them that fear thee * and keep thy commandments.
column3: I am a companion of all them that fear thee * and keep thy commandments.

column2: 64 The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy * O teach me thy statutes.
column3: The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy * O teach me thy statutes.

column2: 65 Bonitatem fecisti. O LORD, thou hast dealt graciously with thy servant * according unto thy word.
column3: Bonitatem fecisti. O LORD, thou hast dealt graciously with thy servant * according unto thy word.

column2: 66 O learn me true understanding and knowledge * for I have believed thy commandments.
column3: O learn me true understanding and knowledge * for I have believed thy commandments.

column2: 67 Before I was troubled, I went wrong * but now have I kept thy word.
column3: Before I was troubled, I went wrong * but now have I kept thy word.

column2: 68 Thou art good and gracious * O teach me thy statutes.
column3: Thou art good and gracious * O teach me thy statutes.

column2: 69 The proud have imagined a lie against me * but I will keep thy commandments with my whole heart.
column3: The proud have imagined a lie against me * but I will keep thy commandments with my whole heart.

column2: 70 Their heart is as fat as brawn * but my delight hath been in thy law.
column3: Their heart is as fat as brawn * but my delight hath been in thy law.

column2: 71 It is good for me that I have been in trouble * that I may learn thy statutes.
column3: It is good for me that I have been in trouble * that I may learn thy statutes.

column2: 72 The law of thy mouth is dearer unto me * than thousands of gold and silver.
column3: The law of thy mouth is dearer unto me * than thousands of gold and silver.

column2: 73 Manus tuae fecerunt me. THY hands have made me and fashioned me * O give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.
column3: Manus tuae fecerunt me. THY hands have made me and fashioned me * O give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

column2: 74 They that fear thee will be glad when they see me * because I have put my trust in thy word.
column3: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me * because I have put my trust in thy word.

column2: 75 I know, O Lord, that thy judgements are right * and that thou of very faithfulness hast caused me to be troubled.
column3: I know, O Lord, that thy judgements are right * and that thou of very faithfulness hast caused me to be troubled.

column2: 76 O let thy merciful kindness be my comfort * according to thy word unto thy servant.
column3: O let thy merciful kindness be my comfort * according to thy word unto thy servant.

column2: 77 O let thy loving mercies come unto me, that I may live * for thy law is my delight.
column3: O let thy loving mercies come unto me, that I may live * for thy law is my delight.

column2: 78 Let the proud be confounded, for they go wickedly about to destroy me * but I will be occupied in thy commandments.
column3: Let the proud be confounded, for they go wickedly about to destroy me * but I will be occupied in thy commandments.

column2: 79 Let such as fear thee, and have known thy testimonies * be turned unto me.
column3: Let such as fear thee, and have known thy testimonies * be turned unto me.

column2: 80 O let my heart be sound in thy statutes * that I be not ashamed.
column3: O let my heart be sound in thy statutes * that I be not ashamed.

column2: 81 Defecit anima mea. MY SOUL hath longed for thy salvation * and I have a good hope because of thy word.
column3: Defecit anima mea. MY SOUL hath longed for thy salvation * and I have a good hope because of thy word.

column2: 82 Mine eyes long sore for thy word * saying, O when wilt thou comfort me?
column3: Mine eyes long sore for thy word * saying, O when wilt thou comfort me?

column2: 83 For I am become like a bottle in the smoke * yet do I not forget thy statutes.
column3: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke * yet do I not forget thy statutes.

column2: 84 How many are the days of thy servant * when wilt thou be avenged of them that persecute me?
column3: How many are the days of thy servant * when wilt thou be avenged of them that persecute me?

column2: 85 The proud have digged pits for me * which are not after thy law.
column3: The proud have digged pits for me * which are not after thy law.

column2: 86 All thy commandments are true * they persecute me falsely; O be thou my help.
column3: All thy commandments are true * they persecute me falsely; O be thou my help.

column2: 87 They had almost made an end of me upon earth * but I forsook not thy commandments.
column3: They had almost made an end of me upon earth * but I forsook not thy commandments.

column2: 88 O quicken me after thy loving-kindness * and so shall I keep the testimonies of thy mouth.
column3: O quicken me after thy loving-kindness * and so shall I keep the testimonies of thy mouth.

column2: 89 In aeternum, Domine. O LORD, thy word * endureth for ever in heaven.
column3: In aeternum, Domine. O LORD, thy word * endureth for ever in heaven.

column2: 90 Thy truth also remaineth from one generation to another * thou hast laid the foundation of the earth, and it abideth.
column3: Thy truth also remaineth from one generation to another * thou hast laid the foundation of the earth, and it abideth.

column2: 91 They continue this day according to thine ordinance * for all things serve thee.
column3: They continue this day according to thine ordinance * for all things serve thee.

column2: 92 If my delight had not been in thy law * I should have perished in my trouble.
column3: If my delight had not been in thy law * I should have perished in my trouble.

column2: 93 I will never forget thy commandments * for with them thou hast quickened me.
column3: I will never forget thy commandments * for with them thou hast quickened me.

column2: 94 I am thine, O save me * for I have sought thy commandments.
column3: I am thine, O save me * for I have sought thy commandments.

column2: 95 The ungodly laid wait for me to destroy me * but I will consider thy testimonies.
column3: The ungodly laid wait for me to destroy me * but I will consider thy testimonies.

column2: 96 I see that all things come to an end * but thy commandment is exceeding broad.
column3: I see that all things come to an end * but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

column2: 97 Quomodo dilexi! LORD, what love have I unto thy law * all the day long is my study in it.
column3: Quomodo dilexi! LORD, what love have I unto thy law * all the day long is my study in it.

column2: 98 Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies * for they are ever with me.
column3: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies * for they are ever with me.

column2: 99 I have more understanding than my teachers * for thy testimonies are my study.
column3: I have more understanding than my teachers * for thy testimonies are my study.

column2: 100 I am wiser than the aged * because I keep thy commandments.
column3: I am wiser than the aged * because I keep thy commandments.

column2: 101 I have refrained my feet from every evil way * that I may keep thy word.
column3: I have refrained my feet from every evil way * that I may keep thy word.

column2: 102 I have not shrunk from thy judgements * for thou teachest me.
column3: I have not shrunk from thy judgements * for thou teachest me.

column2: 103 O how sweet are thy words unto my throat * yea, sweeter than honey unto my mouth.
column3: O how sweet are thy words unto my throat * yea, sweeter than honey unto my mouth.

column2: 104 Through thy commandments I get understanding * therefore I hate all evil ways.
column3: Through thy commandments I get understanding * therefore I hate all evil ways.

column2: 105 Lucerna pedibus meis. THY word is a lantern unto my feet * and a light unto my paths.
column3: Lucerna pedibus meis. THY word is a lantern unto my feet * and a light unto my paths.

column2: 106 I have sworn, and am stedfastly purposed * to keep thy righteous judgements.
column3: I have sworn, and am stedfastly purposed * to keep thy righteous judgements.

column2: 107 I am troubled above measure * quicken me, O Lord, according to thy word.
column3: I am troubled above measure * quicken me, O Lord, according to thy word.

column2: 108 Let the free-will offerings of my mouth please thee, O Lord * and teach me thy judgements.
column3: Let the free-will offerings of my mouth please thee, O Lord * and teach me thy judgements.

column2: 109 My soul is alway in my hand * yet do I not forget thy law.
column3: My soul is alway in my hand * yet do I not forget thy law.

column2: 110 The ungodly have laid a snare for me * but yet I swerved not from thy commandments.
column3: The ungodly have laid a snare for me * but yet I swerved not from thy commandments.

column2: 111 Thy testimonies have I claimed as mine heritage for ever * and why? they are the very joy of my heart.
column3: Thy testimonies have I claimed as mine heritage for ever * and why? they are the very joy of my heart.

column2: 112 I have applied my heart to fulfil thy statutes alway * even unto the end.
column3: I have applied my heart to fulfil thy statutes alway * even unto the end.

column2: 113 Iniquos odio habui. I HATE them that imagine evil things * but thy law do I love.
column3: Iniquos odio habui. I HATE them that imagine evil things * but thy law do I love.

column2: 114 Thou art my defence and shield * and my trust is in thy word.
column3: Thou art my defence and shield * and my trust is in thy word.

column2: 115 Away from me, ye wicked * I will keep the commandments of my God.
column3: Away from me, ye wicked * I will keep the commandments of my God.

column2: 116 O stablish me according to thy word, that I may live * and let me not be disappointed of my hope.
column3: O stablish me according to thy word, that I may live * and let me not be disappointed of my hope.

column2: 117 Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe * yea, my delight shall be ever in thy statutes.
column3: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe * yea, my delight shall be ever in thy statutes.

column2: 118 Thou hast trodden down all them that depart from thy statutes * for they imagine but deceit.
column3: Thou hast trodden down all them that depart from thy statutes * for they imagine but deceit.

column2: 119 Thou puttest away all the ungodly of the earth like dross * therefore I love thy testimonies.
column3: Thou puttest away all the ungodly of the earth like dross * therefore I love thy testimonies.

column2: 120 My flesh trembleth for fear of thee * and I am afraid of thy judgements.
column3: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee * and I am afraid of thy judgements.

column2: 121 Feci judicium. I DEAL with the thing that is lawful and right * O give me not over unto mine oppressors.
column3: Feci judicium. I DEAL with the thing that is lawful and right * O give me not over unto mine oppressors.

column2: 122 Make thou thy servant to delight in that which is good * that the proud do me no wrong.
column3: Make thou thy servant to delight in that which is good * that the proud do me no wrong.

column2: 123 Mine eyes are wasted away with looking for thy health * and for the word of thy righteousness.
column3: Mine eyes are wasted away with looking for thy health * and for the word of thy righteousness.

column2: 124 O deal with thy servant according unto thy loving mercy * and teach me thy statutes.
column3: O deal with thy servant according unto thy loving mercy * and teach me thy statutes.

column2: 125 I am thy servant, O grant me understanding * that I may know thy testimonies.
column3: I am thy servant, O grant me understanding * that I may know thy testimonies.

column2: 126 It is time for thee, Lord, to lay to thine hand * for they have destroyed thy law.
column3: It is time for thee, Lord, to lay to thine hand * for they have destroyed thy law.

column2: 127 For I love thy commandments * above gold and precious stone.
column3: For I love thy commandments * above gold and precious stone.

column2: 128 Therefore hold I straight all thy commandments * and all false ways I utterly abhor.
column3: Therefore hold I straight all thy commandments * and all false ways I utterly abhor.

column2: 129 Mirabilia. THY testimonies are wonderful * therefore doth my soul keep them.
column3: Mirabilia. THY testimonies are wonderful * therefore doth my soul keep them.

column2: 130 When thy word goeth forth * it giveth light and understanding unto the simple.
column3: When thy word goeth forth * it giveth light and understanding unto the simple.

column2: 131 I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath * for my delight was in thy commandments.
column3: I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath * for my delight was in thy commandments.

column2: 132 O look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me * as thou usest to do unto those that love thy Name.
column3: O look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me * as thou usest to do unto those that love thy Name.

column2: 133 Order my steps in thy word * and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.
column3: Order my steps in thy word * and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.

column2: 134 O deliver me from the wrongful dealings of men * and so shall I keep thy commandments.
column3: O deliver me from the wrongful dealings of men * and so shall I keep thy commandments.

column2: 135 Shew the light of thy countenance upon thy servant * and teach me thy statutes.
column3: Shew the light of thy countenance upon thy servant * and teach me thy statutes.

column2: 136 Mine eyes gush out with water * because men keep not thy law.
column3: Mine eyes gush out with water * because men keep not thy law.

column2: 137 Justus es, Domine. RIGHTEOUS art thou, O Lord * and true is thy judgement.
column3: Justus es, Domine. RIGHTEOUS art thou, O Lord * and true is thy judgement.

column2: 138 The testimonies that thou hast commanded * are exceeding righteous and true.
column3: The testimonies that thou hast commanded * are exceeding righteous and true.

column2: 139 My zeal hath even consumed me * because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.
column3: My zeal hath even consumed me * because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

column2: 140 Thy word is tried to the uttermost * and thy servant loveth it.
column3: Thy word is tried to the uttermost * and thy servant loveth it.

column2: 141 I am small, and of no reputation * yet do I not forget thy commandments.
column3: I am small, and of no reputation * yet do I not forget thy commandments.

column2: 142 Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness * and thy law is the truth.
column3: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness * and thy law is the truth.

column2: 143 Trouble and heaviness have taken hold upon me * yet is my delight in thy commandments.
column3: Trouble and heaviness have taken hold upon me * yet is my delight in thy commandments.

column2: 144 The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting * O grant me understanding, and I shall live.
column3: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting * O grant me understanding, and I shall live.

column2: 145 Clamavi in toto corde meo. I CALL with my whole heart * hear me, O Lord, I will keep thy statutes.
column3: Clamavi in toto corde meo. I CALL with my whole heart * hear me, O Lord, I will keep thy statutes.

column2: 146 Yea, even unto thee do I call * help me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.
column3: Yea, even unto thee do I call * help me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

column2: 147 Early in the morning do I cry unto thee * for in thy word is my trust.
column3: Early in the morning do I cry unto thee * for in thy word is my trust.

column2: 148 Mine eyes prevent the night-watches * that I might be occupied in thy words.
column3: Mine eyes prevent the night-watches * that I might be occupied in thy words.

column2: 149 Hear my voice, O Lord, according unto thy loving-kindness * quicken me, according as thou art wont.
column3: Hear my voice, O Lord, according unto thy loving-kindness * quicken me, according as thou art wont.

column2: 150 They draw nigh that of malice persecute me * and are far from thy law.
column3: They draw nigh that of malice persecute me * and are far from thy law.

column2: 151 Be thou nigh at hand, O Lord * for all thy commandments are true.
column3: Be thou nigh at hand, O Lord * for all thy commandments are true.

column2: 152 As concerning thy testimonies, I have known long since * that thou hast grounded them for ever.
column3: As concerning thy testimonies, I have known long since * that thou hast grounded them for ever.

column2: 153 Vide humilitatem. O CONSIDER mine adversity, and deliver me * for I do not forget thy law.
column3: Vide humilitatem. O CONSIDER mine adversity, and deliver me * for I do not forget thy law.

column2: 154 Avenge thou my cause, and deliver me * quicken me, according to thy word.
column3: Avenge thou my cause, and deliver me * quicken me, according to thy word.

column2: 155 Health is far from the ungodly * for they regard not thy statutes.
column3: Health is far from the ungodly * for they regard not thy statutes.

column2: 156 Great is thy mercy, O Lord * quicken me, as thou art wont.
column3: Great is thy mercy, O Lord * quicken me, as thou art wont.

column2: 157 Many there are that trouble me, and persecute me * yet do I not swerve from thy testimonies.
column3: Many there are that trouble me, and persecute me * yet do I not swerve from thy testimonies.

column2: 158 It grieveth me when I see the transgressors * because they keep not thy law.
column3: It grieveth me when I see the transgressors * because they keep not thy law.

column2: 159 Consider, O Lord, how I love thy commandments * O quicken me, according to thy loving-kindness.
column3: Consider, O Lord, how I love thy commandments * O quicken me, according to thy loving-kindness.

column2: 160 Thy word is true from everlasting * all the judgements of thy righteousness endure for evermore.
column3: Thy word is true from everlasting * all the judgements of thy righteousness endure for evermore.

column2: 161 Principes persecuti sunt. PRINCES have persecuted me without a cause * but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.
column3: Principes persecuti sunt. PRINCES have persecuted me without a cause * but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

column2: 162 I am as glad of thy word * as one that findeth great spoils.
column3: I am as glad of thy word * as one that findeth great spoils.

column2: 163 As for lies, I hate and abhor them * but thy law do I love.
column3: As for lies, I hate and abhor them * but thy law do I love.

column2: 164 Seven times a day do I praise thee * because of thy righteous judgements.
column3: Seven times a day do I praise thee * because of thy righteous judgements.

column2: 165 Great is the peace that they have who love thy law * and they are not offended at it.
column3: Great is the peace that they have who love thy law * and they are not offended at it.

column2: 166 Lord, I have looked for thy saving health * and done after thy commandments.
column3: Lord, I have looked for thy saving health * and done after thy commandments.

column2: 167 My soul hath kept thy testimonies * and loved them exceedingly.
column3: My soul hath kept thy testimonies * and loved them exceedingly.

column2: 168 I have kept thy commandments and testimonies * for all my ways are before thee.
column3: I have kept thy commandments and testimonies * for all my ways are before thee.

column2: 169 Appropinquet deprecatio. LET my complaint come before thee, O Lord * give me understanding, according to thy word.
column3: Appropinquet deprecatio. LET my complaint come before thee, O Lord * give me understanding, according to thy word.

column2: 170 Let my supplication come before thee * deliver me, according to thy word.
column3: Let my supplication come before thee * deliver me, according to thy word.

column2: 171 My lips shall speak of thy praise * when thou hast taught me thy statutes.
column3: My lips shall speak of thy praise * when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

column2: 172 Yea, my tongue shall sing of thy word * for all thy commandments are righteous.
column3: Yea, my tongue shall sing of thy word * for all thy commandments are righteous.

column2: 173 Let thine hand help me * for I have chosen thy commandments.
column3: Let thine hand help me * for I have chosen thy commandments.

column2: 174 I have longed for thy saving health, O Lord * and in thy law is my delight.
column3: I have longed for thy saving health, O Lord * and in thy law is my delight.

column2: 175 O let my soul live, and it shall praise thee * and thy judgements shall help me.
column3: O let my soul live, and it shall praise thee * and thy judgements shall help me.

column2: 176 I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost * O seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.
column3: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost * O seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.

column2: Psalm 120. Ad Dominum.
column3: Psalm 120. Ad Dominum.

column2: 1 WHEN I was in trouble I called upon the Lord * and he heard me.
column3: WHEN I was in trouble I called upon the Lord * and he heard me.

column2: 2 Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips * and from a deceitful tongue.
column3: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips * and from a deceitful tongue.

column2: 3 What reward shall be given or done unto thee, thou false tongue * even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.
column3: What reward shall be given or done unto thee, thou false tongue * even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.

column2: 4 Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell with Mesech * and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar.
column3: Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell with Mesech * and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar.

column2: 5 My soul hath long dwelt among them * that are enemies unto peace.
column3: My soul hath long dwelt among them * that are enemies unto peace.

column2: 6 I labour for peace, but when I speak unto them thereof * they make them ready to battle.
column3: I labour for peace, but when I speak unto them thereof * they make them ready to battle.

column2: Psalm 121. Levavi oculus.
column3: Psalm 121. Levavi oculus.

column2: 1 I WILL lift up mine eyes unto the hills * from whence cometh my help.
column3: I WILL lift up mine eyes unto the hills * from whence cometh my help.

column2: 2 My help cometh even from the Lord * who hath made heaven and earth.
column3: My help cometh even from the Lord * who hath made heaven and earth.

column2: 3 He will not suffer thy foot to be moved * and he that keepeth thee will not sleep.
column3: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved * and he that keepeth thee will not sleep.

column2: 4 Behold, he that keepeth Israel * shall neither slumber nor sleep.
column3: Behold, he that keepeth Israel * shall neither slumber nor sleep.

column2: 5 The Lord himself is thy keeper * the Lord is thy defence upon thy right hand;
column3: The Lord himself is thy keeper * the Lord is thy defence upon thy right hand;

column2: 6 So that the sun shall not burn thee by day * neither the moon by night.
column3: So that the sun shall not burn thee by day * neither the moon by night.

column2: 7 The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil * yea, it is even he that shall keep thy soul.
column3: The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil * yea, it is even he that shall keep thy soul.

column2: 8 The Lord shall preserve thy going out, and thy coming in * from this time forth for evermore.
column3: The Lord shall preserve thy going out, and thy coming in * from this time forth for evermore.

column2: Psalm 122. Laetatus sum.
column3: Psalm 122. Laetatus sum.

column2: 1 I WAS glad when they said unto me * We will go into the house of the Lord.
column3: I WAS glad when they said unto me * We will go into the house of the Lord.

column2: 2 Our feet shall stand in thy gates * O Jerusalem.
column3: Our feet shall stand in thy gates * O Jerusalem.

column2: 3 Jerusalem is built as a city * that is at unity in itself.
column3: Jerusalem is built as a city * that is at unity in itself.

column2: 4 For thither the tribes go up, even the tribes of the Lord * to testify unto Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the Lord.
column3: For thither the tribes go up, even the tribes of the Lord * to testify unto Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the Lord.

column2: 5 For there is the seat of judgement * even the seat of the house of David.
column3: For there is the seat of judgement * even the seat of the house of David.

column2: 6 O pray for the peace of Jerusalem * they shall prosper that love thee.
column3: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem * they shall prosper that love thee.

column2: 7 Peace be within thy walls * and plenteousness within thy palaces.
column3: Peace be within thy walls * and plenteousness within thy palaces.

column2: 8 For my brethren and companions' sakes * I will wish thee prosperity.
column3: For my brethren and companions' sakes * I will wish thee prosperity.

column2: 9 Yea, because of the house of the Lord our God * I will seek to do thee good.
column3: Yea, because of the house of the Lord our God * I will seek to do thee good.

column2: Psalm 123. Ad te levavi oculos meos.
column3: Psalm 123. Ad te levavi oculos meos.

column2: 1 UNTO thee lift I up mine eyes * O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
column3: UNTO thee lift I up mine eyes * O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

column2: 2 Behold, even as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress * even so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God, until he have mercy upon us.
column3: Behold, even as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress * even so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God, until he have mercy upon us.

column2: 3 Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us * for we are utterly despised.
column3: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us * for we are utterly despised.

column2: 4 Our soul is filled with the scornful reproof of the wealthy * and with the despitefulness of the proud.
column3: Our soul is filled with the scornful reproof of the wealthy * and with the despitefulness of the proud.

column2: Psalm 124. Nisi quia Dominus.
column3: Psalm 124. Nisi quia Dominus.

column2: 1 IF THE Lord himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say * if the Lord himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us;
column3: IF THE Lord himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say * if the Lord himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us;

column2: 2 They had swallowed us up quick * when thy were so wrathfully displeased at us.
column3: They had swallowed us up quick * when thy were so wrathfully displeased at us.

column2: 3 Yea, the waters had drowned us * and the stream had gone over our soul.
column3: Yea, the waters had drowned us * and the stream had gone over our soul.

column2: 4 The deep waters of the proud * had gone even over our soul.
column3: The deep waters of the proud * had gone even over our soul.

column2: 5 But praised be the Lord * who hath not given us over for a prey unto their teeth.
column3: But praised be the Lord * who hath not given us over for a prey unto their teeth.

column2: 6 Our soul is escaped even as a bird out of the snare of the fowler * the snare is broken, and we are delivered .
column3: Our soul is escaped even as a bird out of the snare of the fowler * the snare is broken, and we are delivered .

column2: 7 Our help standeth in the Name of the Lord * who hath made heaven and earth.
column3: Our help standeth in the Name of the Lord * who hath made heaven and earth.

column2: Psalm 125. Qui confidunt.
column3: Psalm 125. Qui confidunt.

column2: 1 THEY that put their trust in the Lord shall be even as the mount Sion * which may not be removed, but standeth fast for ever.
column3: THEY that put their trust in the Lord shall be even as the mount Sion * which may not be removed, but standeth fast for ever.

column2: 2 The hills stand about Jerusalem * even so standeth the Lord round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.
column3: The hills stand about Jerusalem * even so standeth the Lord round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.

column2: 3 For the rod of the ungodly cometh not into the lot of the righteous * lest the righteous put their hand unto wickedness.
column3: For the rod of the ungodly cometh not into the lot of the righteous * lest the righteous put their hand unto wickedness.

column2: 4 Do well, O Lord * unto those that are good and true of heart.
column3: Do well, O Lord * unto those that are good and true of heart.

column2: 5 As for such as turn back unto their own wickedness * the Lord shall lead them forth with the evil-doers; but peace shall be upon Israel.
column3: As for such as turn back unto their own wickedness * the Lord shall lead them forth with the evil-doers; but peace shall be upon Israel.

column2: Psalm 126. In convertendo.
column3: Psalm 126. In convertendo.

column2: 1 WHEN the Lord turned again the captivity of Sion * then were we like unto them that dream.
column3: WHEN the Lord turned again the captivity of Sion * then were we like unto them that dream.

column2: 2 Then was our mouth filled with laughter * and our tongue with joy.
column3: Then was our mouth filled with laughter * and our tongue with joy.

column2: 3 Then said they among the heathen * The Lord hath done great things for them.
column3: Then said they among the heathen * The Lord hath done great things for them.

column2: 4 Yea, the Lord hath done great things for us already * whereof we rejoice.
column3: Yea, the Lord hath done great things for us already * whereof we rejoice.

column2: 5 Turn our captivity, O Lord * as the rivers in the south.
column3: Turn our captivity, O Lord * as the rivers in the south.

column2: 6 They that sow in tears * shall reap in joy.
column3: They that sow in tears * shall reap in joy.

column2: 7 He that now goeth on his way weeping, and beareth forth good seed * shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.
column3: He that now goeth on his way weeping, and beareth forth good seed * shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.

column2: Psalm 127. Nisi Dominus.
column3: Psalm 127. Nisi Dominus.

column2: 1 EXCEPT the Lord build the house * their labour is but lost that build it.
column3: EXCEPT the Lord build the house * their labour is but lost that build it.

column2: 2 Except the Lord keep the city * the watchman waketh but in vain.
column3: Except the Lord keep the city * the watchman waketh but in vain.

column2: 3 It is but lost labour that ye haste to rise up early, and so late take rest, and eat the bread of carefulness * for so he giveth his beloved sleep.
column3: It is but lost labour that ye haste to rise up early, and so late take rest, and eat the bread of carefulness * for so he giveth his beloved sleep.
