column2: 4 Lo, children and the fruit of the womb * are an heritage and gift that cometh of the Lord.
column3: Lo, children and the fruit of the womb * are an heritage and gift that cometh of the Lord.

column2: 5 Like as the arrows in the hand of the giant * even so are the young children.
column3: Like as the arrows in the hand of the giant * even so are the young children.

column2: 6 Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them * they shall not be ashamed when they speak with their enemies in the gate.
column3: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them * they shall not be ashamed when they speak with their enemies in the gate.

column2: Psalm 128. Beati omnes.
column3: Psalm 128. Beati omnes.

column2: 1 BLESSED are all they that fear the Lord * and walk in his ways.
column3: BLESSED are all they that fear the Lord * and walk in his ways.

column2: 2 For thou shalt eat the labours of thine hands * O well is thee, and happy shalt thou be.
column3: For thou shalt eat the labours of thine hands * O well is thee, and happy shalt thou be.

column2: 3 Thy wife shall be as the fruitful vine * upon the walls of thine house.
column3: Thy wife shall be as the fruitful vine * upon the walls of thine house.

column2: 4 Thy children like the olive-branches * round about thy table.
column3: Thy children like the olive-branches * round about thy table.

column2: 5 Lo, thus shall the man be blessed * that feareth the Lord.
column3: Lo, thus shall the man be blessed * that feareth the Lord.

column2: 6 The Lord from out of Sion shall so bless thee * that thou shalt see Jerusalem in prosperity all thy life long.
column3: The Lord from out of Sion shall so bless thee * that thou shalt see Jerusalem in prosperity all thy life long.

column2: 7 Yea, that thou shalt see thy children's children * and peace upon Israel.
column3: Yea, that thou shalt see thy children's children * and peace upon Israel.

column2: Psalm 129. Saepe expugnaverunt.
column3: Psalm 129. Saepe expugnaverunt.

column2: 1 MANY a time have they fought against me from my youth up * may Israel now say.
column3: MANY a time have they fought against me from my youth up * may Israel now say.

column2: 2 Yea, many a time have they vexed me from my youth up * but they have not prevailed against me.
column3: Yea, many a time have they vexed me from my youth up * but they have not prevailed against me.

column2: 3 The plowers plowed upon my back * and made long furrows.
column3: The plowers plowed upon my back * and made long furrows.

column2: 4 But the righteous Lord * hath hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.
column3: But the righteous Lord * hath hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.

column2: 5 Let them be confounded and turned backward * as many as have evil will at Sion.
column3: Let them be confounded and turned backward * as many as have evil will at Sion.

column2: 6 Let them be even as the grass growing upon the house-tops * which withereth afore it be plucked up;
column3: Let them be even as the grass growing upon the house-tops * which withereth afore it be plucked up;

column2: 7 Whereof the mower filleth not his hand * neither he that bindeth up the sheaves his bosom.
column3: Whereof the mower filleth not his hand * neither he that bindeth up the sheaves his bosom.

column2: 8 So that they who go by say not so much as, The Lord prosper you * we wish you good luck in the Name of the Lord.
column3: So that they who go by say not so much as, The Lord prosper you * we wish you good luck in the Name of the Lord.

column2: Psalm 130. De profundis.
column3: Psalm 130. De profundis.

column2: 1 OUT of the deep have I called unto thee, O Lord * Lord, hear my voice.
column3: OUT of the deep have I called unto thee, O Lord * Lord, hear my voice.

column2: 2 O let thine ears consider well * the voice of my complaint.
column3: O let thine ears consider well * the voice of my complaint.

column2: 3 If thou, Lord, wilt be extreme to mark what is done amiss * O Lord, who may abide it?
column3: If thou, Lord, wilt be extreme to mark what is done amiss * O Lord, who may abide it?

column2: 4 For there is mercy with thee * therefore shalt thou be feared.
column3: For there is mercy with thee * therefore shalt thou be feared.

column2: 5 I look for the Lord; my soul doth wait for him * in his word is my trust.
column3: I look for the Lord; my soul doth wait for him * in his word is my trust.

column2: 6 My soul fleeth unto the Lord * before the morning watch, I say, before the morning watch.
column3: My soul fleeth unto the Lord * before the morning watch, I say, before the morning watch.

column2: 7 O Israel, trust in the Lord, for with the Lord there is mercy * and with him is plenteous redemption.
column3: O Israel, trust in the Lord, for with the Lord there is mercy * and with him is plenteous redemption.

column2: 8 And he shall redeem Israel * from all his sins.
column3: And he shall redeem Israel * from all his sins.

column2: Psalm 131. Domine, non est.
column3: Psalm 131. Domine, non est.

column2: 1 LORD, I am not high-minded * I have no proud looks.
column3: LORD, I am not high-minded * I have no proud looks.

column2: 2 I do not exercise myself in great matters * which are too high for me.
column3: I do not exercise myself in great matters * which are too high for me.

column2: 3 But I refrain my soul, and keep it low, like as a child that is weaned from his mother * yea, my soul is even as a weaned child.
column3: But I refrain my soul, and keep it low, like as a child that is weaned from his mother * yea, my soul is even as a weaned child.

column2: 4 O Israel, trust in the Lord * from this time forth for evermore.
column3: O Israel, trust in the Lord * from this time forth for evermore.

column2: Psalm 132. Memento, Domine.
column3: Psalm 132. Memento, Domine.

column2: 1 LORD, remember David * and all his trouble;
column3: LORD, remember David * and all his trouble;

column2: 2 How he sware unto the Lord * and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob;
column3: How he sware unto the Lord * and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob;

column2: 3 I will not come within the tabernacle of mine house * nor climb up into my bed;
column3: I will not come within the tabernacle of mine house * nor climb up into my bed;

column2: 4 I will not suffer mine eyes to sleep, nor mine eye-lids to slumber * neither the temples of my head to take any rest;
column3: I will not suffer mine eyes to sleep, nor mine eye-lids to slumber * neither the temples of my head to take any rest;

column2: 5 Until I find out a place for the temple of the Lord * an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
column3: Until I find out a place for the temple of the Lord * an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

column2: 6 Lo, we heard of the same at Ephrata * and found it in the wood.
column3: Lo, we heard of the same at Ephrata * and found it in the wood.

column2: 7 We will go into his tabernacle * and fall low on our knees before his footstool.
column3: We will go into his tabernacle * and fall low on our knees before his footstool.

column2: 8 Arise, O Lord, into thy resting-place * thou, and the ark of thy strength.
column3: Arise, O Lord, into thy resting-place * thou, and the ark of thy strength.

column2: 9 Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness * and let thy saints sing with joyfulness.
column3: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness * and let thy saints sing with joyfulness.

column2: 10 For thy servant David's sake * turn not away the presence of thine Anointed.
column3: For thy servant David's sake * turn not away the presence of thine Anointed.

column2: 11 The Lord hath made a faithful oath unto David * and he shall not shrink from it;
column3: The Lord hath made a faithful oath unto David * and he shall not shrink from it;

column2: 12 Of the fruit of thy body * shall I set upon thy seat.
column3: Of the fruit of thy body * shall I set upon thy seat.

column2: 13 If thy children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall learn them * their children also shall sit upon thy seat for evermore.
column3: If thy children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall learn them * their children also shall sit upon thy seat for evermore.

column2: 14 For the Lord hath chosen Sion to be an habitation for himself * he hath longed for her.
column3: For the Lord hath chosen Sion to be an habitation for himself * he hath longed for her.

column2: 15 This shall be my rest for ever * here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.
column3: This shall be my rest for ever * here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.

column2: 16 I will bless her victuals with increase * and will satisfy her poor with bread.
column3: I will bless her victuals with increase * and will satisfy her poor with bread.

column2: 17 I will deck her priests with health * and her saints shall rejoice and sing.
column3: I will deck her priests with health * and her saints shall rejoice and sing.

column2: 18 There shall I make the horn of David to flourish * I have ordained a lantern for mine Anointed.
column3: There shall I make the horn of David to flourish * I have ordained a lantern for mine Anointed.

column2: 19 As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame * but upon himself shall his crown flourish.
column3: As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame * but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

column2: Psalm 133. Ecce, quam bonum!
column3: Psalm 133. Ecce, quam bonum!

column2: 1 BEHOLD, how good and joyful a thing it is * brethren, to dwell together in unity!
column3: BEHOLD, how good and joyful a thing it is * brethren, to dwell together in unity!

column2: 2 It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down unto the beard * even unto Aaron's beard, and went down to the skirts of his clothing.
column3: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down unto the beard * even unto Aaron's beard, and went down to the skirts of his clothing.

column2: 3 Like as the dew of Hermon * which fell upon the hill of Sion.
column3: Like as the dew of Hermon * which fell upon the hill of Sion.

column2: 4 For there the Lord promised his blessing * and life for evermore.
column3: For there the Lord promised his blessing * and life for evermore.

column2: Psalm 134. Ecce nunc.
column3: Psalm 134. Ecce nunc.

column2: 1 BEHOLD now, praise the Lord * all ye servants of the Lord;
column3: BEHOLD now, praise the Lord * all ye servants of the Lord;

column2: 2 Ye that by night stand in the house of the Lord * even in the courts of the house of our God.
column3: Ye that by night stand in the house of the Lord * even in the courts of the house of our God.

column2: 3 Lift up your hands in the sanctuary * and praise the Lord.
column3: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary * and praise the Lord.

column2: 4 The Lord that made heaven and earth * give thee blessing out of Sion.
column3: The Lord that made heaven and earth * give thee blessing out of Sion.

column2: Psalm 135. Laudate Nomen.
column3: Psalm 135. Laudate Nomen.

column2: 1 O PRAISE the Lord, laud ye the Name of the Lord * praise it, O ye servants of the Lord;
column3: O PRAISE the Lord, laud ye the Name of the Lord * praise it, O ye servants of the Lord;

column2: 2 Ye that stand in the house of the Lord * in the courts of the house of our God.
column3: Ye that stand in the house of the Lord * in the courts of the house of our God.

column2: 3 O praise the Lord, for the Lord is gracious * O sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.
column3: O praise the Lord, for the Lord is gracious * O sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.

column2: 4 For why? the Lord hath chosen Jacob unto himself * and Israel for his own possession.
column3: For why? the Lord hath chosen Jacob unto himself * and Israel for his own possession.

column2: 5 For I know that the Lord is great * and that our Lord is above all gods.
column3: For I know that the Lord is great * and that our Lord is above all gods.

column2: 6 Whatsoever the Lord pleased, that did he in heaven and in earth * and in the sea, and in all deep places.
column3: Whatsoever the Lord pleased, that did he in heaven and in earth * and in the sea, and in all deep places.

column2: 7 He bringeth forth the clouds from the ends of the world * and sendeth forth lightnings with the rain, bringing the winds out of his treasures.
column3: He bringeth forth the clouds from the ends of the world * and sendeth forth lightnings with the rain, bringing the winds out of his treasures.

column2: 8 He smote the first-born of Egypt * both of man and beast.
column3: He smote the first-born of Egypt * both of man and beast.

column2: 9 He hath sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O thou land of Egypt * upon Pharaoh, and all his servants.
column3: He hath sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O thou land of Egypt * upon Pharaoh, and all his servants.

column2: 10 He smote divers nations * and slew mighty kings;
column3: He smote divers nations * and slew mighty kings;

column2: 11 Sehon king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Basan * and all the kingdoms of Canaan;
column3: Sehon king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Basan * and all the kingdoms of Canaan;

column2: 12 And gave their land to be an heritage * even an heritage unto Israel his people.
column3: And gave their land to be an heritage * even an heritage unto Israel his people.

column2: 13 Thy Name, O Lord, endureth for ever * so doth thy memorial, O Lord, from one generation to another.
column3: Thy Name, O Lord, endureth for ever * so doth thy memorial, O Lord, from one generation to another.

column2: 14 For the Lord will avenge his people * and be gracious unto his servants.
column3: For the Lord will avenge his people * and be gracious unto his servants.

column2: 15 As for the images of the heathen, they are but silver and gold * the work of men's hands.
column3: As for the images of the heathen, they are but silver and gold * the work of men's hands.

column2: 16 They have mouths, and speak not * eyes have they, but they see not.
column3: They have mouths, and speak not * eyes have they, but they see not.

column2: 17 They have ears, and yet they hear not * neither is there any breath in their mouths.
column3: They have ears, and yet they hear not * neither is there any breath in their mouths.

column2: 18 They that make them are like unto them * and so are all they that put their trust in them.
column3: They that make them are like unto them * and so are all they that put their trust in them.

column2: 19 Praise the Lord, ye house of Israel * praise the Lord, ye house of Aaron.
column3: Praise the Lord, ye house of Israel * praise the Lord, ye house of Aaron.

column2: 20 Praise the Lord, ye house of Levi * ye that fear the Lord, praise the Lord.
column3: Praise the Lord, ye house of Levi * ye that fear the Lord, praise the Lord.

column2: 21 Praised be the Lord out of Sion * who dwelleth at Jerusalem.
column3: Praised be the Lord out of Sion * who dwelleth at Jerusalem.

column2: Psalm 136. Confitemini.
column3: Psalm 136. Confitemini.

column2: 1 O GIVE thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious * and his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O GIVE thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious * and his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 2 O give thanks unto the God of all gods * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O give thanks unto the God of all gods * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 3 O thank the Lord of all lords * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O thank the Lord of all lords * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 4 Who only doeth great wonders * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Who only doeth great wonders * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 5 Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 6 Who laid out the earth above the waters * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Who laid out the earth above the waters * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 7 Who hath made great lights * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: Who hath made great lights * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 8 The sun to rule the day * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: The sun to rule the day * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 9 The moon and the stars to govern the night * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: The moon and the stars to govern the night * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 10 Who smote Egypt with their first-born * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: Who smote Egypt with their first-born * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 11 And brought out Israel from among them * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: And brought out Israel from among them * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 12 With a mighty hand, and stretched out arm * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: With a mighty hand, and stretched out arm * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 13 Who divided the Red sea in two parts * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: Who divided the Red sea in two parts * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 14 And made Israel to go through the midst of it * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: And made Israel to go through the midst of it * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 15 But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red sea * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red sea * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 16 Who led his people through the wilderness * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Who led his people through the wilderness * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 17 Who smote great kings * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: Who smote great kings * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 18 Yea, and slew mighty kings * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: Yea, and slew mighty kings * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 19 Sehon king of the Amorites * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: Sehon king of the Amorites * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 20 And Og the king of Basan * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: And Og the king of Basan * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 21 And gave away their land for an heritage * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: And gave away their land for an heritage * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 22 Even for an heritage unto Israel his servant * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Even for an heritage unto Israel his servant * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 23 Who remembered us when we were in trouble * for his mercy endureth for ever;
column3: Who remembered us when we were in trouble * for his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: 24 And hath delivered us from our enemies * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: And hath delivered us from our enemies * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 25 Who giveth food to all flesh * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: Who giveth food to all flesh * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 26 O give thanks unto the God of heaven * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O give thanks unto the God of heaven * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: 27 O give thanks unto the Lord of lords * for his mercy endureth for ever.
column3: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords * for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: Psalm 137. Super flumina.
column3: Psalm 137. Super flumina.

column2: 1 BY THE waters of Babylon we sat down and wept * when we remembered thee, O Sion.
column3: BY THE waters of Babylon we sat down and wept * when we remembered thee, O Sion.

column2: 2 As for our harps, we hanged them up * upon the trees that are therein.
column3: As for our harps, we hanged them up * upon the trees that are therein.

column2: 3 For they that led us away captive required of us then a song, and melody in our heaviness * Sing us one of the songs of Sion.
column3: For they that led us away captive required of us then a song, and melody in our heaviness * Sing us one of the songs of Sion.

column2: 4 How shall we sing the Lord's song * in a strange land?
column3: How shall we sing the Lord's song * in a strange land?

column2: 5 If I forget thee, O Jerusalem * let my right hand forget her cunning.
column3: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem * let my right hand forget her cunning.

column2: 6 If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth * yea, if I prefer not Jerusalem in my mirth.
column3: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth * yea, if I prefer not Jerusalem in my mirth.

column2: 7 Remember the children of Edom, O Lord, in the day of Jerusalem * how they said, Down with it, down with it, even to the ground.
column3: Remember the children of Edom, O Lord, in the day of Jerusalem * how they said, Down with it, down with it, even to the ground.

column2: 8 O daughter of Babylon , wasted with misery * yea, happy shall he be that rewardeth thee, as thou hast served us.
column3: O daughter of Babylon , wasted with misery * yea, happy shall he be that rewardeth thee, as thou hast served us.

column2: 9 Blessed shall he be that taketh thy children * and throweth them against the stones.
column3: Blessed shall he be that taketh thy children * and throweth them against the stones.

column2: Psalm 138. Confitebor tibi.
column3: Psalm 138. Confitebor tibi.

column2: 1 I WILL give thanks unto thee, O Lord, with my whole heart * even before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.
column3: I WILL give thanks unto thee, O Lord, with my whole heart * even before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.

column2: 2 I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy Name, because of thy loving-kindness and truth * for thou hast magnified thy Name and thy word above all things.
column3: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy Name, because of thy loving-kindness and truth * for thou hast magnified thy Name and thy word above all things.

column2: 3 When I called upon thee, thou heardest me * and enduedst my soul with much strength.
column3: When I called upon thee, thou heardest me * and enduedst my soul with much strength.

column2: 4 All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O Lord * for they have heard the words of thy mouth.
column3: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O Lord * for they have heard the words of thy mouth.

column2: 5 Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the Lord * that great is the glory of the Lord.
column3: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the Lord * that great is the glory of the Lord.

column2: 6 For though the Lord be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly * as for the proud, he beholdeth them afar off.
column3: For though the Lord be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly * as for the proud, he beholdeth them afar off.

column2: 7 Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shalt thou refresh me * thou shalt stretch forth thy hand upon the furiousness of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
column3: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shalt thou refresh me * thou shalt stretch forth thy hand upon the furiousness of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

column2: 8 The lord shall make good his loving-kindness toward me * yea, thy mercy, O Lord, endureth for ever; despise not then the works of thine own hands.
column3: The lord shall make good his loving-kindness toward me * yea, thy mercy, O Lord, endureth for ever; despise not then the works of thine own hands.

column2: Psalm 139. Domine, probasti.
column3: Psalm 139. Domine, probasti.

column2: 1 O LORD, thou hast searched me out and known me * thou knowest my down-sitting and mine up-rising, thou understandest my thoughts long before.
column3: O LORD, thou hast searched me out and known me * thou knowest my down-sitting and mine up-rising, thou understandest my thoughts long before.

column2: 2 Thou art about my path, and about my bed * and spiest out all my ways.
column3: Thou art about my path, and about my bed * and spiest out all my ways.

column2: 3 For lo, there is not a word in my tongue * but thou, O Lord, knowest it altogether.
column3: For lo, there is not a word in my tongue * but thou, O Lord, knowest it altogether.

column2: 4 Thou hast fashioned me behind and before * and laid thine hand upon me.
column3: Thou hast fashioned me behind and before * and laid thine hand upon me.

column2: 5 Such knowledge is too wonderful and excellent for me * I cannot attain unto it.
column3: Such knowledge is too wonderful and excellent for me * I cannot attain unto it.

column2: 6 Whither shall I go then from thy Spirit * or whither shall I go then from thy presence?
column3: Whither shall I go then from thy Spirit * or whither shall I go then from thy presence?

column2: 7 If I climb up into heaven, thou art there * if I go down to hell, thou art there also.
column3: If I climb up into heaven, thou art there * if I go down to hell, thou art there also.

column2: 8 If I take the wings of the morning * and remain in the uttermost parts of the sea;
column3: If I take the wings of the morning * and remain in the uttermost parts of the sea;

column2: 9 Even there also shall thy hand lead me * and thy right hand shall hold me.
column3: Even there also shall thy hand lead me * and thy right hand shall hold me.

column2: 10 If I say, Peradventure the darkness shall cover me * then shall my night be turned to day.
column3: If I say, Peradventure the darkness shall cover me * then shall my night be turned to day.

column2: 11 Yea, the darkness is no darkness with thee, but the night is as clear as the day * the darkness and light to thee are both alike.
column3: Yea, the darkness is no darkness with thee, but the night is as clear as the day * the darkness and light to thee are both alike.

column2: 12 For my reins are thine * thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.
column3: For my reins are thine * thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

column2: 13 I will give thanks unto thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made * marvellous are thy works, and that my soul knoweth right well.
column3: I will give thanks unto thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made * marvellous are thy works, and that my soul knoweth right well.

column2: 14 My bones are not hid from thee * though I be made secretly, and fashioned beneath in the earth.
column3: My bones are not hid from thee * though I be made secretly, and fashioned beneath in the earth.

column2: 15 Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being imperfect * and in thy book were all my members written;
column3: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being imperfect * and in thy book were all my members written;

column2: 16 Which day by day were fashioned * when as yet there was none of them.
column3: Which day by day were fashioned * when as yet there was none of them.

column2: 17 How dear are thy counsels unto me, O God * O how great is the sum of them!
column3: How dear are thy counsels unto me, O God * O how great is the sum of them!

column2: 18 If I tell them, they are more in number than the sand * when I wake up I am present with thee.
column3: If I tell them, they are more in number than the sand * when I wake up I am present with thee.

column2: 19 Wilt thou not slay the wicked, O God * depart from me, ye blood-thirsty men.
column3: Wilt thou not slay the wicked, O God * depart from me, ye blood-thirsty men.

column2: 20 For they speak unrighteously against thee * and thine enemies take thy Name in vain.
column3: For they speak unrighteously against thee * and thine enemies take thy Name in vain.

column2: 21 Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee * and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
column3: Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee * and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

column2: 22 Yea, I hate them right sore * even as though they were mine enemies.
column3: Yea, I hate them right sore * even as though they were mine enemies.

column2: 23 Try me, O God, and seek the ground of my heart * prove me, and examine my thoughts.
column3: Try me, O God, and seek the ground of my heart * prove me, and examine my thoughts.

column2: 24 Look well if there be any way of wickedness in me * and lead me in the way everlasting.
column3: Look well if there be any way of wickedness in me * and lead me in the way everlasting.

column2: Psalm 140. Eripe me, Domine.
column3: Psalm 140. Eripe me, Domine.

column2: 1 DELIVER me, O Lord, from the evil man * and preserve me from the wicked man.
column3: DELIVER me, O Lord, from the evil man * and preserve me from the wicked man.

column2: 2 Who imagine mischief in their hearts * and stir up strife all the day long.
column3: Who imagine mischief in their hearts * and stir up strife all the day long.

column2: 3 They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent * adders' poison is under their lips.
column3: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent * adders' poison is under their lips.

column2: 4 Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the ungodly * preserve me from the wicked men, who are purposed to overthrow my goings.
column3: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the ungodly * preserve me from the wicked men, who are purposed to overthrow my goings.

column2: 5 The proud have laid a snare for me, and spread a net abroad with cords * yea, and set traps in my way.
column3: The proud have laid a snare for me, and spread a net abroad with cords * yea, and set traps in my way.

column2: 6 I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God * hear the voice of my prayers, O Lord.
column3: I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God * hear the voice of my prayers, O Lord.

column2: 7 O Lord God, thou strength of my health * thou hast covered my head in the day of the battle.
column3: O Lord God, thou strength of my health * thou hast covered my head in the day of the battle.

column2: 8 Let not the ungodly have his desire, O Lord * let not his mischievous imagination prosper, lest they be too proud.
column3: Let not the ungodly have his desire, O Lord * let not his mischievous imagination prosper, lest they be too proud.

column2: 9 Let the mischief of their own lips fall upon the head of them * that compass me about.
column3: Let the mischief of their own lips fall upon the head of them * that compass me about.

column2: 10 Let hot burning coals fall upon them * let them be cast into the fire and into the pit, that they never rise up again.
column3: Let hot burning coals fall upon them * let them be cast into the fire and into the pit, that they never rise up again.

column2: 11 A man full of words shall not prosper upon the earth * evil shall hunt the wicked person to overthrow him.
column3: A man full of words shall not prosper upon the earth * evil shall hunt the wicked person to overthrow him.

column2: 12 Sure I am that the Lord will avenge the poor * and maintain the cause of the helpless.
column3: Sure I am that the Lord will avenge the poor * and maintain the cause of the helpless.

column2: 13 The righteous also shall give thanks unto thy Name * and the just shall continue in thy sight.
column3: The righteous also shall give thanks unto thy Name * and the just shall continue in thy sight.

column2: Psalm 141. Domine, clamavi.
column3: Psalm 141. Domine, clamavi.

column2: 1 LORD, I call upon thee, haste thee unto me * and consider my voice when I cry unto thee.
column3: LORD, I call upon thee, haste thee unto me * and consider my voice when I cry unto thee.

column2: 2 Let my prayer be set forth in thy sight as the incense * and let the lifting up of my hands be an evening sacrifice.
column3: Let my prayer be set forth in thy sight as the incense * and let the lifting up of my hands be an evening sacrifice.

column2: 3 Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth * and keep the door of my lips.
column3: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth * and keep the door of my lips.

column2: 4 O let not mine heart be inclined to any evil thing * let me not be occupied in ungodly works with the men that work wickedness, lest I eat of such things as please them.
column3: O let not mine heart be inclined to any evil thing * let me not be occupied in ungodly works with the men that work wickedness, lest I eat of such things as please them.

column2: 5 Let the righteous rather smite me friendly * and reprove me.
column3: Let the righteous rather smite me friendly * and reprove me.

column2: 6 But let not their precious balms break my head * yea, I will pray yet against their wickedness.
column3: But let not their precious balms break my head * yea, I will pray yet against their wickedness.

column2: 7 Let their judges be overthrown in stony places * that they may hear my words, for they are sweet.
column3: Let their judges be overthrown in stony places * that they may hear my words, for they are sweet.

column2: 8 Our bones lie scattered before the pit * like as when one breaketh and heweth wood upon the earth.
column3: Our bones lie scattered before the pit * like as when one breaketh and heweth wood upon the earth.

column2: 9 But mine eyes look unto thee, O Lord God * in thee is my trust , O cast not out my soul.
column3: But mine eyes look unto thee, O Lord God * in thee is my trust , O cast not out my soul.

column2: 10 Keep me from the snare that they have laid for me * and from the traps of the wicked doers.
column3: Keep me from the snare that they have laid for me * and from the traps of the wicked doers.

column2: 11 Let the ungodly fall into their own nets together * and let me ever escape them.
column3: Let the ungodly fall into their own nets together * and let me ever escape them.

column2: Psalm 142. Voce mea ad Dominum.
column3: Psalm 142. Voce mea ad Dominum.

column2: 1 I CRIED unto the Lord with my voice * yea, even unto the Lord did I make my supplication.
column3: I CRIED unto the Lord with my voice * yea, even unto the Lord did I make my supplication.

column2: 2 I poured out my complaints before him * and shewed him of my trouble.
column3: I poured out my complaints before him * and shewed him of my trouble.

column2: 3 When my spirit was in heaviness thou knewest my path * in the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.
column3: When my spirit was in heaviness thou knewest my path * in the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

column2: 4 I looked also upon my right hand * and saw there was no man that would know me.
column3: I looked also upon my right hand * and saw there was no man that would know me.

column2: 5 I had no place to flee unto * and no man cared for my soul.
column3: I had no place to flee unto * and no man cared for my soul.

column2: 6 I cried unto thee, O Lord, and said * Thou art my hope, and my portion in the land of the living.
column3: I cried unto thee, O Lord, and said * Thou art my hope, and my portion in the land of the living.

column2: 7 Consider my complaint * for I am brought very low.
column3: Consider my complaint * for I am brought very low.

column2: 8 O deliver me from my persecutors * for they are too strong for me.
column3: O deliver me from my persecutors * for they are too strong for me.

column2: 9 Bring my soul out of prison, that I may give thanks unto thy Name * which thing if thou wilt grant me, then shall the righteous resort unto my company.
column3: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may give thanks unto thy Name * which thing if thou wilt grant me, then shall the righteous resort unto my company.

column2: Psalm 143. Domine, exaudi.
column3: Psalm 143. Domine, exaudi.

column2: 1 HEAR my prayer, O Lord, and consider my desire * hearken unto me for thy truth and righteousness' sake.
column3: HEAR my prayer, O Lord, and consider my desire * hearken unto me for thy truth and righteousness' sake.

column2: 2 And enter not into judgement with thy servant * for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.
column3: And enter not into judgement with thy servant * for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

column2: 3 For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground * he hath laid me in the darkness, as the men that have been long dead.
column3: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground * he hath laid me in the darkness, as the men that have been long dead.

column2: 4 Therefore is my spirit vexed within me * and my heart within me is desolate.
column3: Therefore is my spirit vexed within me * and my heart within me is desolate.

column2: 5 Yet do I remember the time past; I muse upon all thy works * yea, I exercise myself in the works of thy hands.
column3: Yet do I remember the time past; I muse upon all thy works * yea, I exercise myself in the works of thy hands.

column2: 6 I stretch forth my hands unto thee * my soul gaspeth unto thee as a thirsty land.
column3: I stretch forth my hands unto thee * my soul gaspeth unto thee as a thirsty land.

column2: 7 Hear me, O Lord, and that soon, for my spirit waxeth faint * hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.
column3: Hear me, O Lord, and that soon, for my spirit waxeth faint * hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

column2: 8 O let me hear thy loving-kindness betimes in the morning, for in thee is my trust * shew thou me the way that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto thee.
column3: O let me hear thy loving-kindness betimes in the morning, for in thee is my trust * shew thou me the way that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto thee.

column2: 9 Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies * for I flee unto thee to hide me.
column3: Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies * for I flee unto thee to hide me.

column2: 10 Teach me to do the thing that pleaseth thee, for thou art my God * let thy loving Spirit lead me forth into the land of righteousness.
column3: Teach me to do the thing that pleaseth thee, for thou art my God * let thy loving Spirit lead me forth into the land of righteousness.

column2: 11 Quicken me, O Lord, for thy Name's sake * and for thy righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.
column3: Quicken me, O Lord, for thy Name's sake * and for thy righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.

column2: 12 And of thy goodness slay mine enemies * and destroy all them that vex my soul ; for I am thy servant.
column3: And of thy goodness slay mine enemies * and destroy all them that vex my soul ; for I am thy servant.

column2: Psalm 144. Benedictus Dominus.
column3: Psalm 144. Benedictus Dominus.

column2: 1 BLESSED be the Lord my strength * who teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight;
column3: BLESSED be the Lord my strength * who teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight;

column2: 2 My hope and my fortress, my castle and deliverer, my defender in whom I trust * who subdueth my people that is under me.
column3: My hope and my fortress, my castle and deliverer, my defender in whom I trust * who subdueth my people that is under me.

column2: 3 Lord, what is man, that thou hast such respect unto him * or the son of man, that thou so regardest him?
column3: Lord, what is man, that thou hast such respect unto him * or the son of man, that thou so regardest him?

column2: 4 Man is like a thing of nought * his time passeth away like a shadow.
column3: Man is like a thing of nought * his time passeth away like a shadow.

column2: 5 Bow thy heavens, O Lord, and come down * touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
column3: Bow thy heavens, O Lord, and come down * touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

column2: 6 Cast forth thy lightning, and tear them * shoot out thine arrows, and consume them.
column3: Cast forth thy lightning, and tear them * shoot out thine arrows, and consume them.

column2: 7 Send down thine hand from above * deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, from the hand of strange children;
column3: Send down thine hand from above * deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, from the hand of strange children;

column2: 8 Whose mouth talketh of vanity * and their right hand is a right hand of wickedness.
column3: Whose mouth talketh of vanity * and their right hand is a right hand of wickedness.

column2: 9 I will sing a new song unto thee, O God * and sing praises unto thee upon a ten-stringed lute.
column3: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God * and sing praises unto thee upon a ten-stringed lute.

column2: 10 Thou hast given victory unto kings * and hast delivered David thy servant from the peril of the sword.
column3: Thou hast given victory unto kings * and hast delivered David thy servant from the peril of the sword.

column2: 11 Save me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children * whose mouth talketh of vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of iniquity.
column3: Save me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children * whose mouth talketh of vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of iniquity.

column2: 12 That our sons may grow up as the young plants * and that our daughters may be as the polished corners of the temple.
column3: That our sons may grow up as the young plants * and that our daughters may be as the polished corners of the temple.

column2: 13 That our garners may be full and plenteous with all manner of store * that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets.
column3: That our garners may be full and plenteous with all manner of store * that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets.

column2: 14 That our oxen may be strong to labour, that there be no decay * no leading into captivity, and no complaining in our streets.
column3: That our oxen may be strong to labour, that there be no decay * no leading into captivity, and no complaining in our streets.

column2: 15 Happy are the people that are in such a case * yea, blessed are the people who have the Lord for their God.
column3: Happy are the people that are in such a case * yea, blessed are the people who have the Lord for their God.

column2: Psalm 145. Exaltabo te, Deus.
column3: Psalm 145. Exaltabo te, Deus.

column2: 1 I WILL magnify thee, O God, my King * and I will praise thy Name for ever and ever.
column3: I WILL magnify thee, O God, my King * and I will praise thy Name for ever and ever.

column2: 2 Every day will I give thanks unto thee * and praise thy Name for ever and ever.
column3: Every day will I give thanks unto thee * and praise thy Name for ever and ever.

column2: 3 Great is the Lord, and marvellous worthy to be praised * there is no end of his greatness.
column3: Great is the Lord, and marvellous worthy to be praised * there is no end of his greatness.

column2: 4 One generation shall praise thy works unto another * and declare thy power.
column3: One generation shall praise thy works unto another * and declare thy power.

column2: 5 As for me, I will be talking of thy worship * thy glory, thy praise, and wondrous works;
column3: As for me, I will be talking of thy worship * thy glory, thy praise, and wondrous works;

column2: 6 So that men shall speak of the might of thy marvellous acts * and I will also tell of thy greatness.
column3: So that men shall speak of the might of thy marvellous acts * and I will also tell of thy greatness.

column2: 7 The memorial of thine abundant kindness shall be shewed * and men shall sing of thy righteousness.
column3: The memorial of thine abundant kindness shall be shewed * and men shall sing of thy righteousness.

column2: 8 The Lord is gracious and merciful * long-suffering and of great goodness.
column3: The Lord is gracious and merciful * long-suffering and of great goodness.

column2: 9 The Lord is loving unto every man * and his mercy is over all his works.
column3: The Lord is loving unto every man * and his mercy is over all his works.

column2: 10 All thy works praise thee, O Lord * and thy saints give thanks unto thee.
column3: All thy works praise thee, O Lord * and thy saints give thanks unto thee.

column2: 11 They shew the glory of thy kingdom * and talk of thy power;
column3: They shew the glory of thy kingdom * and talk of thy power;

column2: 12 That thy power, thy glory, and mightiness of thy kingdom * might be known unto men.
column3: That thy power, thy glory, and mightiness of thy kingdom * might be known unto men.

column2: 13 Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom * and thy dominion endureth throughout all ages.
column3: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom * and thy dominion endureth throughout all ages.

column2: 14 The Lord upholdeth all such as fall * and lifteth up all those that are down.
column3: The Lord upholdeth all such as fall * and lifteth up all those that are down.

column2: 15 The eyes of all wait upon thee, O Lord * and thou givest them their meat in due season.
column3: The eyes of all wait upon thee, O Lord * and thou givest them their meat in due season.

column2: 16 Thou openest thine hand * and fillest all things living with plenteousness.
column3: Thou openest thine hand * and fillest all things living with plenteousness.

column2: 17 The Lord is righteous in all his ways * and holy in all his works.
column3: The Lord is righteous in all his ways * and holy in all his works.

column2: 18 The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him * yea, all such as call upon him faithfully.
column3: The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him * yea, all such as call upon him faithfully.

column2: 19 He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him * he also will hear their cry, and will help them.
column3: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him * he also will hear their cry, and will help them.

column2: 20 The Lord preserveth all them that love him * but scattereth abroad all the ungodly.
column3: The Lord preserveth all them that love him * but scattereth abroad all the ungodly.

column2: 21 My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord * and let all flesh give thanks unto his holy Name for ever and ever.
column3: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord * and let all flesh give thanks unto his holy Name for ever and ever.

column2: Psalm 146. Lauda, anima mea.
column3: Psalm 146. Lauda, anima mea.

column2: 1 PRAISE the Lord, O my soul; while I live will I praise the Lord * yea, as long as I have any being, I will sing praises unto my God.
column3: PRAISE the Lord, O my soul; while I live will I praise the Lord * yea, as long as I have any being, I will sing praises unto my God.

column2: 2 O put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man * for there is no help in them.
column3: O put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man * for there is no help in them.

column2: 3 For when the breath of man goeth forth he shall turn again to his earth * and then all his thoughts perish.
column3: For when the breath of man goeth forth he shall turn again to his earth * and then all his thoughts perish.

column2: 4 Blessed is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help * and whose hope is in the Lord his God;
column3: Blessed is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help * and whose hope is in the Lord his God;

column2: 5 Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that therein is * who keepeth his promise for ever;
column3: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that therein is * who keepeth his promise for ever;

column2: 6 Who helpeth them to right that suffer wrong * who feedeth the hungry.
column3: Who helpeth them to right that suffer wrong * who feedeth the hungry.

column2: 7 The Lord looseth men out of prison * the Lord giveth sight to the blind.
column3: The Lord looseth men out of prison * the Lord giveth sight to the blind.

column2: 8 The Lord helpeth them that are fallen * the Lord careth for the righteous.
column3: The Lord helpeth them that are fallen * the Lord careth for the righteous.

column2: 9 The Lord careth for the strangers, he defendeth the fatherless and widow * as for the way of the ungodly, he turneth it upside down.
column3: The Lord careth for the strangers, he defendeth the fatherless and widow * as for the way of the ungodly, he turneth it upside down.

column2: 10 The Lord thy God, O Sion, shall be King for evermore * and throughout all generations.
column3: The Lord thy God, O Sion, shall be King for evermore * and throughout all generations.

column2: Psalm 147. Laudate Dominum.
column3: Psalm 147. Laudate Dominum.

column2: 1 O PRAISE the Lord, for it is a good thing to sing praises unto our God * yea, a joyful and pleasant thing it is to be thankful.
column3: O PRAISE the Lord, for it is a good thing to sing praises unto our God * yea, a joyful and pleasant thing it is to be thankful.

column2: 2 The Lord doth build up Jerusalem * and gather together the out-casts of Israel.
column3: The Lord doth build up Jerusalem * and gather together the out-casts of Israel.

column2: 3 He healeth those that are broken in heart * and giveth medicine to heal their sickness.
column3: He healeth those that are broken in heart * and giveth medicine to heal their sickness.

column2: 4 He telleth the number of the stars * and calleth them all by their names.
column3: He telleth the number of the stars * and calleth them all by their names.

column2: 5 Great is our Lord, and great is his power * yea, and his wisdom is infinite.
column3: Great is our Lord, and great is his power * yea, and his wisdom is infinite.

column2: 6 The Lord setteth up the meek * and bringeth the ungodly down to the ground.
column3: The Lord setteth up the meek * and bringeth the ungodly down to the ground.

column2: 7 O sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving * sing praises upon the harp unto our God;
column3: O sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving * sing praises upon the harp unto our God;

column2: 8 Who covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth rain for the earth * and maketh the grass to grow upon the mountains, and herb for the use of men;
column3: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth rain for the earth * and maketh the grass to grow upon the mountains, and herb for the use of men;

column2: 9 Who giveth fodder unto the cattle * and feedeth the young ravens that call upon him.
column3: Who giveth fodder unto the cattle * and feedeth the young ravens that call upon him.

column2: 10 He hath no pleasure in the strength of an horse * neither delighteth he in any man's legs.
column3: He hath no pleasure in the strength of an horse * neither delighteth he in any man's legs.

column2: 11 But the Lord's delight is in them that fear him * and put their trust in his mercy.
column3: But the Lord's delight is in them that fear him * and put their trust in his mercy.

column2: 12 Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem * praise thy God, O Sion.
column3: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem * praise thy God, O Sion.

column2: 13 For he hath made fast the bars of thy gates * and hath blessed thy children within thee.
column3: For he hath made fast the bars of thy gates * and hath blessed thy children within thee.

column2: 14 He maketh peace in thy borders * and filleth thee with the flour of wheat.
column3: He maketh peace in thy borders * and filleth thee with the flour of wheat.

column2: 15 He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth * and his word runneth very swiftly.
column3: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth * and his word runneth very swiftly.

column2: 16 He giveth snow like wool * and scattereth the hoar-frost like ashes.
column3: He giveth snow like wool * and scattereth the hoar-frost like ashes.

column2: 17 He casteth forth his ice like morsels * who is able to abide his frost?
column3: He casteth forth his ice like morsels * who is able to abide his frost?

column2: 18 He sendeth out his word, and melteth them * he bloweth with his wind, and the waters flow.
column3: He sendeth out his word, and melteth them * he bloweth with his wind, and the waters flow.

column2: 19 He sheweth his word unto Jacob * his statutes and ordinances unto Israel.
column3: He sheweth his word unto Jacob * his statutes and ordinances unto Israel.

column2: 20 He hath not dealt so with any nation * neither have the heathen knowledge of his laws.
column3: He hath not dealt so with any nation * neither have the heathen knowledge of his laws.

column2: Psalm 148. Laudate Dominum.
column3: Psalm 148. Laudate Dominum.

column2: 1 O PRAISE the Lord of heaven * praise him in the height.
column3: O PRAISE the Lord of heaven * praise him in the height.

column2: 2 Praise him, all ye angels of his * praise him, all his host.
column3: Praise him, all ye angels of his * praise him, all his host.

column2: 3 Praise him, sun and moon * praise him, all ye stars and light.
column3: Praise him, sun and moon * praise him, all ye stars and light.

column2: 4 Praise him, all ye heavens * and ye waters that are above the heavens.
column3: Praise him, all ye heavens * and ye waters that are above the heavens.

column2: 5 Let them praise the Name of the Lord * for he spake the word, and they were made; he commanded, and they were created.
column3: Let them praise the Name of the Lord * for he spake the word, and they were made; he commanded, and they were created.

column2: 6 He hath made them fast for ever and ever * he hath given them a law which shall not be broken.
column3: He hath made them fast for ever and ever * he hath given them a law which shall not be broken.

column2: 7 Praise the Lord upon earth * ye dragons, and all deeps;
column3: Praise the Lord upon earth * ye dragons, and all deeps;

column2: 8 Fire and hail, snow and vapours * wind and storm, fulfilling his word;
column3: Fire and hail, snow and vapours * wind and storm, fulfilling his word;

column2: 9 Mountains and all hills * fruitful trees and all cedars;
column3: Mountains and all hills * fruitful trees and all cedars;

column2: 10 Beasts and all cattle * worms and feathered fowls;
column3: Beasts and all cattle * worms and feathered fowls;

column2: 11 Kings of the earth and all people * princes and all judges of the world;
column3: Kings of the earth and all people * princes and all judges of the world;

column2: 12 Young men and maidens, old men and children, praise the Name of the Lord * for his Name only is excellent, and his praise above heaven and earth.
column3: Young men and maidens, old men and children, praise the Name of the Lord * for his Name only is excellent, and his praise above heaven and earth.

column2: 13 He shall exalt the horn of his people; all his saints shall praise him * even the children of Israel, even the people that serveth him.
column3: He shall exalt the horn of his people; all his saints shall praise him * even the children of Israel, even the people that serveth him.

column2: Psalm 149. Cantate Domino.
column3: Psalm 149. Cantate Domino.

column2: 1 O SING unto the Lord a new song * let the congregation of saints praise him.
column3: O SING unto the Lord a new song * let the congregation of saints praise him.

column2: 2 Let Israel rejoice in him that made him * and let the children of Sion be joyful in their King.
column3: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him * and let the children of Sion be joyful in their King.

column2: 3 Let them praise his Name in the dance * let them sing praises unto him with tabret and harp.
column3: Let them praise his Name in the dance * let them sing praises unto him with tabret and harp.

column2: 4 For the Lord hath pleasure in his people * and helpeth the meek-hearted.
column3: For the Lord hath pleasure in his people * and helpeth the meek-hearted.

column2: 5 Let the saints be joyful with glory * let them rejoice in their beds.
column3: Let the saints be joyful with glory * let them rejoice in their beds.

column2: 6 Let the praises of God be in their mouth * and a two-edged sword in their hands;
column3: Let the praises of God be in their mouth * and a two-edged sword in their hands;

column2: 7 To be avenged of the heathen * and to rebuke the people;
column3: To be avenged of the heathen * and to rebuke the people;

column2: 8 To bind their kings in chains * and their nobles with links of iron.
column3: To bind their kings in chains * and their nobles with links of iron.

column2: 9 That they may be avenged of them, as it is written * Such honour have all his saints.
column3: That they may be avenged of them, as it is written * Such honour have all his saints.

column2: Psalm 150. Laudate Dominum.
column3: Psalm 150. Laudate Dominum.

column2: 1 O PRAISE God in his holiness * praise him in the firmament of his power.
column3: O PRAISE God in his holiness * praise him in the firmament of his power.

column2: 2 Praise him in his noble acts * praise him according to his excellent greatness.
column3: Praise him in his noble acts * praise him according to his excellent greatness.

column2: 3 Praise him in the sound of the trumpet * praise him upon the lute and harp.
column3: Praise him in the sound of the trumpet * praise him upon the lute and harp.

column2: 4 Praise him in the cymbals and dances * praise him upon the strings and pipe.
column3: Praise him in the cymbals and dances * praise him upon the strings and pipe.

column2: 5 Praise him upon the well-tuned cymbals * praise him upon the loud cymbals.
column3: Praise him upon the well-tuned cymbals * praise him upon the loud cymbals.

column2: 6 Let every thing that hath breath * praise the Lord.
column3: Let every thing that hath breath * praise the Lord.

column2: 2 Behold, God is my saviour, I will deal confidently, and will not fear * O because the Lord is my strength, and my praise, and he is become my salvation.
column3: Behold, God is my saviour, I will deal confidently, and will not fear * O because the Lord is my strength, and my praise, and he is become my salvation.

column2: 3 You shall draw waters with joy * out of the saviour's fountains
column3: You shall draw waters with joy * out of the saviour's fountains

column2: 4 And you shall say in that day, Praise ye the Lord, and call upon his name * make his works known among the people, remember that his name is high.
column3: And you shall say in that day, Praise ye the Lord, and call upon his name * make his works known among the people, remember that his name is high.

column2: 5 Sing ye to the Lord, for he hath done great things * shew this forth in all the earth.
column3: Sing ye to the Lord, for he hath done great things * shew this forth in all the earth.

column2: 6 Rejoice, and praise, O thou habitation of Sion * for great is he that is in the midst of thee, the Holy One of Israel.
column3: Rejoice, and praise, O thou habitation of Sion * for great is he that is in the midst of thee, the Holy One of Israel.

column2: 52 Blessed art thou, O Lord the God of our fathers* and worthy to be praised, and glorified, and exalted above all for ever and blessed is the holy name of thy glory, * and worthy to be praised, and exalted above all in all ages.
column3: Blessed art thou, O Lord the God of our fathers* and worthy to be praised, and glorified, and exalted above all for ever and blessed is the holy name of thy glory, * and worthy to be praised, and exalted above all in all ages.

column2: 53 Blessed art thou in the holy temple of thy glory * and exceedingly to be praised, and exceeding glorious for ever.
column3: Blessed art thou in the holy temple of thy glory * and exceedingly to be praised, and exceeding glorious for ever.

column2: 54 Blessed art thou on the throne of thy kingdom * and exceedingly to be praised, and exalted above all for ever.
column3: Blessed art thou on the throne of thy kingdom * and exceedingly to be praised, and exalted above all for ever.

column2: 55 Blessed art thou, that beholdest the depths, and sittest upon the cherubims * and worthy to be praised and exalted above all for ever.
column3: Blessed art thou, that beholdest the depths, and sittest upon the cherubims * and worthy to be praised and exalted above all for ever.

column2: 46 My soul doth magnify the Lord * and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.
column3: My soul doth magnify the Lord * and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

column2: 47 For he hath regarded * the lowliness of his handmaiden.
column3: For he hath regarded * the lowliness of his handmaiden.

column2: 48 For behold, from henceforth * all generations shall call me blessed.
column3: For behold, from henceforth * all generations shall call me blessed.

column2: 49 For he that is mighty hath magnified me * and holy is his Name.
column3: For he that is mighty hath magnified me * and holy is his Name.

column2: 50 And his mercy is on them that fear him * throughout all generations.
column3: And his mercy is on them that fear him * throughout all generations.

column2: 51 He hath shew-ed strength with his arm * he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
column3: He hath shew-ed strength with his arm * he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

column2: 52 He hath put down the mighty from their seat * and hath exalted the humble and meek.
column3: He hath put down the mighty from their seat * and hath exalted the humble and meek.

column2: 53 He hath filled the hungry with good things * and the rich he hath sent empty away.
column3: He hath filled the hungry with good things * and the rich he hath sent empty away.

column2: 54 He remembering his mercy * hath holpen his servant Israel.
column3: He remembering his mercy * hath holpen his servant Israel.

column2: 55 as he promised to our forefathers, * Abraham and his seed for ever.
column3: as he promised to our forefathers, * Abraham and his seed for ever.
